title: 60 LES great birthday stay!
text: I decided to stay at 60 LES for the second time to celebrate my birthday and couldn’t be happier with my experience. Jimmy R was such a great help in making my stay the best. He gave great guidance to on the hotels accommodation and the area! Cant wait to stay here again.

title: Avoid if you want to sleep during the night
text: This is a party place. There is a club in the 7th floor which makes a lot of noise during the night, bass sound is super strong! OK if you want to party the whole night and get to bed at 5am, but definitely not OK if you want a quiet sleep. Many desperate guests complaining at the reception but they don’t really care. The club is obviously a part of the hotel which tells a lot…

title: Breathtaking sights
text: The robes were soft, terrace view was beautiful and Marcos and jimmy were very helpful during my stay. The room was very beautiful and spacious. I loved the shower with the rainfall head and the seperate wand. I love the keycard for the elevator, it gets tedious but I rather be safe.

title: Skating in NYC
text: Marcos was the best! There really isn’t that much more to say other than check in was a breeze and the room was is nice and clean. Easy access to local skate parks and parking garages. Plenty of spots to grab a quick bite to eat. We will definitely consider Sixty LES when we visit NYC again

title: Beyond Expectations
text:
On arrival the front desk reception by Justin and Jose was beyond the expectations you’d expect from a four star hotel. Justin answered all our FAQs and provided helpful information and knowledge of the neighborhoods and local current events. 
Our accommodations were perfect though we hadn’t had time to dine at the restaurant. 
We truly enjoyed our stay and will be back on our next trip to the City.

title: Ideal location
text: Hotel stands out for its location. In a residential neighborhood, far from the hustle and bustle of NY, but around the corner from a subway station, around the corner from the unmissable Katz’s and just 10 minutes from Soho. Negative point is the strong smell of cigarettes and marijuana in and around the hotel.

title: So walkable
text: The staff was super friendly and helpful. We came for my partner’s birthday, and we stayed in the empire terrace.The views took our breath away! We were within walking distance of Kinky’s, Balthazar, Bibliotheque, and all my favorite soho spots!

title: Warning: Loud, party hotel
text:
We found out the hard way that this is a loud hotel! 

They have an outdoor bar on the 7th floor. We asked for a room on the other side of the hotel to avoid the noise. The problem is that there’s another hotel across the street with a rooftop bar. So there’s no avoiding the noise. On a Thursday night the noise from the bar across the street kept us up until 2am. All these bars are open until 4am on Friday and Saturday night, so we moved to another hotel to avoid another bad night. 

The hotel was not very helpful or understanding with the situation. I asked for them to refund our two remaining nights. They refunded one night, but said it was too late in the day (3pm) to refund the second night. Given the circumstances I expect a well run hotel to not hassle us over one night.

Bottom line: if you’re looking for a hotel that sounds like the party is going on in your room until 2am or later, this is your place!

title: Amazing hotel with wonderful customer service!
text:
Wow!  Is all I can say!  

This review is long overdue.  We stayed at Sixty LES many times while visiting NYC.  We love the LES and have stayed at many of the hotels in that area but once we found Sixty, it's our favorite.  We continue to come back to Sixty LES for their large rooms, central location, and excellent customer service and decent rates (for NYC).

On our last stay at Sixty LES, we arrived very late in the evening due to a delayed flight.  It was close to Christmas and the hotel was booked full!  We were met with bad news, our room booked was not available.  We had booked a King Suite.  The good news, Jose R. and Justin had upgraded our room to the Penthouse Suite!  Woo hoo.  What a lovely surprise.  We definitley had not expected that.  It was an AMAZING room, and hard to leave!  So spacious.  We travel with our small dog, so we tend to spend a lot of time in the room in the evening and this room checked every box!  Large tub to relax, fireplace, small kitchen and dining area.    It was amazing.

Even if we had not been upgraded, Sixty LES is an amazing hotel in the LES with large rooms and a cool vibe.  Everyone is so nice!  We will be back soon!

Thanks to the amazing staff, especially Jose R. and Justin.   You guys are awesome!

Trust me, the LES is the best neighborhood in Manhattan, if you're looking for a neighborhood (non touristy) with great food and vibes.

title: Love this hotel and staff
text: Lazar helped us out during our stay and really made it such a great and enjoyable experience. Love this hotel and its location. My go to for New York every time I visit. Would definitely recommend ……………………………………………………………………………………………………..

title: Thank you Mohammed!
text: Hotel Sixty LES in New York City exceeded expectations, largely due to the exceptional service provided by Mohammed. From the moment of check-in, Mohammed's attentiveness and professionalism were evident, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable stay. His personalized recommendations for local hotspots enhanced my NYC experience. Coupled with the hotel's chic ambiance and prime location, Mohammed's dedication truly elevated the stay to a memorable level. Hotel Sixty LES is highly recommended, thanks in large part to Mohammed's outstanding service.

title: Amazing views
text: It’s a beautiful location. The views were amazing from the room. My significant other and I had a very pleasant stay . Very happy with the cleanliness of the rooms. The staff were very friendly and utmost helpful , especially Mohammed . Definitely recommend 10/10.

title: Treat yourself to these views!!
text: This is a gorgeous hotel!! Marcos was so helpful when picking the perfect room for my birthday staycation and had some of the most incredible views from the balcony! The area is amazing, coffee around the corner and nightlife right there. The room was so great, modern, very clean. Staff was very helpful and room service brought anything I needed. Thanks for such great birthday stay-cation!

title: Very pleasant experience
text: Had a great time staying here, the room was lovely and spacious with an amazing view of downtown. Located very close to some great food spots and easy access to the subway. Mohammed was very friendly and helpful leading up to and during my stay. Definitely would return!

title: Weekend in Lower East Side
text: Comfy beds, GREAT in house Japanese restaurant that was delicious and had wonderful staff. My husband loved their sushi (Blue Ribbon is the name). Lobby is a little dark for my taste but overall terrific stay. Nightclub below is somewhat noisy so either stay on higher floor or bring your white noise machine.

title: Wonderful stay
text: It is a wonderful place to stay and Nazar was so helpful. He helped with the room and gave great food recommendations. The rooms are spacious and the windows have great views. We also had excellent sushi at blue ribbon sushi. We will be back for another visit.

title: Sixty LES is Amazing!
text: Stayed here for 2 nights and Justin was amazing. He helped me and my wife on everything we needed. The hotel staff and amenities are amazing. Show out to Justin for giving great recommendations for my wife’s bday.  The sauna is great and restaurant is awesome too!!

title: Comedy of Errors
text:
Requested and confirmed early check-in was available.  When I arrived I was informed my room was not available but if I was willing to upgrade $50/night they could immediately check me in…extra $200.

Requested a tea and kettle be sent to the room, they sent up 4 coffee pods and a filthy kettle that had a palm leaves in it.

Carpeting was filthy and they didn’t vacuum throughout the stay.

Walls are paper thin. I could hear everything my neighbor was discussing on the phone at 3am.

No glassware in the room, requested it from front desk, they sent me to Blue Ribbon sushi on the second floor and they refused to provide glasses as they aren’t owned by the hotel.

The entire stay was a comedy of errors.

title: Best remedy after a long flight
text: Stayed here after a 15 hour flight from NZ and was absolutely delighted with the level of service I received. Nazar was extremely personable and accommodating! I enjoyed a hot bath and the rooms look great. The hotel is in the perfect location for great restaurants, shopping, activities, etc.

title: One of the best in NY
text: What a great hotel this is. Great location, decent sized and beautifully curated rooms, and some of the most efficient and welcoming staff I’ve encountered in any NY hotel. Big shout out to Steve and his front of house staff. Walking distance to Katz’s Deli, Russ & Daughters, the subway and all the delights of Manhattan’s Lower East Side.

title: Thank you Justin!
text: I had such an amazing stay for NYE this past week. As soon as i walked in i was greeted by the front desk reception Justin. He immediately was attentive, professional, and warm. As you can imagine the night was a little hectic with all of the people coming in and out but Justin really took care of getting me checked in and answering all my questions while multitasking the other guests and the lobby. great energy goes a long way. And i would 100% stay at this hotel again. Thank YOU!

title: Top Notch Customer Service
text: Excellent customer service. Jimmy R at the front desk was super accommodating, professional, and courteous. Great rooms and great location. The restaurant downstairs is also delicious and part of the room service offering. Would definitely stay again.

title: Awesome hotel
text: Great location - very nice accommodation with  excellent service, particularly from Marcos who was very helpful. The view from the balcony is superb, the room we had also had a fireplace. I would definitely recommend

title: Excellent hotel with friendly, wonderful staff in terrific location!
text: Excellent hotel in the perfect location for shopping and dining! Very easy check-in with a great staff.  Jose R. was so welcoming and the manager Mohammed made everything so nice for us!  Would definitely stay again!

title: Excellent stay at LES 60 for Halloween
text: My husband and I stayed here for Halloween weekend and had a great time.  We asked for a quiet room and were upgraded to a corner suite on a higher floor gratis (we had booked an Allen Suite).  This was just one facet of the excellent service offered by every member of this welcoming, caring staff.  The suite was excellent:  clean, super comfortable bed, breathtaking views, no noise issues.  Housekeeping was thorough and timely.  Coffee in the lobby was appreciated!  Thanks to all for a comfortable stay.

title: Romantic Setup
text: So i came here to celebrate my fiancé's bday and Destiny and Joseph in customer service experience team really went above and beyond to make me and my fiance feel special. I had a present for him, and  they set the present on the bed and decorated the room with tea light candles and set the champagne on the table. I was very impressed with how beautiful and romantic they made the room and how well they made my vision come to life. Will def stay again.

title: Not perfect but very good
text:
Location is ideal. Clean. King suite 400 roomy with nice view.

Bad: Lobby is spartan in decor (water offered often empty and free coffee is bad.) “Experience Fee” for use of a closed pool. Heat/AC in our King Suite was uneven. Throbbing music from the club above. Design issues with all the glass doors in the bathroom. Lots of wasted space in the suite. No valet service or parking arrangements even at this high price point.

Because of limited options in the area, we will return.

title: It never gets old
text: Look, I’ve been staying at Sixty Les since it was the Thompson. A decade later this place is still money! The balconies are dope, the sushi is dope, and Justin and nazar are killing it at the front desk they take care of everything, even make sure the sauna is ready for you! Sys

title: Rich Couples time
text: The hotel was just the right setting that me and my lady was looking for highly suggest booking to treat yourself and walk out to amazing food spots right around the corner…..I would like to give a shout out to Mohammed and Joseph they was very professional and well managed adding to my amazing experience

title: Greatest staff.
text: Justin is the nicest front desk manager. He waived my early check in fee but most importantly, I am in recovery and there were two wine bottles in my room. I brought them down and asked if he could take them. At first he said house keeping had to take them out of the room (totally understandable, I worked at a hotel as well) and he said “never mind, I understand that and I’ll take them,” as I was bringing them back up to the room. I appreciate that kindness so much, he really went above and beyond for me.  I’m sure the rest of the staff is just as great, but Justin is great at his job. The room is very clean and overall would definitely recommend!

title: Cool hotel, great modern vibe!
text: Bed was very comfortable, liked how low to the ground it was. Room had a really cool vibe. Love the bathroom, sink, and shower set up.  Light fixtures were cool and dimming effect is always a bonus to have.

title: Great Hotel in NYC’s LES
text: The Sixty LES was modern, clean, and convenient. The front desk staff (Joseph, Destiny, and Marcos) were incredible - helping with recommendations, early check-in, and holding my luggage. I will absolutely stay here again in the future.

title: Almost fantastic!
text:
Great hotel: clean, modern, friendly staff, super comfy beds, perfect location, and reasonable rates. 
Only gripe is that the balcony nightclub bar half way up the hotel is the stupidest idea ever! With its position on the 7th floor and volume of the music, the sound travels up the side of the building and from our room on the 11th floor we could very clearly hear what individual songs were even with the windows closed. We wore earplugs so wasn’t too much of an issue for us, but with so many reviews here mentioning it and so many reviews for the bar saying it’s always empty, it makes no sense to have such a disruptive bar which no one wants to go to, and it’s an issue which could be so easily fixed by just changing the vibe of the bar. The views from that side of the building are stunning so if the music volume was cut by half and it was marketed as a chic bar instead of a nightclub it would keep guests happy except maybe 1 floor above and below, and the public might actually want to visit the bar. Hotel guests would probably also want to visit the bar - I know we avoided it because it just sounded way too much but would have loved a chill bar in the hotel to drink and take in the views. 
It wouldn’t necessarily make us not return to the hotel but if the bar issue was fixed, we’d be back in a heartbeat!

title: Awesome Boutique Hotel on the LES
text: I stayed in a king suite on the 6th floor and had an excellent time at Sixty LES. I did not have any noise issues, though there is a note that if you stay on a floor close to the club noise could be an issue. The bed was very comfortable, bathtub/shower was amazing, and the staff were friendly and informative.  Though no one was around to help me with my bags during check-in and check-out as they don't seem to have a very large staff and the staff that were available were swamped. Not a problem for me, but might be if you have tons of luggage. I also love it when hotels allow you to cast (on the tv) and this hotel has that option. A plus! Also, a bonus is that I was near a churro place directly downstairs and steps away from Russ & Daughters. Cleaning staff were also friendly and products were good. I would definitely stay here again!

title: A MUST STAY
text: This place is incredible! Friendly staff, beautiful location, amazing views and everything you need onsite or right outside the door. Would highly recommend staying at this hotel! I definitely will be back

title: Gigi super helpful
text:
I've stayed at SixtyLES twice before and loved the location and rooms (for the price, I find the rooms bigger than comparable nearby hotels).

This time I arrived ~10 hours before checkin and Gigi hooked me up with a great rate so I could get in and get settled. Hugely appreciated after 27 hours in transit.

title: Amazing
text: Jimmy R took good care of us! Can’t wait to book our next stay hospitality was great! Can’t wait to come back. He assisted us smoothly as we walked in the door and he gave us a $10 credit towards the bar!

title: Great stay
text: Jimmy R was the nicest guy up front hooked us up and made our stay great.  Hotel was in a great area and easy to go place to place. We enjoyed our stay here over our last one at the Rivington up the road

title: Amazing staff and hotel
text: I stayed at the sixty les hotel with my family and absolutely loved my stayed. I wanted to leave a special review for front of desk Nazar, Marcos and Jose and Frances. They have been so accommodating and friendly from the moment we arrived. Definitely recommend this hotel with great staff.

title: Not trusted e mails from this hotel and bad customer service
text:
I didn’t travel yet but I booked in October I received e mails and messages from booking.com from this hotel and asked me to pay online for the stay.
It was a scam and fraud . The same e mail and message hotel was communicating with me upon booking when I reached hotel they said booking website was hacked when you reach to booking.com they do not answer .
The e mails were hacked and no one wants even to take accountability neither hotel or booking .com
Such a bad customer service

title: Great stay in NYC !!
text:
Very nice people at this hotel, the room is very comfortable with everything you need. Good location with many restaurants and pubs nearby 
Is in very good condition and the restaurant Blue Ribbon :: ricoo!

title: Great staff, clean hotel, nice neighborhood!
text: I usually dont write reviews but I had such a great time with my friends here! From the restaurant within the hotel to the gym to the activities to do around the neighborhood, this location is everything. Any issues we had were taken care of immediately. Due to the club upstairs, we wanted to switch to a different floor and Mohammed was extremely accommodating. We cant wait to come back!

title: A beautiful modern luxury hotel
text:
I recently stayed at Sixty Les for a week for a conference at NYU Law School. Actually everyone who flew from all around the world stayed at this hotel because of its proximity to the NYU Law School.

This hotel is beautiful. This hotel is modern. The furniture, art, decorations, and all the small details are new and NOT run down.

The rooms have a mini-bar fully stocked with alcoholic and Jon alcoholic beverages. They have a few snack options in the room too. They are a decent fee basically for convenience. However, if you want to avoid buying these things it's a small store like two storefronts down.

I occupy several rooms on the 16th floor because I travel with my family. All of our rooms have floor-to-ceiling windows with the most amazing city view! I could see the Empire State Building and all the bridges. It's breathtaking at night. Also, they have blackout curtains so every day I could sleep in.

There is a club named Make Believe on the 7th floor. It's a trendy upscale club. I stayed on the 16th floor and couldn't hear a thing. I did travel with a 2-year-old and he slept like a rock. I should add that the beds are super comfortable too.

They do have an award-winning sushi restaurant on the second floor that serves lunch and dinner.

They have a beautiful lobby on the second floor with great lighting. I had to have makeup done for a press conference so they were able to set up here.

They also have a spa/ fitness center.

A pool on the rooftop but I visited during the closed season.  I'll be back to try it.

I did not find any breakfast options available for room service. However there are some award-winning options within walking distance like “ Sweet Chick” and the “Clinton Bakery”, and a trendy churro stop next door that also sells coffee and soft serves.

Starbucks is within walking distance. However, it's espresso machines in the room and coffee and creamer in the lobby.

Walking distance to Chinatown & Little Italy.

Around the corner from CVS. This is kind of important because I am always forgetting to pack something or run out of things. 

Checking in was super easy. They hold $150 for incidentals for purchases etc. What's not used is returned.

It took around 1 day for the incidentals to be returned to my bank for one of my rooms.

The staff was very pleasant and accomadating.

title: Great trip, love LES neighborhood and Sixty LES
text: We were traveling to NY to drop our first born off at college. A very emotional time. The staff was super helpful and gave us lots of suggestions for shopping for the dorm room, ways to get our stuff to the dorm room, and just generally very friendly. It was such a great stay that I’ve booked it for a business trip/seeing the kid in October as well. Thank you Sixty Les.  Well done ~ Nisar and Marcos. Oh, and thank you Destiny for helping me with the new booking.

title: Great Hotel and Lovely Staff
text: I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights for a business trip and it did not disappoint. Jimmy was absolutely fantastic and helped accommodate all of my needs of being on a lower floor of the hotel. I would 100% stay here again and recommend. Thank you Sixty Les, see you next time!

title: Wonderful front desk welcome & great stay
text:
Jose - at the front desk - checked me into my room on the 17th floor.  He couldn't have been nicer, and my room couldn't have been more perfect...I slept like a log for my 2 nights here, and loved every minute.
Thank you Jose, and Hotel Sixty!

title: Best in the LES!
text: Location, location, location. The SIXTY LES puts you right in the heart of Manhattan's vibrant downtown scene, at a near-perfect crossroads of the Lower East Side, East Village and Soho. For my money, this lively hood provides the best restaurants, shopping, live music venues, and people-watching that the city has to offer. Even better, the location provides easy access to the rest of Manhattan thanks to a subway stop and Citibike dock that are just steps away from the hotel's entrance. All that aside, the SIXTY LES gives good stay. Despite the hipster vibe, the staff are warm and very eager to be of service. The compact gym had everything I needed (including a sauna!), and was gloriously empty whenever I went down for a workout. The pool was closed but pretty to look at, and you could do a whole lot worse than Blue Ribbon Sushi Izakaya on the second floor. And now for the room. Upon checking into my LES Queen Studio for a one-night stay, I was casually informed that I had been upgraded to Penthouse 1 – a random act of kindness that may have spoiled me for life. The palatial room on the 21st floor is literally the size of my house, with two floors, three bathrooms, a kitchenette, a terrace offering unbeatable views of the city in three directions, the comfiest bed in Christendom, and the most glorious bathroom I have ever experienced – complete with a soaking tub that looks like a Richard Serra sculpture. I kept kicking myself that I was there for a whirlwind business trip, and didn't have time to luxuriate in my surroundings. After years of favoring The Standard for my East Village stays, you can bet your bottom dollar that I'll be returning to the SIXTY LES from now on.

title: Hotel SIXTY LES review
text: This hotel and its management settled my issues and made my time at the hotel a pleasant experience. Mohamed and his kindness are greatly appreciated. Thank you, Hotel Sixty LES it was a good time, and thanks.

title: Excellent
text: Jose & Jimmy at reception gave us the warmest welcome and helped us out with everything we needed. Overall great staff … great rooms … great clubs. Just good vibes as well. Clean hotel with an overall great experience.

title: Incredible Service from Justin!
text: This review is specifically for Justin! He is the best and incredibly kind. He was incredibly helpful and attentive no matter how many times I had to bug him during NYFW :) He made finding packages and deliveries for my clients his top priority and welcomed me with a smile every time. Looking forward to the next time we get to join Sixty LES for our stay. Thank you so much!

title: Wonderful!
text: I have never felt more at home in a hotel before! My stay was fantastic, I didn't want to leave. The atmosphere, beautifully designed spaces , professionalism and location were sensational. Sixty Les is now my home away from home. Side note - there's a $500 holding fee on arrival so take extra spending money!

title: Amazing Stay!
text: I booked the junior premier suite; it was lovely and very clean and the room service was excellent. It was an amazing place to spend time with my friends. I'm extremely thankful for the excellent customer service offered by the receptionist, Emely, who went above and beyond to ensure that everything was well. Emely deserves all of the flowers she deserves.  I appreciate everything, and I look forward to visiting again !

title: Little Gem 💎 Cool vibe, clean hotel, and friendly staff
text: This place exceeded my expectations, and is a little gem 💎 . I read some mixed reviews online, and thought I would give it a try. I moved my daughter to East Village, and I wanted to be close for moving purposes. The location is great and has a cool vibe. The hotel and rooms are super clean and spacious, I booked the Jr. Suite. The beds are comfy, I slept so good. The staff was very friendly and flexible shout out to Nazar, and Jimmy for delivering excellent customer service. Another great perk, is this place has a later check-out 12pm vs 11:00 a.m. this place is great if you have friends, or kids at NYU and you need to be in East Village. This spot will be my go to when visiting my daughter.

title: Great hotel
text: Great customer service and an awesome view from our beautiful room. Thanks for the free upgrade.   The rooms are nice, clean and spacious. Would definitely recommend hotel to other coming to New York for a visit.

title: Great spot
text: Can’t say enough great things about the staff from Emily at the front desk to the other workers I met riding the elevator! Stayed Mon-Thurs & it was quiet and comfortable. Will be my go to hotel in NYC

title: Great staff.
text: Came to 60 les for a quick getaway. Wonderful spot in the city. Sydney was super helpful and accommodating. Would def come back! I really loved all the amenties and using the pool the whole time. the food was amazing

title: Swanky hotel with great vibes and a pool deck!
text:
We love Sixty hotels and try to stay at them when possible. The location of LES is great because it is extremely easy to get uptown, over to Soho and the Village and even out to Brooklyn. Also a great area for cheap late night food, well-known restaurants, and unique thrift shops. The pool deck and bar is a great asset for a summer stay and is very cozy.

However, you definitely have to come to this hotel KNOWING that there is a club in it that makes the weekends a bit tough. Even on the upper floors, you can definitely hear the bass until 3AM at least. I would probably not recommend this hotel if you are not coming to NYC with the intention of taking advantage of the "city that never sleeps" reputation — or if you have kids that are light sleepers.

Overall however, the rooms are clean and swanky with nice showers, big windows, and an appropriate amount of space for the price, and the staff is friendly and helpful. I wish the beds were more comfortable, for sure, but otherwise this is a great value for the price and we have enjoyed our stays immensely.

Last tip — bring one of those crocodile hair clips to clip the curtains together around the column in the room to avoid the issue some people are reporting around light coming in in the morning. Works like a charm!

title: A éviter : bruyant et frais supplémentaires
text:
L’hôtel vous impose des frais de service en plus du prix de la chambre. Vous avez ainsi accès à la piscine (avec des horaires réduits voir plus bas), à la salle de sport, aux appels téléphoniques internationaux, ainsi que 10 dollars de consommation dans le mini bar par nuit d’hôtel payée.

Ce qu’on ne vous dit pas clairement c’est que le carton qui indique le prix des aliments du mini bar est hors taxes ! Aux prix indiqués il faut ajouter 10% de frais de service et quasiment 9% de taxes. On vous débite votre carte de crédit à distance donc vous avez la mauvaise surprise quand vous rentrez chez vous ! 

Ça mis à part, l’hôtel est très bruyant entre le night club au 7e étage, le bruit de la rue et celui de la climatisation. Le tout dans un quartier fréquenté la nuit par des drogués! Lors de notre séjour, une femme en voiture s’est même fait tirer dessus par un homme qui lui a volé sa voiture ! Nous avions carrément peur de sortir ! Je déconseille donc fortement cet hôtel aux familles ! 

Ci-dessous un point sur les points positifs et négatifs et le bilan est plutôt négatif ! 

Les + :
La chambre 2 lits Queen size spacieuse 
Le confort des lits 
L’armoire 3 portes avec penderies et tiroirs 
La planche et le fer à repasser 
Le coffre
Le mini bar 
La salle de bains avec grande douche et WC séparé (dans cette chambre mais peut-être pas le cas dans les chambres simples)
La climatisation (mais bruyante)
La piscine
La salle de gym
Le spa
Le métro à 5’ à pied 
La propreté de la chambre 
Les produits de toilette gratuits (gel douche, shampoing, après shampoing, petit savon, 3 coton tiges, 4 petites boules de coton)
La machine à capsules de café et le café gratuit (mais à réclamer tous les jours)
Les transats et le prêt de serviettes à la piscine

Les - :
Les frais de service imposés en plus du prix de la chambre comprenant l’accès à la piscine, au spa et à la salle de sport, 10 dollars de consommation par jour dans le mini bar, le wifi et les appels internationaux 
Le night club très bruyant dans l’hôtel au 7e étage 
Les horaires de la piscine qui ferme à 17h30 (5.30pm) en semaine et 19h (7pm) le week-end 
Le wifi capricieux et qui ne fonctionne pas au spa et à la salle de sport tous deux en sous sol
L’insonorisation (on entend les bruits du couloir et de la rue)
La climatisation bruyante 
L’absence de brosse pour nettoyer le WC (pas top quand on est plusieurs dans la chambre) 
Le nombre de cintres et la taille des rangements (qui conviennent pour 3 jours mais pas pour une semaine) 
Les tiroirs de l’armoire dont certains sont difficiles à ouvrir ou fermer 
Les lits qui sont vraiment trop bas (je plains le personnel qui fait les lits)
Le quartier sale, triste et avec des drogués la nuit

title: So Disappointed
text: I don't like to give businesses bad reviews but I feel compelled to let people know that this hotel is not worth the price they charge per night at all. The staff seems frazzled and unfriendly (except for one guy named Marco) I had put on my reservation check in on line that I need 2 non down feather hypoallergenic pillows for my stay. They were not in my room upon arrival. I called down and requested them and when I returned late that evening they were not in my room. I called the front desk the next day and requested again. Once again I did not receive them. So I had to stop at the desk on the way in that evening to ask for a 4th time... I was told they have been very busy that's why I never received them (SMH) Finally did get them that night, but that didn't help me sleep because the LOUD house music and people partying that I heard until 2am from our 16th floor room was ridiculous. Now let's add the loud sex the couple was having next door to us to the mix. The walls are so thin and there is absolutely no sound barrier from other rooms or the outside street noise. The hallway smelt like fried chicken for some reason, lol. Our room was also near the elevator, once again noise from the opening and closing, bell dinging, and people talking. All in all an awful stay. Bad customer service, bad vibes, lack luster amenities... they have a tiny pump pot of coffee at the entrance in the morning and it was  gone when I got to it, I asked the front desk if they will be refilling it and the girl said yes, he went to get it... waited 15 minutes and then left to go find a hot cup of coffee elsewhere. The only good thing was the view from our room. Do yourself a favor and find a different hotel to stay at, there are many to choose from on the Lower East Side.

title: Do not stay here.
text:
Absolute party hotel - very run down public spaces because the hotel is open to the public. Amenities subpar, If it is cheap & you have to stay in that direct area - ok. Otherwise, DO NOT STAY HERE.

The party hotel element also attracts unsavory characters. No general hotel staff to regulate, overall felt as though at any point I could be in danger. Every hotel room has a connected balcony so you can easily walk from room to room.

Don't bother with the elevators - they take 10+ minutes at any given time because this hotel is open to the public.

No ice machine, you have to call the front desk for it to be delivered. Anticipate calling several times and waiting. Honestly, just go to the bodega on the corner, it will be faster.

The rooms are also old and worn in. 

Night club on floor 7 - we were put on Floor 6 and then had drum and bass in our room "until late" every night of our stay.

I called the front desk, first I was met with surprise as if they had no idea that you could hear the night club in rooms directly below - obviously unbelievable. Reception told me that there was nothing they could do for me as I "booked direct. If I had booked through a third party, they could refund me some portion of my bill"

The next night that I called to see what time they closed; I was told "late" aka it depends on how busy the club goes and what i managed to pull out of them was at the latest 5am.

they didn't have any additional rooms to move me so all in all, had the worst nights sleep. 

I don't mind a party hotel but you need to tell your guests if that is the case. It's absolutely insane that they put people on the floor beneath the nightclub without warning & then pretend as if this is the first they've ever heard of it.

title: Great hotel in a fantastic location!
text: We’re a family of 4 and stayed on the 10th floor for 4 nights in July.  The room was great - beds comfortable, bathroom modern and clean. Hotel reception staff were great.  There is a club on the 7th floor but we didn’t hear any noise from it.  The location is fabulous- so many nice bars and restaurants to visit close by.  We’d stay again.

title: Buyer beware - this place was cool long a go and is now a barely a hotel
text:
A unmitigated disaster 

It’s hard to describe the feeling that develops when you realize that that the hotel you’re stay at literally has given up.

Welcome to 60 LES. 

It’s clear this place was cool 5 years ago.

And at some point - rather than reinvesting and maintaining the rooms - the management decided we’ll go for the quick money and start a club in the building.  

The music starts around 10 and here’s what happens 

- all the elevators show priority to the 7th floor where the club is located. So that if you are going anywhere else - you are stuck waiting for literally 20 mins to go down to the lobby or up to your room.

-  all the rooms vibrate with the bass of the club DJ. We stayed on 5 and 3 and had friends staying as high as the penthouse. Wherever you are - if external sounds are something that keeps you up - be prepared not to sleep until 3’00 in the morning. 

In addition to the clubs crazy sounds - you will Fina a hotel struggling to keep up - in the face of a seeming rejection of any sort of maintenance. 

5 of the 6 cardio machines in the gym done work. 

The staff brings you the wrong things when you request items to the room. 

The shower smells of mildew. 

The paint is chipped and in need of repair.

Unless you are looking to stay at a hotel that is slowly dying, stay far far away.

title: Thank you Sixty LES lower east side !
text:
We had a very delightful staying @ Sixty Les. We felt very well accompanied by Jimmy and Narzar, always willing to help, listen to any request, with kindness and simplicity. 
Without forgetting the cleaning staff, always addressing a smile, all the time.
Nice and clean rooms, beautiful view, quiet @ night (which is not easy to find in NYC!) . 
We’ll definitely come back here. 
And the pool! What a dreamy moment each morning !!

title: Wonderful hotel experience!
text: Great room, super quiet and a great staff. Thanks to Lazzar we were able to have a wonderful and relaxing stay! The hotel is in a busy area but once you step I to the lobby it’s easy to forget. Comfortable beds, clean rooms, and solid location.

title: Birthday weekend
text: This hotel was amazing and had a very good amount of hospitality.. from the pool to the spa and also the sauna. I loved everything I will be returning in the future . They also have a small lounge on the 7 floor that’s a nice chills atmosphere.

title: Can't wait to come back
text:
Where do I begin!? 
Location... I can't appreciate the location enough. It's close to everything! Food, entertainment, exercise, dancing, shopping, sightseeing, all available within the hotel or a 1 mile radius by the hotel! The view was amazing with the wrap-around balcony. 
The staff, everyone from front staff to security to housekeeping. All smiles, says hi with eye contact. Very social/friendly with suggestions to make our trip more enjoyable. Never bothered/harassed our guests who visited us during after-hours. 
The room... open layout, very clean, ac worked great with the humidity, bed was comfy.
Bitter sweet having the club music going on during the weekends... some moments were alil difficult to sleep. But I also did enjoy the club music from my balcony other nights when I wasn't going to sleep early. 
In general, this is one of the most enjoyable hotels I've stayed in while in NYC!

title: Best! Orion was the best
text: This was the most amazing experience.. Honestly the best hotel i’ve ever stayed at. They were so accommodating and the room was amazing. I will stay again and I recommend to anyone who wants to have a great stay in nyc. Orion was amazing and she helped out with much! She deserves a raise

title: Best ever!
text:
The location, my favorite area of Manhattan. The staff, wonderful. The room, enormous. The food at Blue Ribbon in house dining, spectacular. The pool, an enormous bonus in the LES.
I have never experienced better in my 30 years in the city.

Enjoy!

title: Comfort like home.
text: Spent the night at the city for my girlfriend and I anniversary and took the recommendation from a friend that came here prior. Everything from service to the cleanliness and aesthetically pleasing rooms were a plus. Would definitely recommend to others and would be back if ever coming back to the city. Thank you for the great customer service.

title: Amazing
text: SIXTY Les was amazing. I had some questions and Emely, the manager, helped a friend of mine out with room. She is is not just only amazing, her professional is at its best. Highly recommend. The best

title: Awesome experience recommend to anyone who enjoys good service nice rooms
text: Everyone in the hotel was extremely helpful, including Jimmy at the front desk. Who is very professional made sure I got the room. I asked for never had to wait more than five minutes for anything. The pool is amazing. I stay in the city quite a bit. This is the best experience I’ve had lately I will definitely be back.

title: Best Hotel!
text: Favorite hotel in NY!! Best location. Rooms are super modern and clean, great staff, beds are amazing.  This is always my go to hotel whenever i come to NY.  Great neighborhood and great restaurants everywhere!

title: Amazing customer service, beautiful hip hotel, gorgeous room!!
text:
My first impression of the hotel was wonderful. Check in was a breeze, Marcos was SO friendly & made me feel very welcome. 
He put me in a gorgeous room! Absolutely love the floor to ceiling windows and the modern vibe. 
Spacious room, lots of natural light, and super clean.
This is going to be my new go-to NYC hotel. Can’t wait to enjoy the pool & other amenities!

title: Amazing!
text: Awesome hotel, amazing staff, thank you Rodney for everything! Great location, plenty of activities walking distance! I'll definitely be coming back the next time I visit, thanks again for everything I can't wait to tell my friends.

title: A little disappointed
text: Recently checked in. Every little thing is chargeable including 90 minutes early check in although room was empty. No free water. Rooms are tired looking compared to photos. A little disappointed for nearly 500 usd per night. 150 usd per night hold on your credit card as well for incidentals. Rough gig. Maybe better paying a little more for Tribeca or SOHO.

title: Carlos Manager, Hall of Fame service
text: Greetings. I normally don’t write reviews but I felt I had to share my experience. I came in for the weekend to celebrate my birthday with a couple of friends who live in the area. Also wanted to try Katz deli as I’ve seen it on TV before. Normally I’m pretty patient and understanding but I had to vent my frustration about the noise from the club. My friends and I couldn’t enjoy our time together the way we wanted because it was unbearable. I spoke to the manager Carlos and he was a gem from the minute he picked sup the phone. I genuinely felt like he cared. I didn’t expect to be upgraded the way I was but he definitely took care of me and went above and beyond. Moved us up to the 16th floor from the 8th. The card and Prosecco was a really nice gesture. The pool was great, very clean and upkept. Staff were also very friendly and nice. I also appreciate the nice email after the stay and the invitation back. I might have to do that, especially with guys like Carlos ensuring that I had a great stay.

title: LES Gem!
text: I love this hotel.  Hip, chic, but undertated.  Great rooms, modern, well equipped, good quality furniture.   Great sushi place on the 2nd floor, but very expensive.   Great neighborhood.  Overall a great deal for a great stay.  I have stayed here multiple times over the past 3 months.

title: Lovely stay, even better staff!
text: Had a wonderful stay here! The rooms are much bigger than most you'll find in an NYC hotel room, and the staff was lovely. I particularly want to mention Freya'Na Williams, who went above and beyond to help me with a small issue, including proactively following up with me by email several times. She made my "pretty good!" experience "really great!"

title: Home away from Home
text: This is probably my tenth time staying at Sixty LES so I figured it’s time to write a review.  This place of choice when traveling from LA to NYC and mostly because they just always take care of me and make me feel welcomed and at home.  I’ve spent multiple birthdays here, met up with friends who lived in the city here, I even had my “bachelorette” party here.  Tonight after leaving my family in LA Nazar was quick and efficient at check in making sure I was taken care of.  Very thankful for this hotel, the delicious food, comfortable accommodations and friendly staff.

title: Hip Place To Stay In Manhattan
text:
This is the second time I’ve stayed at this property. The first time was in 2022. I returned based on the stellar experience I had last year. 

I am a veteran traveler, and I hate boring hotels. I have no patience for the usual “fixtures” and appearance of the chains out there. Mind you, I hate status with Marriott and Hilton, but I avoid them in cities like New York and Amsterdam. I want to experience larger rooms in those cities. The Sixty LES achieves that goal.

Not only are the rooms are good size, but their lack of carpeting appeases my sense of cleanliness. Next up is the lighting: it’s unique and makes the room—AND YOU, look great.

My only complaint, and why I didn’t rate a five star rating, is the HVAC situation that occurred during my stay. When I checked into my room in the afternoon, the thermostat said 77F. I’m always cold, but that’s a bit warm for even me. I set the AC to 70, thinking that this would bring the room down to a manageable temperature while I went to my meeting. When I returned 90 minutes later, the room felt the same! Nothing had changed. Upon closer examination throughout the evening, it appeared that one side of my king suite was not getting any cool airflow. Only the bedroom area was. In the end, the room got down to 73F. I asked the front desk about this situation as I was checking out. They said that there was a building-wide problem that had occurred. That’s what I figured. It’s NYC after all and HVAC problems seem to be a thing everywhere. It’s also why I didn’t complain. What’s the point when it’s most likely building-wide? You can tell I’ve traveled a good bit.

One other snarky point: I like that both times I’ve stayed at this hotel I haven’t seen a bunch of kids running around. This place does NOT have a family vibe. I’m not seeking that when I travel. I want a property where adults tend to be the majority of guests. You can call me mean. Fine. I know what I like in a hotel.

I will definitely return to this property in the future. I really don’t see the point of looking elsewhere for when I need to stay in Manhattan. It’s convenient, trendy, and well-appointed.

title: Great Location & Views, Spacious Rooms and Wonderful Staff!
text:
Came here for the memorial day weekend. First time staying at the property. Room was not ready yet, but was offered to store my luggage. Came back later in the afternoon and got my keys to the 16th floor.  A really nice view of the city, floor to ceiling windows . Love the natural lighting seeping through. Spacious enough for a solo traveler and felt spacious overall in the room and bathroom. Received a nice welcome amenity note and really appreciated the gesture. Also the room was consistency cleaned by the housekeeper daily. Staff at the front was extremely nice and approachable.   

There is a club/bar/lounge attached to the hotel and a music bar next door. I did hear music into the late night hours when I was still up, but doesn't bother me at all (deep sleeper). It would be great to spend time there with friends or wants a great area to access SOHO near by and across the street that pretty much connects you to everywhere. Honestly, you can walk to a lot of places too. Would definitely stay again when I'm in the city next!

title: Free was AMAZING!
text: The hotel amenities were top tier. Rooftop was a VIBE, rooms are very clean but most importantly the customer service from our front desk host was INCREDIBLE. Free was so nice and accommodating and I will for sure without a doubt return to Sixty.

title: AMAZING
text:
The beds were so comfortable and the location was absolutely perfect! 
We took advantage of the awesome weather and hung by the pool until we had to leave.
Everyone is so friendly and helpful...we absolutely LOVE Sydney and Emely! They were so helpful and welcomed my daughter with open arms, literally! Can't wait for our next time !!!

title: Excellent service from Marcos!
text: We arrived after a long flight to a quick check-in and a very comfortable room. Marcos ensured that we had everything we needed and recommended a great place for breakfast. His service was exceptional and his warm and friendly manner made our stay enjoyable.

title: Bad for sleep. Rooms are nice.
text: Whatever you do, don’t get a room on the 6th floor or the 8th floor if you are staying Thursday or the weekend, and want to get sleep. There is a nightclub on the 7th floor and my room was right below it. Didn’t get much sleep.

title: Marcos made it easy!!!
text: After traveling for over 10 hours. Marcos was able to get us an early check in realizing we needed rest. The room was perfect. The time we spent was great. Thanks Marcos for making our stay perfect. When back in NY we will stay here again!!

title: I love this place.
text: Magnificent. Perfect location. Fantastic service, cool decor. It is not for you if you don't want to be around young people who come to have a good time. There is a whole lot of party all around. Live music plays next door. So fun. Music is everywhere. The lobby always has people working to keep people moving. Pay for the high floors if you want quiet. Be warned that across the street is an all-night roof deck party, so talk about where you want a room to face. Fresh fruit, water, and tea are always in the lobby. Very convenient from Laguardia Airport but JFK, not so much.

title: Overpriced hotel with hidden fees in a mediocre location
text:
- On top of the $360 I paid for one night, they charged an additional $40 fee which they never told me about upfront. The hotel staff did not want to help me with reversing or explaining the fee other than saying it is a "guest experience fee". I already paid for the room, why do you need to charge more?
- The location was noisy, unsafe, and smelled like weed inside and outside the hotel.
- Hotel staff was a little rude, not terrible but they did not provide the hospitality you'd expect from good hotel staff.

title: Exceptional service by Marcos!
text: Amazing service by the staff. We were given a room upgrade to a much higher floor which was greatly appreciated. The service provided was very professional and the attention to detail elevated the whole experience. All of this wouldn’t have been possible if it weren’t for Marcos. He really went above and beyond by providing 5-Star service and assistance for my guests and I whilst coordinating with other staff members as well.

title: AMAZING!!! Special shoutout to Marcos: the staff truly make the hotel.
text:
I have to give a special shoutout to Marcos - that guy was amazing! He made my stay so much better with his fantastic service and attention to detail. He really went out of his way to make my birthday celebrations unforgettable, and I couldn't have asked for more.

The location was just perfect with plenty of cool places to eat nearby, including the iconic Katz deli. And if you're a fan of shopping, there are plenty of indie stores in the area to check out.

Let's talk about the penthouse. Holy cow, it was insane! The elevator went straight up to it, which was super cool. And the room itself was beautiful - the fireplace was to die for, the pillows were like sleeping on a cloud, and the robes were so luxurious that I secretly wanted to take one home with me (I didn't, of course!).

I also really appreciated the little touches, like the room slippers and the Nespresso machine with both regular and decaf coffee. And can we talk about Marcos for a second? He went above and beyond to make sure my birthday celebrations were on point. Seriously, ask for him if you need anything - he's the best.

Oh, and don't even get me started on the hotel restaurant, Blue Ribbon Sushi Izakaya. It was a high-class experience, and the food was insane. I highly recommend the lobster rolls and salmon teriyaki, and don't even think about leaving without trying the green tea creme brulee. Trust me, it's a must-have.

All in all, I seriously did not want to leave this place. If you're looking for an amazing hotel experience with top-notch service, this is the spot.

title: Marcos!!
text: Marcos greeted me after a long day of travel w a warm smile and informative info on the property and area.  He also helped me out with snacks since I had been traveling all day and great places to go for dinner!!! He truly went above a beyond!!

title: Marcos’ Magic
text: Very attentive service :) nice rooms! 10/10 recommend. Thanks Marcos for an easy check in !! Amazing views, definitely try Blue Ribbon upstairs. And if you’re into parties : Make Believe is the place to go

title: Business Trip
text: The staff at Sixty LES went above and beyond to ensure that my room transfers were seamless, and that I received packages that were coming in from overseas. The round-the-clock front desk staff (including Dave’s exceptional service), made for a great business trip for me and my team.

title: Great stay
text: Vanessa made check in very easy and even gave me the option of upgrading for a small fee to a bigger room, she gave me a few options and told me the benefits of each upgrade and made me feel confident I chose the right room. The sauna was a nice addition and I loved restaurant as well

title: Good if you’re looking to party, not so much if you’re not
text:
Overall the hotel is nice. Solid location, relatively clean and open rooms, modern feel (though starting to feel a bit “worn” in rooms), nice showers, nice views depending on the room, and very nice staff. 

The challenge with the hotel, as written in numerous reviews, is that there’s a club on the 7th floor. No way to disguise it or hide it — the rooms on 7 are LITERALLY 5 feet across from…a club. A club that blasts high bass thumping music all night. Seriously….2 floors up and down you’ll hear it (and feel it) all night, and on the same floor forget about it. 

In our experience, we came to our room on 7 to shower before dinner (5-6pm) and when the elevator opened there was a girl getting sick in a trash can and the floor from over drinking in the club (yes 530pm). Management promptly moved us up to 14, but this gives you a sense of the clientele you might run into on a Saturday. 

So, if you enjoy that because you’re actually in the club until 3am, then it’s for you. If you don’t, you absolutely must be on floor 10-16 (not too close to 18 as the penthouses are for partying too and they start on 19), and anticipate a party feel.

title: Fantastic view services people good all was nice and friendly good location easy to go where you need a very nice tripty
text:
Fantastic view services people good all was nice and friendly good location easy to go where you need a very nice trip 
Just need the breakfast in the room could be a better and nicer 
The spa is nice also and the staff very cool enjoy so much this place

title: Business Stay
text: I had a great stay at Sixty LES for a work trip. Emily at the front desk was super helpful during my check-in process and when I had an issue with a water leak. She made sure everything was handled smoothly and was extremely kind. I would definitely stay at Sixy LES again.

title: Visited our daughter in Manhattan
text:
My best experience so far in my 27 years going to New York. The best location to get to anywhere you want. Excellent! Clean modern building and furniture, amazing customer service 24 hours. We slept like babies every single night, mattress is spectacular and so were pillows and bedding.
Views are unique. Do not hesitate for a second you get the value for the price amazing.

title: I’m DEFINITELY booking again !
text: I booked a Queen suite at SIXTY LES for my 28th birthday and everything exceeded my expectations. I connected with guest services in early December to begin my planning process and built a rapport with Vanessa who was so knowledgeable and supportive throughout my entire booking process. The day I arrived, my suite was ready for me and I even checked in online to avoid waiting ! I was able to request items before I arrived and they were all immediately available to me. I’ve never had an experience like this in a NYC hotel! I cannot wait to book again for the summer! Thanks SIXTY LES

This place was so amazing .. front desk and staff was always willing to help and so kind and friendly . Definitely will return check this place out !!! Everything is around and very convenient I love it here

title: Great Location
text: There are so many hotel choices in NYC. We usually choose a hotel close to our activities and therefore get to enjoy new neighborhoods and areas. Sixty LES was recommended by my 25+ grandson who booked a brief staycation there during the height of the Covid pandemic. He and his partner loved the contemporary design and ambiance. My husband and I elevated the average age a bit. There is a club on the 7th floor and a nice restaurant on the 2nd floor. We didn't indulge in either because our focus was on activities outside the hotel. The area is lively, with endless restaurants, coffee shops and bars. The area is close to NYU and hopping with college students, especially on Friday and Saturday nights. Our room was comfortable, modern and clean. We definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Lower East Side
text: Marvelous hotel. Great housekeeping and front desk staff. The view from 1700 is breathtaking. Empire State Building to Freedom Tower. The neighborhood is eclectic, inviting with great food and vintage shopping. Close to subway for easy Midtown and Downtown access. The Lund Family.

title: Breathtaking view
text: The view was so beautiful, definitely going back to this hotel. The room was very comfy and warm. I do have to say that the view made this room a 10/10 too bad it was winter, will be coming back in the summer to enjoy the balcony

title: Great vibe, great space, great location
text: Hard to find two queens in Manhattan, much less in LES. Big room for NYC standards plus great vibe, great views of LES, and great location in the heart of it all. Staff were helpful too. But really you stay here for a surprisingly good space in a great spot.

title: What a Pleasant Surprise !!
text:
I researched about 25-30 hotels before coming to NYC. I’ve lived here and I know how many amazing hotels there are in this city.  I wanted to stay in a more fun, hip area so chose Lower East Side.  I read on Sixty LES, and chose this hotel.  

Upon getting here, first thing I noticed was how many great food spots/bars were around it.  Upon entering the staff was BEYOND FRIENDLY, and helpful, they allowed me to upgrade my room at cost, the room was SPACIOUS, modern and beautiful.  

I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone wanting to stay in the south side proximity of Manhattan. Hope this helped!

title: Only book here if you love to party all night!!
text:
I just wanted to make sure people knew what they were getting- because I didn’t as I booked on the recommendation of a friend!

The hotel has a club on the 7th floor and this is open until 3am Thurs-Sun. It’s not just for residents, anyone can come in for it and it’s very loud. 

It also attracts a real party clientele, one of the rooms opposite us had about ten people in and out at 2.30am on our second night and I think the noise was actually from their room!!

It’s not just the music, it’s the base that vibrates the whole room. I didn’t have more than three/four hours sleep on any night.

It was the most expensive hotel I’ve ever paid for and the only thing that saved it from being a complete disaster was the quite breathtaking view from the terrace. It cheered me up in the morning when I was so tired and kept me company at night when I couldn’t sleep!

The room itself is so basic for the price. Plastic cups instead of glasses, no robe, no slippers, light switches don’t work, small towels. The lights on the terrace didn’t work, I had to navigate using the torch on my phone! 

The staff were lovely though, I have to say- although may have had a cheeky sense of humour!! They moved me for my third night to a higher floor and I was away from the club but underneath the penthouses!! I had the treat of music and base vibrations from 4pm this time instead of 9pm!!! 

If you love partying all night and sleeping all day, this is for you!! If you don’t, please book somewhere else.

title: An incredible unique hotel experience
text: Sixty LES is an exceptional hotel! it was clean, each floor has its own theme, and the staff were professional. The manager,  Dave, was great welcoming me as a first timer. Highly recommended and I will definitely come back again!

title: Noisy
text:
Stayed for 6 nights and had a room on the 4th floor. 
Unfortunately it was difficult to get any sleep due to the venue also operating a night club on the floor below for half of our stay. This meant there was constantly music blaring until 02:00 in the morning, it was so bad you could feel the vibrations through the bed when trying to sleep. This was combined with the issue of very little sound proofing between rooms meaning even when the night club wasn’t on, you were awoken by doors slamming and people talking in the corridors or in the next room

title: Friends’ weekend
text: We stayed at Sixty LES for a long weekend.in November. The location was perfect, with plenty to do within walking distance or a short ride away. The hotel itself was very comfortable and clean. We stayed in a junior suite on the 14th floor; large enough for three adults and very quiet.  The front desk staff accommodated our requests, especially Emely. We would stay here again!

title: Ask for Carlos!!
text: I always look forward to my stay at Sixty Les. It can be nerve-racking being a solo female traveler in the big city, but Carlos at the front desk is always willing to help out or give a great recommendation. It's like a home away from home and I feel safer knowing I have a friend in the building. Love love love this place and their staff -- 10/10 recommend.

title: Bad experience in New York
text:
Room not ready at 4.30 even if checked in online the day before.
Heating not working the first 3 days. 
No room service available.
Blood stains on wall and closet from previous guests. 
Constant smell of weed in the room
Unable to turn off lights several places due to broken switches.  

At the end topped off with no late checkout flexibility. Excuse: New guests will arrive early, even though check in is stated for 3 pm.

All in all a very bad experience with no compensation or remarks from staff. 

I hope people will save themselves a similar experience.

title: Big room. Small value.
text:
Sadly, the reviews were right. 

Some highlights:
Housekeeping was on point
Staff seemed friendly 

Lowlights:
I stayed in a king suite, which had its own shower and tub. Awesome I thought. But it all smelled of mildew and the tub had clear signs of mold in the crevices. 
The bed was definitely not a king size, as advertised as you’d expect in a “King Suite.” As someone who owns a king bed at home I was certain this bed was a queen at best. 
Paper thin walls as other reviews have mentioned. I could hear when my neighbor was showering. And I was kept up when the night club played music into the night (beware of staying Thursday - Sunday) 
Shared balconies as a king suite so keep this in mind if you’re considering booking. 
Poor finishing to the paint and fixtures, don’t believe the marketing photos

All in all, my work paid for this big room. But even for a free stay I would not return.

title: Can’t wait to return!
text: Really enjoyed my stay at the SIXTY LES. Hotel was very clean and staff was extremely friendly! Emely, Jimmy, and Marcos were super helpful with recommendations along with our accommodations! Also, the location is excellent!

title: Emely is a hospitality ROCKSTAR!
text:
As an ardent hotel stayer, the most important thing for me after luxury is great customer\hospitality service. Prior to staying at Sixty Les, I had gotten several recommendations about it but I was somewhat hesitant as I rarely lodge on the Lower East Side. 

My friend's boyfriend was visiting from Washington DC and had an event on the Lower East Side, they both reached out and asked for my help in booking a luxury suite in any hotel around the area. I immediately reached out to Sixty Les and I must say Emely was not just outstanding with her customer service but she graciously paid attention to every detail from start to finish of our stay. We booked the luxury suite what had a magnificent view of the New York City skyline. On arrival there were chocolates and champagne waiting in the suite. 

The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating and Emely was able to organize an early check in for us. We were always greeted with a warm smile every time we walked out and in of the hotel. Many thanks to Emely for also booking a taxi that took my friend's boyfriend to Penn Station to catch a train back home. 

The area can be a little loud as there's a lot going on, but it's what really adds to the uniqueness of this hotel and to top it all off an excellent staff. THANK YOU EMELY for everything, you are a hospitality Rockstar! I look forward to my next stay and highly recommend this hotel.

title: Convenient Location and lovely staff
text: We stayed here for two weeks for work. It is worth noting that it does get loud on the weekends. However it was perfect for our needs and the staff were very lovely and helpful. Particular shout out to Emely who was always a friendly face at reception and accommodated all our extra requests with a smile! Thanks for everything. Looking forward to returning soon!

title: Great
text: Check in at Sixty was GREAT. Marcos went out of his way to make me and my wife’s stay special! The room was spectacular! I will be returning to Sixty for sure. We Had a Really great stay with them! Highly recommend

title: Awesome customer service
text: Marcos was so kind and hospitable at the front desk. He even gave me an upgrade to the penthouse for my bday . I came in from a flight and his warm heart and kindness was just what I needed. Thank you Marcos

title: Ruidoso, oloroso
text:
Llegue a las 10 am, sabiendo que el check inn era a las 3pm, y me ofrecieron tenerlo a la brevedad. Salimos a caminar y regresamos a las 430pm esperando ir al cuarto directamente luego de un vuelo de 8 horas en la noche, el cuarto no estaba listo, esperamos 30 minutos más. 
El cuarto tenía un fuerte olor a marihuana, olor que habían tratado de eliminar, y duró tres dias.

title: Great hotel great staff
text: Normally live in NYC so have been to the hotel but never stayed. Location is awesome as LES is one of the most fun locations in the city. Checked in and Jimmy at the front desk was a cool dude and hooked me up with a sick room with an amazing view of the city. Everything was great. To top it off I left my laptop in the room when I checked out and they retrieved it and held it for me at the front desk

title: Sixty LES
text: Bra hotellrum men se till att inte bo för nära social bar om du vill sova ostört. Mycket hjälpsam och trevlig personal i receptionen. Läget är bra men kräver promenader till västar sidan. Bra med en tunnelbanestation på hörnet.

title: Seen Better Days
text: Everything is banged up and in need of repair. Had to move rooms after two nights because of the blaringly loud club music that would vibrate the room at all hours in the early morning. Made multiple requests for service and they either didn't happen or we had to request again and again. Cool location, some nice staff, but overall a major ripoff.

title: Shockingly bad
text:
Chose this hotel even after reading the mixed reviews on TripAdvisor since the SixtySoho had previously been a lovely experience. The front desk staff is amazing, thus the extra star, but upon arrival there is no doorman/bellman to greet you. Ok, I could live with that, but the lobby is super shabby as are the rooms. I would consider this a 2-3 star hotel. The elevators are so slow there were times I saw people waiting in line to get an elevator. The rooms are beat up and shabby.  The clincher was that there were no robes and slippers and that plastic cups were in the bathrooms for usage-it felt like a room by the hour situation.  The floors were not clean, which I can attest to because there were no slippers to put on. Additionally, the beds were not very comfortable.

I think this a hotel for people looking to stay in the city overnight and by the time they get back drunk don't really care what the situation in the room really is. However, at $795 per night, I expected a lot more!  Not a chance I would ever come here again.  Thankfully I was able to find another nearby hotel and check out after one night. I'm happy they let me off the hook, again front desk staff was lovely, this isn't about the staff at all, just the actual hotel itself.

title: Terrible
text: It was my actual wedding day and our experience at this hotel almost ruined the weekend. Our entire room was actually shaking from the music from their club that stays open until 4am every night (surprise! Won’t find that on their website). We reserved TEN rooms for our guests, none of whom were able to sleep with the loud music. The managers we talked to could not have cared less. There are hundreds of hotels in this city, absolutely not worth the ridiculous amount of money you’ll spend to stay awake all night in a room here.

title: Treat yourself to Sixty Les!
text:
My husband and I recently stayed at Sixty Les for 4 nights. We had such a wonderful time.  All staff was extremely AMAZING!! and  helpful. 

The rooms are very clean, chic and stylish. Beds were comfortable with plenty of closet space. Hotel location was ideal close to eateries, subways, bars and entertainment. 

The pool is petite in size, however the pool area had plenty of lounging with a cute pool bar. 

Thanks to ALL the staff who made our stay memorable. 

Xoxo
Susanne & Greg

title: Staff is incredible
text:
The hotel itself is beautiful and clean, but I keep returning to Sixty Les for the service. Carlos Lopez at the front desk is amazing and makes New York feel like home. He’s always happy to give a recommendation and goes above and beyond to make sure my stay is comfortable. 

I recently booked a stay for a business associate who has a medical condition. I briefly mentioned this to Carlos, and he immediately offered his help to make her stay as easy as possible. It’s a huge weight off of my shoulders knowing Carlos is so eager to assist her while I’m not able to be there. I know she’ll be in good hands!

I will be returning again and again — thank you Carlos and Sixty Les!!

title: Best Birthday stay ever!
text: The staff is amazing danny, emily and marcos at the front desk were friendly & accommodating. Linda, the bartender at the pool makes awesome drinks, she definitely perfected my stay! My new favorite hotel!

title: The view is great for a great price ✅
text: Great aesthetics pov. Great conversation 🧡, the time in the hotel was amazing from the time I got in. My friends and I were able to enjoy the the hole experience , in which I would recommend people from around the world to come and give it a try as well🥹💜❗️

title: Top notch service
text: Marcos was one of the most helpful and attentive people I’ve ever dealt with at a hotel. Made the stay feel so luxurious! Sixty LES is the spot to be if you want luxurious rooms, fun accommodations and a prime location.

title: Great second visit
text: Started out amazingly with an email exchange with Daniel from the front desk. He really made us feel like our anniversary weekend would be so special- and that it was! He was there at check-in and managed to get us an upgrade. He was so sweet and clearly had a knack for hospitality. The room was clean and Daniel made sure to put us further from the club for a more quiet experience. We had drinks at the rooftop bar where Matt took care of us at the bar. He was so kind and clearly enjoys working there, and makes a whiskey sour with a kick! Overall it was a great stay and we can’t wait to come back again since we’ve decided it’ll be our nyc spot for all future trips. Thanks again to Daniel and Matt!

title: I will only come back here because of Marcos
text: My friends and I stayed at the Sixty LES hotel for 7 nights and I can say that if it wasn't for Marcos, our experience would not have been a good one. Marcos was very understanding and accommodating throughout our entire stay. Upon arrival we found that the room we booked was not what we expected. When we initially voiced our concerns about the dirty pull-out couch that one of us had to sleep on for the entirety of the trip and the concern of the shared balcony (which was not specified online), we were given little to no help. We considered cancelling our reservations completely until we spoke to Marcos, who was able to find us a Junior Suite. Similarly, as we were checking out, Marcos ensured we had no issues regarding the price difference of the two rooms. Since you will find my friends’ reviews in more detail, I will sum up my review with this: Marcos was extremely kind and helpful and I would hope the other employees would follow in his example.

title: Great experience, thanks to Marcos
text:
Overall, the staff at Sixty LES were polite. However, Marcos went above & beyond. He is extremely accommodating & genuinely wants to help guests out. If it weren't for Marcos, we most likely would not be returning to Sixty LES for our next trip to NY. 

Upon our arrival, we went to our original room, the Allen suite, only to find that it was not only filthy with a beat up couch, but that the balcony was shared. We were never notified that the balcony was shared, which is a major safety concern for us three young girls staying at the hotel. When we went to the front desk to discuss possible room switch with an employee, we were told that there were no rooms without a shared balcony available. We were very close to going to an entirely different hotel -- until Marcos took over. Marcos actually took the time to look up available suites, & accommodated us with a Junior suite, which had no balcony (totally fine), a king bed + a couch to sleep on. Moreover, Marcos let us know there will be a significant price difference because this newer room was cheaper. 

Fast forward towards the end of our trip, we wanted to verify with the front desk to see what the new price will be since we were never formally told what the price would exactly be. Another employee (not Marcos or the first employee from before) told us that there will be only a $45 reimbursement for the room switch ... absolutely insane. We went from a suite that had an entirely separate bedroom, a whole balcony, & much more square footage, only to downgrade to a studio-type room with a window that barely cracks open? We decided to hold off on discussing accommodations until the next day, which was our check out day. Thankfully, it was Marcos at the front desk. Upon checking out, Marcos realized the unfair price difference, & correctly adjusted the price. 

Once again, I'd like to emphasize that the staff overall were not rude, but it seemed like they didn't care for our satisfaction or safety as guests. If it weren't for Marcos, I would have definitely left a 1 star review for the lack of accommodations, the filth, & the apathy of this hotel's staff. Thank you Marcos, we will be back just because of you & the location of the hotel.

title: Special thank you to Marcos
text:
I want to preface this review by saying if it wasn’t for Marcos we would have had a terrible experience and a much lower rating. My friends and I booked Sixty LES for the Allen suite. Upon arrival to the room we realized that the balcony is a shared balcony with the entire floor. We were very uneasy about this being three young women. When we opened our sofa bed it was dirty and very janky. 

We went downstairs and spoke to somebody in the lobby about switching us into a room without a balcony or with a King bed. We were told by this employee that there are no rooms available and every room with a king bed has a balcony. We went back upstairs to weigh out our option and decided that we were going to cancel our reservation and find a different hotel. When we went down to cancel it we were greeted by Marcos. An absolutely amazing employee. He was able to accommodate us and got us a room WITH a King bed and NO balcony (that the other employee told us didn’t exist). 

We were made aware that there is a price difference that will be accommodated at check out. Once it came time to check out a different employee told us it was only gonna be a $40 difference in the room pricing. So they wanted us to pay $3200 for a room with one king bed and no balcony when that is how much we were paying for a SUITE with a balcony and separate living area. Once again we found Marcos and spoke to him and he was able to honor the price difference and give us the correct pricing.

I really didn’t want to believe the bad reviews about the terrible customer service in this hotel since it’s in such a prime location and very convenient. However, the customer service truly is terrible with the exception of Marcos. He was the only employee that wanted to help and actually cares about the guests. If it wasn’t for him our stay would not have gone as good as it did. The level of care he puts into his job needs to be recognized and rewarded.

title: Come as you are leave like Family
text:
Let me start off by saying Vanessa is a rockstar and the best Front desk manger I’ve meet. I had return to my hometown of NYC of 25 years to work on a Street naming for barrylewis.org.  Amex platinum recommend the SIXTY LES and from the moment I walked into the door and meet Carlo & Emily at the front they handled things with amazing customer service. The location is in the middle of an incredible Artist community. I would recommend booking ahead of time and asking the hotel for what accommodation you need.  A lot of times we do thing quickly and then want to blame others when it comes to a high-end level experience. You want to be in a quieter area than request it a head of time. Sometime we have to understand that some request cannot happen. Dave the Night Manager is another outstanding person that came threw and made my experience top notch. I stayed a total of 28 days at SIXTY and got to experience such hardworking NYers. Linda & MJ at the pool made sure the fun in the sun was recognized. I hope find this review well. Many blessing and enjoy life!

PS - I also got engaged on the rooftop social club on Sunday afternoon. Make Believe

title: 6 jours de rêve dans LES
text:
Les chambres sont spacieuses et très lumineuses. Nous étions au 16eme étage avec une vue incroyable sur le sud de Manhattan. 
Le personnel de l’hôtel est toujours disponible et très agréable. 
La Piscine est très bien située et très agréable pour passer du temps relax. 
L’Emplacement est incroyable à proximité de tous les endroits sympas de LES.

title: Not worth it
text: I've stayed in many different hotels in NY and this one is definitely NOT worth the $. The location is great but the rooms are smaller than advertised, the staff is rude at Definitely not worth the $.

title: Not for us oldies
text:
Booked indigo but my fault - no confirmation so ended up round the corner at Sixty LES 

Polite helpful staff . Room fine - a junior suite - but not cheap ! 

Booked over a weekend so pool just too crowded to get into .

Didn’t eat here .

Plenty of cafes/ delis around  although area rather dirty.

Was the eldest by about 50 years - definitely a hip young crowd here . 

Wouldn’t book again - just that I need a bigger, more sedate hotel - but good if you’re 20-3o ish
