title: Great NYC get away
text:
Great location
Great restaurants around the area and right across from the subway
Great service
Large room for NYC
Comfortable enough for 4 people.
Pool is a nice size and a cool get away from the city heat. 
Would definitely come again for a stay.

title: Överreklamerat
text: Har bott på Sixty Soho tidigare och var väldigt nöjd. Förväntningarna kanske av den anledningen var för högt ställda nu när vi skulle på på ytterligare ett Sixty hotell. Rummet var trevligt. Vi önskade ett rum med utsikt mot Empire men trots att det var halvfullt på hotellet så fick vi ett random rum. Hotellet marknadsförs med fin utsikt mot Manhattan. När vi bodde där var det mesta stängt vilket man inte skrev något om någonstans, så någon utsikt att prata om kunde man inte komma åt. Hotellet känns som ett partyställe för ungdomar. Ganska trist reception och i den publika delen på våningen över fick man knappt ta en öl ... Kommer inte att bo här igen.

title: Carlos and emily are great!
text: This hotel is awesome. Super clean and very professional staff. Emily was so sweet and helpful from the very second we walked in. She was so kind and always made sure we were enjoying our stay. Carlos was also very kind and helpful! Overall we enjoyed our stay and I would definitely come back here again!

title: apartment hunting
text: Excellent location to go in many directions for tourist or apt hunting. Very clean , new rooms & amenities  Lots of nite life w/ 2-3 blocks. Very friendly helpful staff who went out of their way to provide any service for which we asked.

title: Service was great
text: Loved staying here at this hotel. The service was amazing. Was greeted by the front desk by a gentleman named Danny who i believe was the manager. He gave us a nice room and many recommendations of things to do in the area. He was charming and funny and really made my experience even better upon checking in. The tone was set! I will def be back. Thank you danny!!

title: Vacation at Sixty Les
text: The hotel was a dream!  Staff was exceptional!  My best friend and I came to New York for 2 weeks to have a dream vacation.  Marcos and the entire staff made sure that we HAD our dream vacay. Thank you Sixty LES!

title: Poor service
text:
Where to start… this hotel thrives to be trendy, but have lost the basic values and service along the way and sadly only appear foolish. Front desk staff provides a very limited service, and with an extremely reluctant attitude. Not a single smile or how are you in the 7 days we stayed here - quite miserable and sad receptionists. when we approached them, we only got half answers or closed answers (we asked about pool; they say it’s in third floor, but nothing about the opening hours (9-17) or that it is closed the whole day as they called off the life guard as lightening is expected 6 hours later. We ask if there are any outdoor place we can enjoy the sun, they say no and three days later we find a nice outdoor area at 7th floor. Or when asking about breakfast: “there are different menus”. Where can we find these? Use the QR code. Where is the QR code? 2nd floor. This kind of “service” where you’re left with a clear impression they don’t want you to enjoy the hotel unless
you’re a 25-year old hype. 

There is also a club in 7th floor that people outside the hotel also can use, so loud music at night time. This didnt bother us, but if you’re sensitive to noise you’d want to avoid the floors 3-8 as this is pool/outdoor and near the club. 
Lifts are extremely slow and restricted, so have patience. 

On the bright side, with a bit of independency you can easily stay here without interacting much with the staff. house keeping is great - these people also had manners. The lower east side area is cool, with lots of nice bars and cafes. 
Facilities are ok and hotel pool is also nice, although small and with a bit strangest rules; drunk guys having spent hours drinking are welcome to swim, but kids that have been swimming competitively for years are told they cant take their head under water «as they can drown». I appreciate the concern but the double standard adds to the feeling of not being welcome. I spend approx 50 nights a year in hotels and this is the only place ive experienced this attitude across all levels. Based on this, I cant recommend it.

title: Always such a great stay - shout out to Emily!
text:
I come to Sixty a few times a year for work and I have to say I am always so impressed by the rooms and people that work there. Emily checked me in and out this stay and she was so friendly and accommodating. She put me in an amazing room and was overall really caring about my experience at check out. 

The room itself was beautiful, minimalist, and so clean. I was always looking forward to coming back after every late night. 

Thanks again Emily for providing such an amazing customer service experience!

title: Best bed in the lower Eastside
text: This was a wonderful space with a great shower centrally located with one of the best beds we’ve ever slept in. Only issue would probably be the Wi-Fi can be a little spotty. But overall this would probably be one of the few places we would consider rebooking in our extensive travels

title: Photography on a Proposal at Sixty Les "Emely was amazing"
text: I was referred by Emily the guest agent at Sixty Les to capture  a proposal that occur in one of the Pent house of Sixty Les. As I arrive Emily the guest agent at Sixty Les was very helpful to me explained everything and was on point with everything. She seemed very focused at everything she was doing. Amazing vibe and a great personality. I also loved how they are as a Team the guys that work there too super nice and helpful. The proposal photography at the Pent house were amazing , I recommend the stay here as well because of the customer service you will receive that is super important and over all the Hotel is beautiful especially the Pent House.

title: Jimmy to the rescue.
text: If you're looking for a minimalist place to stay that is convenient to great eats and bars, this is your place. Appreciate the comfortable bed and soft silk-like sheets after all day walking about in museums. Did not appreciate the social lounge/nightclub on the 7th floor as the sound carried to the 9th floor. Lounge is open Thurs to Sat, so we asked about a room change on Fri morning. Jimmy offered us a room on the 3rd floor, apologizing for the carpet being renovated. We lost the 9th floor view but gained a balcony and a larger bathroom. Despite still being able to hear the nightclub (the dance music now weirdly soothing), we got the sleep we needed. Nightclub actually looks fun - now if only we were younger...

title: Emily the Bestest
text: Check this location out it is the BEST…Emily the guest agent was the most helpful and amazing contact person to speak to…she eased my nerves and my booking wishes and mad the process so helpful and easy

title: Best Hotel in the Lower
text:
Always make a priority to stay at the Sixty and recommend it to anyone coming out here. Central location, everything  you need and want is around the hotel.

The staff and the crew are usually always on point and very accommodating. Wether you need a early check in or forgot something in your room the team does an exceptional job of making you feel “at home”. 

Erica and Marco helped us extremely this Past stay but I’m sure everyone from bellman to security will be there whenever we need! 

Shout out the 60… my always go to

title: The friendliest hotel in NYC - LOVE DAVE
text: I came in with my girlfriend last week and remember just having an aggravating night and we were both on edge. Nothing was going well, we kept missing every reservation and we were both just at this negative energy tipping point. But when checking in, we met Dave. He just knew how to make us laugh and make us feel happy again as if nothing happened. He recommended local spots that could accommodate us for dinner and we came back to sleep happy and full. I really can’t say enough about how much it must’ve taken Dave to go out of his way and really go the extra mile to find ways to make both of us smile after the night we had. THANK YOU SO MUCH DAVE!! I will never forget this kindness and you WILL be seeing us again!

title: New favorite hotel In South NYC
text:
What an amazing stay at Sixty LES. 
Big shout out to Carlos at the front desk, made the stay extra special for us with his recommendations and the room selection.

Definitely visit the 7th floor for beverages and pre-dinner drinks at Blue Ribbon. 

This is our go-to hotel from here on out.

title: COMFORTABLE STAY
text: Enjoyed my time staying at the SIXTY LES. Staff was nice and very accommodating and made me feel very comfortable. If I come back for another quick trip I will def stay here again. Room was always clean.

title: Best service in LES
text:
I’ve stayed at SIXTY LES several times for work. It is in the best location for good food and a great time. The hotel stage does a fantastic job and creating a restful stay for all guests who travel. The bed is like sleeping on a cloud, and they go above and beyond to make sure guests are taken care of. 

100% would recommend.

title: Super noisy and quite somber
text:
They gave a room right across from the elevator. I could hear every singe move my neighbors made in the room(s) next door. It is SO loud, and there is a restaurant on the second floor and a club on the 7th floor -- on weekends, you won't sleep well. The gym is in the basement and due to covid they only let one person go at a time. It's also fairly somber and dark, I was expecting there to be more daylight.

Pros: The staff was very friendly and the bathroom was nice. 
Don't stay here if you're looking for a good nights rest.

title: ❤️
text: I enjoyed my stay. Emely is amazing. Let her know I was visiting because I needed some alone time as I’m a mom 25/8. She made sure I got the room I wanted and she was very attentive. My second time staying at 60, and I must say this time was way better because of Emely. Felt very homely. Thanks Emely!❤️❤️❤️❤️

title: Guest Services
text: My company was suppose to stay there for a night but didn’t. Due to covid. So my co worker missed the package I was going to try and get to him by fedex. Emily Espinal at the guest services has completely made it easier to reship and get the situation handled with my co worker, getting the package. I want to thank Emily and the hotel for their efforts thank you very much.

title: You have to stay here!
text: Such a great hotel, the customer service is outstanding and I hope when you go, you get to meet Dave. He’s the best and definitely deserves a raise. Make sure to check out the bar attached to the hotel! Great location! Whole Foods close by and tons of restaurants close by.

title: DAVE & EARNEST Night Crew
text: Let me start out by saying that if you should decide to stay any where else other then 60 LES located at 190 Allen Street in NYC your a damn fool or there fully booked  and your just unlucky. Now I could go on and on about how clean, current, great location, easy to get too, etc BUT IM NOT! I'm gonna tell you how the night crew are so fantastic and went over the top to accommodate and went above and beyond so much so that these 2 guys Dave & Earnest should be awarded employees of the year! Straight up I lost my wallet and had over $5500.00 in it. Now no realizing it had gone missing it turns out that these 2 gentleman found it underneath the bench in the lobby. Do you know that not a single dollar was missing when they returned it!! Ok you can say "they did the right thing why praise that?" Let me tell you why....... because 1. This is how I got to know these two cats and 2. After the initial "thank you so much" they gave me a contact which led to my first job in the city. You see that 5500 was the last money I had to my name and was going to purchase equipment for my buisness after I explained that to Earnest &Dave they knew someone who was looking for signs for an up and coming store front and now I'm getting the chance to review the hotel. It's a great hotel but it's even greater with a staff like these guys! Stay at this hotel because the others suck!

title: Great Hotel 5 star customer service
text:
Booked a weekend junior premier suite , hotel was clean room service was super. Above all front desk receptionist EMELY deserves all the credit she was very attentive and professional , she went above and beyond to make sure everything was up to par and more, I couldn’t be happier with the customer service she provided. Thank you Emely for making sure my stay went smooth, you achieved that and because of your services I enjoyed the experience. 

Thanks again Emely  🙏🏼

Room 1003

title: AMAZING PLACE & CREW
text:
We celebrated my son’s 21st bday at SIXTY LES with some friends and an overnight stay. The hotel itself is awesome, clean, and right on trend.  The staff is the best part of this hotel, Jimmy, Erica, and Billy really outdid themselves to service us.  They did everything they could to make sure we were happy!

Definitely going back!!

title: Great Time
text: Me and friends wereStaying at the 60 LES celebrating a friends birthday and from the beginning the night manager Dave he showed us a lot of from the beginning. Definitely will come back again to stay!

title: Great service
text:
Stayed here for only one night unfortunately but had the best stay.  Very attentive and friendly service.  Will be back in a month and make this a priority in my hotel choices .  Since COVID a lot of hotels are not as accommodating towards basic hotel needs and wants,  not here!  Front desk is amazing,  I forgot to ask the guys name sadly but he was so friendly and awesome!
Great room and view!

title: Amazing stay
text: I was so pleased with the service provided at Sixty Les. We booked a one-night stay on Nov 9th for a special occasion and it did not disappoint. The room was absolutely beautiful and the service by the staff was amazing. David Footman and Emily were super helpful and so incredibly kind to us during our time at Sixty Les. We will definitely be back for a longer stay in the near future. Thank you all so much!

title: OUTSTANDING STAY! IT'S ALWAYS A PLEASURE!
text: I've been staying at the Sixty LES since it was called The Thompson LES and I enjoy it the same each time! The Sixty is a beautiful, modern, gem of a hotel, located on the Lower East Side. While it's location, amenities, visual aesthetic make it a great hotel, the staff makes for a GREAT and ENJOYABLE stay! Everyone was so warm, helpful and informative, in terms of making sure guest were able to maximize their experience in and around the area, pointing out the best eateries and shopping! Thanks James, Karen, JP, David and all the great folks at the Sixty LES, you guys get my vote every time! Kudos to you!

title: Excellent stay
text: Excellent stay at Sixty LES hotel. Sami at the hotel was very accommodating and did everything to make sure we had a wonderful stay. Highly recommend staying here anytime you are visiting NY. Great location, nice rooms, and great sushi 10/10

title: Solo traveler in New York.
text: Stayed one week. Check-in was quick and easy. Room was very nice and clean. Room is appropriately sized for 1-2 people in New York. Excellent staff. Turn down services provided clean sheets and towels everyday. Easy access to subways for travel to/from airport or around the city. Bathroom was clean. Shower was rainfall shower which was super relaxing and never ran out of hot water. View of Manhattan was amazing(17th floor). Neighborhood was a little rough though had plenty of places and restaurants to explore. In hotel restaurant was good although a little expensive. Checkout was quick and easy.

title: Sixty LES Hotel - Wonderful and Problematic
text:
I stayed eight nights in October 2021 and reserved a small suite with a terrace on the  fifth floor. The terrace was only a standing terrace, much to my chagrin. Apparently someone decided it is too narrow for a table, but a small table and two chairs, which would have made a difference, e.g.,coffee in the morning and/or a glass of wine or a cocktail before dinner would have made a big difference. To me, the room was a $4,000+ waste of money.

There was an extensive bar, but no coffee maker, nor microwave, which were disappointing. I purchased a Mr. Coffee and was subsequently told the hotel has a coffee maker, if I had asked. Why wasn’t I told this when I checked in? Hotel front desk couldn’t say. Additionally, there wasn’t an Info Sheet of any kind in my room, which would have helped provide details about using the heat and air conditioning, operating the TV, hotel restaurants, about going to the Front Desk if you want a Do Not Disturb notice for your door, the location of nearest subway, neighborhood restaurants & coffee shops, etc.

Depending on the elevator you use, you have to select Floor #1 or Floor #2 in order to reach the lobby and exit the hotel. The walls are thin, as I heard people talking & TVs in other rooms and people talking in the hall, which wasn’t great. One major problem was the music and dancing that occurs each Saturday night. It was 1:30 AM before the music stoppe and I could fall asleep. Again, I was listening to people’s conversations & laughter until almost 2:00 AM. The walls & floors are far (far) too thin in this hotel for music, dancing, drinking, etc. on the 7th Floor until 2:00 AM  - c’mon! Not great after paying $4,000+ for one week.

Also, I left empty food containers in & next to the trash almost daily, but housecleaning didn’t always take it/them. I had to call Maintenance to remove the trash. One day, I turned on cold water in the bathroom sink and it was discolored.  Maintenance came up and advised that I leave the water running until it clears. It took 15-20 minutes before the water was clear, again. Last, when I turned off the TV in the sitting room, the TV automatically came on in the bedroom

On the plus side, the staff are terrific if you need something/anything. They are polite and helpful at every turn! Aside from housecleaning, who didn’t recognize the “Do Not Disturb” notice whenever I hung it outside my door, everyone else on staff are just exceptional. I was very grateful for the staff’s kind attention and care.

title: Beautiful rooms, amazing view, and the best staff
text: Sixty Les is a great location in the heart of the Lower East Side next to a ton of great restaurants, shops, and transit stops. As soon as I walked in I was greeted and taken care of by Dave, who I had a great experience with and was super kind and accommodating to me! The room had a super comfortable bed, beautiful view, ice cold AC if you like it, and an amazing rain shower in the bathroom. On top of a beautiful hotel room Dave’s service seriously made this work trip incredible and I had a great stay at Sixty. Looking forward to coming back again!

title: Cool hotel off East Houston
text: My wife and I stayed two nights at this funky cool hotel. Location wise, it was great. We were attending some of the nightclubs in the area (Mercury Lounge, Bowery Ballroom) which made it easy for the late night walk back to the hotel. Our room was super cool.  Nice bed, awesome shower, a decent amount of storage and good working AC. The lobby was small, but not really an issue. The staff were encountered were friendly and helpful. I would say the only issues we had was the speed of the elevators (plus one being out of order didn’t help), also there was always someone in the front of the entrance smoking. For a non-smoker, it was annoying having to walk through the entrance and encounter someone smoking every time.  Allen street is busy so there  isn’t much they could have done. This area of NYC can be sketchy at night, especially if you walk further south. We didn’t have any issues, but could imagine others having issues. We would consider staying here again

title: NEVER AGAIN
text:
I will start by saying the room was beautiful. Very spacious and clean. HOWEVER, check in was 3pm… i got there at 3:30 and was told my room would not be ready for another 40 minutes………that was the first problem. THEN i had 5 guests in my room at one point and heard a knock at my door. Was told they got a noise complaint. Meanwhile we were not loud at all. A man asked how many people were in my room and i said 5. He told me THE MAX # OF PEOPLE IS 4. This stranger proceeded to come into MY ROOM while I had friends GETTING DRESSED just to COUNT how many people were in MY room that i paid $700 for. 
20 minutes later there’s another knock… another noise complaint after we WERE NOT EVEN PLAYING MUSIC OR ANYTHING. I said “we can’t even talk in my own room?” He said no… i was so uncomfortable that this man came into my room just to count the number of guests. Oh and check out was 12pm and they called me at 12:15 to ask why we haven’t checked out yet … 15 minutes late but it was OKAY when i couldn’t CHECK IN u til a hour past the actual check in time. Never again!!!

title: Great stay!
text:
We normally stay at PUBLIC but wanted to switch it up in the neighborhood, happy we did! Location is close to everything and staff is great. The first night we had an issue with our room, a loud connector room + a techno private event bumpin till 2:30am in the 7th floor event space. Called down to the front desk for other options and they were very accommodating with us switching room, and with a free upgrade because of availability. 

Thank you manager Dave for making it happen and making our stay great! Will definitely come back because of that!

title: Had an amazing stay!
text: Thanks to the great service and support from Jimmy who is a great help and friendly staff member here. The location is great and there are lots of food options to choose from! The hotel staff are all amazing and I can't wait to be back.

title: Best night manager Dave
text:
Writing this review because Dave’s above and beyond service.
Dave provided me with exceptional customer service and accommodated my every need and made my stay exceptional.
 I’ve never had such a personalized service and I can say it elevated my stay in NYC.

title: Bug Infestation
text: I stayed at the Sixty LES after doing research on the hotel beforehand.  I used to stay at The Sixty in Beverly Hills frequently, so I came to expect a certain caliber of customer service.  When I checked in I found that my room was infested with bugs.  I notified the front desk and they treated the issue very nonchalantly.  They finally moved me to a new room and I was charged full price for that room.  The new room was right above a night club, which played loud music until 2 am every night.  The Sixty is certainly not taking precautions to sanitize their rooms because of the Covid pandemic, as most hotels out there are.  If a clean room in LES is what you’re looking for I would avoid Sixty at all costs!

title: Friendliest Place In NYC
text: Absolutely the friendliest staff in NYC and more than happy to assist you ! Always a huge smile !  I will absolutely RECOMMEND a stay at SIXTY Lower East side. The club was awesome ,  great drinks and dancing! The restaurant was amazing! Food was excellent!  Thank you

title: Great Gym and Rooftop Pool
text: Came in August of 2021 and really loved the place.  We were on the second half of our honeymoon and James at the front desk went out of his way to make our stay great.  The rooftop pool is a perfect place to spend a hot day.  Rooms are comfortable with great views of the NY skyline.  Showers have awesome water pressure.  Lastly, the location is literally perfect and puts you right near all the nightlife activities.  Highly recommend staying here.

title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
text: DO. NOT. BOOK. THIS. PLACE. If I could take away stars, i would. First off, let start by saying this is THE ABSOLUTE WORST hotel I have ever experienced. I decided to book a room since it was my birthday. I left the room for dinner elsewhere with friends. Once we got back, my friends wanted to use the restroom so my best friend decided to bring them to the room first while i looked for parking. As I was going into the hotel, they stopped me and told me I wasn't allowed up because there's maximum 4 people occupancy. excuse me, HUH??? I BOOKED THE ROOM. THE ROOM IS UNDER MY NAME. I explained to them that my friends were simply using the bathroom and we were going to go back out. They would not let me up to my OWN room and continued to cut me off and say "4 ppl only. 4 ppl only." I walk to the front desk to explain the situation and as I am speaking to the front desk person, I turn to the elevator and see that they just let 8 random (not being racist, just clarifying: I am asian. my friends are asian. The other 8 girls at the elevator going up were white.) I immediately asked them what the issue was and why I wasn't allowed up. They used "its policy" excuse.... when I PAID for my OWN room and was being denied entry. I was mortified. I asked them why they were being a bit irrational and possibly being racist and they immediately asked me to leave. I waited for my friends to come down and as I was trying to go up, the security starts yelling at me saying 4 PEOPLE MAXIMUM. Now Im PISSED so I said "THEY CAME DOWN ALREADY AND ITS MY ROOM." Security then let me up and I packed my belongings and left within 3 hours of my "stay". I disputed my charge with the bank and they're claiming i stayed the full night because I initial-ed the statement saying that there will be fees if I break anything (which DOES NOT prove that I stayed the night). THEY DIDNT EVEN PROVIDE THE SERVICE. THEY KICKED ME OUT ON MY BIRTHDAY and they NEVER justified why those 8 ladies were allowed up when every room is supposed to be max 4 people. $650 gone. poof. never again,

title: Beware
text: Just a quick note that to be allowed to enter the Pool, there is a $75 extra charge on each person per day. This is not listed on the Hotel's website and is misleading. Also worth mentioning that the pool is 3'11" feet deep only.

title: WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE OF MY LIFE!!
text:
Let me just start off by saying I don’t typically leave reviews. But I decided to go out of my way to bring to light some of the disturbing incidents that took place during my recent stay at the Sixty-LES hotel. Long story short, this was the worst hotel experience I ever had in my life (and I travel A LOT). 

First, during the entire 5 night stay, we only had our room cleaned 1 time. When our hotel was not cleaned, we were told housekeeping services needed to be requested 24 hours in advance. No one told us this at checkin. But we chalked it up to a miscommunication and requested it for the following day. When no one showed up the next day, we called again (multiple times) and were told the “delivery of fresh linens had been delayed.” Not even sure what that means, but after much persuading the staff reluctantly agreed to clean our room. The job was lackluster at best. They left empty cups and trash, didn’t clean the bathroom and didn’t touch the balcony. Although we “requested” housekeeping services multiple times for the remainder of our stay, they never showed up again. 

But that was only the beginning. Throughout our entire stay, the hotel staff was extremely rude, aggressive, unprofessional, and at times, highly confrontational. For example, I invited 2 friends to our hotel suite to have a few drinks before we went to dinner. The security denied my friends access to our room. When my friends tried explaining to the hotel staff that they were invited by guests of the hotel, the staff member began screaming at them and physically threatening them in the lobby in front of other guests. After this incident, the hotel manager apologized to us and told us that the hotel fired that staff member. I asked the manager why this happened in the first place and he told me the hotel apparently has an unwritten “no visitor” policy. I told the manager that I saw the staff allow other hotel guests to invite visitors to their room without issue. He responded that how the policy is applied is “up to their discretion.” So basically… the hotel maintains a “discretionary” policy that allows them to deny any guests the right to invite visitors to their hotel room. But they won’t tell you this at check in. Unfortunately, our stay only got worse after this.

This next example is what put the nail on the coffin and was what resulted in us checking out of this excuse-for-a-hotel 2 nights early. On this night, I invited 2 female friends (one of whom was an old friend from college who I hadn’t seen in years) to meet us at our hotel. They did not have keys so we asked them to wait in the lobby for us to come down. During this time, the security guard began aggressively screaming at these women to leave the lobby. Despite my friends expressing that they were visiting guests of the hotel, the security told them they had to wait outside and began physically PUSHING the two women out of the building. All of this was caught on security footage and my friends are now preparing to take legal action against the hotel. 

After this incident, we decided to switch to a different hotel for the remainder of our trip. Upon checking out of the hotel, I explained all of these incidents to the manager on site. Unfortunately, he was dismissive and unsympathetic to say the least. Worst of all, he cruedly asked “well… were the two women intoxicated?” I told him that they had not even begun drinking yet, and even if they did, how the hell does that make it okay for a security guard to physically assault two women for waiting in the lobby for their friends?! Rather than apologizing for his employees’ vile and unprofessional behavior, the manager told us he did not have the power to refund us for any portion of our miserable stay. 

Unfortunately, these incidents only represent a fraction of all the unsettling incidents and unprofessional behavior we had to deal with during our stay. I didn’t even get into the two times we were denied entry into our own rooms, which we were paying for! Or the pull out couch that feels like what I would imagine a prison mattress to feel like. But by now, I’m guessing you get my point - Avoid this hotel at all costs!!! They don't clean your rooms. They assault guests. They assault women. They create fake discriminatory policies. And they do it all with no remorse. If you stay here, it will be the worst hotel experience you will have ever have and will have you leaving NY with a truly awful taste in your mouth.

title: Not luxury.
text:
I stayed at the NYC lower east side location with 2 friends as we were passing through Manhattan. When we arrived to our room there was an obvious smoke smell. After speaking with hotel employees we were told there were no additional rooms in the hotel and the options presented were a discount on the room rate and to “ionize” but we would have to leave the room for 45 minutes while this procedure was done. Ultimately the discount given on the room was only $31. 

We were also surprised to find there was a night club on the same floor where our room was located. The hotel website does not mention there being a night club in hotel. The music coming from the night club could be heard in our room until well after 1:30 AM making it impossible to sleep. 

Considering that this hotel is marketed as a “luxury” hotel I am quite very disappointed. I would not recommend this hotel unless you don’t mind the smell of cigarette smoke and sleeping next to a night club.

title: Amazing Place to stay
text: Everything was super clean and they accommodated all of our needs. Shoutout to the elevator man Jimmy Romero, he was a standout worker at the hotel. Always super nice and professional! The hotel is also in a really cool location.

title: If I could rate this no stars I would
text: I have been at this hotel for 8 hours. The computer froze at check-in and we had to leave our bags. We tried to call to get through while we were out to see if we could check  into our room, no one picked up-operator, reservation and guest services-from their main number.  We paid for suite (3 people) and had to ask them to make up bed, we arrived back at 10:00 pm and they had left the sheets on the sofa bed (which by the way is thin and lumpy). Went out to the bar terrace for a drink and the place was holding a private party. This place is a wreck.

title: Make Believe!
text: We travelled to NYC for a bachelorette and Make Believe was a fun scene for a Saturday night party. Chelsea at the door was extremely accommodating and friendly to our walk-in group. The club had a fun vibe and great views. Poppa ran the rooftop and was so welcoming! The DJ and music was more dance/EDM than pop anthems but we still had fun. Conrad in the elevator was amazing and kept the party going as we departed. Thank you Chelsea, Poppa and Conrad!

title: Dogs in Pool
text: We were hoping for a nice, restful staycation. But we got a room that was too loud and too dirty to sleep in -- so we ended up going home to sleep. We came back to use the pool. But despite there being a supposed rule against allowing dogs in the pool, guests had their dogs in the pool. Alerted management, they did nothing. Alerted lifeguard, who had already seen it, and his attitude was like, "Well, I'm not sure it's against hotel policy..." Asked him to double check on that, and he didn't want to be bothered with it. He would have preferred to do nothing -- and allow an untrained puppy dog to relieve itself in the pool.

title: Bad
text: This could be the worst hotel experience I've ever had -- and I travel a lot. First off, when you walk into the lobby you're greeted with powerful fumes of incense. This is baffling. If second-hand tobacco smoke is bad, who decided that polluting the air with incense was a good thing? (And of course the smell rides the elevators up through the higher floors.)  The rest of this operation is chaotically disorganized. We paid extra to use the pool, but were told on the morning we tried to do so that it was closed for the day -- because "It's supposed to rain." It never did rain, but they didn't open the pool. (When we peeked in at it the following day, we saw two dogs paddling around amid the bathers.)  The hotel advertises room service, but there was none. First we were told that we would have to come downstairs to pick anything up. Then we learned that there wouldn't be anything to pick up, because food items came from the hotel restaurant -- which was closed, so...too bad. The elevators that weren't out of commission were dirty, the room furniture was battered,  and the minibar had no bottle-opener (seems like a small thing, but when you have to wait more than an hour for someone to bring one to you, it becomes a sizable annoyance). I could go on (and on), but you get the idea. Despite the fact that room rental is non-refundable, we went and slept somewhere else on the two nights we had booked.

title: Terrible Hotel Ran Like Motel
text: I use to love Sixty Les but unfortunately this hotel is now being ran like a motel. For the amount of money guests spend to stay at this property nothing is organized. There is no housekeeping I asked the front desk countless times for fresh towels. Which never arrived to my hotel room, if I wanted to spend my time at a run down motel I would've booked one. This is an insult to people who want to relax at a high end hotel. If you understaffed then maybe don't take so much guests.

title: My new favorite NYC hotel
text: We booked the afternoon of our stay and still got upgraded to a King room with balcony view of the city. Simply stunning views, beautiful giant mirrors, amazing shower, and lovely luscious green pool in the heart of the Lower East Side! And all the Warhol’s were the icing on the cake. Literally a seamless stay, would definitely stay here again!

title: Probably not
text: I traveled solo for my daughter college graduation.  Front desk was rude to other guests while I was in the lobby; barking out orders about where to stand and making derogatory comments about the guests.  My room was spacious and clean but it is loud on the weekends, mattress was not a mattress and charging hotel guests an additional $75 to use the pool and sun deck!

title: Rude staff and Busted Rooms
text: An extremely negative hotel experience. Front desk was rude, short and aggressive. Floor, cabinets, and walls of room were all very scratched up, dirty, and not well maintained. Coffee table was very damaged and disgusting. Way less upscale than photos depicted. Bedroom had AWFUL sound insulation, so loud all night. This was also in one of their largest/“nicest” rooms. Cannot recommend against staying here enough.

title: NASTY UNSANITARY
text: If you are trying to have a relaxing staycation with ur best friend and go to open the pull out couch and find a long round hair and crumbs here is the place! Also, when we went to complain, the receptionist had the AUDACITY to ask if we wanted sheets to cover up this hair. Then, the manager said we can only get 50 percent off the stay. Cool! Thank you for the discount. Next time charge us for the strangers hair!

title: Not a great experience
text:
I stayed at SIXTY LES over the weekend with a couple of girlfriends. When checking in, the concierge was so rude and condescending towards my friends and I. We kept reiterating no parties, no loud noises or you will be fined. We’re a group of 5, 28 year old women. Not teenagers. 

Later we ate dinner at the blue ribbon sushi restaurant. This is some of the worst fish I have ever eaten. And for prices like that, it should be amazing. I was so disappointed. 

The concierge in the morning was a young woman and she was super sweet and the rooms were very nice and clean. These are the only two reasons the rating is even a 2.

title: Below Average
text:
Imagine an overly modern hotel in 2005.  Now, imagine that same hotel that does zero upgrades or anything to re-invest into the hotel.  That’s Sixty Les.

During check in, my buddy gets a long listed scripted list of “don’t do’s” which included no partying, loud noise, fridge containing drinks that are all chargeable, blah.   I get it, but the attitude was quite a negative start to the stay. 

Price reflects the hotel.  I paid a little more, upgraded and got one of the “higher floor” junior suites.  The whopping 14th floor with no real view, stains on couches, water marks on desks, damaged lamp shade, very average to below average hotel.  Bed was decent, I will give them that.

Wasn’t very impressed with location either.  Stick with West Village or Soho.

title: Amazing hotel!
text: We had our honeymoon in New York from Norway and first started with a cheap ABNB, but hated it and decided it was our honeymoon after all and that we deserved some luxury and ended ut at Sixty Les. The room was big with a big bathroom, a "living room" and a big bed in its own part of the room, overlooking the pool and the classical New York brick buildings. The pool was amazing! The rooftop was magical!

title: Great Bathtub but Overall Not Totally Feeling It
text: We had to wait about 20 minutes after 3pm to get into our room because they were cleaning it so there wasn't 24 hours between us and the last guests. The hotel is clean and fashionable. The deep square bathtub was fantastic. The views are awesome.  There is something about the aesthetic though - black walls, black tiles, glass coffee table, lighted photo behind headboard of bed... that elicits vice. We heard a lot of screaming from drunks either next to or above us (or both). We also  had to wait over three. hours to get a tea kettle for the room. The front desk was very kind and apologetic. I get it. These things happen. They are probably understaffed due to covid. I also wasn't able to get a later check out. If you want a later check out, don't wait until that morning. Try the night before. It's not a cozy hotel. It's the kind of hotel that makes you feel as if you are a rock star that wants to party.

title: Absolutely amazing!
text: My husband and I stayed at sixty les for our 5th year anniversary. The room was amazing! Very clean, well stocked bar and lots of snacks in the room! They were convenient... the prices for the snacks seemed high until you walk around NY and realize the prices are about normal. The view in the room was also amazing! The staff was friendly. We got to go on the rooftop to celebrate and they even let us be alone and made it feel special! The bed was firm but comfortable. There’s tons of restaurants near by. The only thing to keep in mind was the parking. Parking cost $75 a day and it’s a little walk(4 blocks) to the nearest parking garage. However we had a nice peace of mind knowing our car was safe in there. You can drop your luggage off in the lobby when arriving so you don’t have to carry it. The staff are very friendly and helpful. There is no room service because of Covid but if you need something they bring it right up to you. There was no issues with that for us. This is a true NY experience if that’s what your looking for. We was and extremely pleased we choose this hotel. Will definitely be back

title: Horrible experience.
text: Check-in experience was terrible. A very embarrassing moment to say the least. I've been here multiple times before this time and always end up coming back because I loved coming here. I will not coming back after the experience that I had. Front desk didn't even seem to be aware of the hotel's policy? I've recommended this place to so many coworkers & friends for travelling purposes.  Save your money and time and look elsewhere.

title: Staycation Gone Wrong
text: Booked the Empire Terrace with Penthouse Pool Paradise. On their website when booking the Penthouse Pool Paradise package it said it reserved two loungers for the pool. We got to the pool and the lifeguard on duty who was so nice! Basically told us the front desk is advertising 1 thing and guest of the hotel are getting another. They did not have chairs reserved for us. It was basically first come first serve. I would not have paid even more per night for my room if I knew we weren't actually going to get loungers at the pool. The pool was packed when we got there and there was no place to sit. It was a waste of money to buy that package. They included a bottle of wine and sunscreen in the package but it was not worth it at all. We just wanted a staycation at the pool and with the package we paid extra for. The room itself was nice. Great view of the city. But would not stay here again.

title: Overpriced & Horrible Service
text: I booked 2 rooms at this hotel a king suite & double queen studio that both had a private balcony each and we're anointed rooms for my birthday weekend sep 5-6 & made reservations for their restaurant at blue ribbon. A week before arrival I called to make sure that the Rooms I booked where on the same floor & the person I spoke to assured me that it was possible. Fast forward to day of arrival I was checking in at 3pm with the front desk lady told me that the rooms were on different floors When she told me that I was very confused because I was told the complete opposite but I went to talk to my family to see if they were ok with being on a different floor from me, when I went back to the Gsa I was working with was attending another client so I went to the other Gsa & he was very rude to me and was very bothered that I was asking questions so I sucked it up and just grabbed the hotel cards to head to the rooms. The King suite was not clean the shower smelled like a public restroom the entire stay! There was no toothpaste ,no robes & no hand soap ! The double queen studio was not as described! There was no balcony like it stated! No toothpaste or hand soap or robes as well. Also when we called the front desk because we needed something no one would pick up. The stay Was so disappointing & disgusting it did not feel luxurious the way it looks on your website ! The restaurant was a mess to the menu at the restaurant was not the same the website ! When I made my reservations I inquired about the pool and they said it was closed and I got at the hotel it open and I wasn't able to go to the pool because I didn't reserve it, which is unfair This was overpriced & bad customer service, so much for a great birthday weekend... The hotel did not accommodate us for our stay

title: Don't Waste Your Money
text:
Luxury price for subpar hotel. The elevators appear to consistently be out of service, the mini bar was completely empty, the lighting is horrible and the pool closes too early. It appears that people live here and hog the elevators with their groceries and some even have pets. One person's pit bull even pooped on the sidewalk right in front of the hotel entrance. Also, my friend woke up with bites on her ankles after sleeping in the pullout sofa. Also, after checking out, I was charged $70 for allegedly taking two bottles of shower gel, which I didn't even use, much less take.

If you're looking to book this hotel for  amenities, go elsewhere...trust me.

title: Great Stay
text: I had to stay here for 5 nights during the pandemic. I originally booked the Allen Suite as I wanted outdoor air coming into my room.  I had taken a red eye flight from LA so I arrived around 8 am and the hotel staff generously allowed me to check in early and on top of that upgraded me to a King Suite corner room. The suite had great shows and bath and large with bedroom and separate living room as well as a small balcony. Obviously with the pandemic many of the regular services of the hotel was not available but food delivery was made to lobby and housekeeping staff frequently was available to provide new sheets and towels. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Stylish Accommodations on the Lower East Side
text:
My spouse and I stayed at the SIXTY LES on a long weekend in mid-January 2020. We booked our stay online, reserving a Junior Suite. Note that the SIXTY LES charges a $29 per night Guest Experience Fee, which includes two bottles of water per night, a $10 minibar credit per night, Wi-Fi, and fitness center access. (The mandatory fee also includes pool access in the summertime.)

As its name implies, the SIXTY LES is located on the Lower East Side; its main entrance is on Allen Street, with a rear entrance (via the hotel restaurant) on Orchard Street. Another SIXTY property is located in SoHo, as well as a location in Beverly Hills. The lobby of the LES is dark and chic, with a few minimalist furniture pieces arranged along the wall across from the front desk. A wall of hanging beads behind the front desk hides a staircase that leads to the lounge/bar/restaurant area. The second floor offers comfortable lounge space, along with the hotel restaurant Blue Ribbon Sushi Izakaya and the outdoor Kanpai Garden in warmer weather. The seventh floor offers a nighttime club called Make Believe; on the Saturday afternoon that we arrived, with our room located just one floor below the lounge, the noise and vibrations were a bit loud. We were concerned that the raucous music would continue late into the night/early morning, but when we returned from dinner at about 10:00 pm, it was surprisingly quiet. In contrast, there was no music/noise on Sunday afternoon or evening, so perhaps the Saturday afternoon party was an anomaly. 

Our junior suite number 601 was spacious at 450 square feet. The entry foyer led to the bathroom, with separate glass cubicles for the toilet and the oversized slate shower, divided by a small sink/vanity area that could be closed off by a sliding door. Note that the back of the shower wall faces the main living area in the room and contains a panel of frosted glass through which shapes can be viewed, so the shower area is not completely private. Across from the bathroom space was a wall with three adjacent closets; one held two cozy bathrobes (but no slippers), another held the minibar and safe, and another was empty with plenty of room to hang clothes and store bags. On that same wall, a built-in furniture unit included the desk (on which trays held non-refrigerated mini-bar snacks and full-size liquor bottles for purchase), and a long wooden bench suitable for holding luggage. (There was a tremendous amount of storage space and surfaces in this room.) Online, room amenities mention Nespresso machines in the rooms, but there was not one in ours. Our junior suite had a small living area (with sofa and coffee table) separated from the bedroom area (with a king-size platform bed [which was a bit low for us 50-somethings!] and two nightstands) with a hanging metal bead/chain curtain. Large floor-to-ceiling windows overlooked the outdoor pool and Orchard Street. Room décor (including a unique lighted photograph headboard, glossy black wood floors, and black reflective walls) created a stylish, contemporary feel. The wall-mounted television could be angled slightly depending on whether you viewed it from the sofa or the bed. 

We enjoyed our stay at the SIXTY LES; we like the area, and we liked our spacious junior suite.

title: Good room, worst service ever
text:
The room is classic, nothing to say about it, you pay for what you have, nothing to be excited about. The elevator can be a bit long to take you to your room but overall experience was OK. 
The big issue :
When you arrive they ask you to pay a deposit of 1.5 times the price of the room and let you know it will be refund in 5 to 7 business day... 13 days I'm Waiting for it... I have send 3 emails and called twice to ask is it normal, what is happening just to know, to be aware, if they were telling me sorry its taking 15 days, fine but here... No answer, no communication, no clarity... And it was the same at the desk when I was at the hotel, not nice people, except the security person, Won't recommand

title: Great modern hotel! Very popular (and loud) bar.
text: Spent two nights here for a girls weekend. It was very modern and clean. When we arrived, it only took a few minutes to check in. The workers were very friendly and willing to help. When we first got to our room, it was on the seventh floor. There was a bottle of champagne in the room. We called the front desk to ask about it and they said the champagne was ordered by someone else and was put in the wrong room. (We didn't want to pay for it, but would have taken it if offered to us). They called back and offered to move us to a different floor because someone else had requested a room on the seventh floor because of the attached bar on the same floor. They stated that the bar area can be very loud. We decided to move. We were moved up to the 11th floor. It was very nice and quiet. The original room had king sized beds but we paid for queen. the second room had the queen beds. Needless to say, they messed up. The rest of the stay was great. We checked out the bar which was hopping at 7pm (early for the city!). Glad we didn't stay on 7. There is a nice quiet lounge on the second floor right outside of the attached sushi restaurant. Great location, too!

title: Still a Great Choice but waiting for lifts ....
text: I'm becoming a regular to this hotel, its location is the drawcard but the level 1 bar and restaurant are also pretty damn good. I get a corner room so bright and light. The balconies give such great views, reminds you what an awesome city you are in. Staff are very friendly and helpful ....

title: Save your Money!
text: Let me start by saying I come from the hospitality industry and work for a resort so I am extremely patient and understanding when it comes to service. In fact, I always try and write good reviews only. Upon trying to check in the front desk agent informs me that he can only check me in with a credit card that has a chip. I found it a bit odd but did not have a card on me with a chip. I explained that to him and he said well I can just cancel it for you then. No offering of help to try and offer an alternative nothing. I had never heard of this before and travel often. I was shocked and asking him what my options were he rudely said well I can cancel this reservation and you can leave! I was stunned as this was not an option. I asked if he could at least attempt to try and swipe my card he replied I guess. When that didn’t work I asked to speak to a a manger which he claimed he was the manager. I then said well what if I pay cash which he then became very inclined to take my money. I thought that was also odd. Then I asked can you try and manually enter the credit card number which he said I guess and then tried and it and thru. He did not smile once was not welcoming or hospitable in any way! Mind you I was extremely polite as I know how guests can be. The room was sub par the bathroom floor was filthy and the hallway smelled like a zoo literally a zoo! The valet charge is $70 and they also charge u some other outrageous fees for things as well. The room was supposed to cost me $215 I wound up being charged $397 and no I didn’t order room service or access the overpriced minibar. I have no problem paying for luxury or service but I could have stayed at the W which was a much better a highly favored property over this one for that amount! The couch in the room was in the condition of a frat house basement couch I wouldn’t even sit on it! Save your money and go elsewhere! Oh and I am still waiting for my “incidentals“ which was another $397 for some reason to be refunded a week later! I actually looked forward to  staying here but it’s a disgrace to the industry. The valet was the only plus extremely pleasant and attentive and the bed was comphy! Watch out for the front desk agent seemed like he was scheming on some extra money for his pockets not the property!

title: Avoid - be warned
text:
Booked an Allen suite room, 6th floor. Walked in, and saw a sectional couch in horrible condition. Disfigured cushions,  stains throughout the couch. Picture a couch that gets offered for free on Craigslist, probably in that condition.

We had a loud thumping music in our room until about 4am and that’s when we were finally able to go to sleep . We weren’t warned or asked or told that our room would be right under the bar club. Luckily we paid for late checkout at 2pm. 

2:02 PM someone from the front desk was knocking on our door to make sure we were ready to exit. We were a few minutes late, but our whole morning afternoon was set back because we weren’t able to sleep until the wee hours of the morning. 

CANCEL your reservation unless you plan on indulging and partying in NYC until the wee hours of the morning. Don’t expect 4 star furnishings, or 4 star service.

Their resort fee is silly, find a reputable hotel even if it will cost you a little more

title: Nice Property
text: This hotel has a nice property for the price. The area is lively and the rooms are modern and clean. My only complaint is they charge an "experience fee" of ~$30 a day. This fee makes more sense when the pool is open, but it should be reduced in winter when there is one less amenity. I know the fee is to offset the amount they charge, which is relatively low for how great it is, but it should vary depending on the season.

title: Best bang for your buck
text:
The hospitality was A+ and Raul was top notch! Sixty LES is such a cool hotel and in a great location... Sushi bar on the 2nd floor was delicious and the 7th floor has a cool bar (just a younger crowd). Overall this hotel is a win because it’s in the Lower East side and you’re able to walk just about everywhere. 
Happy we made the decision to stay here.

title: Best service!
text:
I stayed at Sixty LES for 4 days and received the most amazing service. When we checked in a gentleman named Raul checked us in and carried our bags to our room without hesitation. When we checked out, Uber was surging +$100 to get to JFK! Raul went out of his way to walk down the street and get me a taxi for a flat rate of $52, just in time for me to make it to the airport on time. 

Excellent service- I will be back! Thanks Raul!

title: Mixed experience
text:
We stayed at this hotel twice in one week - a 2 night stay with a one day break to visit family, then a one-night stay.  We booked a suite which was nice and spacious, nice wet bar with coffee machine (we later found out not all rooms have coffee machines).  The mini bar prices are truly ridiculous - like $60 for a $10 bottle of wine.  I am willing to pay a lot for convenience, but not that much.  The view is nice and the neighborhood is great.  The shared balcony was no better than a window, however. 
 We had breakfast on site which was good, and had a few snacks in the sushi bar one night which were excellent.  So the first stay midweek was all pretty fine.  However, they also made us sign something at check-in saying we wouldn't bring any outside food or drink in.  I have never seen that before and I think it's unacceptable.  Can't bring home your leftovers?  What about your latte?  When we returned for our second stay on a Saturday we were a couple hours early and they understandably did not have our suite ready.  We went to lunch and returned at check-in time.  The room was still not ready and they said housekeeping was very behind and it could be another hour.  They offered us free drinks in their wild patio bar.  We were exhausted and needed to shower and nap before obligations that night.  About 45 minutes later they still didn't know when the room would be ready so my husband convinced them to downgrade us to a smaller room so we could just check into something.  This room had no coffee machine.  I thought this was poorly handled, they knew we were in the area and would want to check in on time, and we were already return guests that week which I thought would count for something.  And how long does it take to clean a room when you know a guest is waiting?  Finally I have to say I found the video in the elevator revolting.  Also, when the club is hopping the elevator waits can be long.

title: Great location, sensational staff!
text:
This hotel is in a great location on the Lower East Side, near its borders with the Bowery and the East Village.  I stayed here for 3 nights in October and had a wonderful time.  It's important to note up front that, as a number of other reviews mention, this hotel can have a lot going on.  The club is very active (I didn't see inside, just the many people going in), and the overall party atmosphere can be strong in the public areas (at least on the weekend), so if that sounds off-putting, this may not be the place for you.  However, I found the atmosphere to be energizing and well managed.  The rooms are gorgeous and many of the views are spectacular.  I was lucky to get a King Suite with Terrace and it was very clean and well-appointed.  They nailed all the basics of water pressure, linens, bedding and the overall condition of the room/furniture. 
 
The best part of SIXTY LES, though, is the staff.  Oh my.  These people are top notch.  I was not so great at capturing names, but Josh was the manager on duty most of the time I was there, and he is fantastic.  Everyone at the front desk was awesome.  The bellhop team members were EVERYWHERE, and couldn't have been nicer or more helpful, and did everything with a smile and super positive attitude.  Housekeeping left me a lovely note and did a beautiful job.  The people at this hotel give it a personality that will have me coming back again and again.  

Thank you, SIXTY LES team, you gave me such a great stay!

title: Like place but not the bed
text: I gave 4 stars bcuz the bed was not comfortable. To me the bed is important. When I travel it is important I get a good sleep even If it is for a couple hours. But everything else in the room was nice. The bathroom is cool, I like that 2 ppl can fit in the shower. The room was big, it had a sitting area. The hotel offer valet which is a plus but at check in they didnt mention no going in and out, which means everytime u leave and come back there is a charge. They have a club or lounge area. What I didnt like is even tho we stayed at the hotel we had to go to the first floor get a stamp and then go up to the lounge area. I feel if u stay at the hotel u dont need to get a stamp like ppl who didnt stay at hotel. There is a lot of eating places walking distance. I like the price and the place just need a better bed.

title: You pay for the view - not the service
text:
Sooooo..... 

let’s open with that. 

I was shocked to the core with this visit. First off to have no tea and coffee station when we spent a lot for a weeks stay was shocking to me, but each to their own with basic hosting skills. I’m also laughing in my head at the fact of seeing a lot of other reviews commenting on the price of bar snacks. Pop chips were $7 a packet which is well over 100% mark up. They are taking the piss. The $10 credit on the daily mini bar just isn’t worth it.

What was worse was they stuck us in the room above the social bar which was pumping out bass until 4am. I found it funny how they could leave you a considerate note about being cautious with the transport around the New York marathon trail but not the noise from their own venue. Seems as though they value their tacky nightclub clientele who may only pay an entry fee over guests who spend hundreds of dollars per night for a room who could potentially return but in this case never! I’m glad British air ways were able to supply me ear plugs where the cost of my flight was cheaper for a return then one nights stay at this hotel. 

There was no information about pool closures when booking, and the hotel staff didn’t notify us about sister hotels and their amenities.

Front door staff were on point though, the doormen and cleaners were wonderful. 

I’d never return. 

They also never replied to my email about the noise from the social club. Let me mention one more thing. They put traffic cones in front of the entry doors at 12 to ensure their night club clientele don’t enter the lobby. However the front desk staff think it’s a great idea to blast loud music from a portable bluetooth speaker in the lobby sending mixed signals to anyone coming home for the night. It was tacky like the video in their elevator.

Don’t be fooled by their website. The end.

title: Skip this One
text: My two star rating is not based on the facilities perse, but rather on value for the cost. We had a suite on the third floor, street side. Pretty noisy, but that could have been fixed Here's what couldn't: You get a daily $10 credit for the minibar. Unfortunately one of the only things under $10 is a small can of Pringles, so really all the $10 credit would do is probably to encourage you to spend more that $10. In addition, there is a 10% restocking fee (come on!). But the worst minibar affront is yet to come: Their literature says that you "may" be charged an additional fee if you store your own items in the minibar.  I must admit in the 19% of the world that Trip Advisor says I have traveled that I never came across something that egregious. A few other tidbits: the sofa was worn and lumpy, actual stuffing showing on one corner of the ottoman. The bed was likewise worn and lumpy. The toilet was slightly off-putting as it is by itself in a small closet-like nook with a 3/4" thick frosted glass door.  In addition this was no ADA toilet, and was so low that it was hard to get on and off it. That was ultimately the deal killer for us, and I do have to give a shout-out to a very understanding manager that we spoke with who was kind enough to allow us to cut short our stay after just one night.

title: Fantastic location and staff
text: We stayed in Sixty LES on the beginning and end of a New England road trip, and the staff was so helpful and accommodating. Raul at the door was extremely helpful and nice, he really made us feel at home and took great care of us throughout our stay, until the moment of departure.

title: Booked for 3 nights
text:
So far, I've had a pleasant experience over the phone and agents were very patient, helpful, accommodating and kind. I navigated the website and was very impressed with the hotel appearance and double beds room size which lead me to call and book. After reading the "not so great" reviews, I was apprehensive about keeping my reservations as I still have one more day to cancel it but I am still hopeful even after reading all the reviews, good and bad that I will have a great experience at Sixty Les. I booked the double queen beds room that is over 400 sq ft and hoping that it holds true to the website listing and is what I will be calling home for the three nights I am there. Overall I've received great customer service considering I called over five times and the level of service was consistent each time and I hope my experience in person at the hotel will be the same. 

Look out for a "Stayed for 3 nights" review

title: Horrible Customer Service
text: This hotel tries so hard to be trendy and hip however, ends up grossly missing the mark and instead comes off as pretentious and cold.  They seem to have forgotten basic customer service and treats their guests as unwelcome distractions.  The elevators have a disgusting sexist video on loop of two women frolicking around their hotel acting like complete prostitutes.  Did not explain parking fees during check in or check out and over-billed me.  When I tried to talk with someone in charge she was unimaginably rude and condescending and 100% unhelpful.  There are soooo many amazing hotels in NYC - do not stand for this.  I promise you, there are rooms comparable to this hotels and you won't have to deal with their horribly rude customer service.

title: Love this hotel!
text: This is the third time I’ve stayed at Sixty LES when coming to NYC. I’ve stayed for business and fun and every time the service is amazing. Raul is especially memorable. He is always so kind, professional and takes such good care of us! Will always come back.

title: Nice boutique hotel with special atmosphere
text:
Had a junior suite which usually has two rooms - we had a long room separated by a curtain of chains. 
Good location but we stayed in the Sixty in Soho (Thompson St) before and we liked it much better. Friendliness and Service quality of staff much higher. 
Price too high for value offered.

title: Chic spot in LES
text: Cool rooms, nice big showers, balcony overlooking 2nd Ave. Overall really pleased with this place. Staff always friendly. My guy Raul always willing to give the insider tips on where to go/good restaurants.

title: Thank you, Raúl
text: Raúl is definitely the man you want to see when you walk into Sixty Les. He’s attentive & all smiles. Made the check out experience seamless & enjoyable. His help was much appreciated. Overall experience was A+. Will for sure be back!

title: Clean, slick rooms and  very good service.
text: This hotel is very trendy, very close to subway (F line) and M 15 bus stop a few steps to left of front door. The staff are exceedingly obliging, polite and helpful. The only reservations we have are that the rooms are not well designed for people who are staying for a week and want to unpack properly. Also the lighting in the rooms is very dim - particularly for seniors! Otherwise it is a very good hotel indeed.

title: Noise from nightclub
text: We stayed in room facing street and could hear hotel nightclub easily from three floors above. It stays open generally till 3-5am. Pool bar closed by 5pm due to neighbors being close by. Not sure why guests aren’t treated as well as the neighbors.  Check in staff generally ok.  One staff member continually referred to me as ‘her’ whilst checking in and kept on doing this even when knowing my name; inept and incompetent.

title: Terrible terrible terrible
text: Don’t get fooled by reviews saying this is a cool hotel. The area is nice, but please go and find somewhere else to stay. Apart from the fact that there’s a super noisy nightclub on the seventh floor (yes, you can hear the bloody music and people talking loudly until around 3-4am, which means forget about a goodnight sleep), the room next door to ours had parties going on super late all the time. Unfortunately, even though the staff tried to help, not much could have been done. We desperately wanted to move hotels, but no refund was offered. They suggested changing rooms to probably another super noisy room, which didn’t really solve the problem. The fact this is a 4-star hotel is a bit of a joke, and the price it’s charged for such a horrible infra-structure is completely out of order! Please please do not stay here!!!

title: Experience will depend on what you're looking for
text:
Age (and/or lifestyle) might make a difference in your experience here. A group of us stayed here for one night for a bridal shower/bachelorette. We checked in around 5ish. All the rooms were ready but I think we had to change the name on them so there was some difficulty with that. I don't think it took too long to resolve though. The bellmen (Raul and Christian) were AMAZING and incredibly helpful. They were the best part of the stay. The housekeeping staff were also very nice.

Aside from them, everything was just kind of meh. Elevators take forever and you're packed in because of the bar/club patrons. The pool area is small and gets packed early as well. For whatever reason, despite getting ice earlier in the evening, later in the night when my friend called down for more, she was told there was a charge for ice. Before she could inquire further, the guy hung up on her.

The main room we hung out in was a King Suite Terrace so we had a little outdoor area, which was quite nice. The view is amazing and it was sort of unique since that was the night of the blackout. But you could get views at other hotels too. There's nothing here that's particularly special.

Again, could be an age thing. I think when you're younger, you're more tolerant to noise, cramped quarters, and sassy customer service - the general partying lifestyle and being amongst the action. Which, is the vibe that SIXTY LES is going for. So in that regard, they're quite successful. (Except I think the pool area could be improved)

If you're looking for something more relaxing and chill, or if you've got a family with young kids, this is not your spot. I literally saw a guy walk out of the pool because a child entered and was too close to him. He looked at the child annoyed and walked out. Not saying that's the hotel's fault, but that guy is definitely the clientele they're marketing to and trying to attract - young, fun, partying, etc.

Not my kind of hotel, but I could see others enjoying it.

title: Sexy, soothing hotel - a gem in the lower east side
text: I stayed here over the Labor Day weekend. I was pleasantly surprised. I stayed at the junior suite. Very big room. Lots of Japanese accents, very soothing, calming colors. Surprinsingly quiet given we are in downtown Manhattan. I slept like a baby. The hotel also offers a surprisingly nice outdoor swimming pool where you can have drinks and hang out. Finally on the 7th floor you have a beautiful lounge with DJ and stunning views of the NYC skyline. I'll definitely stay again!

title: Great hotel in the heart of New York
text:
Felicia and the staff were very nice. I’ve stayed at a few hotels in NYC and this has been the best I’ve stayed in. 

Nice and friendly staff (all Of them)
Comfortable beds and pillows 
Big spacious room
Quite room (couldn’t hear the streets or neighbors)
Great location 
Nice pool

Will definitely be back

title: Souvenirs disappeared
text:
Some souvenirs went missing from my room. My sisters and I checked in to Sixty LES on August 21st and checked out on August 25th. I noticed 2 pairs of shoes and a shirt I purchased for my son at a little boutique shop called Mooney were missing. One of my sisters had flew out the night before and I was up packing on the 25th at 5:30am NY time (2:30am LA time) so when I called to ask her if she had accidentally packed them she did not answer. At that point I had a flight to catch so I just assumed she had them and went on my way. I knew if I by chance i forgot them in my room I could always just pay to have them mailed out to me (happened to me once before at a different hotel). I called on the 25th in the evening and was told nothing was found in my room. I was dumbfounded. How did they just disappear? I asked my sisters to please check EVERYTHING again and I did too. Still no luck. I emailed the hotel today and received a response pretty quickly stating that nothing was found in my room. 
I felt the need to post about my experience because it's the first time I've ever had anything disappear from my hotel room. What the heck could have happened to my stuff? The only people who had access were my sisters, myself, and the staff. Let's say I did forget them in the room, well nothing was turned in. Or maybe the housekeeper threw them away thinking it was trash? So there's that. Nothing I can do but warn people to keep track of your things. Luckily I always use the safe for valuables.

title: Boutique Hotel or Youth Hostel?
text:
Honestly, I thought that the whole place was a rip off. It was expensive and there’s was no service. They were rude, unhelpful and quite frankly we were the unimportant guests. Obviously the drunk people that were trying to get into the hotel without being  guests were much more valued. We had a few drunks in the elevator and this was not a nice experience.
On Saturday, we had gone to the pool to sit and relax, though when we arrived it was noisy and packed with people that evidently were not staying there. We were even asked to move, because the seats were reserved. This was a disgrace, since we were paying a fortune for a suite! We then moved to the terrace to find that the noise coming from the hotel social club was unbearable. This was our one opportunity to sit and relax. 
Got a bit sick of the over sexualised  video in the elevator too! Totally inappropriate, especially since there are kids staying there.
Honestly are you a party hostel or a boutique hotel??!

title: Overpriced and Noisy
text: Can’t say I enjoyed my stay here. Such bad value for money, area a bit too sleezy and too focused on shallow party goers. Given we were in the most expensive suite, if that is an accurate description for what we had, I don’t think we were treated accordingly.  No room at the pool and that was why we stayed here. Always full of people who evidently were not staying at the hotel and who had reserved seats.  Extremely noisy bar on terrace that was more like a rave with chronic music.  Website should explain that only suitable for 29 something party goers. Also a little worn looking ie chipped furniture. Not a boutique hotel and definitely not worth what we paid.  Great if you are after a youth hostel atmosphere at an exorbitant price

title: Just Ok
text: For the price it could be much better. No doorman to meet me outside, not really a lobby area to speak of, shower leaked on the floor. Rooftop bar was too much of a party scene. Pool was nice. Rooms were a good size. PRO TIP - get RID of that annoying promo (+sexist) video of women in bikinis playing in the loop on the elevator. It's too much. Honestly. What dudes made that marketing decision?!

title: Absolutely wonderful for Partying
text:
I planned a party for my brother and SIXTY LES really came through. There were slight delays in getting the room ready, but the free upgrade and excellent customer service made up for it. Everyone on site was very nice and helpful. I do want to mention Shemara(front desk); Shemara went above and beyond with helping me plan my brother's birthday. It was as if she was my personal party planner. I have her to thank for making a big event much less stressful. A+ customer service all around, but Shemara especially!   

We stayed in the penthouse loft. It is pretty hard to beat that room. Check it out. It is fit for a king/queen! Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Wanna be boutique hotel not quite worth it.
text:
Positives. Location. Staff and service. Great party options (lounge, pool, sushi). 

Negatives. Overpriced. Loud. Party scene. 

Great spot but this entire neighborhood is one big frat party on the weekend. The hotel is clearly a day drinking (and night drinking) spot which is fine. But just he warned. A bit of a mess when you are coming and going with your children. The lounge that everyone goes to shares the elevator with everyone else. A better system to let both exist needs to be implemented. 

Room was ok but a bit musty and damp.

title: Nothing really bad, but nothing really good either
text:
Stayed at Sixty LES for three nights at the end of July. Stayed in an Allen Suite.
Nothing really bad, but nothing really good either.

Location: liked it
Reception personnel/check-in: efficient, but no "hi, how are you doing", "welcome" "great to have you". I know it is NYC and everyone is very cool, but you know, you are working in the service industry...
Allen suite: good size, nicely laid out, stylish, but somewhat cheaply done and won't age well (queue hinge in cupboard broken etc), and what's with the little drawer unit in the bedroom? Cheap looking, bad quality etc
Housekeeping: good
Pool: very nice, but less nice swimming with cigarette butts from night before
Lifts: you might as well walk, especially when one of them is out of service
Check out: Receptionist didn't bother asking whether we had a good time or not; probably didn't quite care enough - again see comment above. And would have been nice to be told about the resort/service charge at check-in...

As I wrote above, nothing terribly wrong, especially as it was relatively competitively priced at $450 a night, but it is all in the execution... Maybe I would feel less strongly about it all, had we not just spent 5 nights in a Four Seasons where none of the above would happen. I guess that's why I will go back there, but probably won't be coming back to SIXTY LES, especially as there are lots of other similar hotels in NYC.

title: New York hotel
text: Excellent hotel. Great pool area with amazing friendly and helpful staff. Awesome rooftop  bar and club. Big rooms with comfortable beds and nice linen. We stayed I a junior suite with lounge area which was great

title: Trendy at all costs?
text:
If being trendy provides an excuse for the lack of quality, then this is definitely the place to book. It was my second visit in 3 months and despite the few deficiencies, such as the long long wait for the elevators or the quirkiness of some staff members, which I considered cute in fact, I still decided to come back. Unfortunately this time there was nothing cute, nor justifiable. To name a few incidents; a young girl fished a condom out of the pool, I had little black bugs in my bed, and I had literally beg the cleaners to make up my room. When I gave feedback on the above to the reception they were rather unimpressed and promised to “let everyone in the office know”. 
On the positive side, the location is great and some of the bar tenders at the pool bar are extremely nice.

title: Do not stay here unless money is the only thing that matters to you in choosing a hotel
text:
The only reason I'm leaving more than one star is because this hotel was cheap. Before reserving, we called ahead to see if we could use the pool for the day on the 4th and were guaranteed.
