We arrived to the pool at 9am, got seating, and a staff member put a reserved sign on our seats(without saying anything) while we were sitting. About an hour later we were asked to leave the seats- this would have been fine if we were made aware that the seats were reserved and all the others were not, in which case we would have sat at any of the identical couches which were all filled by that time

In the room, there were very obvious body fluid stains on the couch in our room as well. Also aside from the pool staff, everyone we encountered was unprofessional. We tried to order(and pay the fee) for room service but were advised if we came downstairs it would be cheaper... we didn't care about this. We just wanted delivery. Also I don't think a lesser version of a pancake exists(see pic attached). And housekeeping knocked on our door at 10:30am(post pool) while we had our "do not disturb" sign on and asked when we were leaving... with our "package" checkout was at 1pm. Also uncomfortable bed. So long review, but in short: unclean room, poorly managed pool, unprofessional staff. 

P.S. We did not get into any confrontations with the staff and were completely sober(zero drinks) so this isn't an unprecedented rant...

title: Nice location and hotel but the pool...
text: Nice hotel, good room, good location but we especially booked a hotel with pool (34 Celsius outside) and with a child. But the opening hours are so limited! 9 till 5. Spending a day in the city the best way to end is to swim afterwards say around seven/eight but not possible. And also very annoying is that they let local people at the pool, crowded all over we had to lay with a towel on the hard concrete floor. All the people from outside the hotel had the sofa and beds. That's the reason we would not book this hotel again.

title: An outrage !
text: We stayed there my girlfriend and I in August for 6 nights. I must stress your attention this is my  first ever review on TA and the reason for this is that our experience was just terrible. We got there round midnight on a Friday. The night team was kind but not that efficient as it took them 15 minutes to give us access to our room. Good! the room was on the 14th floor (as we asked) sorta stylish and with a nice view of LES and the rest of nyc although the room was tiny! The pool was a plus as well. We had a flood in our room and they could not do anything for us other than make us pay for drinks at the bar while we were waiting for the room to be fixed. They wouldn’t change our room nor compensate us given the hassle we were going through. The front office manager was awful and indifferent to our situation. I work in hotels myself and would never treat my guests the way we were treated. Sorry but never will we return to this property or any other properties from the group. Hope you sort yourselves out soon!

title: GREATTTT Bellmen/Guest Services and Clean Rooms
text: While I am giving this hotel 2 stars, I will say it is a very very generous 2 stars. I will start off this review by stating that if you are looking to travel to the NY area and are looking for a hotel with an outdoor pool this should NOT be one of your top options. Initially, my check-in process was very unpleasant. There were 2 woman (Sue and Doreen) who were working the morning shift at the front desk and displayed signs of attitude and annoyance. While my check in process was quick it seemed to be more of a “go away” quick than positive customer service experience. I actually came back as I had more questions and that’s then I was greeted by the lovely James, who is a hotel manager for the morning shift. Not only did he greet me with a smile but his customer service was top notch. He was able to answer all my questions and gave me such a warm welcome. Moving on to the amenities, i.e the pool. The first day of arrival, while exploring the hotel and waiting for my room to be ready, I witnessed that by 10:30am the pool is already packed and all, 15, of the chairs/couches are taken. The pool area is very small so be aware. I specifically had a plan the next day, Saturday, July 6th, to arrive at the pool at 9:00am for the opening and secure a chair. This is where things went south. Upon arriving to the pool door at 8:45am I was greeted by a worker who stated the pool wasn’t quite open yet and that they were awaiting the lifeguards arrival. 8:45am turned into 9:10am which turned into 9:20am and a line full of angry customers waiting outside the door. This is when I learned that Sixty Les Hotel outsources all of its amenities which allows the hotel managers and staff to state things life“we have no control of this situation”. The pool, the club/bar, the valet parking, and the restaurant are all its own entities and not apart of the Sixty Les brand. The lifeguard was an hour late and no one at the front desk could provide any clarification or explanation as once again “it is not their problem” and yes one of the hotel managers actually stated this and told us, the angry customers, to stop calling about the situation. While at the pool, be prepared for lots of kids/families. It didn’t bother me at all but seemed to bother other guests as there is a lot of splashing and playing going on around the pool. If you can tune it out the pool is actually a nice atmosphere. While the pool situation was very disturbing I will state the highlights of my trip. Starting with the Bellmen/Guest Services employees. Christian, Raul and Brian were THE ABSOLUTE BEST. Not only did they help with parking my car on the street, as I was not paying $70 a day to valet, they were able to answer questions about the area and Raul was very knowledgeable about the best restaurants in town. We had a junior suite and the room was very clean with modern décor. I gave this hotel 2 stars because of the cleanliness of the hotel, and James, Raul, Christian and Brian (not the whole staff). I would not recommend staying here again as the overall experience I had was not one that I care to revisit.

title: Not a 5* just yet
text:
The hotel itself was lovely but there was some negative. 
I arrived at 2pm and the room wasn’t ready so had to wait an hour before I could get the keys, I had traveled from London so just wanted to unpack and have a cold shower and NY was very hot that week. 
Room was on the 15th floor and was clean and had no negatives to say. 
We tried to use the pool a couple of times and there was never any chair available so we when back to our rooms so was very disappointed by then as we paid for a poo we never used. 
3 lifts in the building but on arrival one 2 working so it did take ages going to and from the room. 
Housekeeping came to our rooms ever really early and we was still getting ready or really late and we was trying to relax after a busy day. 
We had to speak to the reception to ask them to sort the timings out. 
The hotel had great location 2 minutes walk to 2nd ave subway station, it also had some amazing restaurants close by. 
I would stay in the area again but maybe not to hotel.

title: Terrible
text: My husband and I booked this hotel for a staycation, wanting a relaxing time by the pool. I even called ahead to ensure there were no events etc as sometimes nyc pools get busy. The hotel assured me there were no events but when we arrived it was an absolute nightmare. First off, they put a $500 hold on your card for incidentals - even though we pre-paid for the hotel. We asked for a room on a high floor and were surprised when they also charged us $20/night extra for it at the end of the trip. When we went to the pool it was overrun by a mix of partygoers spilling their drinks in the pool and kids screaming and doing cannonballs. To top it off there were no chairs left so we (along with about 30 other people) were forced to just lay out towels on the floor where people stepped over us. Apparently they sell day passes to the pool in addition to having hotel guests (which they failed to mention). The next day we showed up early, determined to get a chair, only for the lifeguard to be 2 hours late (pool opens at 9 and guests were waiting in line in the hallway until 11am). The rooms are small, and do not offer coffee in them (no machine, and not even cold brew in the mini bar). Also we spilled something on the bed before leaving for the day, and although the room was clean when we came back, the same stain was on the sheets leading us to believe they just made the bed without changing the sheets. Another guest I spoke with said the hotel charged her card $6k and it took three days of calls just to get them to admit it had happened. She also said she had a balcony in her room and someone above her kept dropping lit cigarettes down, causing burns on the furniture. All in all a total disappointment and not relaxing in any way. No real sign of luxury either, just a bunch of overpriced food and drink and a rude staff. Stay away unless you’re 22 and need a place to crash after a drunken night :(

title: Sleep impossible in rooms above club
text:
Design, room size, bed, bathroom, view, courteousness of staff, location are all fantastic - really EVERYTHING I look for. It's owned by Italian company Miss Sixty. However this hotel chooses to sell rooms (802 and others) directly above its lounge that plays hiphop and techno music until 2аm, and it is LOUD inside the rooms - noise and vibrations. I fully understand that this is a hotel where some people come to party, where there may be noise from drunk patrons returning to their rooms, and street noise. BUT! I travel frequently in the US and overseas and have literally never seen a hotel provide a room in which you simply, structurally, could not sleep until 3аm. Night staff was courteous but I didn't want to move to another hotel at midnight (and fight for a refund), and they could only move us to another room the next day. Hоʈеls Tоɲighʈ gave us a compensation voucher, they were excellent! We reported our situation to the hotel's night desk clerk. When I approached the day clerk the next day, she was aware of the situation, courteous, and moved us. However there was no apology from her or from the hotel manager, or any attempt at a further gesture or accommodation by the hotel (typically at four and five star hotels, management sends a note and a fruit basket or something like that). I am sure kind words of Mr Nicholas will follow this review and he will offer to make it right next time if we only phone him before and request a quiet room. However, I would kindly remind him that a) it's not normal to have to phone a manager to book a hotel room in order to be to sleep before 3am, b) it's not normal in a first-world country to put people in rooms like that and then "manage their complaints", and c) the hotel actively, structurally chooses to sell uninsulated rooms on top of its booming lounge. No amount of courtesy or kind words can make up for the conscious business decision that they make, to put people in a room which fails one critical, mandatory feature of a hotel room — SOME ability to sleep at a regular hour. Kind words (parole, parole, parole…) are meaningless when the hotel does this to people, day in and day out. The only way I could ever feel better is if the hotel told me that they had decided to create a new room category for those rooms and disclose in the OTA listings that those rooms are subject to some noise till 3am - many party people would be fine with that. 
PS the elevators and air conditioning are "disobedient", but those are things you typically encounter in refurbished older buildings in New York. Oh and the amentiy fee includes a $10 credit for the minibar each night, and the clerk "accidentally" didn't tell me when I asked what was included, until I specifically asked about a minibar credit.

title: The worst hotel experience I've ever had
text: I travel to NYC about 7-8 times a year and have stayed in many different hotels and areas of the vibrant city. I was shocked at how loud the street noises were.  We were unable to sleep all night!!! There was a club directly outside our room (we were on the 8th floor).  The noise went on and on ALL night, it was absolutely ridiculous and i would NEVER stay there again!  i would highly recommend that you look elsewhere if you are a light sleeper.

title: over all good experience
text:
I have spent two night in this Hotel over the week end. Location in great and I found the rooms very spacious for the NYC standards. Rooms and bathrooms are very clean.
the only downside is the noise created by the terrace bar front desk provided earplugs. Overall I would suggest the Hotel

title: Great Spot
text:
Very hip spot right in the middle of the LES. Great amenities, pool is nice, Blue Ribbon restaurant is very good but the staff is the main reason I keep returning. Thank you to Christian, Raoul and Josh, you guys keep me coming back. 

-G

title: Best Birthday Ever!
text:
Stayed for my birthday! A1, TOP NOTCH SERVICE from the moment I pulled up in front of the hotel. Didn’t even get the chance to get out of my car and Raul was right at my service at the curb, and took me all the way up to my room.  Helped by sharing his on street parking which saved me from paying NYC Parking garage fees over $70/day/no re-entry. Raul remembered my name and greeted me every time he saw me. Thanks so much for Just being you and providing exceptional customer service. Everyone was helpful but Raul went above and beyond and truly stood out! 

Check in was a BREEZE my room was ready early which helped bc I had 2 Broadway plays to see and didn’t have much time to spare. 

Beautiful hotel and that rooftop pool was such a bonus. It rained my entire stay and it still didn’t keep me from throwing on my bathing suit, covered with their comfy robe, and bottle of champagne straight to their poolside. Created a photo shoot  since we were the only ones taking advantage of having the entire space to ourselves.
Room was very spacious for NYC standards, clean, and well designed. Floor to ceiling windows and chic decor!

Restaurant was great too ate at the bar and enjoyed people watching.  A famous actor (I’ll leave un named) was casually having a drink next to me and was super friendly sparking conversations with everyone. 

Overall it was a great time and can’t wait to book another night there...

Thanks for making my birthday special!
Thanks again for everything Raul!!!

title: Perfectly ok
text:
I checked into this hotel a couple hours ago. I actually booked a night in advance of my anticipated stay, knowing that I’ll arrive early tomorrow and don’t want to have to wait until 3pm. 

My initial impressions: Check in was smooth but unremarkable, front desk was pleasant although perfunctory. 

I was told valet parking is $70 and no in-out, which is steep even by NY standards, but I can park around the corner for a bargain. 

I had paid extra for jr suite on a high floor. The elevators were also sparse and a little weather worn — probably not noticeable if the hotel didn’t try to maintain a sort of sleek minimalist vibe, which it does, and every little ding stands out. 

The room is... fine. It is very clean. The furniture is a little dinged up. I’d hoped for a view which I why I requested the high floor, but basically floor to ceiling windows afford me a clear view of the condo unit across the street. 

The furniture also shows considerable wear, and in some cases is even a little broken. The bed side stand for example won’t stay shut and sort of hangs open.  The desks and furniture are all a little bit scratched. 

The use of the label “suite” is generous as in any other city this would be considered a room, but I expected that, and as promised there is a small seating area. 

All in all it’s perfectly acceptable, but not what I had in mind when I booked a 4.5 hotel for a special occasion. This rating is reserved for hotels with the absolute highest standards, and although the prices are relatively reasonable, next time I’d probably book a slightly lesser tier room at a slightly more upscale or refined property.

title: Overcharged for my stay.
text:
Overcharged me for my stay.

I booked a day use room this past Monday (the 17th) and signed a paper at the hotel stating the rate and tax is $151. I also had a $35 bottle of wine in the room and an Evian water bottle which couldn't have been more than what...$10 at most. So a $200 bill. Yet, my card was charged for about $270 and my calls to "accounting" lead to voice mail and I don't know how to fix the situation. This is really disappointing.

Oh and my toilet in my suite was unflushed - and full of number 2. How fun. The bathroom was also filthy and there was an engineer in my room when I tried to check in. 

I'd like my money back, please.

title: Bare Necessities
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed here over a weekend trip to New York City, and the hotel provided everything we needed, however didn't really stand out in any way.
We booked the lowest room category, since we would only be sleeping there for two nights, and I think that after seeing photos of some of the higher room categories this may have been a mistake. 
Our room was relatively stylish, however also dark and cramped. There was little space outside of the bed, and the bathroom was tiny -- just big enough to fit a shower-bath, toilet and sink. 
The walls were pretty thin as well. We could hear the dinging of the elevator every time it arrived to pick someone up on our floor. We could also hear other guests' conversations in the hallway. Since we didn't spend much time inside anyways, this didn't bother us. 
We didn't have any issues with the staff, but they didn't stand out in a favorable way either. Since we already had planned our activities and restaurant reservations in advance, we didn't need any help from them, besides check-in and check-out. 
Overall, I think we got everything we needed from this hotel. We were not disappointed at all and had a comfortable stay. However, I do not feel the need to return and wouldn't recommend visitors who aren't familiar with New York to stay here.

title: Good for business trips
text: The location was ideal and the staff was good. The swimming pool is an added bonus. The rooms were spacious and clean. The room service was good and left a thank you message at the end of stay. It was overall a satisfying stay and would recommend this place.

title: great location with swimming pool
text:
The location of the hotel is amazing, in the heart of the LES next to Soho and Nolita and in front of the subway. Lots and lots of restaurants  around the corner like the famous Katzs deli or the Russ&daughters, bars with live music and the whole shopping area Broadway Lafayette at 10 min walking.
The swimming pool is amazing sun in the morning in the shade in the afternoon, the life guards were amazing with our kids allowing us to chill and relax while they were playing in the water.
The staf was super helpful and friendly. The hotel is a trendy place with a lot of hipsters customers and beautiful party people but we felt very welcomed with our family and small kids. 
The food from the restaurant was great. The trendy bar with rooftop at the 7th floor was really nice.
The only less point was the gym because it was really smelling sushis, but there is a gym around the corner your can book for 30$ a week. 
The room was cleaned every day, sheets changed. And no bed bugs which is quite important nowadays in NYC.
I would definitely recommend this hotel !

title: Almost Perfect but shady issues with room temp control
text:
I had to stay the weekend in NYC for work and immediately sought out a hotel with an outdoor pool. Sixty had great pics, a good location, and the price is unbeatable.

I don't know where all the complaints about service come from because I dealt with so many lovely helpful people the entire weekend.

My standard room was really big, and in NYC that's saying a lot.

The location of the hotel is perfection. So many yummy restaurants, bars, things to do. Having lived in NYC twice, it's an area not many tourists visit and truly coveted dining is all around.

The pool is small, yes. You can't complain about that in Manhattan. And yes, there were a few families with TOTALLY unruly kids but that's not the hotel's fault. BLAME THE PARENTS PEOPLE. Actually, one day, I even saw the lifeguard speak to the parents and the kids were immediately taken down a few notches. 

There's a bar at the pool which is divine.

Here's the thing that I can't believe nobody else has complained about. You have ZERO personal control over the temperature of your room. I have a feeling it is controlled at a building-level and the employees either don't know this or cant' divulge it. I like to sleep with a cool room and in a hotel I usually go about 69 or 70.

Day 1- checked in- turned AC to 65 to cool the room down quickly and went to dinner. Came back. Room temp was at 67 and felt humid. Realized the A/C unit was identical to Hyatt and Hyatt House Jersey City which I had the exact same issue with days prior.  Called maintenance, he came and told me it was working even though I explained that the fan was basically silent and no air was moving. I dont care if the wall feels cold. I care if the room is cold. He told me to turn the temp to 50. That's insane. But I did it and the room temp stayed the same all night.

Day 2- Left the AC on 50 and went to the pool. Came back in the afternoon and room temp was at 77 and stifling. Had to open the door to the hallway to breathe. Front desk moved me to a new upgraded room.

Upgraded room was lovely, massive, slightly cool but not ideal. Turned AC to 65 and the room got cold enough so I turned it to 67 and went to bed. 

Day 3- Woke up at 2am sweating. The room temp read 72 degrees and the AC setting was on 65. Went to bed, woke up at 4am even hotter. Room temp was 75. Called front desk, they offered to send a technician. I declined bc i was checking out in 3 more hours. 7am hit, the AC started cooling down the room again.

YOU CANNOT CONTROL THE TEMP HERE so if you want to stay in the summer, I would just be wary. GOD KNOWS what it's like in the winter.

title: Horrible, Don’t waste your money folks !
text: When I checked in the hotel I wasn’t greeted with hospitality from the staff. Doreen the Lady checking me in was very rude. Let’s just say I won’t go into details but it rubbed me the wrong way that I no longer had the desire to stay there. The fee for incidentals was $150 which they don’t mention until you show up to the property. Also the fee for the “studio” style room was overrated. The “luxury” view was for the projects across the street. Lastly, when my partner and I went to the pool we were surprised to see the limited space. The pool was shared amongst adults under the influence and six year olds. Not very appropriate when you want to relax and you’re greeted with minors splashing you poolside. Not to mention one of them hit me w a blow up pool ball and that is when we left the pool. The experience from start to finish wasn’t pleasant. I’ve had a better time at the Hampton inn and better service at the Martinique hotel, even the Hilton. So please don’t waste your money.

title: Always Awesome
text: Favorite locale in the LES. Lots to do at the hotel alone; Blue Ribbon, pool life, spa, or party at Make Believe. So many options. Staff is always great, thank you to Christian & Raoul for always making our welcome and our farewell feel special!

title: Génial
text: Endroit génial,piscine magnifique,plat bien garnis,très bonne ambiance,les plat sont très bon,et le personnel au petit soin,dommage que le temps n’étais pas au rdv,merci pour l’accueil,je conseil fortement cette endroit,

title: 10/10 would recommend!
text: Elegant decor, charming and helpful staff, rocking mini bar, a surge protector/international converter, and a comfy bed? Hell yes! Only regret is that I didn’t get to check out the pool or the sushi place and I didn’t take photos. Oh well, guess I’ll have to stay here again!

title: Staycation
text: My husband and I have always wanted to stay at a hotel in our hometown, just for the experience. We got a special deal on the SIXTY LES website and stayed in the Empire Terrace room. Loved it! Amazing views, as described on their website. They are not exaggerating! The room was a good size and very comfortable. Bed and bedding were super-cozy. Nice sheets and bathrobe, though just one bathrobe. Hmmm...Great shower and bathroom. I would give it a five, but, as everyone is saying, the staff is not great and seem really tapped out. The lobby is small and crowded and there's a small front desk staff that seems overwhelmed and not very nice, though the bellmen were fine. Working for tips, I guess.I also called beforehand and was given the runaround and put on hold a lot. But for staff issues, I would give this five stars.Re-train the front desk and hire another front desk person so they are not overwhelmed? Neighborhood and room were great.

title: Low value for money, loud and lame service.
text:
I surprised my husband for his 30th birthday and carefully selected Sixty LES as our accommodation. A selection I definitely regret. 

Even though the rooms were ok our general experience was very bad for one important reason: staff and service was absolutely terrible. Everyone we met during our stay was completely uninterested in us and our experience - as a matter of fact both staff members that checked us in/out were only interested in charging a credit card and talking to each other. 

Not only were the staff members uninspiring and disinformative, they were clearly annoyed by our questions regarding WiFi, hotel facilities, bar/restaurant opening hours. Information that could and should have been given to us as part of a greeting in a simple checking procedure.

The hotel it self has a terrace and bar which is pretty decent however the bar/nightclub in the same building that plays intense techno/trans music from 4pm-2am is very unpleasant. Me and my husband like to party and definitely wouldn’t be described as sensitive people + I know New York is pretty loud itself - but this volume was way beyond acceptable and should be stated in the description of the room.

In short: service and general experience was really low and I would not recommend anyone booking this hotel. There are much better alternatives in the same area of the city.

title: Visiting
text: Me and my fiancé is going to this hotel for a week stay we look at all the pictures so far and everything looks beautiful and neat can’t wait 🙂 he live in Washington and I’m from queens hopefully we have no issues with the staffs

title: Penthouse nightmare
text: I had a very unfortunate experience while staying in your penthouse suite over the weekend.  When I called to book the Penthouse suite, front desk informed me I was only able to book that specific room directly at the hotel at the front desk, which is rather odd, however quoted me a price over the phone. Upon arrival,  I ask to book the suite and the hotel did not stick the price I was quoted. I felt taken advantage of and was given several inconsistent price for the suite. I ultimately felt as if they tried to rob me.  No Managers event attempted to correct or  help me with booking the suite. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

title: Managerial - Check In Nightmare
text:
I called this hotel yesterday before booking to ensure that I could get an early check in after a 12 hour redeye flight. I was told on 2 separate phone calls that this would be no problem but I might not get the room type I requested. Cool! Happy to pay an upgrade fee or early check in fee, no foreseen problems. 

When I spoke to Eddy Griffin the on duty guest services manager this morning, he told me this was not an option and in fact they NEVER tell people that early check will be available. He also said the staff don’t come in until 9 and the earliest I could check in is 1! I explained his staff didn’t give me any indication of this possibility and his response was I TRAINED ALL THE STAFF PERSONALLY! I asked if they record the calls and to listen to yesterday’s conversation to confirm the information that was given to me yesterday. 

Eddy was rude, I have never come across a guest services agent that was disregarded me so much. After 30 min talking to he said he would contact the actual general manager (even though I had requested to speak with the general manager originally, but I was transferred to Eddy) and the woman I spoke with yesterday and call me back. He never called me back, nor did the general manager. 

Currently sitting in the “restaurant” waiting for check in. This whole mess would have been avoided if they didn’t misinform me prior to me making my booking - or simply cancelled my booking so I could find an appropriate hotel. It’s Friday night in NYC and they could easily resell this room (it’s only 8am!)

LASTLY they have charged me $50 UPGRADE fee to switch from a KING to a QUEEN— someone tell me how that makes sense. Will update after / if I am checked in. Would not recommend this hotel and their mediocre customer service or lack there of. 

I am a gold rewards member and have stayed at 83 hotels in the past 12 months. This is not normal and unacceptable. I wish I could stay elsewhere.

title: Excellent stay
text: My second stay at SixtyLES and we left very satisfied. Nicholas the Hotel Manager was a real pleasure to communicate with and rectified a booking discrepancy prior to our stay with utmost professionalism. His associate, the acting manager on the day of check-in was wonderful and very welcoming and the guys on the door terrific. Our room was great, with balcony and views towards MidTown and the Empire State building. The hotel is in a great neighbourhood walking distance to SoHo, Greenwich Village etc and a subway across the street. The only negative was that one of the front desk staff seemed unhappy to be there, no smiles, unhelpful and quite rude. Otherwise a perfect stay and we would return.

title: Daughter's Wedding
text: Wow!  This was our first trip to New York and did not know what to expect. As soon as we pulled up a young man, Raul, was at our door.  We stayed in room 303 which opened up to the pool.  Very quiet but when pool opens it maybe a different story.  Our daughter was upgraded to the penthouse...what a view!   The staff was friendly but Raul was always there making sure we were ok.  He was able to answer all our questions...where to get pizza, hot tea with lemon and honey etc.  Thanks to all for making us feel welcome and comfortable.

title: Awful, do not stay here
text:
I stayed here with some friends while visiting New York. While the location is OK (really the only thing going for it), there are better hotels nearby that I’m sure would be better. 

My friends were woken several times on the first night by an amorous couple in the next room! When they asked politely at the hotel to move rooms the hotel said there was no rooms. So we checked a few websites and were able to book a room, proving they did have other rooms available but were just refusing to move us. 

The hotel denied lying to us, and when we complained again they attempted to bully my friend, shouting at us (we couldn’t believe it either, but luckily have it all on video). They were not only completely unhelpful, they were rude and insulting too. I have never experienced service like this - we were stunned and appalled. 

Eventually after having to return to the hotel later that evening (interrupting our night) my friends were finally given a new room. 

The bar is also awful - no atmosphere and the cost of drinks is extortionate. We didn’t eat in the restaurant having decided we didn’t want to spend any longer at the hotel than we needed. 

I very, very rarely give negative reviews, however in this instance I genuinely feel the hotel service was so awful I wanted to warn other visitors.  The shouting and complete disregard of our experience demonstrated a total lack of understanding about customer service. Do not stay here.

title: Fab location, fab hotel.
text: Hotel is modern and clean and our room was spacious enough.  The staff is friendly and accommodating.  We'd like to give a special nod to Josh.  The hotel bar is fun and again the staff were gracious and kind.  We will stay here again.

title: Samara is Amazing
text: I’ve made a mistake booking a room online and Samara was able to help me correct that with poise and professionalism. She had made everything easier and convenient for me and I am already looking forward to my stay at the hotel because the services over the phone is more than excellent!

title: Raul was the highlight of our stay
text: We were instantly greeted by Raul. Our room was not ready, and he graciously brought our slew of bags to the basement spa area so we could freshen up before heading out for the day. He held our bags for us until our return and delivered to our room. We saw him daily throughout our stay and was always so cheerful and helpful. The hotel itself was wonderful! Very modern, clean and trendy. Definitely a young crowd, so expect noisy late nights. We had issues w/ the guests next door to us coming in at 4am and being so incredibly loud we had to call the front desk. The upstairs bar was SUPER cute and fun! Great decor, strong drinks. The pool was closed, but looked awesome from our window. The adorable coffee shop next door quickly became our morning routine before we set out for the day (Hedgehog Coffee). I can't wait to go back and see Raul & Sixty LES! PS - the location was ideal! Close to so many amazing neighborhoods and hot spots!

title: Très décevant à déconseiller
text:
Malgré un design plutôt séduisant , l'hôtel est triste et l'accueil froid !!
Les chambres son minuscule et bruyante mais un étage élevé

Nous avions réservé cet Hotel par To Night avec un prix toutes taxes comprise, plusieurs semaines à l'avance , pour le dernier jour nous réclamer une taxe ( soi-disant gouvernementale) de 29$ par jour , ce qui est faux et illégale 
cette soi-disant taxe n'a aucune justification et ne correspond à rien , sauf a arnaquer le client d'un surplus !!! qu'il faut absolument refuser de payer

Hôtel à DECONSEILLER

title: Fab Hotel in New York
text: Stayed at LES Sixty for business for a few days. Hotel was absolutely fabulous and everyone was super professional! Raul and Christian were really amazing! Side note if you are flying in on an early flight make sure that you book your room for the night before you arrive otherwise you will not get your room until 3pm as this hotel is ALWAYS sold out. The upside is they have a gym and showers that you can freshen up in case you do have an early meeting like I did. The view from the 10th floor mini suit is the best!

title: Christian and Raul are amazing!
text: We stayed at this hotel for a bachelorette party. Christian and Raul were so sweet and helpful our entire stay and we all couldn’t stop talking about the amazing service they provided. We most certainly will return to this hotel!

title: Les Sixty hotel!!!
text:
We stayed at the LES 60 hotel for a bachelorette weekend and the hotel staff was SO accommodating! Raul and Christian were there to great us every morning and helped us with recommendations in the area. They were so sweet and welcoming! We stayed in the penthouse which was amazing!!! 

LES 60 is a must!!!

title: AMAZING
text: The sixty LES was FABULOUS and we had such a nice stay. Specifally Raul and Christian went above and beyond to make everything easy and enjoyable. Great service incredible room and overall wonderful time. Thanks so much can’t wait to come back!!!

title: Amazing customer service!
text: I stayed at this hotel for a bachelorette weekend and the service was amazing. Raul and Christian went above and beyond getting our luggage from our room and loading it into the van that took us back to Long Island. Highly recommend!

title: Best ‘staycation’ ever!!
text:
My husband and I got a suite, and friends got one too, to celebrate a birthday. We checked in on friday afternoon, and it was super quick and friendly.
( I THINK Michelle was her name, but I might be wrong) March 8/19

We had the BEST time. Our room was gorgeous.. looking over the pool, though it was closed, I bet it’s pretty rad when open.
We went out for the night, returning to absolute COMFORT.
We slept so well, it was quiet, private, luxurious while still hip and fun.
The location was AMAZING as we are New Yorkers, so being able to bounce around by foot hitting up our fave spots was awesome.
We checked out, and kept our bags at the front desk while we brunched and went to a watering hole we love.
I’ll tell you, 
Raul was fantastic, friendly and treated me like a queen.
We got our car, and left ELATED.. promising eachother that we ‘HAVE TO COME BACK AND DO THAT MORE OFTEN’

Thank you.

Really. 

Perfect stay!!

Keep up the good work, and feel free to email me when you have specials, 

Cause we  want to see you guys again

title: Extraordinary Guest Manager Maguette
text: Maguette Dieng, a guest service manager, is amazing at SixtyLES. My girlfriend and I stayed at this location on Christmas and Ms. Maguette was so pleasant and accommodating, despite her having to work on Christmas. When we checked in she was prompt and efficient, she even threw in some extras for our stay because of the holiday. We had an incredible time, thanks to Maguette, and will be returning for my birthday.

title: Bad . malo ....
text: Resumen: 1- puertas de habitaciones tienen tanta abertura parte baja que entran todos los sonidos de los pasillos 2- de las habitaciones cuando fuman tabaco o marihuana se sienten en tu propia habitación 3- sistema de calefaccion ruidoso 4- cubiculo de ducha con olor a humedad 5- los cristales sucios 6-servicio de recepcion muy poco profesionales ante situaciones de mantener al pasajero como prioridad de huesped 7-los cerramientos tanto de baño etc ruidosos y descuidados -8 la limpieza de entrada al hotel tanto de conserjeria malo -9 si te toca fin de semana tienes que esquivar a la gente que entra a la disco al mismo hotel ( no es recomendable para personas que quieran descansar por las noches ) 10-colchones de calidad baja y almohadas 11-no cambian la ropa de cama todos los dias ...cada 4 dias minimo 11-Balcones compartidos sin division por lo cual debes mantener cerrada la cortina todo el dia si te tocan vecinos que gustan pasearse por todo el frente de tu habitacion 12- 200 dolares la noche  por la zona y por lo que ofrecen es bastante malo .

title: Mala atención e instalaciones mediocres por el precio .
text:
Hotel que se pasa de moderno donde el trato descortés y las pocas normas de convivencia estan a la hora del dia.
Personal en mesa de recepción , no tiene sentido de hospitalidad y rozan la falta de respeto..llegar por la tarde luego de andar todo el dia por la ciudad muertos de frio con ganas de descansar y la habitación estaba tal cual la dejamos , sin limpiar ni cambiar toallas ni sabanas, de lo cual la recepcionista ni se hizo cargo ni ofreció una disculpa ni un cafe para que limpiaran la habitación...que estaban con mucha faena!! nunca visto que un hotel no tenga horarios de limpieza de habitaciones ni refuerzo de personal en días fuerte siendo un supuesto 4 estrellas !!!!
Habitación correcta de espacio pero con instalaciones mediocres por el precio que cobran, cama demasiado blanda, aire frio/ calor demasiado ruidoso, mala presión del agua en la ducha, todo hace ruido.. puerta que comunica a habitación de al lado por la cual se escucha y huele todo ( olor a tabaco y otras cosas!)... Mal aislamiento entre habitaciones... Sin duda no repetiré ni recomendare este hotel ! sin hablar del video que pasan en el ascensor, sexista total...mostrando a  dos chicas semidesnudas todo el tiempo como si eso fuero cool !!! desagradable !

title: Horrible Experience (worst hotel)
text:
The staff are clueless manager refused to deal with anything instead pretended she didn't know what was going on despite staff pointing her out. 
No clear instructions on their website reguarding check in 
Charged twice 
Restaurant in hotel horrendous, doesnt even make sense for what they advertise. 
Woken up every morning to discuss minibar, which was extremely annoying. 
Will NOT be returning to his dump. Worst hotel experience never encountered such rude staff in hospitality. 
The managers attitude from the start was absolutely horrendous even overheard her mention to staff oh well they can either get over it or leave. 
Room gotcleaned when we went out came back it stank of sewage

title: So disappointing
text:
My family and I stayed for one night on Feb 19 and it was not a stay to remember. The suite had a sleeper sofa which was a reason for making the reservation.
The mattress was unbelievably poor and not something I would expect to see in any hotel. 
That was not the only surprise.
We dropped into the roof top bar to find they had no white wine.
Really!

Next morning I made it clear at the desk that the particular sleeper sofa should be replaced. Not sure that will happen.

We had stayed in 6 Columbus Circle for the previous two nights and it was lovely. 
Two very different Sixties hotels.

So disappointed with Sixty Les. Will never be returning. It was defo LESs in so many ways!

title: Lack of respect
text:
We were put in a room (which was extremely poorly soundproofed) located right above the hotel’s nightclub. The DJ played bass pumping house music until 03:00AM; it was so loud, I could recognize some of the tracks he played. After waiting over an hour for reception to bring ear plugs to our room I went out to purchase some myself. The next day, they offered to change our room but never apologized for the essentially sleepless night we had. Aside from this and the fact that you share the elevator with drunk/wasted clubbers, the room was clean and stylish.

Refuse to stay in room 803 or adjacent rooms!!

title: Great Hotel! Terrible hotel restaurant!
text:
This hotel is a really good hotel, especially if you stay in one of their 400 sft suites. The hotel is situated in the lower East side and so it has a young trendy buzz that carries over into the hotel. It’s full of trendy people and has a cool bar. The room and beds are super comfortable and the hotel staff really have a great ethic and are there to ensure that your every need is met. 

The restaurant is outsourced is not part of the hotel but is the only one in the hotel and hence you have no choice but to order at it. They NEVER answer their phone. Their dishes are tiny and overpriced. I was asked to pay $35 usd for a decent size bowl of oatmeal at this place. The restaurant staff are arrogant and unfriendly and ruin the entire experience.

I’ll be back at this hotel when they replace the restaurant!

title: Perfect spot for NYC getaway
text:
The hotel is perfectly located in my favorite part of NYC -- close to the best bars, restaurants and music in town.  

The staff was thoughtful & helpful from the moment I checked in.  Was very lucky to upgrade into the Orchard Suite, probably the coolest room I've ever stayed in NYC hotel. Gas fireplace, terrace a mile long, two sitting areas, beautiful bath tub...even the robes were amazing.

Blue Ribbon downstairs is a great place to grab some drinks and a bite, though daytime service was more than a little slow.

Overall an amazing experience, can't wait for my next trip!

title: A couper le souffle
text:
On ne peut que recommander cet hôtel. 
Nous avons eu une chambre dans le un coin de l'immeuble, avec donc une vue incroyable sur Manhattan. Les lever et coucher de soleil étaient à couper le souffle.
Le lit était très confortable, la chambre et la salle de bain très propre. 
Le petit + : deux bouteilles d'eau tous les jours gratuitement.
Le personnel de l'hôtel était très sympathique et accueillant.
Nous aurions aimé être en été pour tester la piscine!

title: Wonderful Find!
text: This is an exceptional hotel on the Lower East Side near Houston Street.  A wide range of traditional and new restaurants (Katz's Deli/Hair of the Dog) and venues nearby.  Staff is friendly and helpful, rooms are uncharacteristically roomy and well apportioned.  Nice amenities in room.  This one is a keeper!

title: Overall a Good Experience
text:
I stayed at Sixty LES for three nights during the week of Christmas with two other people. It was overall a good experience, and I would stay again in the future if the duration were two days or less (the reason why outlined later in this post). 

Room: Nice with a good vibe, and the suite is perfect for three people. The bed being low didn't bother me. Thankfully (maybe due to the holidays) there were no parties or loud music. Their TV system is very slow for some reason. The free internet offered worked just fine for me, so I don't think it would be necessary to purchase their upgrade unless you're doing some heavy duty stuff. 

My complaint: Like wtf is up with not having a coffee maker in the room? There is something really disturbing about doing that to a person.Thank God there was a coffee shop next door. I gladly went through the lobby and to the coffee place in my full on pajamas without any shame. A coffee maker is a La Quinta level amenity, so for the cost and presentation that this hotel is trying to give off, customers should not be tortured with no caffeine. 

The $29 a day "Experience Fee": Must comment on this, since everyone is. Like most reviewers here, I think the whole experience fee thing is silly, but a lot of hotels are doing that now. My guess is they do this so that the overall cost per room appears cheaper when advertised online. Hotels should just stop doing this as a separate charge in general as it's annoying (and probably would save their staff a lot of time from having to explain / justify this to nearly everyone who checks in), but Sixty LES is not the only hotel that does this. Annoying yes, but something totally on them, not-so-much. 

Bar / Restaurant: The bar with the view of the city is nice enough. I live in NYC so it's different for me, but I could see tourists from out of town loving it. I felt the Japanese restaurant was just average, but it serves until very late (2 am I think on the night we were there). A real restaurant serving so late is a plus.

Neighborhood: A great neighborhood, and located across the street from the F train. It might be good for some to be out of the total tourist trap which is midtown. 

Staff: The doormen were excellent, and very friendly. Their demeanor was in total contrast to the receptionists who were a bit stiff (maybe tired of explaining the experience fee). They were professional, however, so this isn't a complaint more than an observation. 

Overall the hotel was pleasant, and I enjoyed my stay, but you need to be warned that they charge a really ridiculous $150 per DAY deposit. The first thing I asked was "what kind of people stay at this hotel, and what the hell did they do that there has to be a $150 per day hold standard?" Seriously, I would like to meet them. I wondered if other people thought the same thing. I have traveled all over the World, and stayed at 5 star hotels, and I have never ever been required to put down such a large hold. They should review this policy, because if you stay more than a night it can really suck for people especially if they are on a budget, but honestly even if you're not. This is why I would not consider staying there longer than two nights, because out of principle I will not have such a larger amount of money blocked from my card for 3-5 business days. It's absurd. 

To recap: Rooms are nice, service is professional, the location is great and different than the usual tourist traps. Overall, I was happy to stay there, and would stay again in the future for no more than 1-2 nights as the deposit is outrageous, and my rockstar days are over.

title: Watch Out for Your Credit Card!
text:
The hotel itself is not bad. Rooms are clean, there is a lot of traffic but it has a great location. The problem is what they charge you with, and then don’t answer your email. My credit card was overcharged about $250.00. 
Despite many conversations in person and over the phone with their staff, and lots of reassurance they’ll correct their mistake, almost two months later I am still to receive a refund. Emails went unanswered, just so I don’t have it in writing they did a mistake?
There are way too many hotels to take the risk staying at this one! Chiara

title: New Years 2019
text: Great location and great staff but a lot of problems with room. Broken fridge, no lights outside on balcony, furniture damaged and stained, and no hot water. Great views and location but the room needed some maintenance.

title: NY trip
text: Nice place, clean, and friendly staff. Would stay here again but not on the 6th floor.  The club is on the 7th floor and you can hear it through the ceiling when sleeping.    The bar and lounge area was cool/sheik, bartender was helpful.

title: Stay elsewhere !
text:
Booked 4 nights at this hotel booked through Magellan Luxury Hotels.
Very poor service ! Rip off with a mandatory @29 per day Resort fee which includes access to the outdoor seasonal pool. Really at 0C temp outside !. $10 minibar credit per day only items in the snack section are priced at either $7 or $9.
Free WiFi. Slow is being polite but hey you are only paying a portion of the $29 per day fee .
2 free bottles of water valued at Costco of 50 cents ! Unlimited free local calls. Have they not heard of mobile phones.
Returned to the room after a day in the city for a quick nap before dinner only to find that at 4:30pm the room was still not made up. Amenities in the bathroom were never replenished during our 4 night stay.
Wanted to speak to the Housekeeping manager Martha but she was to busy to meet or speak to us !
My suggestion STAY SOME PLACE ELSE OTHER THAN Sixty LES !

title: Party Hotel / Bad Service
text:
Stayed at Sixty Les for one week and was very disappointed by the service. I arrived around 5pm to the hotel and they told me that my room was one floor above the hotel’s club and that it would be very loud during the night. After some negotiations they proposed another room in a different floor, which wasn’t ready yet but they promised that it wouldn’t take too long.
Eventually I received the keys for the room at 8.30 pm - after a long distance flight! No excuse, no drinks offered - nothing!
The room was nice with a great view, but couldn’t really make up for the bad service.
The restaurants in the hotel are good but quite pricey.
I moved rooms at the end of the week, as some friends arrived and we had booked a suite in order to be together.
The sofa bed in the room was broken and we had to move to another room. Again we only received the keys around 9pm for the new room. No excuse - nothing.
I wouldn’t recommend the hotel, despite the nice location and the great view of certain rooms, as the service is really very bad.

title: Terrible experience
text: I caution anyone making a reservation at this hotel.  They pulled a bait and switch on me - I had booked a king room and was told at check-in that a plumbing issue had taken the room out of service.  I had friends who had checked in earlier and they were told the same thing for the king reservation that they had.  I don't believe that a plumbing issue occurred but rather they booked too many king rooms and planned to switch people to a queen upon check-in.  If I had not been late for something, I would have cancelled my reservation and gone to another hotel for the night.  They made no effort to accommodate me except to reduce the rate to the usual queen rate for the night.  Next time I won't give them the chance and won't bother to reserve a room here.  They also have misleading fees such as the "experience" fee just for being there.  It was complete BS and the experience sucked anyway.I recommend you don't book this hotel unless you want to overpay for a bad experience.

title: Started rough but ended better
text:
This was my second time staying here. I have to say I was a little disappointed this time around. I stayed earlier this year and everything from service to room was impeccable. Unfortunately this time the room was not up to par. There seemed to be some sort of leak from the shower that created a bubble in the hardwood flooring by the bed. When you step on it water would spew up. I immediately contacted the FD to let them know and they would send an engineer up. It took about 20-25 mins to have someone come. They just looked at it and said they would be back. I called FD again to get some update and I spoke to a different person who wasn’t made aware of the situation. I had to explain all over again. Finally got an update and they said that they were sold out that night but could move me tomorrow or give me a discount for tonight. I was only there one night so that move the next day was not a possibility. Another call sometime later and they said they may able to move me to one of their big suites due to the likelihood of a cancelation. 

About 8:30pm they finally let me know that they could move me to the two bedroom suite. I was very grateful for the move (and awesome upgrade). 

Although the move was very late (I had to move some plans around) I appreciate them rectifying the situation. 

I might come back.

title: Comfortable hip hotel
text: Good size rooms with reasonable closet space and tub in bathroom! Although we were opposite elevator soundproofing was adequate. Only comment is that coffee needs to be provided before 7am restaurant opening as there is no machine in the room

title: Great experience!
text: Super friendly staff and generous size rooms make this hotel a stand out! LES has great walkability and close to fun non touristy shops and restaurants. We will be back. The fried rice at the Asian restaurant was delicious !

title: Sixty LES
text: Stayed at sixty LES for 5 nights in December 2018 had a blast great location in the LES for restaurants and nightlife with good transport options near by to get you to midtown and downtown as well as brooklyn. Rooms were nice we had a great view of the freedom tower from our room. But most of all we found the staff to be excellent especially Raul and Josh the door men /bell hop nothing was too much trouble they were always on hand  available  and very friendly

title: Christmas in New York
text: We went to New York to enjoy the Christmas decorations a family tradition. This time we booked an Airbnb, huge mistake. We couldn’t spend even a few hours in the place. We were so fortunate to find this hotel.  Amazing place. The hotel staff were so friendly and accommodating. I can’t tell you how great they were. The rooms were clean and stylishly updated. Beds were very comfortable. The hotel is close to great coffee shops and famous diners. Not a far walk from The Soho Bloomingdales and other known boutique shops. I have to say the hotel saved our trip from being a disaster. Won’t book an Airbnb in New York again. Would stay at this hotel again.

title: Disappointing
text: My sheets were dirty. Staff was very inconsistent ranging from extremely dismissive to mildly attentive. The only positive exception was Raul whom seems to do a bit of everything from opening doors, hailing cabs, helping with check in and check out, delivering room service, etc. Very attentive, helpful and pleasant.

title: Hotel with a view in grteat neighbourhood
text: The hotel is really nice: comfy rooms, great view if you are on a high floor, friendly staff.The only drawback was the A/C a bit noisy in our room, but nothing major:You are in the middle of a lot of bars and restaurants and 10 minutes walk for Soho. Cherry on the cake, the metro is just accross the street.

title: Great view, lovely staff
text: Loved staying here. The location and view are great and staff is professional and competent. Special thanks to Josh who welcomed me warmly every time I came in and left the hotel. He was super helpful and courteous and carried my insanely-heavy suitcase with a smile.

title: Good value
text: Nice hotel.  Good sized rooms.  Quiet and comfortable.  Bathroom a bit small.  Rainfall shower excellent. Good location.  Lots of places to walk to.  Easy subway access. Fun neighborhood.  Some terrific local breakfast spots nearby.

title: Stay away from this hotel!
text:
Yesterday I arrived late at the hotel, I was so tired and just wanted to sleep. I started to undress in my room then I all the suddenly see a man on my balcony smoking. I call the reseption, they explain that it is a shared balcony. Then offer me another room, but for additional fee. The location of the room was a disaster and it did not want to pay more than the 300 $ I already paid. 
During the night noise from the hallway and elevator and it was a funny smell in the room. The bedsheets did not smell clean/soap. Next morning, I asked for another room because I for sure don't feel comfortable sharing a balcony traveling alone.  No they where fully booked. Only room they can offer is over their popular noisy restaurant closing 0300 am. 
Then I ask what will be the final price if I want to find another room, they said 300$
So I book a room at indigo hotel nearby. 
When I come back, the final price is 619$
After negotiations he gave me 100$ discount. 
And now I see why they can't offer me a better room, they are renovating the whole front of the hotel. 
Fully booked, bulls***t.
Stay AWAY from this hotel!!!

title: Second Time Back
text:
We generally don't like to go to the same place twice, but for a few reasons decided to to back to Sixty LES.  The price is decent, and it was a good jumping off point for a lot of the activities we had planned.

First Impressions: The first night, we got in from traveling.  After a quick check in, we just wanted a meal and decided to try the sushi restaurant.  We didn't have reservations, but were seated at the bar and had a very nice time in a bustling place with good food.  It was a nice way to start our trip.

Location: The next day, we had some activities planned in the adjacent areas, and it was an easy cab ride to get to where we wanted; however we did have a few plans to go uptown.  I don't know if it was because it was a holiday weekend or just a regular weekend, but travel by taxi took some time.  With that being said, everything we did in the Village, SoHo, LES, and Chinatown was easy to get to from this location.

Service: The staff at the hotel was great.  Very professional and extremely helpful.  The doormen were always there to help whether it was getting a cab or helping us with the door.  One time I was bringing two coffees in and they immediately recognized my need and helped me with the door.  On Saturday night, I guess there is a club on the top floor, and they reserve an elevator for just club patrons.  Some of the young revelers were visibly inebriated and kept trying to get on the guest elevators and were like, "Woooooo!  Let's ride this elevator!" and the staff deftly guided them back to the correct elevator.

Rooms: The rooms, to me, were like staying in a nice apartment.  There was a practicality and elegance to the layout.  Not one bit of wasted space, thoughtfully planned, and all with feel of room and comfort.  I guess the last time we stayed here, my wife was unaware of a $10 mini bar per day credit that is built in to your room charge.  We decided to use our mini bar credit this time around, but on one day the housekeeping service came so late we decided to skip having housekeeping.  Since we skipped it, they assumed we used $20 of mini bar credits the next day and it showed up on our bill, and then we had to explain this upon checkout...it just seemed like a lot hassle.

The Bar: I liked the bar on the 2nd floor.  Once again, the staff was great and they make good drinks.

Overall: Good location if you want to roam around the LES.  Right next to Katz's Deli, which is a plus.  The elevators can be a bit slow, but overall, a nice place.

title: Lost a guest for life
text:
I'm VERY disappointed in this hotel. We booked here bc it was close to everything we wanted but that was the only plus side. They gave us a room right off the elevator. It was fine until we got back to the room later in the night and realized we were RIGHT ABOVE the club. We decided to go to the club/bar after we had a few drinks elsewhere. The club/bar was TERRIBLE. Poor service, annoying club music for no reason, rude entitled people, and no space to stand. Lastly, we ordered our drinks, hung out for a few and then realized we didnt want to stay because of the above annoyingness. I started to walk out the door and was stopped by a security guard who rudely informed us we could not take our $15 drink to the room (which was 1 floor up). The security guard got aggressive with my husband and called additional security for no reason. 

When we checked out there was $100's of extra fees I was not told about or expecting. 

I will never go back to any of their locations.

title: Won’t ever stay here again
text: Spending the weekend in NYC and we were given a rom on the 7th floor.  We were told their rooftop bar is on the 7th floor.   Well it isn’t a “rooftop bar” it’s a night club.   We have been listening to loud, blaring music since his afternoon.   It’s like trying to sleep in the middle of a club.  Whoever thought it was a good idea to put a 20 something night club in the middle of guest rooms.   I called to see if we could change rooms and were told they had nothing available.  Will never stay here again

title: Manager has hotel hubris.
text:
I made 3 separate reservations via Expedia (more competitive rates) was charged 240, 395, and 535. I prepaid and expedia charged my Amex. We all do this. It's very common. 

Now the hotel takes my card for the MiniBar, it also charges my via card 240, 395, and 535. The managers at sixty LES claim, that they do not honor expedias prepaid reservations and retain the right to charge for a nightly room as they see fit. What? Yes you heard it right. You will pay double the normal rate for a room, if you don't book through Sixty. 

PS spoke to the manager. She was inept and ineffective. Whenever someone must remind you of their credentials and say "I am the manager." "I've been in this industry for years" It indicates that they know less than Jon Snow. 

Sushi isn't that great by the way. 

This is dishonest. Not sure if the managers not if this their actual policy. If it is, why stay at a hotel, that will nickel and dime you for anything. Just taking advantage.

title: just okay for the price
text: Sleek, clean room, but nothing special for the price. You pay a facilities fee which is supposed to include two bottles of water per night, but when housekeeping did my room they didn't replace the bottles of water I had paid for. I had to call to ask for them, which is just the kind of nickel-dimey thing that makes a place feel cheap. The staff were very nice people, but the management is just so-so.

title: Hotel Sixty LES
text: It's a very swanky hotel in the Lower East Side.  Good walking distance to NY university, which is why I chose it (traveling for a conference at NYU). The service was great, and very friendly and accommodating.

title: Large Rooms for NY, Helpful Staff, Guests must deal with Rude, Drunk People at Hotel Club
text: Stayed here for five nights while I visited my son. I accompanied my niece who recommended this hotel because she had previously lived in the area for many years. After reading reviews on TripAdvisor, I requested a standard room in a quiet area of the hotel away from the Nightclub which is located in the middle of the hotel. The room was large, quiet and nicely decorated. About $350 per night. The Japanese restaurant was amazing and the staff was friendly and accommodating.  My niece booked a corner suite which was lovely but loud. I rated the hotel 3 stars due to the fact that I was forced to deal with rude, loud and mean drunks on more than one occasion, while attempting to ride the elevator to my room. These people were going to the club in the hotel via my elevator. At one point my NY niece had to step in to defend me from an incredibly rude and drunk woman. I learned to keep my mouth shut, eyes down and not smile or say good evening to those that stepped on the elevator with me and had obviously had a bit too much to drink. I would not stay here again.

title: Rude Staff, Poor Communication, Invasion of Privacy
text: Absolutely terrible service. We stayed in the penthouse as a very special treat for my birthday weekend. The staff was careless, rude, and every one of them seemed to have a different idea of hotel protocol. One of the worst instances was when we ordered room service and came back to our room to find our room service delivered on the table (without contacting any of us) and our front door that opens directly into the elevator left WIDE OPEN! Any person could have walked right in to our room.

title: Nice stay at Sixty LES
text: I recently stayed with the hotel for a week on business. It was a very comfortable stay. The beds are amazing and the set-up very good/efficient with adequate desk/writing space. There is a good fridge and snacks selection. The room was very clean and well maintained. Apart from one noisy Saturday evening (to be expected) I had no issues with noise or neighbors. I would stay again and recommend to others. It's an oasis within the hustle and bustle of the LES.

title: 5th and last stay
text: I have stayed at this hotel a handful of times and each time the rooms and service level has slowly degraded.  It feels as if the party crowd that doesn't even seem to stay in the hotel is what keeps this place afloat.  For the money there are plenty of other hotels that will provide nicer rooms and a better experience.  Showers leak into the hallway, shower fixtures leak often, halls smell old and used and most spaces including the rooms smell of fresh baked marijuana.  Soap was not replenished when the room was cleaned...had to request extra towels to dry the floor and was brought half of what was requested.

title: Just ok
text:
We stayed 4 days post cruise in Nyc . Decided to use a hotel on the lower side to experience a little of authentic New York life. We were not disappointed with the area. Lots to do here. 
This hotel could be a lot better. It is on a busy noisy street. Near underground services. 
Plenty of local bars and a good Italian round the corner. 
We didn't like the pubic areas , could do with some TLC. 
Rooms are very modern , industrial decor means  no paint on the ceiling ! 
The beds are very low down , if you have any joint or back problems you will suffer. 
Bathrooms are very very dark , and very small. 

Staff were pleasant and helpful at reception. Maid service is variable. 
We did not use dining services. We loved a local coffee bar selling great breakfast snacks just down the street. Great coffee there. 
We enjoyed our stay in the city , one of the most exciting places we have visited.

title: Sleepless in NY
text:
It would have been an adequate hotel, except for the "Club" on the 7th floor. By club, I mean the thumping-music kind that goes on till 3 or 4am on Fridays and Saturdays, and 1am other days. Good luck if your room is on the 6th floor; probably worse if you're on the 8th to 10th, as the club extends out to an open area, and noise travels up. Oh, the front desk will provide ear plugs, but it's hardly the solution. There is a separate line and lift for the clubbers to go up, but you can still bump into them on the way down in the other common lifts. You don't get a feeling of privacy nor security.
Else it's a good location - plenty of coffee places (Hedgehog Coffee, practically next door, does excellent expresso-style drinks); and if strong, salty liquorice is your thing, BonBon, with their Swedish liquorice imports, is a further 2 or 3 minutes away. And, of course, plenty of good restaurants within a 10 minute walk.

title: Modern & convenient location
text:
Stayed at this Lower East side hotel for work & play reasons. Good experience overall.  The hotel offers a couple of restaurants (limited food selection - mostly sushi).  The staff was super friendly (very impressed by the doormen - attentive & courteous).  We stayed in two rooms.  The first room on the 9th floor was well-appointed, quiet but small.  We upgraded to one of their suites on the 6th floor and it was double the size.  The suite had a huge shower/tub combo enclosed in frosted glass -  if you are shy or sharing with friends, it might not be a good choice because the glass enclosure faces the living room.  All 60LES beds are comfy but oh-so-low to the floor.  The balcony is shared and it is long and skinny - forget about lounging.  The rooftop bar is a major happening spot, but be prepared for loud thumping music throughout the night if you are staying over the weekend.  Room service is a no-no at this place - way overpriced and delivered in a brown bag.  Breakfast for 2: $60.  Better get Grubhub (lots of choices).

You cannot beat the location and there are plenty of restaurants & bars to choose from for entertainment, plus soho, the west village, & tribeca are just a 10 minute Uber ride away.  We also enjoyed our city views from the room.

title: Beautiful but dysfunctional
text: Great views. High ceilings. Nice linen. Near subway. Friendly staff. But lots of little problems let it down. They are very close to being a great hotel but....noisy air con, closed pool from early September. One day they may get it all in order.

title: Confortable
text: Only complaint would be they didnt offer coffee till 7am. And it was 6 dollar cup of coffee. I ordered two one day and it was 15 dollars. Being there for business, I woke up early hours and needed coffee, very disappointed that I had to either walk 6 blocks to get coffee or suffer the wee hours without coffee.

title: Wow
text: People were friendly great location,  room had tub because I requested one that is a plus.   Bed was super comfy.   Bath products smell great.  Location is fantastic loads of restaurants and boutiques.   Bars everywhere.

title: Great Location
text:
We stayed here for a girls' weekend trip and a nearby music festival. It was about an hour Lyft ride from JFK and as soon as we arrived, we were met with such great service, which continued all weekend. 

What we liked:
* Service was attentive and fast. 
* GREAT location: The hotel is near tons of food options, from casual to fine dining, as well as shopping, groceries, pharmacy, bars. Everything was in walking distance and really added to the fun and playfulness of the weekend.
* We had a tiny smidge of a balcony (standing room only) that is shared with all of your neighbors. Although it was small, it was cool to stand out there and watch. Just make sure you keep your door locked because the balcony is shared.

What to consider:
* There is a bar in the hotel and on weekend nights it can get loud depending on where your room is. At first we considered requesting a room change, but after a while it kind of added to the hum and vibration of the city.
* The hotel room itself does show some wear and tear, which makes this place average. It's not any worse than any other hotel of this age. The difference here is that the initial design was so modern that it still feels up-to-date, there's just normal wear and tear.
* The bathroom layout was not desirable and the material used for the doors was so flimsy. It's comical how difficult it is to turn on the shower and once you get it on, it didn't drain well. The bathroom is where you see the most wear and tear.
* The pool is small and there are limited seats, but who is going to NY to swim? Initially we were excited about this amenity, but we sat poolside for about 30 mins before deciding to go explore the city.

We did not make a mistake by staying here as two young women looking to have fun in the city for the weekend. It fit our budget and there were no glaring issues.

title: Not a bad spot
text:
It was a busy check in but we were seen to promptly staff were great during our whole stay.  They were always helpful and when we had to change room because of the loud music on the weekend they were very accommodating.

Room was clean bed was comfortable shower was a bit confusing to use but worked it out in the end.

When booking be aware of the loud music at the weekends otherwise metro is close and there are plenty of restaurants around for food.

title: Great location
text: The staff, especially the door staff were so friendly and helpful. The hotel is also in a great location, close to restaurants and shopping. The rooms were spacious, but the foyer lights by the door always kept turning on. Unfortunately, we also found a pair of underwear and pants that were left behind (probably from the last stay) which is unsettling as who knows what else the cleaners missed.

title: Loved this hotel
text: It was so clean and sleek. The service was wonderful. Loved the staff and the room was small but great. Checking was smooth and easy and we enjoyed the location a lot. Walked to Central Park and everything in midtown.

title: AWESOME
text: GO STAY HERE. The quality of this hotel is just beautiful, attention to detail, lux and friendly combined. My fiance and I had a lovely time, we had friends to our suit at a very early hour and the staff let each in welcoming and called up first.

title: No soundproofing in rooms - rude management.
text: Can clearly hear club music and voices from the terrace bar until 4am as well as voices, movements and even the toilet flushing in neighbouring rooms. Staff know about the issue and are arrogant when you complain. The beds are comfy and door staff friendly. Pool nice, but closes at 4pm and you have to get there by 9am if you want a sunbed.

title: Let Down in LES
text:
Recently stayed 4 nights as part of honeymoon with my wife. The interior of the hotel is smart and tidy, with good facilities such as pool, gym and terrace bar.  The rooms were small although adequate, but lacked tea/coffee facilities. The views of Manhattan are great from the higher floor rooms and from the bar itself.
The bar is essentially a club on a weekend and at the risk of sounding like an old person, the music is loud so if you are looking for quiet evening on adjacent floors then think again. It wasn’t something that bothered us as were out anyway. We still fancied a look inside the bar for a quick pre-drink before heading out on the town but weren’t made to feel very welcome by the hired door staff until explaining we were residents.
Mostly the reception staff were friendly. The main downside to the trip was that they said you had $10 credit for mini bar and snacks in the room each day. On two days we had two $5 snacks (packet of cookies, nuts, then Pringles and bottle of Coke Zero, no alcohol, with each item priced at $5) however we were changed €11 and €12 on the respective days. It was not stated that we would be charged for tax, or the full sale price as it turned out. We emailed the hotel afterwards asking for refund out of principle alone, however they never replied to refund us and still haven’t. They also could not take pre-payment from my credit card that I’d booked it on upon arrival so we used a UK debit card instead to make deposit. They said no payment would be taken from my credit card as a result, but $295 was still taken from my credit card without approval. This was eventually refunded after 10 days but left us short for the rest of our stay in California. This type of place would suit people who enjoy the great location and don’t expect to spend anytime in the hotel or speak to the staff.

title: Cool Lower East Side vibe but could be better
text:
Positives

* The view from our room (we were on the 16th floor).
* Location - close to subway stations and there is a great selection of restaurants, cafes and bars in Lower East Side. Great area, with a New York feel, without the tourist tat. 
* Selection of drinks and snacks in mini bar BUT please see points below.
* Facilities - bar, pool, restaurant. 
* Alarm clock has an iPhone connector.
* Comfortable bed. 
* Effective air con. 
* Free bottle of water left in room each day (but don’t confuse it with the mini bar water than is also left out and is listed on the mini bar menu!)

Negatives/ points to consider

* Quite small room - fine if you don’t have much luggage but we had 2 suitcases and we were clambering over them during our whole stay. 
* We arrived quite late from London due to a delayed flight and although the receptionist was polite, we didn’t particularly feel welcomed. Check in was talking a while due to this being the first time we had used our bank cards in the USA - an offer of a drink, even just water, would have went a long way.
* Bar attracts a really young crowd rather than hotel guests. It is really loud on the weekend. 
* Alarm, despite us not setting one, went off at 7am. 
* No tea or coffee facilities.
* Perhaps the most frustrating for us and a real warning for others... they tell you on arrival you get $10 mini bar credit. We only spent this credit on 2 of our days (luckily!). We carefully checked our mini bar menu and it stated each item we wanted was $5 so we knew we hadn’t exceeded the credit. They have actually charged us for the mini bar items and more (possibly tax but this was not identified on the menu and if so, incredibly sneaky)! We absolutely did not have any other items. We have contacted the hotel and surprise surprise... they are now ignoring us! Overall, a nice stay has been tainted by this error and their lack of customer service for previous guests. 
* We gave them a different card to charge but they also charged a card they told us hadn’t been used or authorised. As it was our honeymoon, $295 out of pocket was a real inconvenience... they were already taking $150 per day for damages which took a week to be returned.

title: Great location
text: Great location. Spacious room (for New York) close to village, soho , Nolita, travelled with my 2 daughters, 16 and 19, we loved the hotel and the location, clean, modern, swimming pool , great sushi restaurant, staff was friendly , would stay there again very quiet area at night, u dont hear the normal New York sirens and honking

title: Select room carefully
text: We had booked a superior Queen room which turned out to be very small, the bed was basically a mattress on the floor, not good for older people. There was no comfortable chair to sit on and at night it was very noisy. We were able to get an upgrade luckily and our new room was bigger with a balcony. Excellent views of New York and a lot quieter. It had a chair but it wasn't very comfortable and there was no top sheet on the bed. Bathroom was very small but a good sized shower.  The staff were friendly and very helpful. Hard to see Concierge as he wasn't in on Sunday when we arrived and didn't start to 10.00 on weekdays. We were gone before  then most mornings. Was in a very good position. The subway was very close and about 15-20 minute walk to Chinatown, Little Italy and Soho so lots of places to eat and shop.

title: Looks good from afar
text: Location is good and staff are friendly.  Elevators are slow and there’s not enough .  Everything in the room looks modern but it’s all cheap crap. The light switches don’t work properly, the water pressure is below average and the fixtures are counter intuitive.
