They also forgot to finish the ceiling in the bedroom which adds to a musty dirty type smell.  The pool was heir big selling point but t closes at 4 pm.  Over priced and won’t be back.

title: Great boutique hotel in convenient location
text: Right near the subway. Plenty of cool restaurants and bars surrounding. You receive a $10 credit on the mini bar everyday which is great. Staff are friendly and accommodating. The only downside we found was that the pool closes daily at 4pm which is a shame in the summer months as it would be nice to go for a late afternoon dip.

title: Location Location Location .... but the bar thing?
text: Stayed twice, staff great, superb location big suite, skinny balcony but a secure to open window to let the "street" vibe in (closed it was very quite for NY). Pretty fast check-in but they make you sign away your first born (being slightly older I cackled at the no party rule) room has everything, as always quirks but all good (the lit scene behind the bed switches off). The pool is like 3" deep so its a very much lounger scene, Level 1 Beer garden terrace is great, the asian restaurant + slightly separate bar are good, breakfast fast and spot on, barman were bloody good blokes...there is a BUT they rent/lease out the Level 1 bar and Level 7 (?) to a third party, and hotel guests are not guaranteed entry which sort of makes it hard to invite guests to meet you (Dante turned us away late which sort of bummed one night out) -- oops one littel tip, the restaurant on 1 has its own entrance so you can scoot out of the lift and down the stairs to Orchard STreet.

title: 2nd trip in 3 mos. It will be our last.
text:
Th bad: Got the same King terrace room both times. Ratty couch has been replaced. Stained (lit rally same big stain) throw rug and dirty side chairs remain. Killed a huge 2inch NYC roach the first night of our second trip. Water pressure is abysmal. The in room smart TV system is awful. It can take 5 min to turn on and then often becomes unresponsive. Room service is a mess. You can’t get a pot of coffee only to go cups. Previously room service was full service. They’ve now changed it to brown paper bag/box d livered to the room. It looks like corporate is pulling out all the stops to cut corners. We won’t be back.

Good: the location, the views and the staff are all fantastic.

title: Great check in and location. Dirty and banged up room and common areas.
text: The room was dirty and banged up. I’ve stayed in the hotel before and was disappointed to see its condition. Staff was nice at check-in. The 7th floor, where the bar/lounge is had a strong stench of alcohol and kitchen. That smell continues into the rooms. Gave a trashy experience. Maybe other floors are better. We checked in at 3:30 and that was the only room available. If we wanted a different floor, we would have had to wait.

title: Mention très bien
text:
Il s’agissait de notre 13e voyage à New York. Autant dire, donc, que nous connaissons pas mal d’hôtels dans la Grosse Pomme... Ce Sixty LES nous a très agréablement surpris ! 
Nous avions pourtant lu certains commentaires négatifs dans lesquels des clients se plaignaient du bruit, en raison de fêtes sur le rooftop du 7e étage. 
Notre chambre, située au 8e, avait justement une vue directe sur le bar. Et, honnêtement, je ne vois pas où est le problème. 
Il y avait effectivement de la musique, certes. Mais lorsqu’on choisit un hôtel comme celui-ci, situé entre Nolita et le Lower East Side, dans un secteur très prisé par les noctambules, il ne faut pas s’attendre à entendre les mouches voler. New York, ce n’est pas La Bourboule (sans, bien sûr manquer de respect à cette ville) !
Et puis, s’il y avait effectivement de la musique, le son baissait considérablement au fil de la soirée. À minuit, on n’entendait plus rien...
Donc, mention très bien pour cet hôtel à la clientèle plutôt jeune et branchée.
En outre, la salle de bains est top, tout comme la salle de fitness. Idem pour les cocktails servis dans ce fameux rooftop !
Conclusion : si vous ne connaissez pas NYC, que vous venez y faire du tourisme basique, préférez un établissement situé plus haut dans Manhattan, dans le large Midtown, entre la 34e rue et Central Park.
En revanche, si vous connaissez déjà tout, comme nous, et que vous voulez explorer davantage la vraie vie des New Yorkais, dans un quartier déserté par les touristes, cet hôtel sera parfait. D’autant qu’il n’est pas très loin de Brooklyn, et qu’on peut très vite aller à Williamsburg, par exemple.

title: Last minute city stay, quick and easy.
text: Stayed at Sixty LES last minute with my girlfriend in May. The booking to check in process took about 5 minutes total which was amazing. We had a basic King room looking west with a great view of the freedom tower. We were only one floor above the roof bar which gave off some noise but it wasn't so bad. Didn't get to spend too much time at the hotel but if we need another last minute spot we will be back, for the price the place was perfect.

title: Once a great Boutique Hotel not just nothing special anymore...
text:
I have been going to this hotel since 2008. Once to twice a year, either alone or with my wife, this was our favourite hotel, and the place to stay for a NYC stay.

End of June I spent three days at the hotel and deducted that the service was bad.

I left for Boston and came back end of June for a week at the hotel and deducted again that the service was bad:

- The rooms have not changed in ten years.
- The service has been going downhill.
- The Bathrooms have not changed.
- The TVs are smaller and slower.
- There are stains on the walls and ceilings.
- The quality of the lighting and decor is just outdated, aged, and unattractive now.

We got a really bad room during the second part of our trip. I tried 5 times to discuss a change of room with the manager on duty including paying more for a better one. No response. He could not be bothered to help. I could not be bothered to spend my money there anymore either.

The hotel has changed of management and owner since a few years, and I guess no one cares anymore.

Also while I really like the Lower East Side I notice that this is no longer the area that it was ten years ago. It is no longer up and coming, young and fun. Several restaurants and fun bars have closed down, and no one seems to be renting these premises to start new places. I guess the new area are Brooklyn and Tribeca...

In any case our last room was terrible, unpleasant and like staying in a dungeon (to quote another review). For that experience the hotel is super overpriced.

Forget the pool, the rooftop bar...there is much better in NYC in other hotels.

After ten years they will not see us again there...

title: Pretty standard stuff, with pretty crappy pool rules
text:
We paid extra to stay here b/c they had a pool, the rooms are equivalent to hotels costing $20+ a night less, but since there are so few outdoor pools in NYC, we splurged.  There has been light drizzle on/off all day, but the storm moved through at 2pm (pool is open only until FOUR PM!!).  They won't open it "due to weather" (or due to it costs them $$ to staff it).  At check in yesterday (after 4pm, sunny 90 degree day), they assured us it would be open even if it's drizzing.  Drizzle and clouds have moved out, manager refuses to open it even though it's 2:30.  They knew I was furious, and offered me nothing.

Additionally, cleaning started knocking before 9am, we sent them away.  We got back at 2pm, they never came back.  The fees give you $10 from the mini bar/snacks ONLY if they restock it every day, but they never came back to restock, soooo, I guess we're out?

Room is fine, average, bed is practically on the floor, no top sheet (just bottom sheet and duvet, and everything is super dark - the bathroom is black, bad lighting and no window.  The TV does suck, kept quitting out on his, took forever to change stations.  Bigger than the Yotel, similar quality.  I'm in NY a few times a year on business, this was a trip with my daughter.  I will not come back to stay here for my next trips.  The neighborhood is great, Tenement Museum is a block away, transit is across the street.

title: Pourrait mieux faire
text: Nous étions 4 adultes , nous avions choisi une Chambre avec lit et sofa . Le sofa est très inconfortable , nous avons demandé un deuxième matelas afin de ne pas trop ressentir les ressorts c était mieux mais pas suffisamment confortable pour récupérer des journées trépidantes de NY . Salle de bain au top et petite sortie sur terrasse avec jolie vue .

title: TRENDY HOTEL TRENDY LOCATION.
text:
We had incredible days staying at the Sixty Les.
The location is great, not too many tourists, lots of cool restaurants and bars just a few steps from the hotel.
Our room was spacious really well appointed. A Junior Suite it was something nice to have so much space in NYC.
The gym is nice, the Japanese restaurant also very cool.
The rooftop was ok but I expected more. The pool was closed on the first days.
It was a great stay in a cool location

title: Like staying in a dungeon
text:
Hated my stay. The staff are pleasant but everything is for the hotel's convenience not their guests. 

The rooms decor is completely dark.  So a suite is nothing like the light breezy room pictured. We needed every light on just to see anything. 

The pool closes at 4pm week days so forget sightseeing and then a swim. 

The tv took so long to change channels we gave up trying. We were told "everyone complains of this" gee maybe you'd like to do something about it? 

The web price if you book on line is incorrect. Why? Seemingly because they can't be bothered to get it right. 

Like boutique hotels of old everything is over priced.

title: NYC Trip 2018
text: I just checked out today and wanted to give my review. I stayed for 5 nights with a back to back reservation. There were 3 of us and the first room that we got was the one bedroom terrace suite. This suite has amazing views (please see my inserted pictures do the view), we stayed in the suite for the first 2 nights. It was very comfortable, spacious and quiet that were where times I even fall asleep just sitting on the couch. There is a nespreso coffee machine in the room with free coffee pods, the bathroom was spacious and easy to use shower control, he living room with a small dining table is very efficient for me and my friends and the bedroom was huge and has a dark curtain to make sure the sunlight does not hit you in the morning. For our lady 3 nights we moved to a room that has 2 Queen bed and the size of the room is still comfortable for 3 adults. This room does not have a coffee machine but if you do ask I’m sure he front desk will be happy to send one to you. Checking in was easy and seamless, I got in later so my friend checked in first with no problem. We checked out all of their venues, from the gym, pool, social club on the 7th floor (amazing) to the beer bar on the 2nd floor. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the bell services is always gracious and helpful. Everyone greets you like you are part of heir family. Housekeeping was superb, every time we get back to the room we have our rooms refreshed, towels and toilet amenities replenish. I would definitely come back and recommend friends too. Kudos to heir Managers Rigel and Chanel very attentive and always have a smile on heir face. Thank you!

title: Great Stay
text: The hotel was in a lively area, with plenty of things to do and great places to eat. Even the sushi bar on the 2nd floor, Blue Ribbon, had amazing sushi! The hotel is also located not too far from Little Italy and China Town. This would be a great place for business trips, couples and families.

title: BIG NO NO!!!!
text:
I enjoyed my stay a few month ago in Sixty SOHO and I really looked forward to stay at LES as it seemed to even cooler and nicer as the area around is.
But not at all! Just avoid this hotel!!! Their are far better options around in the area.
First of all my room was on the seventh floor were there is also a bar open till late at night. So I couldn’t sleep at all, because of the loud music and in addition many costumers go out of the noisy bar to speak on the phone in front of your room door. 
I had a junior suite with is a bigger room with a seating area but awful and outdated designed.
The furniture is rundown and dirty. I didn’t even dare to seat on the stained sofa.
They have in the room fake designer pieces such as the bedside lights which at falling apart.
The shower is spacious but again so unthoughtful designed that its uncomfortable.
I booked a room with breakfast - but they start serving at 7 am and not even coffee is available through room service before this hour. Because I had to check out at 0630am to catch a flight I didn’t get any breakfast they refused to refund und the breakfasts cost and didn’t even try to compensate or find a solution. fYI - a coffee machine is not available in the room.
The gym - is a joke as well as it has 4 Trade-mills and almost no further equipment. So don’t plan on a workout.
I didn’t check the pool by myself but it doesn’t look like something to write home about.
And on top of all that the staff was unkind and unhelpful - every request I had was denied, not even a proper umbrella was available at the reception when it was raining.   
I won’t be back there for sure as there are so many better options around and you shouldn’t too.

title: Great location and friendly staff
text:
This is a review is my experience in this hotel.  I will also say that it also encompasses some my preferences and personal issues that may not apply to everyone.  

The hotel is very nice and in a great neighborhood.  There are lots of really great places to eat and some good shopping.  We found it very easy to hop on  the subway and get anywhere, especially getting to Broadway to see shows.  We could easily walk to Joe's Pub to see a show and to the fashion district for shopping.  It was also nice to walk across the Williamsburg bridge and explore that area.

The staff was great!  Always friendly and greeted us as we came and went as well as offered any assistance.  Their friendly faces made me pause to complain, but if you are having issues you have give them a chance to fix it.  On a few occasions they did; like with hangers, top sheet and noise from the toilet flushing and cold water running.  

I actually thought the noise level was good.  Usual traffic sounds outside and on the weekends a slight thumping came from the music in the club.

We made our reservations in advance and received an e-mail prior to our visit which allowed to check in early and add any upgrades or services.  There were no upgrades available, but they did offer a late check out at 2 pm for an additional fee.  We selected that option and it was verified at check-in.  However on the day of check out we received a call (12:15 pm, noon is normal check out) to see if we needed any assistance with our bags and when were coming down.  I informed them that we opted for the late check out and was asked who I spoke to at check-in.  I did not remember, but she allowed it.  I had my e-mail receipt for the option so I forwarded the e-mail and they confirmed.  We were okay to stay longer, but our keys had been deactivated. 

During the check in process via the e-mail.  I was asked if were celebrating a special event and I responded with “Celebrating 18 years together”.  They responded with “We will do the best we can to make this a very special birthday.”  We did not receive anything special.  After we had a few things fixed (TV and Pipe noise), we were given a small bottle of wine and a nice note.

This review is getting long, but we did have a few issues with the Allen Suite:
1. The bed had a sheet covering the mattress and then a duvet.  No top sheet.  I called to ask about this and was informed that this is how they do the beds.  I requested a top sheet and they brought one.  It remained on for 3 nights and then it was taken away.  I did not request a new one and tried to sleep with just the duvet covering us.  
2. The next issue for me was the bathroom.  It was in the living room and had foggy glass walls, so if you have guest over, order room service or are a person that really like privacy it could be a little awkward.  The sliding glass door has a big hole in it (the handle) and there was a large gap between the wall and sliding door when closed, so both allowed the cold air to blow in or people to peep into the room.  It was pretty, but not ideal.  We didn’t get a full sense of privacy.
3. There were two stalls in the bathroom one for the shower and one for the toilet.  The one for the toilet was small like a restaurant or department store stall, except with a fancy foggy glass door and metal bar in the middle.  The metal bar was an issue,  You had to be careful when pulling up or down your pants otherwise you would hit your head on the bar.  I did that twice, so learned to maneuver things differently so I would not knock my self out.
4. The closet in the bedroom was very small and only had a few hangers.  We requested some more hangers and they brought them up right away, so that was nice.
5. Our TV was terrible especially in the living room.  We had to use the remote from the bedroom, but the TV would lose the signal or not come on.  We had to play with the with the wires to get it to work.  I did call about and they came up to fix it, but it worked okay for the that day and then went back to not working.
6. The free wifi was very slow.  A 12 second instagram video would not even load or it would pause every 2 seconds.  It was like the old days of dial up.  I just used my data plan it was easy and faster, much faster.

Overall a good hotel.

title: Visit with my 8yr old daughter
text:
Extremely disappointed, reason for booking this hotel was the pool. After travelling, I knew my daughter would be tired in afternoons, so we could head back to hotel to relax. Emailed to advise a few days before our arrival that I was travelling with a child. 
Arrived on a Wednesday, pool didn’t open until the weekend, even on a Friday when we went to pool, it has just closed, shut at 4pm!!! Very disappointed kid. 
Wrong part of town for me, intimidating area, wouldn’t want to be out in evenings with a child. No coffee shops close by for mornings. Not handy for anywhere. Hotel noisy at night, loud bar, party crowd. Rooms are very small. I wouldn’t recommend for families or children

title: Great hotel. Roof top bar a joke
text: Hotel was nice. Very expensive to drink pool side. Make believe is the roof top bar. What a joke. They don’t care if you are staying at hotel. You need to be a young girl in order to get in. They turned us away unless we wanted to pay $1500 for 6 people.

title: Very unimpressed. Way overpriced.
text: We switched from a hotel down the street to this one because we wanted to “upgrade” for our last night of vacation. Big mistake. The previous hotel was cheaper and much nicer. The rooms are run down. The pool is dirty. Our tv barely worked. Internet is super slow (unless you pay extra). Let’s just say they do a really good job with their marketing... there are better hotels for the money. One pro is the staff is very nice. Everyone was very helpful and friendly.

title: Great location, great facility, outstanding staff
text: We've stayed at LES twice now, and both times were excellent. It's a new excellent facility with incredible views of the city on the upper floors. The staff is as good as we've encountered anywhere. We will definitely be staying again.

title: Well Designed in Central Location
text:
We stayed at sixty Les hotel for, four nights. We are a family of four visiting New York for the first time. We were very impressed with the service once you arrive at the hotel.

Checking in was very simple, the Bellman helped us right away from the curb side all the way to our room. All the Bellman were very courteous and helpful when leaving and arriving to the hotel from a days out on the town. The lobby was very clean and quiet and relaxing.

The room was well-designed and provided some good amenities. The room was small with what looked like a full size bed. The best space for small the restroom was small and the living area was small. Now this may be something to expect since it is in New York's busy Lower East Side. 

I gave it three out of five because the bed was uncomfortable and lumpy. The hotel room near us or the bar below us probably allowed smoking because you can smell it in the room. And the walls were very thin.

The shower head was very nice rainfall Style. The bar setup was very useful with many cups to use. The complementary soaps and shampoos smell delicious. The bed was clean and so was the room when we arrived. The View was amazing and it was local too many shops and restaurants.

This was Hotel one of two from our trip so don't have much to compare to in New York. Comparing stay to other stays in other cities such as San Francisco or Washington DC.

Overall I recommended a stay for couples only. This is not a comfortable room for a small family. That is not the hotels fault that is our fault. We made it work and it was a fun stay.

title: Stay Away!!!
text: So many other hotels in NYC in this upper price range that provide better service, no need to waste your money here.  Room not ready on time, had to settle for a lesser room, as my kids were getting restless standing around waiting in the lobby - front desk staff absolutely useless in arranging transportation back to LI......staff (bell men, maids, etc.) all courteous and friendly but management - the worst - also beds are low, platform type literally 1 foot off of the floor - something I would expect in a teenager's bedroom not an

title: Maybe too contemporary for practicality
text:
This may have been a better stay had we been informed prior to our arrival the bar was closed for renovation as we had planned several group meetings at that bar over our 4 day stay. The room offered lots of space, but the contemporary style offered inconvenient truths: platform beds super low, bathroom super dim, room lighting super sparse.  
On the plus side, the staff was polite,especially the bellmen,and housekeeping was excellent.The 2nd floor lobby was nice. The in-house sushi restaurant a plus! Overall it was just an ok stay on the upper east side.

title: shady $150.00 incidental charge
text: When I checked in, I. was told there would be a $150.00 a night incidental charge.  I questioned this charge and they said in case I order something as in room service.   Well, I had no choice -either pay it or no check in. While at the hotel, I did have a few incidentals as in room service charge. When I checked out there was no deduction from the $150.00 I was charged but charge full room serve. Its like the $150.00  was just a random charge.  I have contacted hotel that only sent me a bill just like the one I have that does not resolve issue.  With this problem and the problem of $6.00 coffee from restaurant , and dark dark elevator ( could not see numbers), I will say no thank you . Too many better options in that neighborhood. On a positive note , staff was nice. This place just your every dime -that is what it felt like. No thank you.

title: Absolutamente ruidoso y nada de lo que buscaba encontré
text:
Reserve este hotel por la piscina. Cuando llegue me entere que solo la abren el fin de semana y pocas hs. Prometen un bar/ social club que dicen que es del hotel pero en realidad solo hasta las 9 pm. Luego es privado. A partir del viernes el ruido de este social club es insoportable si tienes pensado dormir algo... y olvídate de reclamar o algo. No le importas a nadie. Dos
Noches enteras sin poder pegar un ojo hasta las 3 /4 que es cuando cierra el social club. Insoportable. Habitación Mini como cualquiera en ny así que entre tanto para elegir ni loca vuelvo. En la recepción cada uno te dice lo que se le ocurre en el momento. Nadie te da la información correcta. Inentendible. Ni muerta vuelvo a quedarme acá.

title: Noisy and overpriced
text: Best thing about this hotel is it’s location which is in Lower East Side. Place is nice and staff friendly and very helpful but problem is it is very noisy with various bars/clubs/social clubs functioning in hotel when we were there. Very expensive and not worth the money IMO

title: Noisy Noisy Noisy
text:
Difficult one. Hotel is clean and the staff are nice . Rooms are a good size . 

However it stops there . On the lower floors it is noisy . What causes the issue - The venue next door, and the night club on the seventh floor ,So if you are near either , forget it, you wont get much sleep. What compounds the problem is the design .The lift is central and the rooms are very close to the lift so again adds to the noise level .Lift bell noise etc  .

You also are on Allen street which again is noisy . Hey you are in Manhattan but I have stayed in similar in much better locations .

title: Wonderful spring weekend
text: For our anniversary, my wife and I flew in from the west coast on the red-eye for a get-a-way weekend in the City. We arrived early knowing that we could drop off our bags and we could get our room in the afternoon. Christian met us at the door with a genuine welcome, Doreen checked us in and wished us a happy anniversary, and said that she would call when the room was ready. She was very sweet and pleasant, and made us feel welcome too. After an early brunch and a few hours in the sun in Washington Square we received the message that our room was ready. We made our way back through SoHo, got our bags and arrived in our room. I think it was classified as a junior suite queen, maybe. It was very nice, with a comfortable seating area, firm bed, great shower, two super soft robes, and all the amenities. A nice view of Allen Street with the afternoon sun was perfect for a well deserved nap.  We were always greeted by the staff we met in the elevators as well as the different doormen. Conclusion: A great staff is a reflection of good management. I called the hotel (Aneivah was so nice and helpful) to get the names of the front office manager and GM because I believe they are the key to our wonderful experience.  So, hats off to Maria Meggia in the front office and Jennifer Villamayor for creating such a great work environment that allows your employees to shine, and shine they did. Thank-you!

title: Great hotel in the lower east side.
text: Room has hard wood floors and felt very clean. Nice bed faith down pillows. Balcony overlooking Allen St. Nice lounge. All the amenities from iron board, soaps, hair dryer and robe. bathrooms were super nice. Central to trains, shopping and food.

title: Extremely disappointing!
text:
This hotel stay has been a fiasco since day 1. My sense is that there is poor communication among the staff, and that guests are not treated well.  The walls in this hotel are paper thin and it is always noisy.  The rooms are very dark. Last night my husband woke to go to the washroom and slogged through 2" of water.  We called the manager at 4:00 a.m. to report ( a hot water pipe had burst).  There were further  visits and we lost a night's sleep.The manager promised we would be comped the night and upgraded. The morning staff were oblivious to the fact we were still walking in 2" of water, and we had to ask for help with mopping and then wait until 1:30 for a room to become available. In fact we were downgraded.  
This hotel has a hip vibe and is well located in the lower east side.  I do not recommend it.

title: Perfect location
text:
This was a wonderful hotel with a perfect location when visiting New York.  Efficient reception.  Modern design. Comfortable beds. Clean rooms.
In the summer the hotel even better with a wonderful outdoor swimming pool.
The breakfast however, was not up to my expectations, so next time I stay there,
I will have breakfast at one local diners!

title: Not for anyone over 30!
text: Trying too hard to be expensive trendy. Rooms cramped, no storage, not even for suitcases. We were 3 floors above the very noisy terrace bar and the base thump went on into the night. Drinks overpriced didn’t try the food.

title: Great hotel but they need to address the noise issue
text: Professional and helpful at the front desk, staff were all very courteous and kind, great location/view of the city, “hip” feel, nicely decorated and generally well-appointed rooms, if a little small (we were in a queen double) (no coffee maker unless you’re in a suite, then you get an espresso machine). The down side (and it’s a pretty significant issue) is that it’s VERY poorly insulated. Loud, pounding ‘base’ reverberated from the music at the hotel's new social room/night club on the 7th floor, through our room on the 8th floor, until 3:00 AM. Nice atmosphere but evidently no regard to structural design for guests who may want to sleep! Others have mentioned this in previous comments - It’s a real problem - take heed unless you don’t normally go to sleep until 3:00 AM anyway. It should be noted that we did not use many hotel amenities, so I cannot speak to those (restaurant, etc).

title: LOVED SIXTY LES!
text: Amazing experience at Sixty LES. Friendly staff! Hospitality was on point. Definitely recommend, definitely will return! And it’s close to everything you need, shopping and transportation. Thank you Sixty LES!

title: Nice hotel
text: Recently stayed at LES to celebrate my 21st birthday. Service was great! I applaud the bellmen there! Unfortunately I didn't catch anyone's name but I was always greeted with a smile! Room was decently sized and terrace was an added bonus! Will stay here again.

title: Overpriced but great service
text: I was staying for one night for a celebration in the East Village. This was a good location and was a 10 minute walk to the location of the celebration and a 10 minute walk to brunch in the morning. My stay was on a Saturday night so rates are usually higher but this was a little too high in my opinion and the bed was not at all comfortable. However, I would stay here again and would recommend to others as the service was excellent and the pizza reccomendation was spot on!

title: great
text: it was a great stay in a spacious room, with a great location, never needed to use a cab or Uber, except to get back to Penn Central...also great espresso next door! It is not often you can find a room with 2 double beds in the city anymore! Thank you for that!

title: Great location, nice hotel, but rooms not as big as advertised and rather pricy
text: The hotel is located in a very nice neighbourhood and in the middle of Manhattan. The top rooms (Empire View) are sizable and have fantastic views. But the lower rooms are not sizable as advertised and don't have the great views as advertised. But overall the hotel is good and rooms are not small, a bit sober (no coffee machine, etc) and definitely highly priced.

title: Great staff, very good rooms, loved the location
text: Great hotel for us as a family, the rooms were big, recently renovated and spottlessly clean. Staff was very helpful and always friendly, but relaxed. The location is great, right by a subway stop that takes you to midtown, and walking disctance to soho and nolita. There are many nice restaurants near by.

title: Trendy and Good Location but poor service. Better value for money elsewhere in Manhatten
text:
I and a colleague stayed at Sixty LES for close to 15 nights. The room for $270 a night was ridiculously small. The mini bar fridge had to be shoved inbetween a closet right next to the bathroom. 
While the hotel is trendy and they have a nice bar and restaurant, thought the service & approach of the staff was poor. I think the management has not empowered the front desk or team to make any decisions or have any desecration. After having stayed at the property for 17 nights, when we called the front desk to check if we could check out an hour later, they promptly said it would be 'chargeable'. Thought the $8 charge for a bottle of water was excessive. Location of the hotel is good with lots of restaurants and bars close by. However for the price they charge, there are lots and lots of better options in Manhatten and also in the same area.

title: Modern & Spacious
text: What a great location of this hotel in the Lower East Side right by Rockwell.  The hotel is modern and the room was spacious - not many hotels in NYC can boast the amount of space - high ceilings and big windwos. Nice clean rooms.  The only downside was the bed was platform, low to the ground and really hard so it wasn't my ideal sleeping situation.   The staff were super friendly and really accommodating. Great stay overall!

title: Great Time For My Wife s Birthday
text:
We had a great time for my wife s birthday celebration.We stayed at Penthouse 3 and 
it was incredible. It would not have been possible without the help of Darren Bernstein
Sales Manager of the Hotel..The staff was helpful and friendly and accommodating to
us. We would love to come back every year.

title: Great hotel - Great location
text: I was visiting my daughter in and I wanted to be close to her in the LES. This couldn’t have been better.  I will definitely stay here again. Loved it! The cable in the gym needs to be fixed. However, this is not a biggy complaint.  The rooms were lovely I loved that there was a lot of light. The views are fabulous.

title: one of my happiest hotel stays in nyc
text: we stayed in sixty LES because we needed to be in the lower east. it is a lovely hotel - warm, chic, homely - that was always a pleasure to return to, especially on cold march days and nights. we were bemused by housekeeping that seemed to have lost the plot - too much shampoo, no shower gel, or too many coffee pods, no creamer etc. i feel petty mentioning it because we received a bottle of wine, chocolates and a profuse written apology midway through our stay (and the oversights continued)—it all added up to being rather endearing. the hotel restaurant is japanese (blue ribbon) that serves excellent food. front desk staff were all very friendly and professional. i'd love to stay here again!

title: EXCELLENT
text: I love this place; I've stayed there over half a dozen times and I keep coming back for the value, service and property.  The food is great; everything is a few steps away...and the staff always goes above and beyond.

title: Not comfortable, nor practical for more than a one night stop over.
text:
Poorly configured rooms lacking basics like places to hang coats and robes, storage for suitcases.
3rd floor was noisy.
Lifts ping all night.
In general feels modern but cheaply put together.
Not bad, just not great.

title: Unparalleled quality for the price
text: I am a 33 year old male and stayed on a Friday, Saturday, Sunday night while I was back in town for business and pleasure.  Having lived in the city last year, I was excited about the location as it is in the booming LES.  I was extremely impressed with the staff/level of service, and the facilities.  The rooms were super Chic with unbelievable views of downtown all the way up to Chrysler tower.  Access was slick with the F train across the street.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Good hotel
text: Wasn't that expensive the location was excellent. The Japanese restaurant on the 2 floor was amazing although the outdoor bar was less than unless you like my Everest  decibel levels to pounding hip hop which younger people seem to since the place was jamming when we were there. But service was attentive and friendly. Rooms comfy. Only things to detract was the virtually inoperable TV and the lack of ventilation in bathroom. I'd stay again.

title: Amazing View
text: I spent a week here, and I only can say nothing but good! Staff is very friendly, and the view is mesmerizing. Giant wall to wall windows and minimal style rooms. The bed was very comfy and the location is perfect as well

title: hotel molto bello!
text: questo hotel sorge nel lower east side, ha ottime stanze e se avete uno dei piani piu alti anche un ottima vista! il bagno è molto bello e le stanze pulite. è un po' fuori però dalla new york turistica ed è invece in una zona molto caotica durante le serate del weekend.

title: Great Time in the LES
text: We stayed in NYC recently for 2 nights.  I had stayed at this property once before and found it to be very comfortable.  The second stay did not disappoint.  I chose a suite this time, which was spacious and comfortable, a great value for the price.  The room could probably be refurbished a little bit BUT this was a nonfactor for us since it's basically a place to sleep.  That point aside, the hotel staff kept the room clean without ever feeling invasive.  The location is great, on the edge of the East Village and LES, close to plenty of shops and restaurants.  It's also a short walk to Soho, as well as being close to 2 subways to get you to the further reaches of the island and Brooklyn.  Admittedly we got the room for a good rate but even adding 20% to the price of the room I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to our friends and family.

title: Amazing stay at Sixty LES
text:
I️ travel a lot for work and have stayed at some of the nicest hotels in Manhattan. However, this was my first time staying at the Sixty LES. I often stay at the other Sixty Properties like the Nautilus and Sixty Beverly Hills and this one was my favorite. The room was very quiet and the mattress was incredible. The rain shower was delightful and it felt like I was in a home, not a Hotel room. 

The service at the front desk was impeccable, Jared, one of the front desk team members makes you feel like welcome and made every effort to accommodate me. Impressed. The bell man, Joshua, continued the excellent service pointing out all the amenities and making us feel even more welcome. 

I️ love the hotel since it’s right next to Soho without the crowds and only several blocks from Whole Foods.

title: Loved it.
text: I booked a Junior Suite at a great price for a 1-night mini-getaway.  I loved how spacious the room was.  The bed was huge and so cozy and clean.  We really enjoyed the decor, it was modern and trendy, with some really fun features and accents.  There was a nice little separate sitting/living area if you are dining in, which we did since it was terribly cold out.  The Cheese Grille place is just next door, it's a hidden gem that specializes in awesome signature grilled cheese sandwiches and mac & cheese bowls.  The shower was very clean with plenty of space and modern appliances -- one of those rain shower heads that comes straight down are always nice.  The shower is in a separate space from the toilet, which is in its own little room.  The two are separated by the sink area.  It was one of my favorite bathroom setups in any hotel I've stayed in.  Plenty of closet space and warm, fuzzy robes.  One thing I always have an issue with in some hotels is fiddling around with the thermostat.  Luckily, that worked great in this room.  I would've stayed there for a week if I had the free time.

title: Hotel is Gorgeous, The Staff eh..
text:
I decided to stay here with my Hubby for his bday for a bit of a staycation, we were also going to be celebrating nearby. The initial interaction at check in sort of put us off. We normally will pay with cash for our incidental charges hotel stays to avoid any random holds on our cards. Long story short, it was such a hassle to pay with cash and the whole process had to be resolved by two separate individuals. The desk associate just seemed sooo bothered with us, and all we wanted to do was check in and relax. She kept announcing to the couple behind us that " Im so sorry, I'll be right with you" as if this process wasn't holding us up as well, or like we were such a burden. 
Anyway, we get to our room. It was ok - It wasn't what I thought I originally booked, but it was ok for me. My husband on the other hand, was not too impressed. He called downstairs, and first addressed our check in situation with the manager and then requested an complimentary upgrade. They refused the complimentary part, but did allow us to pay for an upgrade. They sent up the bellhop (who was very polite, and considerate) to help us take our belongings to the next room. They also sent him up with a receipt for the upgrade, that we had to sign prior to moving (side eye). When he came back with our receipt, they sent him with a bottle of champagne. 

We enjoyed the room as much as we could after we got settled. I have to say, the room decor is super swanky. I probably enjoyed the tub/shower combo the most. They also have toiletries from Maison Margiela, so they definitely get a plus for that. 

After our night out, we just wanted to sleep in so we asked to extend our stay and they told us they were completely booked so we would haVe to check out unfortunately. Of course you are... I really try not to base my opinion off of one stay at a hotel (especially local) But I honestly do not see myself staying here again.

title: Grandes chambres mais vieillissant
text:
Certes le Sixty LES (anciennement Thompson LES) n'est plus l'hôtel branché qu'il fut. En particulier dans un quartier de Manhattan où les nouvelles adresses n'arrêtent jamais d'ouvrir (cf le récent PUBLIC de Ian Schrager), mais tout de même le Sixty LES a un bel atout à faire valoir : la taille de ces chambres, dans une ville où bon nombre d'hôtels offrent des superficies minuscules.

Associé au rapport qualité-prix correct, il s'agit du principale avantage de l'hôtel qui a déjà beaucoup vieilli et semble déjà largement dépassé, du design aux équipements en passant par la politique tarifaire (tous les services additionnels - minibar, laundry, petit-déjeuner, accessoires - sont surfacturés) ou le service, fade et impersonnel.

title: Great location but hotel is feeling tired
text: Great location in Allen Street near Russ & Daughters, Katz's Deli in LES and friendly staff. But rooms need to be updated with new beds, smart TVs & improved WiFi. Also Hotel should reinstate the Fellini movies in the lifts which were great.

title: Buona esperienza
text:
Rispetto all’aspettativa creata dal sito é piú essenziale negli spazi, nonostante abbiamo scelto una camera king bed, ma ben tenuto, in ordine e pulito.

Personale gentile, essenziale (ma premurosi) anche nel servizio.

Ottima posizione: vicino alla metro che porta a nord, a pochi minuti a piedi dalla zona sud e sud est (nolita-soho-lower&east side...), in mezz’ora si arriva a ground zero. 20 minuti di metro x area time sq/Rockefeller.

Le camere alte con vista sulla strada dell’ingresso offrono una super visuale su alcuni noti grattacieli.

Solo una nota stonata: il condizionamento era solo in camera e non arrivava in bagno che era freddo.

title: Pas confortable
text:
Bien situé mais trop de bruit !!!  Quelle idée de placer une famille avec jeune enfant juste au dessus d’un club ? Précision....Il y a un bar club musique à fond jusque tard dans la nuit... personnel pas à l’écoute 
Trop cher y a beaucoup mieux sans trop chercher

title: Sixty LES is a good option
text: Stayed in the king suite on the sixth floor the day after Christmas. Noise wasn't an issue as the bar on the floor above wasn't open. The view from the balcony was amazing. You do share it with other guess on the floor, however so it isn't private. The king suite came with a soaking tub which was perfect because it was deep and comfortable enough to fit two people. The bed is pretty low but it was extremely comfortable.

title: Very comfortable room
text: We visited over Thanksgiving weekend.  We have visited NYC city in the past and found the rooms to be very small.  Sixty LES is not like the others.  Our room was very accommodating with a very large shower.  The staff was very helpful knowing the closest Dunkin Donuts and better restaurants in the area.  We will definitely go back.

title: Good for touring--not ideal for business
text: I had a two night business trip which included having to dress (suits) so this was not an ideal choice.  The room is quite tiny which in and of itself isn't an issue, however, when it came time to do any work, the desk is rather limited, and the floor space between the bed and desk requires some maneuvering to even get into the chair.  And having to iron a couple of shirts during the stay was a comedy on the tiny ironing board atop the tiny desk.  I would also note that the hardware in the room seemed a bit tired, however the soft goods (towels and linens) were great.  All of the staff I encountered were VERY nice, and I find that important.  I was also delighted to be located just around the corner from the famous Katz's Deli so was able to drop in there for dinner one night which was a treat.

title: Great Spot - Trendy Hotel
text:
My daughter and I joined my husband on a trip to NYC and stayed (again) at SIXTY LES (LES = Lower East Side).  We like this hotel as it is well placed for a good walk to pretty much anywhere.  The subway (Line F) is super close (100m) and is a very central line to get anywhere easily. The hotel rooms are well done and the room we had this time 1401 (?) was nicer than the one we had last year.  It is on the 'back" of the hotel and was much much quieter! Two beds and a decent amount of space.  Ben @ the Concierge was super helpful as always. The Bellmen are well informed and can direct you where you need to go. 

As we were leaving at different times (hubby/us) I asked to stay a little longer.  We were offered an hour more.  May I just say that at 12:45 - 1:05 Housekeeping came past 4 times.  A few too many and talk about feeling pushed out!  A little unnecessary I believe and that is so easy to fix.  

Be aware - when you check in a hold is placed on your card (standard hotel practice).  The hold is released after 4-5 days.  We checked in and then changed the card we wanted to use to "hold for extras".  Well - somehow - charged twice and - crazily - for the bill too (didn't use the second card that should have been recorded).  This, for a stay of 5 days can tie up some $$$ which is just on "hold".  

Apart from that - it's a great spot.

title: Best Hotel Deal Downtown
text: A wonderful hotel staffed by an incredible team dedicated to service. Solid food and beverage options, a workable gym, chic rooms with sexy showers, great views, killer balcony, prime location AND it's affordable!

title: European delight
text: The small touches and the smiles of the staff were such a delight. Take a moment to relax and plan your time to enjoy your stay as we did. Enjoy the food and take a moment to adjust the lighting to just what you want. It's your stay, make it a good one!

title: Perfect stay
text: Arrived a bit late from Europe and was greeted with an upgraded room with city view! Fantastic room, great bed, loved the location and super nice staff. This is the second time that I have stayed here and bringing my family back in May 18. The subway (F train is just across the street). Great dining in the neighbour Hood. Short walk to SOHO.  Absolutly recommend this hotel!

title: Tiny cramped rooms and terrible experience.
text:
I booked this for 3 nights and the room is way smaller than advertised. If you book through a website like hotels tonight, your room is more likely to be 200 sq ft. 
They are having issues with false fire alarms which will wake you up early in the morning so don’t plan on getting any rest. 
Absolutely one of my worst experiences in a NY hotel. This is more like a 3 Star hotel if anything and there are better choices in this area such as the New Hotel on Bowery.

title: LES is more and SIXTY is a good number
text: Excellent friendly and efficient check in service and doormen. The upgraded room we received was impressive particularly set off well by the illuminated headboard screen that gives the whole room a very restful tone. Lighting is so ... so important.Everything else is as you should expect at this price point and I'm only upset that I didn't get the chance to see the rooftop bar

title: for the price ok! the view is great
text:
We stayed 5 nights there and had a good time. the staff is very friendly and extreme helpful! 
the rooms are modern, small and were not 100% clean. we had a blasted towel and some dirt in the corners and on the curtains! you can hear the lift coming even when your door is closed.
the highlight was the view we had! the view is amazing! we saw the brooklin bridge, the finance district and a lot more!
would we pay the same price again for the stay? probably not. 
if those things are no problem for you and a amazing view is important for you, than go for it!

title: Great visit until the last night-- great location
text:
Overall the hotel was great! Everyone at the beginning was very nice and friendly (even the cleaning staff when we would run into them in the elevator).  I was really impressed by how the doorman and the front desk seemed very on top of things.  Doorman would recognize people coming to the hotel from the outside and make suer the door was open for them before they go there.  The first desk person when we checked in was slammed and still really nice and on top of things.  

The location is excellent and we were able to walk to nolita, soho, and chinatown, not to mention it's super close to Russ and Daughter's and Katz.  Also in reference to the internet. 

There is free wifi, which is plenty enough to use social media and check emails is free in all areas (public areas and room), but if you want a higher speed wifi to stream video or something then there is a charge.  My only confusion with this is that when you do the free wifi it seems to go to a payment or confirmation screen for like 10 seconds and then quickly load another page. I was never able to see what the confirmation screen said and one time it loaded slightly slower and I thought it said I was confirming the paid internet? 

Overall everything was great until the last day where I felt like I was being told to leave as quickly as possible.  We had asked the night before if we could have late checkout and was told to ask at 8am and it's based off of first come first serve. We called 8am on our checkout day on the dot.  We were told the latest we could have is 12:30pm (original check out time is noon).  We wanted to grab something to eat really quick before taking our bags out and at 11:50am we asked if it was possible to check out at 12:45, just 15 minutes late.  Our flight had actually be delayed till 8pm and we weren't asking for that much longer in the grand scheme of things.  We were told that we can't check out 15 minutes later since house keeping needs our room ASAP.  Really this means that then we will check out immediately, and ask them hold our bags, and then ask them to get our bags in like the next hour (so more work on both of our parts).  It wasn't until after I said this that I got a maybe, but you have to hurry and come back immediately. We rushed and made it back at 12:25 but our keys already didn't work and we had to get new keys at the front desk.  Definitely got a unwanted feel on our check out day. In addition to this apparently there were bar charges to my room on a previous night. We never even went to the restaurant or bar.  I would have thought that the hotel employees would ask guests for the guest name and room number or check signatures or something to validate this.

title: It's OK if you get a good rate and want a hip neighborhood
text:
The Sixty Les has more negatives than positives about it. It's just not a professionally run or maintained hotel. First is the upkeep, even walking into the lobby, things are a little rundown, chipped paint, worn furniture, at least one elevator seemed to be out during our entire stay. Our room was no better. We stayed in a suite with a stained dirty couch, a flimsy thin mattress that was incredibly uncomfortable and a shower that leaked into the room at the base causing a puddle of water on the wood floor. The AC barely worked and when we arrived the room was hot and humid even though it was about 70 degrees outside and evening. 
The hotel itself seems to split it's revenue between the hotel, the tiki bar and the large Blue Ribbon sushi. That means that there can be long waits for elevators, and bumping into drunks especially over the weekend. Not the greatest family environment. 
That said, the lower east side is a nice place to stay, lots of new restaurants and coffee shops, and convenient access to Soho. 
What really spoiled our trip though was an encounter with one of their staff. My family got in the elevator after dinned to head up to our room. There were two employees in the elevator, the elevator sopped, one employee got off, and the other one stepped forward, I reached around to use my key to activate the elevator and get to my room only to have my hand pushed away and the employee say to me, "don't try to override the elevator." I aid I was sorry, but I needed to get to my room and I had not idea what he was talking about. To which he replied "I don't have to tell you, it's common sense." I again asked him what he was talking about and this time suggested he might be a little more polite with a guest. He grumbled something about "if you don't like it.." when I got off with my family and headed to the front desk to complain. The only response I got from them was "I'll talk to him." No apology, although I detected from their reaction this was not the first complaint.
If a hotel is going to have a bar, and the employees are going to be frustrated by bar patrons, then they should make separate access, so that hotel guests are not treated like belligerent drunks when they are trying to get to their room.

Over all, I like the neighborhood, but would not consider staying here again. Employees aside, the hotel is just not well kept for the price.

title: Such a disappointing weekend stay at Sixty Les
text: I arrived to the hotel weekend of 10/20/17 after a 3 hour drive, pulled up and was sitting in my car for 5 minutes and thought well maybe I gotta check in to get valet. Then went to my room and was NOT happy with hard bed being inches from the ground. TV didn't work and when they sent an engineer to my room he got it to turn on and lead to another disapointment that room didn't have the Yankees Game on! so nice engineer suggested I go to the sushi restaurant on 2nd floor and to my amazement the Yankees game was on in the restaurant so it made no sense I couldn't watch it in my $400 a night room smh. Anyway so I'm sitting at the bar and I get NO acknowledgement from the bartender while I sat there for 10minutes then decided to ask him about the Asian Whiskeys and he was not pleasant at all as if I was bothering him so I sat there for 10 more minutes again no acknowledgement if I wanted a drink or a menu so I left and went to my boring uncomfortable room. This was suppose to be a special birthday treat for my sister and even told the front desk that it was my sister's birthday and they did nothing special what so ever instead we got a 100 sq.ft room with ONE small bed for me and my sister to sleep in together. I  went to front desk and Guest Services manager couldn't do anything for me because I booked through hotel tonight of which I warn everyone not to do because I think hotels like Sixty Les have small poor quality rooms for third party booking sites.I was stuck here for the entire weekend. I picked the hotel because of what I saw on the website but it was not inviting or welcoming at all. I did get room service and they were nice but everything will not get me to stay at this hotel again and I will spread the word to everyone not to stay at this hotel. I should've stayed at any of the other hotels I've stayed at like the NoMad, the James, the Michaelangelo in the past. I travel to NYC several times a year and what a horrible stay and they did nothing about it.

title: Surfait
text:
Beau concept . Hotel a la deco des annees 60 . Chambres modernes et de bon design . 
Cela pourrait faire une belle adresse mais l hotel est mal insonorise : boulevard tres frequente et a 5 h du matin , vous pouvez renoncer a dormir ( et ma chambre etait au 4 eme etage  .... Quid des etages bas ) 
Organisation et service bricolees . Pas tres classe . 
Bon resto japonais dans l hotel . Coffee inexistant . 
Bref tout pour etre une bonne adresse , mais loin de l etre .

title: Sixty Les New York Allen St
text:
I stay in NY city several times a year at least (6 times). I have used this hotel group in Miami very good, Allan Street is one of the worst parts of NYC, that is fact.
The hotel is small dark, that is the style, But it also hides the dust in the rooms
The bed was extremely poor quality, the base was wooden frame, no support the mattress was cheap and buckled when you sat on it, gave me an awful back in the morning. The only good thing about the room was the sheets and feather pillows. Other than that small dark, which hid dust
Reception were polite but  they could have provided smart uniforms, instead of their own clothes which were not the best. The cost was $410 for night it was not good value of money
I went to the restaurant on the 2nd floor, it was like a dark dingy speak easy from the 50s movie, several booths which I did not touch as I am sure they were plastic. 
It was a very poor show from what the photos on site looked like. 
A massive disappointment  from the Miami property

The area was very run down, some people wandering around at 9am high as kite

The best thing about  the hotel was the door man, They were polite, smiling, helpful, and very, attentive, Josh was great so went out of his way.
He could teach receptionist a thing or two

The robe in bathroom was excellent quality, so that and sheets and pillows thats it

I was expecting much better place than what I go, I will never stay in 60 hotel again.

title: Thin walls
text: We booked a stay in a king studio but were “upgraded” to a junior suite. The room was nice...not impeccably clean but I wouldn’t describe it as dirty either. The staff was very accommodating and gave us a nice tour of the room upon arriving. The bed was a queen which kind of annoyed me since we booked a king and like I mentioned before, it was an upgrade. The hotel is located in a great area and it was quite close to our destination for the night. My husband and I were awakened at 7am by a couple having very loud relations. The walls are either paper thin or their fun just travelled through the vents. Whatever the case was, it sounded like they were in our room. All in All it was a great stay besides our early morning wake up call.

title: Wedding in NYC
text: Last July our dream of getting married in NYC came true. We were very happy to spend the vacation days at Sixty Les. The hotel is located in a new area of Nyc for bars and restaurants, Lower East Side. The subway is just round the corner and city buses are in front. There is a swimming pool and Spa. We were impressed by the Tiki Tabu terrace bar and by the Blue Ribbon Sushi Izakaya Japanese restaurant, both very good. From the bar you can enjoy a view of the city, both facing North and South, with a drink at sunset. We would thank Event Manager Melissa for her support and for the opportunity of being assigned a very nice room on a high floor, with balcony and breathtaking view. Next year's anniversary will be at Sixty Les.

title: Elegante e ampie camere
text:
Per lavoro ho soggiornato presso questo hotel in Allen St.
Le camere sono ampie e moderne, con grandi vetrate e comodità varie al suo interno. Peccato il rumore molto alto per l'aria condizionata: per chi ha il sonno leggero come la sottoscritta, è obbligata a spegnerla.
Ricordate di portare l'adattatore per le prese americane, perché la struttura le fornisce solo in acquisto.
Personale gentile, disponibile e sempre attento.
L'albergo si trova in una zona piena di locali molto rumorosi: si sentono anche nei piani alti (ero al 12°); se dormite profondamente, questo non sarà un problema.

title: Pas très classe
text: Nous avons passé 1 semaine dans cette hôtel les chambres sont corrects, cependant nous avons été déçu par l'accueil un peu froid du personnel.Le petit déjeuner n'en parlons pas 19 dollars pour un café un jus d'orange 4 mini viennoiseries décongelées et un petite coupe de fruits,très loin des petits déjeuner Espagnole, bref indigne d'un hôtel de grand standing et la salle n'en parlons pas bancs et tables en bois avec banquettes en tissus franchement nous avons l'habitude de voyager mais là....heureusement nous adorons New York et sommes restés le stricte minimum dans cet hôtel sans âme.

title: Well designed, remarkably good service, memorable stay.
text: Surprisingly good service for an American hotel. Across the board, the staff were genuinely warm and helpful. Excellent reception and room service. Thoughtful touches like a phone charger and healthy snacks in the mini-bar. Free wifi. Good food. The only thing missing was an electric kettle in the room.

title: Hote bruyant et cher par rapport aux prestations
text:
Attention hotel très bruyant à cause du roof top très fréquenté et des soirées plus qu'animées( clientèle jeune!). Rue très passante sous l'hôtel. 
Le petit déjeuner n'est pas copieux et très cher 60€ à 2 avec juste une assiette avec des oeufs et bacon, thé et café.
La super vue n'est possible qu'à partir des suites.
Les queens n'ont pas de vue et les kings ont une vue quand on est sur le balcon, et celles qui ont une jolie vue sur la high line sont au dessus du bar.
Nous avons été déçus par les prestations offertes.
La climatisation est beaucoup trop bruyante pour être allumée pendant que vous êtes dans la chambre, méfiez vous l'été!

title: Loved it!
text: Beautiful room with a pull out sofa bed.  View of the pool.  The pool was clean and fun, the restaurants were comfortable and high quality.  Happy, helpful and cordial staff.  Trendy fun club.  The last time I was in NYC I stayed in Central Park South, but I find the Lower East Side alot of fun and more down to earth.  This hotel is one I will certainly revisit.

title: Le prix d'une vue sur NYC
text:
Nous avons séjourné 1 nuit dans cet hôtel, dans une chambre avec balcon à l'angle du bâtiment. La vue donne donc sur toute la presqu'île de Manhattan. Nous avons adoré la situation, le panorama depuis la chambre et même depuis notre lit. S'endormir en regardant les tours illuminées était comme un rêve. Nous avons profité du spa, qui comporte un sauna et une salle de sport, heureusement nous étions seuls car le sauna est quand même petit. La piscine, ambiance très lounge, avec le bar à côté est très agréable en cas de beau temps, mais elle n'est qu'au 7ème étage, ne vous imaginez pas la même vue que dans la chambre sur tous les buildings de la ville.
En revanche nous avons été déçu de l'accueil très froid du personnel en général, de la poussière dans la chambre présente un peu partout, de l'usure du mobilier (bureau, parquet, robinetterie, garde corps sur le balcon ...) signe d'un manque d'entretien.
Le restaurant japonais de l'hôtel est vraiment très bien, mais très cher aussi.
En bref, je trouve un peu cher le prix de la chambre un peu élevé quant au niveau des prestations proposées. On paye pour la vue si on a la chance d'avoir une chambre bien située. Je m'attendais à plus de modernité de la part d'un hôtel d'une chaîne recente qui se veut très contemporaine.

title: Cool hotel, cool staff, cool neighbourhood.
text: Hotels in NYC can be a bit hit and miss. I've stayed Sixty LES three times in the past month and think it's one of the best value for money. Location is excellent, staff are friendly and helpful, it feels like a luxury hotel catering for a creative crowd. Restaurant and bar are perfect and I'd be happy to go back any time.

title: amazing
text: fuori dai circuiti tradizionali questo hotel sito in lower est side nei pressi di chinatown offre confort e servizi di elevatissima qualità. ottimo anche il ristorante in sitle giapponese al primo piano. la sera appena a pochi passi la zona è disseminati di locali con musica live blues e soul...

title: Beautiful hotel, with great location and an amazing view!
text:
We stayed 3 nights at Sixty LES september 2017.
This hotel is truly fantastic!

Friendly staff, nice pool/bar area, great location, clean rooms and fantastic view over the city skyline.

Next door music bars with live music every night. We went there every night after a long day exploring the city. 

Good breakfast in the Blue Ribbon restaurant.

title: Amazing staff- Great stay in NYC
text:
We just returned from a lovely weekend at Sixty LES. I cannot say enough about how wonderful the staff are at this perfectly located NYC gem. I had contacted the hotel prior to arrival as I had some concerns about noise based on some previous reviews. I had mentioned that we were traveling with our two children to celebrate their birthdays.
Not only were were placed in a lovely, quiet room, the boys were surprised with delicious cupcakes and cards that several of the staff thoughtfully took the time to sign! They were very excited!
Our room was clean and very comfortable. My eight year old enjoyed his robe immensely and we were grateful for the umbrella as there were a few sprinkles that day. The pool area was lovely and the restaurants looked enjoyable though we did not have the opportunity to try them out.
Check out was quick and easy.
We are extremely grateful to the staff at Sixty LES as about an hour after departing the hotel, our son realized he had forgotten his wallet (with $250 in cash and more in gift cards-all of his birthday money) in the night stand of the room. We went back to Sixty LES and they had found the wallet and returned it to our son completely intact. He was so relieved and happy as were we. The weekend ended on a perfect note and we are very appreciative of the extra mile that the staff of Sixty LES went to make everything so special for our family.
The location is great, the hotel is fun. Noise was not a problem in the least. We had a great time and will definitely return!

title: Nice hotel with a great staff
text:
I am torn writing this review. On one side, the staff and hotel itself are awesome but I was very disappointed with the type of booking we had. We booked two pool side rooms but had daily trouble getting access from our rooms. The pool on the weekend gets extremely crowded early until around 5pm. We wanted to go out but found our doors locked around 6.15 pm --45 mins before closing. 

The decor and style is very modern and the room was great.  We had breakfast daily in the hotel and was very nice. Really enjoyed the fresh fruit and yogurt. The staff was very accommodating and nice. Overall, a nice hotel on lower east side Manhattan.

title: Vue incroyable
text:
Nous étions au 17ieme etage, chambre petite, clim un peu bruyante (comme partout) Mais vue A couper le souffle. Si possible demander une chambre en etage.
Personnel très sympa, dispose d'un concierge ce qui est utile, prix attractif pour NYC
Seul bémol le Petit dejeuner : très Cher (20 $ le continental pour un bol de fruit et 4 minis viennoiseries). Le quartier regorge d'endroit sympa pour prendre un bon petit dej

title: Très bon hôtel
text:
Nous avons passés une excellente  semaine dans cet hôtel .
La chambre était spacieuse avec terrasse , propre , une excellente literie et calme, le seul point négatif est la climatisation très  bruyante !
Le quartier n'est pas près des lieux touristiques  ( Time Square, Empire State etc....) mais ce fût notre choix .
La piscine est son bar sont une belle pose après une journée de marche !
Le personnel est adorable et aux petits soins .
Un petit bémol tout de même si vous optez pour le petit déjeuner inclus :
le choix resté limité ; deux mini viennoiseries , deux muffins , un jus de fruit , café ou thé pour le reste tout est à la carte et en supplément bien sûr !
Très près de Chinatown et de Little Italie il y a  deux stations de métro toutes proches .
Le quartier est devenu très branché donc beaucoup de restaurants,bars ( assez bruyants ) pour la plupart.
Une belle découverte, une bonne adresse dans NYC .

title: Emplacement idéal, insonorisation intérieure laissée à désirer
text:
Nous avons séjourné trois nuit dans ce lieu.  Propre, moderne, idéal pour être plus au calme dans quartier populaire avec bus et métro au pied de l'hôtel. Restaurant, épicerie, boutiques, bar a chicha et autres sont également à deux minutes à pied.
Seul problème, entendre très distinctement les discussions et musique de nos voisins de chambre...l'immeuble en construction devant l'hôtel était clairement moins dérangeant..... pour nous c'est un problème, mais les goûts de chacun sont différents.....

title: À eviter
text: Si vous aimez les hôtels hors de prix, bruyants car un bar (club) est ouvert jusqu'à 1h du mat au 7 eme etage, avec un service minable digne d'un hôtel 2 étoiles maxi et un petit déjeuné à la limite du ridicule alors oui cet hôtel est fait pour vous. Sérieusement à éviter.... quartier cool mais c est tout. (Et je ne parle pas de l'ascenseur qui est tout simplement dingue...il faudra parfois s'arrêter à tous les étages avant de pouvoir regagner sa chambre...)

title: Nice hotel in LES with outdoor pool and roof-top terrace
text: A nice hotel with clean and good sized rooms. The hotel has good facilities like restaurant, outdoor pool and roof-top terrace. The restaurant is a good sushi restaurant. The hotel has a friendly staff.

title: Great hotel with friendly staff
text:
We just had an 11 night stay in this hotel which we moved to from a different location due to the pool. This hotel was so much better than our original choice and we couldn't have asked for more friendlier and helpful staff. 
The rooftop pool was so good after a hot day and our studio room was a decent size for my husband and I with an eight month old using a portacot. Plenty of space for us to spread out.
The location in the Lower East Side was perfect for everything we wanted to do plus there were so many great local eateries that were cheaper than eating in the middle of the city.
This hotel contributed to is having a fabulous first family holiday.

title: Great rooftop bar
text: A great unassuming rooftop bar serving an array of drinks and a few bar snacks, service was good with quite a buzzy atmosphere, the bar staff were friendly and quite drunk knowledgeable, overall a good little spot with friends

title: Super helpful staff, awesome location, great rooms
text: Came in for a bachelor party and our Airbnb canceled on us the night before. The staff at the hotel hooked it up with great rooms and Monica (the concierge) helped settle a bunch of our plans after things had to get shifted around (like making our dinner reservations for 14 people). Would 100% recommend staying at this place

title: Excellent hôtel!
text:
J'ai séjourné 4 nuits dans cet hôtel boutique design. 
Chambre superbe et très bien équipée. Les baies vitrées du sol au plafond permettent de se réveiller avec une vue imprenable sur Manhattan sud.
Service impeccable.
Piscine agréable quand il n'y a pas trop de monde.
Cet hôtel ouvre son roof top aux clients non résidents donc le vendredi et le samedi c'est impraticable et clientèle très jeune.
Demandez une chambre en étage élevé pour profiter de la vue.

title: Bien
text:
Un accueil simple et courtois
Une piscine presque sur le toit
Dommage que la musique couvre nos voix
Dans un quartier où l'on a le choix
Aussi bien des restos que des petits kawas
Tout autour beaucoup de vieilles syna
Attention bien ouvrir les yeux sinon on ne les voit pas 
Pour revenir au sujet critique
Baies vitrées pléthoriques 
Donc vue magnifique
Le soir ou le matin avec le soleil qui pique
Déco de la chambre new yorkaise typique 
Beton au plafond,murs noirs mais pas de briques
Petit dej inclus dans le prix
Le voucher est un bon de 20 dollars tout compris
Service à la carte,à table et assis
Mais la somme est vite partie 
18$ pour ce qui est sur la photographie

title: Tres bel hôtel, chic et bien placé
text:
Nous avons séjourné 6j pour notre toute 1ere fois à NY dans cet hôtel. 
Dans l'ensemble c'était une super expérience.  
L'hôtel est très moderne, la chambre avec une deco branchée digne de NY et du quartier LES. 
RAS sur la propreté.  
L'emplacement est top, un métro à l'angle de la rue et plein de taxis à heler pour arriver aussi vite et pour pas cher dans le centre et Times Sq. 
Le seul bémol est sur les prix. 
Nous avions réservé en payant un supplément de 190€ pour les ptis dej, et nous avons été déçus pour ce prix là de devoir partager une assiette à 2 car nous avions un "forfait"  de 40$ alloué et que tout est à la carte et très cher. 
Prévoyez donc de déjeuner à l'extérieur,  comme les vrais NYkais ;)

title: Amazing!
text: Where do I start... the staff are incredible,as soon as we arrived they were extremely helpful..view from the room amazing! Beds are super comfortable, 2 amazing bars with great views,,, think rock n roll here...I've been to NY for years, but LES is the new place to be..to me this hotel was amazing, the staff could not be more accommodating,when I walked through reception earlier today, it was all smiles and hellos, a nice change from the big chains hotels in NY. My 2 cents is book it!

title: Just Okay...
text:
Just stayed at Sixty LES for 4 nights/5 days. There was some good, there was some bad...

Quality - For the quality of the hotel, I thought it was pretty overpriced. Typically I stay at the Bowery or NY Edition. Those are both pretty pricey as well, but you definitely get what you pay for there. I didn’t feel that way here at Sixty LES. I suppose you pay a premium for the pool they have on site. 

Cleanliness — There was an old key card in the pocket of one of the robes. Obviously they’re not cleaned after each guest checks out...

Staff — The staff here are all very lovely and accommodating when you speak with them. 

Room Service - This was by far the worst thing at the hotel and I think it’s because the person taking your order is also the one running it up to your room. So for each order (I made about 4), it would take about 20-30 minutes for them to call me back so I could actually place an order. I’ve never been to a hotel that offers room service and you have to wait that long to simply place an order. That said, the staff delivering your food are so nice so this isn’t directed at their service, but how the hotel management staffs and conducts room service. 

Tiki Tabu — Just okay. They were out of 3/4 of the cocktails on the menu which was insane to me. Stock your bar, keep it stocked. The margarita I did get could have been much better. The crab rangoons were soooo yummy though. 

Room — Overall the rooms were pretty big for NYC, but the bathroom itself was rather small. They were stylish too.

title: Worth every penny!
text: I decided to splurge this year for my birthday and saw that Sixty LES was having 25% off some suites on their website and went for it. I was completely blown away. I ended up staying in the King Suite with a Terrace on the 15th floor, which was one of the corner suites. I didn't even realize when I booked the room that the bedroom would be separated from the living room, I thought it was one large space - This made it so much nicer to have my friends come up to the room and not see all of my personal items. In the living room there was a relatively large television, a couch with an ottoman, a large coffee table, a small eat at table with two chairs, and a wet bar. The prices of the in room items may seem expensive but it's New York City and a Luxury Hotel, so don't expect a $2 bottle of water. The waterfall shower in the bathroom was extremely spacious and there was a ton of counter space, as well as shelves underneath the sink to place items. There is a well lit mirror and another mirror that pulls out from the wall, which has a regular magnification as well as an up close magnification. In the bedroom, there is another large television and a king size bed. The bed seemed a bit low to the floor, just an FYI if you have a bad back, but was extremely comfortable and had amazing sheets. There were also two closets and a desk attached to the wall with a chair. The only drawer in the bedroom is the one at the desk, other than that you will have to hang up your items in the closets. There are two night stands, along with a radio suitable for older Apple products, but it does have an auxiliary cord! I forgot to mention that there is an additional closet in the hallway leading to the living room which has a full length mirror and also you can hide both televisions in the wall units they are placed in. The terrace is amazing, there are two lounge chairs with towels and a small table between them, along with a table with four chairs. You're not completely cut off from your neighbors but there is still plenty of privacy for you go out and sunbathe without being uncomfortable. I was located on the side of the hotel across from Hotel Indigo which has a rooftop lounge, so you can hear the music being played from their area. It honestly didn't bother me or my friends, but if you're looking for a quiet night that most likely will not happen during the summer. Unfortunately, there is not a light for the terrace so eating outside at night may be difficult. I know people have said before that lighting inside the room is an issue, but the switches have dimmers so you just have to get used that! The living room and bedroom have black out curtains, which give you tons of privacy and can help you sleep late without the sun bothering you. In terms of the staff at Sixty LES, everyone was extremely nice and welcoming. This didn't feel fake which has happened at other hotels in the city. They were genuinely willing to help no matter what time of the day or night it was. Room service, just like the in room items, will seem expensive but again it's New York. The food comes quick and is well made, FYI tip and a delivery fee are automatically added on top of the price of the food. Other amenities they have are the pool, spa, gym, some restaurants, and the rooftop bar. However, the "rooftop" bar is actually located on the 7th floor. It's a pretty cute and laid back place that has couches and low coffee tables rather than high top tables and stools. Since it was my birthday, I didn't personally buy any drinks, but I'm sure the pricing is similar to that of any rooftop in the city. The only negative about this is that it is located on a floor with guest rooms, so if you happen to be staying on that floor I'm sure there will be quite a lot of foot traffic and noise. Overall, the money spent was well worth it and I can't wait to go back!

title: Amazing spot in the LES
text: Our room was directly above the tiki bar on the 7th floor. Understandably, the party went on into the wee hours of the morning but it would have been very helpful and informative to have received this information when arriving to the hotel so we were not surprised. Also, once, a hotel employee entered our room although we called through the door we wouldn't be needing the minibar services. Thought that was odd that my husband called out either "No thanks" or "No, we didn't request anything" and the employee still entered the room briefly. Is that typical? Otherwise, the location was absolutely fantastic and made our stay accessible and convenient.
