Super convenient to Williamsburg, East Village, Chinatown, Little Italy, SoHo, NYU, and short train rides to Chelsea and Greenwich Village.

title: Very good location, comfy bed, clean room
text:
Things we loved:
- Its proximity to the nice bars, cafes, restaurants, shops and subway
- Clean room, comfy bed, and room was bigger than usual rooms in other hotels
- Free wifi, bit difficult to log on from iPhone, though
- Beautiful view of Manhattan skyline from the balcony
- Staff are somewhat helpful and friendly
- The bar was always busy, but the service was good and the drinks were ok
- Nice, cozy pool

Things we didn't like so much
- Noise from the street and the restaurants/bars below our room, but it was not a problem for us because we were always too tired to be bothered from our sleep
- We wanted just one extra hour of late checkout and the request was denied straight away, we noted that the guy at the reception did not even check the records before telling us straight there's already somebody else waiting to check in

All in all, a bit pricey but worth it.

title: Not thrilled with stay...
text: The staff was perfectly nice but the hotel room left something to be desired..it was clean, but the room was so small there was not much to clean.  The bed was too short...I am 6' tall and felt like I was sleeping in a child's bed.  For NYC the room was not overly expensive but I would have paid much more for a bed that I could actually get a good night's sleep in.

title: Awful crowd
text:
Starting with the positive, the staff here - in particular the Doormen and Reception staff were all very friendly and helpful. 

The rest of my experience was pretty bad. Several encounters in the elevator with people going to or returning to the rooftop bar who were drunk and disorderly. The crowd at this bar is super cheesy - i would say mostly consisting of self-entitled brats. It's a shame because of the size of this hotel their presence permeates everyone elses experience. They take over the entire 7th floor, the lobby and the pool area. They are loud, rude and noisy. I have a feeling this bar was once cool but is not populated by people who think they are cool but are not. The 'scene' is definitely not the best thing to return to after a long day spent in Manhattan or Brooklyn. One night two guys in boat shoes were yelling at a female guest about how she was in their way  - the doormen did the right thing and kicked them out (they were bar guests) but still, imagine how safe she felt in that hotel. Definitely not a refuge. Definitely not relaxing. 

The rooms themselves are OK. My friend had a larger suite which was nice. But I had a small room. It was VERY small. No closet space and the shower had very little ventilation so ended up smelling musty for a lot of the time I was there. Also - I couldn't switch my TV off which meant I slept (or didn't sleep) to a nice blue glow each night. The handle on the shower is someones idea of cool design but it doesn't work.

title: Choose another hotel
text: Booked last minute on Hotwire. Not much positive to say-lobby was dirty, elevator was dirty as well. Our room was on the 7th floor right near the lounge and all the doors to the lounge were open and I felt like I was sleeping in a bar. Called down twice to ask them to close the lounge doors.  Lights were broken and didn't turn off, engineering had to come and shut them for the night.

title: Good hotel in great neighbourhood
text: Enjoyed our stay in hotel, staff were great especially door staff, very helpful and pleasant. Rooms comfortable, clean and with balcony able to watch 4th July fireworks. Good location in lower east side near restaurants and bars. Only negatives lifts took for every ( no separate service lift).

title: Lage top
text: Das Hotel ist in einer optimalen Lage und einem sehr trendigen Viertel von New York. Die Zimmer sind sehr klein und überschaubar, dafür hat man einen super Blick auf New York, nette kleine Bar und Pool, meiner Meinung aber ist das Hotel zu teuer für die Qualität, die abgeliefert wird.

title: Das dritte Mal
text: Da wir von diesem Hotel in NYC sehr überzeugt sind, verbrachten wir über New Year fünf Nächte in diesem Hotel. Wie bei den vorherigen Bewertungen war alles super. Wir gehen auch bei einem nächsten Besuch wieder in dieses Hotel. Für uns das ideale Hotel in Manhatten.

title: Best hotel in best neighborhood!
text:
Nearly every time I travel to NYC for work I request to stay at Sixty LES. The location is perfect, the hotel rooms are super comfortable, there are great city views and the staff is top notch! 

The hotel restaurant: Blue Ribbon Sushi, is great too! It gets a little crowded on the weekend nights, but the food is super tasty. 

My favorite thing to do when I stay there is run across the Wiliamsburg bridge and back, and then go to the little tiny juice bodega - Juicy Lucy - right across Houston for a fresh pressed juice after my run! Great tradition!

title: Fantastic hotel in a chic neighbourhood.
text:
I had a blast at Sixty LES. I happened to be in New York over my 30th birthday and stayed at Sixty LES for 9 nights. The crew at Sixty LES made my 30th an absolutely memorable one. Room with a view, complimentary champagne and wine - it made my birthday that much more special.

I love the ambiance of the hotel, the chic decor, the comfortable size/cleanliness of the room, the excellent view of the NY skyline from the room, the location (vibrant and lovely neighbourhood and just across the street from the subway), and the friendly staff (big shout out to Josh). I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone in a heartbeat!

title: Great hotel in a hip neighborhood
text: We stayed here over three nights and had a great time.  The hotel is super hip and upon arrival we weren't sure if it was the best hotel decision with two kids.  However the staff were lovely (especially the doormen), the concierge was super knowledgable and very kind, and the swimming pool was fabulous.  In fact we picked this hotel because of the swimming pool and it didn't disappointment, it certainly made our stay.  Our room was very comfortable and worked well for a family of four.  The neighbourhood is fabulous with tons of great restaurants, shops, museums and parks at your doorstep.  The rooftop bar was also very nice but it got a bit busy in the later hours.  The only disappointment is that upon check-out they wouldn't let us stay by the pool until 5pm (or the same day) when we were leaving for our flight.  It would have been much easier to hang out at the pool with the kids right before our transatlantic flight...

title: Best in the LES
text: My husband and I have been coming here for seven years and it is still my fave of all the Sixty Hotel's in NYC. Clean, conveniently located, great restaurant, and one of the best on-site staff teams that there is. Many (many) thanks to Raoul, Christian and Eleanor for being a huge part of the reason we always come back!

title: Great hotel at a great location
text: I stayed here when I traveled to NY for work and this was an amazing place to stay. Loved the room interiors. Lots of stuff to walk around and do. There's a bar right next to this hotel which says live bands. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay here.

title: Our Regular Hotel In New York
text:
Conveniently placed on Lower East Side Manhattan we stay here when we come to New York 2-3 times a year.  
Staff always very helpful to give us best possible room which we appreciate greatly. 
The Blue Ribbon Sushi acts as the hotel restaurant and we often dine on delicious Japanese sushi. 
Highly recommended and not too pricey.

title: Klein aber nett
text:
Drei Nächte verbrachten wir in NY im Sixty LES. Wir wollen bewusst in einem uns unbekannten Stadtteil von Manhatten wohnen. LES (Lower East Side) liegt so zwischen den Sehenswürdigkeiten wie Battery Park oder Center Park. Uns hat der Stadtteil befallen, es gibt viele nette kleine Shops und Restaurants und wir haben nette Coofeeshops entdeckt und haben in einem Mini-Restaurant wunderbar Thai gegessen. Wir sind viel gelaufen aber dies tut man sowieso in NY. 
Nun zum Hotel. Sehr freundliches Personal und wir hatten ein Zimmer in der 17 Etage welches einen wunderbaren Blick über Manhatten bot. Die Fenster waren von der Decke bis zum Boden und gaben neben dem tollen Ausblick auch viel Licht. Die Einrichtung ist modern und es war ok sauber. Somit alles fein, doch das Zimmer war echt winzig. Um das Bett knapp Platz zum drumrum laufen und auch sonst kein Platz um irgendetwas abzustellen, Zwei Koffer irgendwo hinzutun ohne darüber zu stolpern ist eine große Herausforderung. Wegen der kleinen Zimmer würden wir wohl das nächste Mal ein anderes Hotel wählen.

title: Excellent
text:
I stayed at the Sixty LES for three nights in May 2017. The hotel is very modern and clean. 
The layout of the bathroom area is very comfortable - separate units for the shower and the restroom. The reception staff, concierge and doorman were very friendly and helpful. The location is excellent for those who want to explore the Lower East Side and the neigboring area. Although I am not sure I will stay downtown next time I am in New York, I will definitely recomment this hotel to my friends who go there.

title: Nice location and good vibes!
text: The area is so lively with lots of good restaurants, the people working as doormen were so helpful and they always had a smile and warm greetings. The room was clean, and the view was fantastic. The swimming pool was under construction, it was a disappointment.

title: Nice Enough!
text:
I had a nice stay overall at the hotel.  It was a good location for where we needed to be, and close to Whole Foods which we all loved.  One + block away.

Reception staff were nice.  We each received great rooms with partial views.  The room layout is great with separate sitting area and a massive shower.

The Sushi bar was hit or miss.  Had one spectacular Japanese one day, awful the next ...smh!

Nice 24hr cafe next door...nyc deli/cafe food, but at 4am it works :-)

For the price ($500 per night) they could refresh the rooms a little and fix little tiny issues that stand out to someone paying that kind of cash per night for multiple rooms over a one week period.  Scratched furniture and dangling cables is a big no no at that price point.

I would say this hotel should not be charging more than $350 per night in my opinion.  So if you get it for under $400 its money well spent.  Over that, you might not be that impressed.   As you can see I have mixed feelings all based around the price.  We paid too much and that was with a discount!!!

I did sleep well and heard nothing from the room next door so all in all it was fine.

title: Hip Hotel Great NYC Vibe
text: Large room with separate seating/gathering area.  Very clean.  Bathroom setup is a little unusual in that there is not real door.  The door to the toilet is glass, and does not allow for much privacy, other than that, it was a great hotel for us.  The staff was very friendly and professional.  They went out of their way to be helpful.

title: Great hotel with a distinct sixties aesthetic
text:
It's a pretty cool hotel with a visage of Andy Warhol in the outdoor pool.

A Japanese restaurant and for me a great location. A lot of immigrants originally settled in this area that borders China town so lots of great places to eat ...

The mini bar was amazing .... Included is a hangover cure & phone charger + travel adapter. Very cool ...

Excellent views from the rooftop bar, good service and great ambience.

Stayed in room 606 has a balcony and great views.

title: What a gem
text: Perfect everything! First the room beautiful well done lighting and a balcony and the location!! Right in middle of the restaurant and late night music scene with a good Gym and super Japanese and breakfast!! Better than Hotel Indigo and right across the street!! CVS nearby and great food all over with multiple music stages nightly right next door!! The air conditioner let you run fan that Completely blocked out the city noise and sirens (we were half way up on tenth floor of 20)

title: Great hotel, well located but a bit noisy
text: The hotel was great and very well located but the acoustic isolation was not good, we could hear everything from our neigbours bedrooms. I didn't test the spa, swimming pool and rooftop but it seems great too! I recommend the hotel.

title: Fun in the heart of the LES
text: I booked this for my best friend for the night before and night of her wedding. We had the bachelorette party at the salt water pool which was super fun. The food and drinks were good. In the heart of the LES, so easy to get around the city to all of the hot spots. The roof had a grea view, was super modern and comfy.

title: Disappointment and False Advertisement at its finest.
text:
We opted for a King Suite at this lovely hip establishment. It was my birthday weekend and I wanted to try something new! Big Mistake. The room description mentions a deep soaking tub which had me sold! No mention that it "may have a tub". Upon arrival we were greeted by the valet who offered to find our vehicle and park it for us, he also took our bags to the room. He was great! We reached the front desk and began checking in, we were so excited! We went right up to our room and were instantly turned off. The once cream sofas were now stained beyond belief, the carpet was also very dirty. Trying to make the best of it I threw my bag on what they consider a king bed literally on the floor and went to the bathroom to find no tub.. 
Once I realized what I had paid and what I was receiving it made me quite upset. I contacted the front desk and was told someone would contact me. I waited..and waited. I called the front desk again and asked to speak with a manager and even read them my confirmation with the room description. The manager told me "some of the rooms have tubs" which is not clearly stated on their website. I asked if there was another room available but there were no more king suites. At this point I asked to be refunded and I would depart the hotel, the manager seemed almost frustrated with me and made me feel as if I had made a mistake and it was my own fault there was no tub in the room. She then said she would send me complimentary breakfast, I told her we had plans for breakfast as it was a getaway. She insisted almost which was kind, until the gentleman from the valet came up with two vouchers for complimentary muffins and orange juice. 
This was very unfortunate, I will not return nor recommend this hotel.

title: Nice Room with High End Touches but Poor Service
text:
I stayed for one night while in NYC. I got a suite as I booked far in advance and they had deals. I arrived shortly after 6 pm on a balmy Sunday evening. The lobby is small but contemporary. The front desk clerk tells me that my room isn't ready yet and to have a seat, she'll give me the keys in a few minutes. Mind you, check in is at 3. So I end up sitting there for over a half hour. Meanwhile I get to enjoy drunk 21 year olds stumble out of the elevators from the rooftop bar and get to hear a hysterical drunk girl shouting at the staff about why someone was overcharging her credit card. It was truly cringeworthy.

I finally got up to my room and it was well appointed, comfortable, and I truly enjoyed the Nespresso machine. I will say the heating and cooling is temperamental. One room was hot and the other cold because there is only one thermostat. I think this is a fine hotel but I just didn't like the vibe. It definitely caters towards the young party crowd. If you are looking for a Vegas atmosphere in NYC, then this is your place but if you are looking for a classy, quiet place, look elsewhere.

title: Wow True customer service still alive and well!!
text:
After much searching I selected this hotel from Jetsetter website! I wanted to get somewhere special to take my niece for her 16 th birthday trip!! Boy did I make the right choice!!!! My flight was delayed a whole day... And my niece arrived without me
This was very nerve wracking for me!! I called the hotel and they totally took care of the situation!! ( unlike American Airlines who then couldn't get my bag to me for 2 days!!that is another story) The front desk was very concerned that I didn't have my bag and all were watching out for it!! They helped us so much w shopping and dinner plans! From the front desk.. To the bellman.. To room service all Top Notch!! I would def come back and will tell my traveling friends!! Thank you to all at Sixty Les! 😀

title: Très bien mais...
text:
Hotel très bien situé, dans le lower Eastside. Chinatown, Little Italy et le très huppé quartier de Soho vous tendent les bras à quelques courtes minutes de marche. (Entre 10 et 20 minutes suivant votre parcours et vos choix). 
Le quartier qui entoure l'hôtel ne manque pas de petite boutiques de fringues et de resto et bars assez sympa. Allen street est une artère très passante, il vous sera facile de héler un yellow cab ou de vous uberiser en moins d'1 minutes chrono (ils sont partout les Uber driver ici) pour atteindre les beaux quartiers de NY, le mythique Time Square et le magnifique Central Park (comptez entre 15 et 25 minutes suivant le traffic et la destination).

Le personnel est très accueillant et sympathique, les chambres sont modernes et très propres dans un style très new-yorkais (ça tombe bien!) mais il y a un petit bémol, le rangement. Petit placard, petit tiroir donc il vaut mieux voyager léger et faire ce que tout bon touriste prévoyant doit faire quand on vient à New York, faire des emplettes et remplir sa valise pour le retour.

Attention au petit déjeuner si, comme moi, vous venez via un site ou une appli proposant des hôtels de standing à prix discountés car le petit déjeuner est très cher. On monte vite à 70 voir 90 dollars pour deux. 

Le restaurant sert une cuisine plutôt japonaise mais on se surprendra à trouver quelques classiques américains servis avec nos fameuses french fries tels que le cheeseburger ou leur énorme steak à la fois délicieux et subtilement "japonisé" par une épice ou un condiment. (Le steak sauce wazabi rivalise sans difficulté avec notre mythique steak au poivre).

Avril n'étant pas le mois le plus chaud de l'année, la piscine ne nous a pas été d'une grande utilité mais c'est à l'évidence un privilège à ne pas rater pour ceux qui viendront ici aux beaux jours.
Info importante pour les geek, les accros de la tablette ou encore les drogués du social en réseau, la wifi est gratuite pour checker ses mails mais si vous voulez faire plus, il va falloir débourser 15 dollars par jour pour du débit de YouTuber!

En résumé, je conseille vraiment cet Hotel qui ne manque pas de qualité mais je tire juste la sonnette d'alarme sur les prix plutôt élevés des prestations annexes car pour être franc ça picote légèrement quand on paye la note le jour du départ ;)

title: Great hotel and trendy sushi!
text: Great hotel with amazing rooms! We had a terrace suite which was awesome! I almost upgraded to the penthouse 1 floor suite but it was slightly out of my price point. I would have done it in a second for a special occasion! Sushi downstairs is quite good and the atmosphere is amazing! Highly recommended!

title: Great location, okay facility, bad service
text: The hotel is in convenient location especially for me as my work place was on 2nd street. The room is very small but have a great view(I had a corner room). The man at the door is very friendly and helpful but housekeepers and front desk should be improved. I called the front desk 3 times as house keeper missed towers, shampoo, etc. Twice out of 3 requests, it never came to my room. We asked for taxi to go to the airport. A lady in the front desk called ONE taxi company and said they are full. We called an Uber at last. They were just not helpful.

title: Qualité/Prix
text:
Nous avons très bien été accueil. Cependant, sur leur site, c'est mentionné que la chambre fait 30m2. Ce n'est pas du tout le cas. Chambre Assez petite.
Sinon personnel très souriant et chambre propre. 
La vue de la chambre donnait sur le World Trade Center.

title: Genuinely friendly welcome and stunning rooms!
text: This property proves that high end does not need to be "snooty".  A hip, friendly reception "cool kids in school" staff matches the DT vibe of this smartly done property.   No pretense, no attitude, no problem kind of place.

title: Excellent!
text: I recently stayed here because I've heard so many great things about the Thompson properties in NYC. I loved the neighborhood. Walking distance to anything you need. We were pleasantly greeted by Eva at the front desk and she was able to upgrade us to a studio. The room was amazing and extremely clean everyday. I'd definitely recommend this hotel and I can't wait to return!

title: Good hotel, good location, small rooms
text: This hotel is in a great location, in the LES and an easy walk to Soho/Chinatown/East Village. The rooms are small, though not exceptionally small for New York, and they have lovely views of the city. The staff is always polite and helpful, and the gym is small but does the job.

title: Boutique hotel, great location for night out
text: This was my first stay at one of the Sixty hotels, I've chosen LES because I like the area, arrived at 1pm and could check in at 2pm (great point). Everyone in the hotel was nice, although during my stay I didn't have to use the concierge service. The room (Queen superior) was outstanding! I was on the 12th floor with a great view (city view is important to me when I'm on vacation), deco was so beautiful, super comfy bed, neat bathroom, I didn't like the TV that much, it didn't work well, remote control didn't work at all, but who needs tv when you're in NYC? The bar was also good for pre drinks, great cocktails and atmosphere, once you step out of the hotel you already feel how busy LES can get at night, there are plenty of bars and restaurants just a few steps away. I'd stay at Sixty LES again! Thank you SIXTY :).

title: Loved the location!
text:
This time around I decided to stay somewhere different.  This hotel was very minimalistic, smelt awesome every time you stepped into the foyer and it was a fantastic location to all the nightlife of restaurants, cafes, bars and pubs!  Also very close to the train station to allow moving around the city very easy.

Loved the spacious bathroom and large bed.  Downside for us that was no room to put our luggage.  It obviously caters very well for people doing short stays with an overnight bag but for international travellers with medium suitcases!  And I didn't even pick the smallest room.

The staff at the front desk were brilliant!  Helped us with directions and recommending local cuisine.  We visited the bar upstairs once and found it had a good atmosphere and quite busy.  The only downside is our cocktails were served in plastic cups.  Wasn't impressed.

Either way, loved being in the Lowest East Side of Manhattan!

title: Great Chic Rooms
text:
We went as a huge group with multiple rooms. While we were loud and obnoxious celebrating a birthday for a weekend the staff was nice enough to endure us all. Rooms could have been put all together by the hotel desk staff. Some of us were on different floors. But the rooms were nice and clean and beds were comfy. 

I recall the elevator stopped working after we came back from a night club downtown. It was well past 4am. The entire group was intoxicated. We walked the 6 blocks from the club to find the elevator wasn't working. Literally had to walk up 9 flights of stairs. Little tiny tiny hallway area steps. It was murder! Heels off barefoot drunk walking up to the 9th floor.

title: Nice boutique hotel on the Lower East Side
text: Stayed here one night.  Good location for Lower East Side activities. Very modern - rooms are larger than I expected for New York. The bed was a bit hard for me but still comfortable. The best part was the staff. They were very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel for sure.

title: Great rooms in the Lower East Side
text: Good sized rooms in a chic boutique hotel.  Friendly staff.  Central Lower East Side location, walkable to many restaurants, bars, LES staples.  Room service is provided by the Blue-Ribbon sushi next door.  I ordered room-service one night ... pricey sushi, ok quality.   The beds and sheets were super comfy.  I would definitely stay here again on my next visit.

title: Location, Location, and Comfort
text: A very comfortable boutique hotel in the heart of the LES.  So many restaurants, bars, and landmarks within walking distance...and next door to Rockwood Music Hall.  The room was spacious, clean, modern, and very comfortable.  There is blue ribbon sushi restaurant in the hotel, where we had breakfast as part of the package.  Expected an average breakfast but had a delicious start to the day.

title: THE BEST hotel experience I've ever had
text:
I cannot say enough about this amazing little hotel. The space is gorgeous, the location is perfectly hip and convenient, the staff is friendly, it's QUIET (imagine that, in NYC), luxurious and more. 

Seriously, this was the best hotel experience I've ever had, (and I travel often)! Jared, at the front desk, was so great. I'd stay here over any other NYC hotel (this beats out The Standard, The Ace, W Union Square, etc. etc.) any day. A perfect experience, all around.

title: Second visit--Sixty LES is still a winner
text: If you like the action of the Lower East Side, you will love this hotel.  It faces Allen Street which is much wider than most LES streets. We had great unobstructed views of freedom tower and al that surrounds it.

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: Location is Ideal, close to the Train and give you the true NYC experience.  The Staff is helpful and nice.  I travel to NYC once a month for work and will only stay at Sixty LES.  Great views, clean rooms, perfect location and amazing staff.

title: Stay away if you want to sleep and relax!
text: Had to check out and leave this hotel at 11:30 pm the night we were to stay there. There were people partying in the hallway and repeated calls to the front desk and management did not improve the situation. A random man knocked on our door claiming to be housekeeping. He wasn't. The room was ok but temperature was freezing and in spite of our attempts to adjust the temperature it could stayed cold. Would not recommend unless you want to party all night!

title: Best location in Lower East Manhattan
text:
Waking distance to Soho shopping and Little Italy and Chinatown.  The famas Katz , Russ & Daughters ， Clinton Street Bakery are all within 5 minutes walking distance.  I got upgraded to a King sized bed room and   the size of the room is very spacious with New York Starndard.  The bathroom is big with huge shower heads.  

There was a fridge in  my room  but no coffee pot . I requested a kettle and was delivered to my room very quickly 

The breakfast in the hotel is very expensive.   I chose to eat at the poplulas Clinton Street Bakery  twice and some coffee shops very close by. 

Definitely will come back if I can get a rate under $300 in May.

title: "Will you marry me?"
text:
A few months ago I started to plan how to pop the question =). I visited a few other hotels around the area. Unfortunately, none of them offered the same view, suite size, amenities, price and most importantly the courtesy and service level that Ms. Catherine Brin (front desk manager) showed during my quest. She definitely played a great role in making sure everything was perfect for my wedding proposal! 

The king size terrace suite was just perfect! The terrace with the view of midtown, the amenities, and the great space! 

Catherine, Thank you again for offering us such a great hospitality!

title: Impossible to sleep
text: Upon entering Sixty Les the impression is of a small cool hotel. But the truth is located right next to a construction site that worked between the night of the 17-18 of February all night long. Noises from the multiple cement trucks that worked 24/7 made it impossible to sleep.  Multiple cranes and trucks constantly driving in and out of the site also contribute to on going noise. The front desk, which is on Allen street was unaware of the activities going on in the back of the hotel. They did not feel it was their job to contact th police to explore if this 24/7 construction was legal or allowed in the city of NY. To their credit- they did offer to move me at 3:30 am to another room that would suffer from the same noise. My recommendation is skip this hotel for the next year- till construction is over.

title: Nice hide out on Lower East Side
text:
It's a pretty dark, yet cosy hotel in a very nice area of New York. Rooms are ok. Not fantastic, but decent. Strange arrangements for lightning, TV etc. 
I missed a vibrant lobby. It has potential to be good but it had been much better wit a small bar or a coffee stand.

title: A little gem
text: My 3rd visit to this little gem in this busy city. Great location with good size room . Check in with Jared was effortless, and staff happy to help with any questions, or directions. I would recommend.

title: Great Stay in a Great Location
text:
We stayed at Sixty LES with our teenage daughters for a few days between Christmas and New Year's Eve.  The hotel is clean and modern.  The staff is friendly.  We were not sure about staying on the Lower East Side, but absolutely loved the location.  It is a quick subway or cab ride to Mid-town.  When you are done touring that area, you can head back to the hotel and feel like it is your own little neighborhood.  We loved many of the restaurants and delis within walking distance of the hotel.  Our daughters would highly recommend Sadelle's, Katz's Deli, Petee's Pie Company, The Meatball Shop, and Laduree's.  We could walk to Soho for shopping - amazing variety of high end and affordable as well as vintage shops.  Our daughters thought LES was the perfect location.  We would definitely stay at Sixty LES again.  

Other highlights to visit:  Metropolitan Museum of Art, MOMA, Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, Empire State Building (go late to avoid lines), Central Park, etc.

title: Great location
text:
Great location. Walking distance from a train stop, so many places to walk to eat like Russ & Daughters, Katz, Sweet Chick and more! 

The rooms are typical NY sized, a bit on the small side. The staff working there are nice. There is a very modest gym, a cool pool too! 

I like that Blue Ribbon Sushi is on the 2nd floor of this hotel. The food there is consistently good and so is the service.

title: Beautiful hotel in a perfect location
text:
I stayed here for two nights with a friend and loved it. Everything from the service in reception to the interior and exterior design.
The pool area is great and so is the roof top bar - I'm sure all the pictures speaks for itself!
I really liked the location and we tried lots of places in the area. Thank you for a wonderful stay!

title: A Gem in Soho
text: I have been staying at this hotel for 7 years now. I am a business traveler and the staff and their accommodating service is outstanding. The rooms are wonderful and are generous in size. The front desk and bell staff are especially excellent. The neighborhood is fantastic, especially for a wine and food lover.

title: Really Nice Hotel
text: My wife and I stayed here for a week in March 2016, we were visiting our niece who lives nearby. Very welcoming staff, rooms were really nice, lovely bar area!! No complaints at all. We didn't eat here as we were out and about all over NYC!!

title: A few nights in the City
text: Excellent location.  Excellent hotel.  Extremely comfortable bed and the room was spacious. It was just before New Years Eve and the hotel was full, but we could not hear anyone else in the hotel. We will definitely stay here on our next get-away to the NYC.

title: Linda vista
text:
Ficamos hospedados por uma semana no Sixty Lex, em período de ano novo. Achei a localização perfeita, bairro mais tranquilo, apesar de movimentado, para esse período em que a cidade está lotada. Muito próximo das estações de metrô, conseguimos nos deslocar com muita facilidade por todas as áreas da cidade. (aproximadamente 15min da Times Square). Fomos muito bem atendidos pela equipe, que tem um perfil mais descolado, assim como o hotel em si. 
Quarto bonito, limpo, bem equipado e com grande janelas com uma vista maravilhosa para o ONE Trade Center e outras paisagens de Manhattan. Voltaria a me hospedar, com certeza!

title: Quiet cave in a great location
text: This hotel offers a secluded private feeling in a great location for some of the best restaurants in the city.  The staff, especially Jared, is incredibly accommodating.  It is my home away from home.  Stay there once and you will always want to go back.

title: Great hotel
text: This place was awesome. From the moment they took our car to valet it up to when they brought us to our room. They couldn't be more friendly and accommodating! Even had our car ready when we checked out

title: a bit disappointed for the price, but overall not bad
text: The room description on hotel.com said that the suite had a separate sitting area and the way it was phrased seemed to imply that there was at least a partial wall.  Much to our dismay, the "separateness" was simply a bunch of hanging beads that did absolutely nothing to "separate" the two areas.  I was extremely disappointed by this, especially since we partially made the choice of this hotel (which was NOT cheap at $400 a night) because we thought there would be some separation so our toddler could sleep in the other "room".  Also, there were stains on the rugs in the outer hall, and a few on the drapes and sofa, which, for a room that expensive per night I don't find acceptable.  The staff however was great and the location was ideal for us.  I had mixed feelings about the stay, but due to the nightly average price of 400, I was a little disappointed.

title: Trendy but not obnoxious
text:
Had a great one night stay. Check-in was smooth and the staff was friendly and accommodating. 

The floor-to-ceiling windows in the room (try to request a room as high up as possible) were soundproofed so you can't hear any of the LES traffic below.

The industrial style looks really cool but may not be for everyone. The ceiling is an exposed cement slab which might feel a little unsettling. The switches for the lighting in the room didn't make much sense (the light box behind the bed was harsh), but we were eventually able to finagle a decent lighting set-up.

The rainfall shower was an added bonus, as were the Argan toiletries. The additional handheld shower attachment was tricky to figure out at first.

Make sure to get some sushi from Blue Ribbon (I recommend the deluxe sushi platter)!!

title: LES Weekend
text: This was our second time staying in this hotel in NYC.  Great location convenient to subway, countless restaurants and bars.  Friendly staff and decent size, comfortable rooms.  Great hotel for a fun weekend in the city.

title: Probably could do better for the money
text:
We stayed here over the Holiday season and the cost I believe was slightly more than staying in midtown at a luxury hotel at the same time. However, we wanted to experience the East Side in a contemporary setting and chose to stay here instead.
The view up on the high floors was very impressive. The room was their standard room. It was clean. It was modern and attractive enough but it was a bit tight with very little space (or even hooks) to hang your clothes. (It probably would suffice for a single person staying a single night). The bed was low which could be an issue for people with knee problems. The rain shower in the bathroom was nice. There is no coffee maker in the rooms and getting one was a frustrating experience with multiple calls and miscommunication between the front desk and housekeeping. Nevertheless, there were some exceptional individuals, especially at the front desk and housekeeping. It would be really nice if they had either a coffee shop or at least a coffeemaker in each room.  I really would give this hotel 3.5 stars. It's good, above average, but not certain it deserves a very good rating.

title: Cool hotel in LES
text: Perfekt läge i LES. Nära till bra restauranger, tunnelbana, shopping. Skönt häng i området med nära till det som känns som NYC! Hotellets olika restauranger och barer var trevliga även om tog del av topfloor som vi förstod var trendigt för locals.  Trevlig och hjälpsam personal. Reste med vuxna barn 16,22 år.

title: Le chaud et le froid
text:
Bilan en demi-teinte pour cette hôtel :

Le moins :

Les chambres sont petites, voir minuscules
Aucun espace de rangement digne de ce nom. Vous ne pourrez pas ranger les affaires de votre valises
La climatisation est bruyante donc c'est soit le bruit et le dessèchement de l'air ambiant (car la chambre est petite), soit vous avez chaud ou froid
Le literie est standard, loin des prestations des chaines haut de gamme

Le plus :

Hôtel situé à 2 pas de la station de métro ligne F qui vous amène directement au centre ville de NY
Le design moderne et avec de la personnalité
Le bar au deuxième étage
La gentillesse du personnel
Les baies vitrées des chambres qui donnent sur une vue superbe. Choix d'une chambre à l'étage élevé impératif !

title: Filthy place...
text:
...not very well kept with partially disintegrating furniture. 

Stylish decor, very dark´ish, poor soundproofing, no tea/coffee making facilities, very low and short beds, breakfast, snacks and minibar overpriced, actually a rip off to charge $8 for a bottle of water in the room.  

Nice and friendly staff, although housekeeping knocks at your door as early as 8am if you do not put a sign outside...why..?

Rooms are nice and big enough, not really clean though. Don´t look too deep into the corners or behind the curtains.

We stayed in the Thompson in Chicago and were really impressed by their traditional hospitality in a contemporary setting, that´s why we booked here (on the booking website hotels.com the Sixty was still called the Thompson). Disappointed with the place, you´ll get better value for money in NYC.

title: Overall disappointed
text:
Sixty and Thompson, I think you used to either be one company or one bought up the other's hotels. These brands used to be quite good. A little bit low key, great service. They were kind of boutique-y before boutique hotels became trendy. I've stayed at several of their locations not just NYC but world wide. 
I never felt like a welcome guest at LES during my stay. The hotel looks dated despite being a relatively new establishment. The rooms are pretty nice. Very straight lines, no clutter. Housekeeping does a great job keeping them clean. I stayed here with my husband and we had asked for a single bed. We were given a room with 2 double beds and were told, again in that 'we're doing you a favor' tone, that the room we are being offered is bigger than what we booked so we should just say thank you. Apparently this room 5th floor corner room is a VIP room. There was constant construction noise. The noise from the street, Orchard I think, which is a very busy street with other hotels and bars, bothered me a lot less than the construction noise which started early and went all day. Also, it sounded like the elevator or some service corridor was along this room and there was continuous noise from that as well. 
I extended my stay twice. What was intended to be a 2 night stay turned into a week. The very last day I asked for a 2pm checkout instead of the 11am or 12 noon. I was met with such attitude at the front desk. I was told that if I VIP shows up, they will need that room. I work with VIPs, this is not a room I would put them in because 2 minutes wouldn't go by and I'd get a phone call that they want to move. While this hotel at one time was probably hip, the front desk staff does nothing to make you feel welcome. If anything you feel like they want you out as soon as you step in. 
If it wasn't for the guys at the door, I would've had the worst time. They were the only ones that put a smile on my face every morning when I left, each time I came through the revolving doors. In particular, and I hope the hotel manager will read this review, Joshua was extremely nice. I wish I could have said thank you to him but he was off the day I left. 
The bars (both the upstairs and Blue Ribbon's) make the worst mixed drinks, IF they can even make a mixed drink. I wanted bloody mary upstairs and they couldn't make one. 
I love sushi, so the fact that Blue Ribbon is in the hotel was a consolation. You can also order it to your room. 
All in all, if you don't like the staff to be nice but are looking for a clean place, great location it's a great place to stay. It's also spacious for NYC standards.

title: Beautiful hotel
text:
I have stayed here a couple of times on business and also we have used the penthouse suite for meetings. the hotel is lovely, the pool deck looked great although i did not get to use that. Its nice to have access to an outdoor pool in the city. The bar area and social space has a very relaxed vibe. the room is super comfortable and the staff are great.
Its on the lower east side with plenty of eating places in wlaking distance and there is a subway across the street.

title: Great experience
text: This place was great! We got an awesome deal 1 day in advance on an app, and were totally thrilled when we walked in. Our view was unreal and it was really cool to sleep with the shades open and wake up to the city at our feet. The decor is modern and the place itself was really clean. The one drawback was listening to the people next to us fight (she was freaking out at 4am, slamming the door and generally losing her mind. The door definitely was banged up when we left the next morning) - but then they made up and we had to listen to that until 6am. So! Not at all the hotels fault, but maybe thicker walls would be a nice touch. Overall, we would totally stay here again!

title: Wholly Unimpressive
text: For $500 per night, even in New York, I would have expected a lot more.  We requested a higher floor rather than a balcony, but the hotel could not accommodate that.  The room had a strange odor that smelled like a skunk, but there were no other rooms to move us to (apparently).  The walls are very thin and you can hear the people in the next room talking.  The bathroom might look cool, but lacks function entirely - poor water pressure, doors slam shut on their own, shower leaks, etc.  The first towel I picked up had a hole in it.  The bed was too low and was hard.  This hotel is trying to be a super cool boutique hotel, but it's missing the target.  I picked it because I thought it would be trendy and something different for my wife's 30th birthday trip, but we've learned our lesson and will stick to the hotels in NYC that we know.

title: My stay at Sixty LES
text: Stayed hear about 2 weeks ago & Enjoyed every minute . Staff was so friendly and helpful !!! And my room had such an amazing view , Definitely my go to hotel when visiting New York ! Highly recommend:)

title: Graet Neighborhood Vibe
text:
This is a relatively new (built 2012?) property on the Lower East Side (LES) of Manhattan just below Houston Street. There is a very nice neighborhood vibe with a lot of trendy bars, restaurants, coffee shops, night clubs , live music. Hotel is right in the middle of all of it.
Front desk staff is very nice and professional. Rooms are well laid out but on the small side. I guess that is typical for a lot of New York City. Also is expensive which is pretty typical. The crowd is pretty young in general. 
Great area to walk to East Village, SOHO and other well known lower Manhattan locations. It is Uber friendly  -- < 10 minute wait. Cabs and subway also pretty convenient.

title: Une bonne adresse!!
text:
Arrivons très tardivement en taxi ,
Personnel accueillant,intentionne,souriant, chaleureux.
Bien situé métro F dans quartier resté authentique
Chambre avec déco contemporaine,salle de bain propre avec balcon et une  vue 
magnifique .
Petit bémol clim un peu bruyante surtout quand vous dormez!
Je recommande

title: OK but ....
text: I've stayed here a bit recently but experience has been mixed.  generally it's OK in a slightly cold and characterless place but occasionally  they are thoughtless.  the other time they put me in a room below a party space.  the party didn't stop til 1am.  when I complained there was  no way to sleep they could not have cared less.  when  I asked if a discount was available given I couldn't get a full nights sleep I was made to think I was nuts to ask!!  sort of says it all...

title: La réalité est loin de la pub...
text:
Il ne s'agit pas d'un nouvel hotel comme je l'avais imaginé car en arrivant je me retrouve dans un ancien Thomson, fréquenté quelques années plus tôt, sans qu'un peu de neuf n'y ait été rajouté. Lobby froid et peu chaleureux, chambre manquant d'entretien (draps usés jusqu'à la corde et déchirés par endroits, cuvette des WC descellée, grosses taches sur la moquette des couloirs, tuyau de la douche qui fuit..). Le petit dej payant continental comporte deux mini mini mini viennoiseries et une salade de fruit.
Personnel sympa, bien situé, mais ça ne suffit pas.
A notre arrivée du fait d'un surbooking, la chambre réservée n'était pas disponible, et il aura fallu que je me plaigne pour passer du 3eme au 6eme étage, alors que je devais d'après le décriptif bénificier d'une vue sur la "skyline". Expérience décevante. J'en suis à me demander si les avis élogieux sont véridiques.

title: Stylish hotel, with small but nice rooms
text:
The hotel is very modern, the staff friendly, the rooms are small, but not too small and the view is breathtaking.

I ate at the sushi bar and had drinks at the Tiki bar, both were really good.

The neighboorhood is really good. Less touristy then other places in manhattan, and close to a lot of good bars and resturants. 
Will stay again if I have the oppurtunity.

title: Nice staff, mediocre settings for high price
text:
Positive points: very nice staff, helpful concierge, great massage therapist upon request, nice sauna and gym, nice bed. Well situated, if you like the LES.

Negative points: not very new and clean, doesn't look like cleaning took more than 20 minutes in between guests (don't look behind drapes and bed), very small room, no dim lights to read (either extremely strong lights, or none at all, lighting is very oddly and poorly done), terrible room service, really really not good, and they replaced the cool REN bathroom amenities with cheaper hotel stuff, very disappointing - fan heating, so its either very loud, very hot and dry, or you don't use the heating system, and they offer no portable humidifiers..

Generally these NY trendy spots feel very impersonal. Interior design looks already so dated and un-fresh.
They are more like mini condos that you rent for a few days. Convenient but not so confortable.
They still don't have silently shutting doors like any city now has for hospitality. They are over-priced for something quite basic. They still offer 8$ bottles of water in the room which is a scandal.
Am kind of fed up with trendy hotels in NY right now...

title: Great Place to Stay in East Village!
text: Really nice design, great location, super nice staff.. From Raul at the door to Sasha from Sales team...Everyone is really professional. I stayed at this hotel two times in the last one month and loved it. Highly recommended. Don't miss  Blue Ribbon Izakaya Restaurant on the 2nd floor..

title: Best on Lower East Side
text:
Perfect location for us on the Lower East Side. Many shops and restaurants well within walking distance. Decent size room and layout for a NYC hotel. Friendly and helpful staff.

A few annoyances: had to have the TV serviced twice, the A/C once, and the fire alarm went off vacating the entire building...long walk down the staircase from the 11th floor, but alas was a false alarm.

Helpful Hints: Get a room on a high floor to cut back on city noise in the middle of the night. The 11th floor was not high enough.

Perhaps biggest annoyance, and somewhat contrary to any logic, we got a materially better rate along with a bigger room by making reservation via Magellan. I never thought these travel websites deliver, but this one sure does !!

title: Book it Now!
text:
Having stayed in a number of other hotels nearby, some costing more, I was thrilled to find the Sixty LES. 

We encourage you to try a corner King, the lower floor corner Kings have terrific, huge, terraces and the upper floors have jaw dropping views, as do most all of the rooms, I suspect.  

We were in the city with nephews who had never been here before and this was the perfect location- better than we had realized when we booked.  

It's easy to miss the F train entrance that is immediately across the street from the front door - but once you find it, the rest of the city is that much closer.  All of the restaurants and clubs within a few blocks make this a lively and happening place to be.  If you get hungry in the middle of the night or if you are stumbling back at 3 in the morning, there is a great little restaurant two doors down that serves 24 hours.  This, combined with the nephews finding friends who took them to after-hours clubs within 3 blocks meant that the city lived up to its "never sleeps" reputation.  

The staff were outstanding.  They could not have been kinder or more attentive. We actually looked forward to seeing them and their warm welcome every time we returned. The hotel is professional while being alive and vibrant.  The 7th floor has a busy bar - but there was no issue with noise - and it was fun seeing folks flowing in and out in the evening and nighttime. 

Oh, and the La Dolce Vita playing in the elevator is great.

title: Great service, great location, super cute doorman
text: Great little hotel right in the thick of things. Quiet friendly neighborhood. Super helpful doorman named Raul, who was also easy on the eyes. Gym is tiny, but get your exercise out exploring the hood.

title: Nice people, poor hotel
text: Just a quick follow-up on our stay at Sixty LES.  There was not a deluxe king room (which we booked and paid for ahead of time) available when we checked in.  Our only options were queen bed rooms.  The hotel would not provide a price break on the downgrade, however I did negotiate free parking.  The quality of the hotel is quite poor--not at all a "luxury" hotel.  The property is old and tired, and not clean.  The worst of it:  we had dirty sheets on our queen beds--one had dirt and one had dried blood (I am not kidding).  We were offered a complimentary continental breakfast and clean sheets. I will say the staff was as kind and friendly as can be.

title: Best in LES
text: I love this hotel. The staff is so accommodating. The pool is one of my favorites in Manhattan. The rooms are stellar, especially the shower. Room service is delicious. The tiki bar is great. The location is excellent for lower east side, and you'll never know who you'll see there.

title: In the Center of OUR favorite NYC
text: There are so many fantastic neighborhoods in NYC - all with their own flavor.  My husband and I have always been partial to the Lower East Side and we were excited to see this hotel had been renovated.  We love taking a red-eye, landing and walking to Katz's deli after dropping our bags off at the hotel.  Sixty LES is a very hip, clean and contemporary hotel located just down the street from Katz's deli.  You have easy access to Houston street with great food and shops. The restaurants in the neighborhood are high quality and the people super friendly.  Staying at Sixty LES and living a slice of this NY life - even for just 18 hours - like we did on our last trip is so much fun.  We also brought our kids on this trip because we were heading to Mass for a family wedding. We wound up going to two dinners and three bars in the span of 6 hours.

title: Stylish and confortable
text: I don't think a hotel room for one can get any better than this. Great view from the giant windows, spacious bathroom, quiet and nice atmosphere. The region where it is located offers a lot of good restaurants, including the famous pastrami sandwich place Katz right around the corner. If you have small children be aware that the elevator has a monitor playing a quite erotic video on loop, I wonder why.

title: Hotel moderno
text:
Con una arquitectura muy propia de los hoteles de vanguardia, sixty les ofrece uno de los hoteles más cool de Manhattan ubicado en lower east side cerca de todo y con una vista espectacular, sus habitaciones tienen un diseño muy actual, no parece el típico hotel de negocios aunque puede cumplir esa función, dentro la decoración es cuidada, lujosa y minimalista, se respira mucho el nuevo NY en este hotel, la piscina es muy chic y el bar del 7 piso ofrece una vista sin igual, sin duda es un hotel muy hecho a la medida.

El restaurante Japonés del segundo nivel también es bellísimo.

title: WOW! FRONT DESK JARED
text:
I grabbed the room on hotel tonight last minute. Great room, big bathroom and fantastic views. Was upgraded as soon as we walked in. The entire staff was friendly and helpful but JARED from the front desk was by the ultimate in making my stay 100%

I will absolutely be back - thank you SIXY

title: Great Hotel with a Amazing view
text: Our stay at this Hotel was Amazing! On our Honeymoon Trip to NYC we enjoied The Hotel very much! They gave us an upgrade to a panorama Suite on the 16th floor! It was amazing! Great staff, room was clean only the bathroom is a little bit small!

title: Great location, clean comfortable room, close to transport and shops, friendly helpful staff.
text:
Thank you Manager Steve for a great weeklong stay in lower eastside New York. View from our level 17 room with balcony was great. The room was perfect. Linen changed daily and cleaned well also. The hotel is across the road from 2 Avenue subway which is a link to everywhere in New York. Even the buses stop almost outside. Chinatown and Little Italy are a walk away. There are many fine places to eat nearby and a convenience store also. It has a gym and pool. Ben the concierge was very friendly helpful as we're all the staff. We never had to open the front door ourselves once. Breakfast which for us was included was great and the service there was friendly and efficient. Or daughter has stayed here twice and recommend it to us and we now also recommend it.
Thank you from Sydney Roy and Anne

title: Cool hotel, in keeping with lower east side spirit
text:
Stayed at this hotel twice for business recently. It's a cool place and the staff are friendly. 

It's prices are a little high for what you get compared to other places like the Bowery, but it still preferable to anything in midtown as the area is fantastic and much more interesting.

I liked the bar on floor 7, not blown away by the sushi in blue ribband and definitely not worth the room service fee for that.

title: 'Cool' but Warm
text: Hotel exudes hip LES vibe-- you can tell what kinds of guests it attracts  from the other reviews ("my cameraman", "here for Fashion Week", every other guest is either English or Australian). So it's a "cool" place with lots of dark walls, silent Sophia Loren movies playing on the elevator, etc. But the staff seemed genuinely warm and lacking the usual emaciated, expressionless facade of staff at Midtown hotels. A comfortable spot for a couple midweek nights. I'd be a little concerned about the number of younger/party people guests that might be more prevalent on the weekend (I only saw guys pantomiming oral sex on the elevator once during the week)-- the broken couch in my room was a sign that maybe the guests are wilder on the weekend?

title: Wonderfully located with fantastic staff...
text: There was a lot more on offer at this hotel than I was able to take advantage of [gym, spa, etc.,] but the hotel itself is a nice addition to the neighbourhood. Although it's not as boutique as the Ludlow [in my mind] it's far nicer than the Indigo [both in the next street along] and is wonderfully located on Allen Street with all the cafes, bars and stores around it that you'd typically want from the LES. The hotel was kept clean and calm, something I always appreciate when there's a bar in the hotel as the lobby can get annoying, but the staff kept people moving and no one that was enjoying the bar interrupted my stay. The bar itself is very weirdly decorated and out of sync with the hotel - personally - but the views are amazing and I was able to catch some incredible sunsets there. I worked on a deadline from the hotels public spaces as well and no one seemed to mind which I always appreciate. Staff were young, polite, and well trained - too often young NY staff can be belligerent, but these guys weren't. Great location, with great staff, clean rooms, well stocked rooms, nice toiletries [which were replaced everyday although i was clearly 'stealing' / stocking up on them [thank you, housekeeping] with good wifi and a sushi restaurant on site [didn't eat in] and spa available too [also didn't use spa either, but a guy in Gucci loafers seemed very happy with it!] Wouldn't hesitate to recommend to others. Daniel, who seemed to be at work continually, was respectful, great at his job and a pleasure to talk to. Thanks to all the staff for making my trip - and deadline - a pleasure.

title: Ehhh...rude bell boy made this not so great.
text: Traveling on business with a bunch of people from my company. Had to store some baggage for my camera man and they charged €5 a bag...okay cool. But then the bell boy wouldn't give us a receipt for our expenses and proceeded to tell me that they "don't give receipts" for that. It was clear he was pocketing the money and taking it as a tip instead of actually charging us. If I was traveling for pleasure it would have been no big deal but because it was for business it was important that all expenses were reimbursed. We actually yelled at each other in this nice hotel that's NOT CHEAP. I felt like I was treated like I was at a Motel 6 (no respect). The room was beautiful though and there's a breakfast place right next door to the right that is amazing!

title: Das zweite Mal SIXTY
text:
Wir sind im Juni das zweite Mal in SIXTY LES zurückgekehrt, da es uns beim letzten Besuch sehr überzeugt hat. Auch beim zweiten Besuch haben wir nicht zu bemängeln. Es war sehr nett vom Personal, dass sie uns das selbe Zimmer wie beim letzten Besuch organisiert haben, da es eine wunderschöne Aussicht hat. Das Hotel gefällt uns so sehr, das wir wieder ein Zimmer über Silvester gebucht haben!
Es wird uns sicher auch beim dritten Besuch nicht negativ überraschen :)

title: Comfortable stay - great staff!
text: I recently stayed at Sixty Les during fashion week and the location and attentive staff was idea for a busy week. The staff was so helpful with any special requests I had and the location made it fairly easy to get to west, south or midtown Manhattan. Room very clean with a great view! I would definitely stay again.

title: Nice room and nice Bar
text: 虽然房间不是很大，但是很喜欢落地大窗和矮矮的床的感觉。枕头被套也很舒服，装修的颜色也是黑灰为主，显得很酷，晚上在床上看夜景会觉得很美妙。7楼的酒吧氛围不错，楼下也有很多有现场表演的酒吧，一定会再去。

title: Nice hotel great location
text: Stayed for a well the start of the month. Was in a good location across the road from a subway station and loads of bars/restaurants within walking distance. View from room was excellent after asking for one facing Allen street at time of booking. Tiki bar had great views and the cocktails where very strong. Would definitely stay again.

title: Great Location
text: Great location, comfortable and cozy rooms. Con-slow elevators. Staff very friendly and helpful staff. Club onsite, lovely rooftop bar, great food and cocktails. Shopping district within walking distant.

title: Loved it
text: First thing we noticed when we entered our room was the magnificent floor to ceiling windows overlooking the city. Room was very clean, great bed and linens. But what made our stay a cut above the usual hotels was the personalized service we got from Guillaume. Sisty LES is our new home away from home! :-)

title: Hip hotel in the last genuine part of NYC
text: Stayed at numerous occasions when it was the Thompson LES. Nice staff, rooms OK but a little worn on my latest stay. Great neighborhood, a lot of nice cafes and restaurants close by. And as I stated, one of the last neighborhoods in Manhattan that not totally commercial with chain-staters and cafes.

title: Style and comfort on the Lower East Side
text: SIXTY is a lovely boutique hotel centrally located to just about any attraction in New Yorks newly lovely LES. The staff are young and helpful, the rooms have massive windows looking west toward Freedom Tower and uptown towards the rest of the city. The rooms are tastefully decorated with serene understated decor and amenities one would expect from a boutique hotels. My room did not have a bathtub but had a great shower with good water pressure. The location really is the star here and the hotel is a half block south of Houston close to cinemas, The New Museum and some great restaurants all within walking distance, as well as Chinatown, Little Italy and Soho. If you need to be in this area of the city the Sixty is a great option.

title: Plush
text: Great hotel, matches the price reasonably well. Room was large, clean and well appointed, bathroom especially had plenty of room which was a nice change. Staff were super helpful and friendly. Pool was a welcome relief after a warm day of walking the streets of Manhattan. It was pretty expensive, but new york aint cheap, and it is a pretty nice hotel. Would return.

title: Girls trip!
text: We decided to try SIXTY LES so that we could explore a new part of town this trip! The service was great, the hotel was clean. We encountered Raul several times during our stay and he was super helpful. We loved the Tiki Bar atmosphere and drinks. I look forward to our next visit!

title: Loudest hotel I've stayed in outside of Cuzco, Peru
text:
I stayed here on a business trip with fellow co-workers.
Got in Wednesday night and 2 in our group checked out right away because of the noise - the place was a zoo. The doors are paper thin and you can hear everything in the hallways - the sound actually seems amplified.  On top of it, the bar is like a nightclub - there was no NOT hearing it and the people in the street out front.  Walked out the next morning and there was a giant puddle of puke a few meters away.
Thursday night was loud again, so I went to sleep elsewhere.  I left my stuff in the room because I was supposed to be working with colleagues again on the Friday.  When I returned around 4, my elevator card didn't work.  That's because I had been checked out.  Not by me.  My stuff was all in a room.  They said it looked like I had packed everything but, clearly I hadn't.  I had food in the room, my computer in the safe (oh don't worry, they got that out for me) and a little change on my nightstand (that didn't wind up with my stuff).   I have to stay, this the first time I didn't have to check myself out.
The location is fine (if you like to party) and the rooms are clean and good-sized.  Too bad about the lack of sound-proofing, the party clientele and the odd service.  
Definitely would not recommend or stay here again.  Whether someone else is paying or not.

title: I loved it
text:
Mes enfants et moi avons adoré notre séjour au Sixty Les! Superbe hôtel avec sa piscine Andy Warhol, sa très belle architecture d'intérieur, si bien placé dans le quartier très vivant du Lower East Side. 

Super Equipe au lobby, doormen si attentifs et professionnels! 
Merci à Eric, un des doormen si adorable avec nous, qui nous a rajouté encore plus de piment et de plaisir durant notre séjour avec son style et son expression tellement New Yorkaise! 

Un grand, grand merci à Guillaume!!! aux petits soins avec nous, vraiment professionnel et  attaché à nous rendre notre séjour encore plus agréable!

Je ne peux être que dithyrambique sur cette belle aventure new yorkaise au Sixty Les!

Marisol

title: Nice Stay
text: Stayed for 3 nights during a business trip. Very pleased with the service. Only complaint was my room lead right out to the pool and there were a few guests that were a little noisy. Loved the sushi restaurant. Raul very kindly helped us with our bags.

title: Good location and friendly staff
text: I have stayed at the soho sixty several times. This version on the lower east side did not disappoint. The check in staff was ferry friendly and helpful with some printing. The room was clean and well laid out. The bedding looked ready to be retired but was clean. The 7th floor bar had a great view and was hopping with a young crowd. I would stay here again. I liked the hood and there was a subway stop just a block away.  The cleaning staff needs to work on dusting in the public spaces. I would stay here again.

title: Family stay in New York
text:
Les Sixty is a chic boutique hotel, the room was well decorated and the bathroom was excellent.

Staff very helpful especially the doormen.

Pool area is very trendy and whilst the pool is small and quite shallow it's works very well and was ideal for us and the kids after a day of sightseeing.

Area is great, good restaurants, safe and very cool

2 issues, 

1st when i booked I chose to push up a level to a Kings Suite which I enquirer about before I booked. I was advised this was on a higher floor with a corner balcony with the sofa in the living room converting into a bed for our 2 kids. Our room was on the 6th floor which didn't feel much like a higher floor and whist we had a view of both the Empire State and Freedom Tower from the balcony with this being a 20 story building I was was expecting a bit more wow.

2nd, there is a great bar with roof terrace but it was closed for private parties on 2 of 4 nights. If the bar is part of hotel it's should be open for residents or at least partially. If part of the hotels sales pitch is the bar and roof terrace to have it closed 50% of the time is a bit of a cheat.

title: Great location. Rooms good. Communal facilities needs work
text:
We stayed in a suite and was impressed with rokm and facilities. Air con was perfect and bed large and comfortable. 
When we checked in at 4pm our room wasn't ready,  despite check in at 3pm, a free drink helped to say sorry. 
Pool and bar was very busy at the weekend and we didn't stick around. Pool stayed busy midweek 
Went to tiki bar at lunchtime and much better. 
Staff are really friendly and there to help. 
Local area has loads of great food, UK visitor this kind Hoxton and shoreditch 5 years ago. 
If they sort out the over crowding in the bar and pool it may have been a 5.

title: Nice hotel
text: We arrived and checked in.  The check in staff was nice and they gave us a small but nice room we had booked through Magellan.  Unfortunately at about 12:00 am someone on our floor was smoking so we called down and a really nice guy came upstairs to tell the people to stop.  The smell was awful so they offered us a fan or another room.  We took the other room.  it was much bigger with 2 queen beds and space for luggage. The next day we asked if we could stay in that room but it was already reserved so we packed out stuff up.  They moved our luggage so when we returned later that day we had another room.  There was a note apologizing for the inconvenience of the smoke & the move and hoping this would help.  There was nothing with the note though.  We asked the next morning at the front desk but got no answer.  Strange.  The hotel is clean, well maintained with friendly staff. The doormen were especially nice.  The pool is small but lovely way to cool off from the heat of NYC.  It was a fun new area for us to stay in with a very yummy gelato plate around the counter.  The hotel is a hotspot for starts apparently with NKOTB, Future and others staying there,.  That was fun.  I would stay there again especially if you are looking for a different area away from the Time s Square madness.  As we checked out I asked about the manager's note.  There was supposed to have been champagne but we never got it so they discounted our night instead.

title: Jewel in East Village
text: This hotel is a jewel in the east village. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable and professional, the location is ideal for walking to SoHo and Greenwich Village. If you are food enthusiast, many great NYC dining spots nearby.

title: Fantastic stay in LES
text: This is the second time I've stayed at Sixty Les and it won't be the last. With a great location in LES, rooftop bar and pool, it really has everything you need for a fun visit to NYC. All the staff are super friendly and helpful. Raul was especially nice and gave us assistance and advice whenever we needed it.

title: Visita a New York
text: Buen hotel, de diseño moderno con un restaurante especializado en sushi y con piscina adecuada.  Muy buena calidad de atención y cuenta con un pequeño gimnasio y una sala de copas para la noche. Apropiado tanto para familias como para grupos. Situado en East River cerca de Chinatown algo alejado del Square Avenue pero con buena comunicación de metro y bus.

title: L'hôtel qui a tout bon
text: Bien placé entre downtown et midtown, à 30 mètres du métro F (2nd avenue) qui permet de remonter vers uptown très rapidement. Jolie piscine, bar branché en terrasse avec une jolie vue, chambre impeccable et spacieuse. Belle déco contemporaine, aucune faute de goût. Personnel intentionné.

title: Decent and good location
text:
Stayed here several nights in July:

+ Perfect location; just below Houston and just above Delancey, close to nice restaurants and bars
+ Close to bus stop and not to far from subway
+ Rooms are clean and spacious
+ Hotel staff is friendly
+/- There is a great rooftop pool and a really nice bar. As other guests pointed out, both are not exclusively for guests. This can be suboptimal for the pool, the bar is actually quite a nice spot to spend your evenings. They host private parties on a regular basis at the bar, please keep that in mind when planning your evenings.
- There is no real business area in the hotel to work remotely (which I like to do), so I had to juggle a bit between going to the nearby Starbucks or Berkli Parc Cafe and sitting in the area on the first floor where there are some cosy seats. That is area is ok, but there are no real tables to work from (so laptop on your lap).

title: Sixty LES ...pretty good
text:
Stayed there for a few days for my birthday.The hotel overall seemed a lil cramped, the queen room was kinda tiny (but not for NYC I guess) the bed was very comfy though. The layout is pretty nice and very clean, with a friendly helpful staff. 
The tiki bar was very nice and the bartender was really cool. We didn't make it to the rooftop pool, or the restaurant which looked very nice. However, since we were blocks away from China Town and lots of very good restaurants, good food wasn't hard to find.

Way too much construction going on in the area (like almost everywhere in Manhattan nowadays) and a lot of hustle and bustle. But if your young, or just love that big city excitement/danger you'll be right at home. 
Very close to public transportation and taxis are plentiful. So do yourself a favor and don't rent a car. If you do... GOOD LUCK trying to find affordable parking.

Overall it's not the luxury they portray it to be. But it's very nice. However, I probably wouldn't stay longer than a weekend.

title: Good enough for LES I'd say
text:
Just below Houston and just above Delancey this is a perfect Lower East Side (this is what LES stands for) location. And close to Broadway and SoHo too. 

Modern and stylish but no frills. Sushi restaurant, Beer Garden, Tiki Bar and pool on level 3 are open for all. May not suit everybody. 

King Bed room is big enough for two and facing Allen St with wall to wall glass windows. Aircon is a bit noisy. Beds are too hard for me. 

Please note that there is no breakfast venue but instead in-room breakfast that you order the night before by filling out a form. Also: avoid the so called 'spa', it's a joke with entrance through the kitchen. Complimentary Wifi could be faster.

title: Nice hotel but not impressed that the facilities are not exclusive to guests.
text: Spacious rooms, good location. However, I would not stay here again. We chose this hotel because of the pool to discover it had been booked for a private function more than once and we were asked to leave at 5pm an hour after we arrived. Secondly the staff let non-guests in and therefore it was over crowed each day of our stay. The restaurant was also unavailable due to a private function. Not impressed at all.

title: Good For Exploring
text:
We stayed at the Sixty LES on a recent visit to NYC to see Coldplay. We enjoyed the area as it was close to many of the restaurants and shopping areas we were interested in without having to stay in SoHo. Also, we booked thinking we would enjoy some of the pool time. However, every time we tried to go to the pool, it was overflowing and full of people who in some areas must be considered "cool". The hotel is very lovely, and we really enjoyed the  Blue Ribbon Sushi restaurant for a late night dinner after the concert. The staff was very accommodating and helpful... but the two bars in the hotel were again always full of a younger and pretty annoying crew. Location is great for walking and exploring, but if you aren't familiar with the Lower East Side and it's typical residents and scene, you should familiarize yourself with that first. Ate a divinely amazing dinner at Supper in the East Village not too far. Easy subway access makes location even better if exploring outside of the neighborhood. Oh, and our view from our balcony room (1500) was amazing... Best view I've ever had in the City- Freedom Tower, Empire State, Chrysler Building, and the Brooklyn Bridge. Our room was nicely sized, but I found that the design while trying to be modern seemed a tad cheesy. FYI- I recently stayed at the Sixty Nautilus in South Beach for a girls' trip, and their decor was on point as well as the entire property.
One suggestion I would make for this hotel is to have a separate elevator access for guests coming to the Tiki bar late night, as that was extremely annoying coming home at the end of a night out.

title: Hotel very popular with the youngsters
text: We stayed here because our son lives in lower east side. The hotel itself is lovely, rooms gorgeous and door men so friendly and helpful. The downside to this hotel is that floor 2 and 7 where there are bars is open to the public so at times very noisy and busy. On the weekend our 11 year old daughter could not get any where near the pool as the pool area was completely packed with youngsters having a great party time. I would prefer that the pool is used only by guests of the hotel.

title: New York visit
text:
Stayed recently in a deluxe King room. Great, modern 3 way bathroom, room small, a shared balcony. Lifts are very slow 

The hotel charges an additional $150.00 per night of stay to cover incidentals, so for a 4 night stay $600.00

title: Bachlorette Stay
text:
My maid of honor and I stayed here for 1 night during my bachelorette weekend. The hotel is beautiful, very trendy and typical of a NYC boutique hotel. The windows in the room were floor to ceiling with a great view of the city. I found the room to be bigger then average for NY, however the only mirrors in the room were in the pitch black bathroom. We had to sit on the floor by the windows with our tiny compact mirrors while we were getting ready. A few minutes after we got into the room there was a knock at the door. I must have paused for a second to see if it was for our room and before I knew it the door was being opened. I ran into the bathroom as I was in the middle of changing and my gf ran to the door which was already being opened by a staff member wanting to check our mini fridge. Are you kidding me?? We just got there, didn't even have time to make a drink if we wanted to and if he was checking from previous guests that should have been done before letting us into the room, either way, you don't just knock and walk in! We checked out the Tiki bar upstairs, really cute but we had plans and didn't stay for a drink. We did have dinner at the Japanese restaurant which was perfection, food and service were great. My other gripe is they hold $150 for incidentals, I've now been checked out of the hotel for 9 days and the charge is still pending.  
I really wanted to give this hotel a higher rating but between the staff member opening the door and the charge that's still on my debit card I just can't.

title: Amazing!
text:
We were visiting New York for our anniversary. We stopped in SIXTY LES on our anniversary night. We had such a warm welcome and everything was so easy.
We had been put in one of the best rooms. The view was astounding and everything was finished to a high standard. We were sent complimentary champagne because it was a special occasion.
The pool and bar area was lovely and relaxing. 

I would definitely return if we were to go back to New York. It was really lovely. The staff were brilliant and friendly.

title: Amazing View!!!
text: Great staff, very courteous rooms are comfortable in size and offers amazing views of NYC! Location is pretty convenience, there are many options for dinning, if you do not feel like going out you can try their restaurant of simply enjoy the tiki bar that offers items that are shareable if you are with a small group. Highly recommend this property.

title: Hip Hotel in LES
text: Near the junction of Allen Street and East Houston Street, Sixty is a landmark hotel in New York's fashionable and edgy Lower East Side. Perfectly positioned for a host of vibrant shops, bars and restaurants catering for every taste and with fantastic panoramic views of downtown from our room on the 8th floor. It's pretty hipster-ish decor and atmosphere, but friendly with it. More for young couples and groups than those with young children but you are made to feel very at home by the lovely staff. Downsides are drinks and room service are extortionate and we found the 3rd floor open air pool closed without announcement for a private event which was pretty poor form when we'd paid for use of the facilities. But the overall impression was great and the location is fantastic. LES rocks and anything goes. Party central.

title: not that great
text: small rooms, expensive rates, disorganized staff. small crowded pool.  and on top of that, they accidentally charged us an extra $1100.  The manager was very apologetic and  quickly removed the charge, but pretty crazy.

title: Slept like a baby
text: I go to New-York four or five times a year and always stay at the Sixty Les, the staff is very courteous and helpful. The tiki bar on the roof top is really nice and shows a great view. I was lucky enough to get upgraded to a nicer room, very design and modern. The pool area is great spot to relax and enjoy a young trendy dynamic atmosphere. The hotel is fairly priced considering its prime location. I would recommend this hotel to all kinds of travellers.

title: Great spot, great service
text:
