Located on the lower east side right near a bunch of cool bars, clubs, small live music venues.  Perfect for young people (or young at heart).  Rooms are very comfortable, minimalist, hip.  We had a balcony overlooking Allen street which was really cool.
Service was excellent all over the property.  Rooftop bar at night had great views.  Drinks were great but not cheap.

title: Super Lage, grandioser Blick
text: Modernes, recht chices Hotel, super Lage in LES mit direkter Subway Anbindung, super Blick Richtung Financial District (16. Stock), belebtes Viertel mit allen Ausgehmöglichkeiten, fussläufig zum Chinatown (ca 10 min) wenns mal preiswerter sein soll

title: Calm and impressive
text: I went to sixty les and had a nice time. I was glad as it was not in downtown Manhattan so it was not so busy I liked the food as they had an all you can eat sushi place called the blue lagoon which was yummy 🍱🍱 also the famous Katz delicatessen was a huge success and just by the hotel

title: Great Stay in the Lower East Side
text:
The Sixty LES is one of the nicest boutique hotels in which we've had the pleasure of staying in NYC. Situated near SOHO and the East Village, it's not only close to terrific shopping and restaurants, but offers an authentic NYC experience far away from the more touristy areas of the city.

Our room was very well appointed, very comfortable & clean, and very spacious, and the staff did a terrific job accommodating our needs.

While we did have an issue with room service on several occasions, I am delighted to report that the hotel manager himself, called us to rectify the situation and apologize, which he did to our complete satisfaction BEFORE we checked out.

We've stayed all over the city... in what I would classify as top-end properties (W's, Westin's, Kimpton's), but Sixy LES will absolutely be welcoming us again soon!

title: Great hotel - shame about the pool access!
text:
We stayed at Sixty LES and overall thought it was a great hotel.  The decor and furnishings were really modern and very well done. The door staff were excellent, really friendly and helpful.  And housekeeping did a great job.  We had a room high up that had incredible views.  The rooftop bar is great for a summer's evening and the views back over the city were fab, but unfortunately the beers were always warm, which is pretty disappointing on a hot day.  The hotel is in a great location, there are some fantastic local restaurants and bars and it's an easy walk (or subway if you prefer!) to soho or East Village.  
Like many other reviewers on this site, I want to express our disappointment about the rooftop pool.  We chose this hotel specifically for the pool (and paid a lot for it!) as we travelled in summer and wanted the option of some rest days by the pool.  We had read about the habit some NYC hotels have of opening up their pool to locals, so made sure we rang Sixty LES to ask about this BEFORE we even booked. We were assured that the pool is for hotel guests only, however this was definitely NOT the case.  Almost every time we went to the pool it was overrun with locals, and we couldn't even get a chair most days.  Weekends were the worst (we stayed in the hotel for over 2 weeks), with people arriving at 9am and drinking all day.  The staff even served greasy food to one group INSIDE the pool.  They ate and drank in there and one guest with a small child ended up leaving because of their behaviour.  I don't have a problem with a party atmosphere, but I do have a problem with paying guests being unable to get a seat or enjoy time in the pool because of locals coming in for free.  Especially when the hotel assured us (and other TripAdvisor reviewers) that it is for guests only.  You cannot get to the pool without a room key or a staff member letting you up, so there is obviously an unwritten policy about letting locals in!  We tried to raise it with hotel management one day and get them to clarify the policy for us, but we were left waiting in reception for the duty manager for over 30mins and eventually gave up. If you're going there expecting to get good use out of the pool, I wouldn't recommend it.  Otherwise it's a good hotel in a great spot.

title: New trendy, sexy hotel with nice staff near the F train
text:
If you want to stay in the edgier, hipster Lower East Side, you'll want to stay here. As a new hotel, you can be assured that it's got the newest furniture and friendly/not jaded staff.

The room had floor to ceiling windows on the wall--we could see for miles! The bathroom was great too, with an actual solid door that closes, unlike the flimsy sliding pocket doors that most hotels have to save space. 

The hotel has a spa with a steam room, but I sadly didn't have time to use it.

Best part--The F train 2nd Ave subway stop is right there across the street! Really useful if you're going almost anywhere. I would stay here again.

title: Wonderful experience at the Sixty Les Hotel.
text: Whether it's 2 days or 2 months (as I have stayed) the Sixty Les is a great stay.  A small boutique hotel situated near great restaurant, an amazing music scene and great neighborhood overall.  Everyone at the Les was friendly and willing to service you in any way they could.  Thanks to Melissa, Catherin and Raul for your wonderful hospitality.  Can't wait to return.  You guys are the best!!!

title: Entre le moyen et le très bien, donc BIEN !
text: Hôtel très bien situé. Commerces et restaurants partout à proximité et situation idéale par rapport aux points principaux. Hôtel très chic et chambre plutôt moderne et jolie bien que très petite (pour la nôtre du moins). Nous étions situés au 15ème étage et la vue était magnifique. Grâce à la baie vitrée nous avions une vue impressionnante sur Manhattan. J'ai vraiment apprécié ce point de la chambre. En revanche des petits détails ont, sans avoir gâché le séjour, fait baisser la note. Une serviette mouillée ne nous appartenant pas à trainé toute la semaine en haut d'un placard et des papiers qui venaient on ne sait d'où apparaissaient après le ménage de la chambre. La chambre (je parle évidemment de la nôtre) n'avait pratiquement aucun rangement. Le minuscule placard ne nous permettait pas de tout ranger du coup la moitié des affaires était restée dans la valise. Hôtel évidemment très cher quand on compare avec l’hôtellerie française pour une qualité équivalente. Mais les hôtels à New York sont très chers donc rien de surprenant. Et puis les taxes (auxquelles je ne me ferai jamais) augmentent la note. J'ai trouvé le personnel d'accueil moyennement chaleureux. Certain(nes) étaient plutôt accueillant(tes) et d'autres beaucoup moins. Cet hôtel dispose d'une salle de sport plutôt bien équipée. Pour ce qui concerne le petit déjeuner, je m'attendais à un buffet ce qui n'était pas le cas. Nous avions le choix parmi une carte du restaurant indépendant situé dans l'hôtel pour un montant maximum de $25, autant dire que pour ce prix nous n'avions pas vraiment grand chose : une assiette américaine + un café et comme nous étions 2 nous pouvions prendre un jus d'orange (pour 2). Enfin fallait dépasser le montant pour avoir plus. Cela étant j'ai apprécié ce petit déjeuner que j'ai trouvé très bon. Et puis le personnel du restau (rappelons-le ne faisant pas partie de l'hôtel) était vraiment très très sympa. Voila. Je recommande cet hôtel parce qu'il est très bien situé et que finalement il est plutôt bien, même si quelques points sont à améliorer.

title: I loved having a balcony
text: I stumble upon 60 LES when helping my son move into his Lower East side apartment. The room was well-appointed and very hip. It is in a vibrant section of town. Most of all, I enjoyed our balcony and a wonderful view of the city.

title: Fun and hip hotel in a fabulous location
text: My daughter and I spent two nights at the Sixty LES hotel for a weekend in March.  We really had a great time. We stayed in a standard room and it was perfect for the two of us. It had a great view and we loved the floor to ceiling windows which made the room seem bigger. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel is located in the Lower East Side which itself is a fantastic neighborhood with so much great history. Close to Katz's Deli, Russ and Daughters, Meatball Shop, Yonah Schimmel Knishery, just to name a few amazing must eat at restaurants.  The Tenement Museum is about 2 blocks away with fantastic tours.  This hotel is so close to so many great neighborhoods in NYC. We were able to walk everywhere - Chinatown, Little Italy,  SOHO, Lower Manhattan, East Village, West Village. Plus the subway is close by with easy access to other parts of the city. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Hotel Perfection! Location Superb
text: After originally pre-booking and checking into Hotel Americano in Chelsea for 5 nights we decided after only one night that whilst modern and cool the room was way too small... I quickly recalled that my brother had stayed at Sixty LES on our last trip to NY ... I phoned the hotel direct and was lucky enough to secure a last minute booking.  WOW, WOW, WOW ... What a stunning hotel, staff amazing, glorious luxury sexy decor... Very spacious room with separate lounge area and super comfy bed.  We could not have been happier with our hotel experience! My partner chose this amazing city to propose over dinner at Buddakan restuarant Meatpacking and afterwards upon our return to Sixty LES the staff had decorated our suite with flowers, rose petals, candles and French Champagne! nothing was too much trouble and the staff greatly assisted us in making this a very special experience!  Would stay here again and again! Around the corner from the famous Russ and Daughters Bagel Shop and my other favourite The Meatball Shop!!  Loved Tiki Tabu rooftop bar too! very cool.

title: eine gute Wahl
text: Wir waren knapp eine Woche dort. Das Hotel liegt sehr praktisch an der Ecke East Houston und Allen Street. Somit sind viele spannenden Ecken (SoHo, Chinatown, ...) leicht zu Fuß zu erreichen. Die Haltestelle der F-Linie liegt quasi direkt vor der Tür. Das Hotel ist eher dunkel gehalten, sehr schick auf alle Fälle. Die Zimmer sind recht groß und haben Fenster, die den gesamten Raum abdecken und man hat eine tolle Sicht auf die Stadt (je nachdem in welchem Stockwerk das Zimmer liegt). Das ist aber tagsüber nicht notwendigerweise von Vorteil, wenn man ein Zimmer zur Allen Street hat. Da knallt die Sonne ziemlich drauf und trotz Klima wird es da schwer warm. Also am besten die Vorhänge zu lassen. Bei den Zimmern aufpassen. Im 7. OG ist die Bar. Die ist abends gut gefüllt und wenn man in den Stockwerken drüber ist, ist das dann doch recht laut. Das Bad ist toll - designermäßig - mit Regenduschkopf. Sehr nette Leute am Empfang, die sehr serviceorientiert sind.

title: Great view, shame about the hotel
text:
We stayed here for eight nights for our wedding in NYC and had the most amazing view from our balcony. It was also in a great location. Unfortunately that's where the positives end. As someone who used to live in NYC and work in the service industry, I realise it's different to other cities. But we're both well travelled and must say that Sixty LES was among the worst we've experienced in terms of customer service and overall experience. 

The reception and hotel staff were non-communicative at best - until we were checking out. The elevators were an experience unto themselves with complicated buttons and a confusing and time-consuming system of getting to the gym and spa - only one goes there, but you have to figure that out for yourself as they won't tell you, even when you ask! 

The pool - which is a big selling point in the pictures - is either never open or being prepared for, or closed for, photo shoots and private parties, which just shows a disregard for guests, who pay more than enough for the facilities. Or it's just full of people coming in from outside, as on the last day of our stay, when we were hoping to finally get some pool time, to no avail. When we asked the barman/lifeguard if any beds would become free, he just said he didn't know. 

The bars on the 2nd and 7th floors seem to just cater for outside clientele and guests do not seem welcome, including for our own pre-wedding reception drinks, which seemed to be disturbing the staff meeting, even though it was lunchtime and open. 

The whole vibe in the place is just not geared towards making guests comfortable or welcome, which really shouldn't be the case. For the prices we were paying for a special week, that just felt unacceptable. A friend of ours was also stopped from coming into the hotel altogether in the middle of the day, which is just wrong. The room was also never really cleaned to a standard you would expect from a hotel like this, including the balcony, which was just left alone. 

There seems to be a problem with the running, management or culture of Sixty LES which needs to be addressed if they don't want to lose guests. We heard other guests complain too, not least about the elevators, which are just plain confusing! Not a hotel to be recommended, in its current form at least!

title: Un excellent hôtel dans un quartier vivant
text:
C'était notre deuxième visite au Sixty LES et notre séjour fut des plus agréable.
Le personnel est très efficace et cordial et nous a encore une fois fourni un service excellent. Notre chambre était superbe, le point de vue sur la ville, propreté et service on été parfait.

Le quartier est intéressant, et on y sent la vraie vie de NYC.

title: My Stay!!!
text:
I stayed at this wonderful hotel from the 25th - 31st May 2016. The hotel was extremely clean, modern & delivered a warm welcoming on arrival. The staff were really helpful but two of them really stood out to me and they where Nalani & Taiwo. They were both really amazing & really hard working also there customer care skills were AMAZING!!!! Would recommend this hotel 10000000%.

Many thanks 

Justin

title: Great Location, Fabulous Hotel
text: We stayed at this hotel for only one night, but we really wish we were able to stay longer! The staff at this hotel makes you feel like royalty from the moment you step out of your cab! We were lucky enough to stay in one of the rooms with a balcony overlooking the city! Breathtaking views of midtown and downtown NY! The location is perfect, too! Famous eateries like Russ and Daughters and Katz just a block away from the hotel. Everything about our stay was perfect, highly recommend.

title: Lacked attention to detail/pool is NOT just for hotel guests
text:
I agree with Nick of Paris calling it "typical affordable luxury hotel."  It's ultra modern borderline-cold decor would be nice if the desk was not covered in water stains, the robe provided would actually reach all the way around your body (I am a size 4 and it barely met in the middle), the toiletries provided were quality products, there wasn't a messy extension cord thrown behind the bedside table, etc.  
The tiki bar (which has great potential, especially because of the view) was on our floor and is quite loud. (don't stay on the 7th if you want quiet)  And the staff at the bar was terrible.  After waiting a half hour for a simple appetizer, we just cancelled it and left.  My white wine was warm.  And the clientel is primarily drunk 20-somethings.
If you like the idea of staying at a hotel with a rooftop pool, good luck actually getting a seat poolside.  The Sixty advertises that the pool is for hotel guests only, but that is a flat out lie.  It was packed with hipster New Yorkers from the moment it opened until the moment it closed.  It is very disappointing when a business is so blatantly dishonest.
Like the previous reviewer, we are in our 40's and this just wasn't the place for us.  For those of you that are interested in the party that the LES offers and want it to extend to your hotel stay, then this is for you. If you want excellent service and attention to detail with quiet evenings to sleep, find another hotel.

title: Typical "affordable luxury" hotel
text: Sixty is like many of these affordable "luxury" hip hotels. It's well designed with cold but comfortable rooms and relatively impersonal service. Being 40 i'm obviously not the target client who is more like in his/her late 20s - at this age you can accept the crowded pool area, the permanent loud music and inflexible hotel policy which charges $50/hour for any late check out. Obviously not trying to capture any repeat clients here. Overall, the hotel is OK and maybe deserves a 4 star rating - i'm putting 3 because i'm simply not 20 anymore! Rooms are small but fine but VERY noisy - like is often the case in these cheap "industrial" design - don't forget your earplugs if sleep is on your agenda.

title: une bonne adresse pour une escapade à NY
text:
Située en coin de building en étage haut et disposant d'un balcon, la chambre 1600 offre une vue époustouflante à 270 degrés sur NY : De la One World Tower jusqu'au Chrysler Building en passant par l'Empire State ! On aime son coté dépouillé mélange de béton/design. Le personnel, à l'accueil comme au petit déjeuner, est très accueillant et efficace.
Placé dans Lower Est Side, Le SIXTY LES est idéal pour découvrir ce quartier pas encore rattrapé pour les grands groupes qui diffusent les mêmes marques partout dans le monde !

title: Sweet!
text: What a stylish, friendly and well located hotel! Rooms are more spacious than many nyc hotels, and some of the views are amazing! Gym and sauna clean and workable, second floor lounge comfy and attractive staff truly sweet. Only complaint: no in room coffee, room service not open til 7 and few early bird caffeine options in the nabe!

title: AMAZING STAY FOR
text: I planned a pretty elaborate trip for my girlfriend's birthday.  I also proposed on the trip.  The staff was able to upgrade my room and actually helped in some of the details of the planning!  The concierges were incredible and I couldn't thank them enough as we checked out the last day.  The room was clean, beautiful and I absolutely loved the views of the city.  I would especially like to give a shout out to the doormen and bellhops (great guys), Eleanor and Ben at the concierge desk and Melissa and Catherine at the front desk.  We will definitely be staying there next time we come to the city for my birthday!

title: A Party for your senses
text: Sixty is full of surprises...the colors, lighting, textures and feel of the place is inviting to all senses. It's hard to call it beautiful-it's more like a tease that beats with intensity.  I can't say enough about the service, from the guys who grabbed the bags and parked the car (yes, they did bring it back) to the wonderful people at the front desk and concierge. Everyone was beyond friendly and helpful and I would comeback home to SixtyLES whenever possible.

title: Great Hotel on the LES
text:
Stylist rooms and a bustling location make this a great stay in the Lower East Side.  Despite being further downtown, it has a somewhat central location to visit the financial district, SOHO, TriBeCa as well as the village.

Only complaint is the lack of electrical outlets near the bedside.

title: Hotel contemporain dans un quartier encore authentique
text: Le sixty less est un hôtel contemporain dans un quartier encore authentique de New York dans le lower east side, proche de Soho et de chinatown. Parfait pour un jogging le matin tôt sur les bords de l’hudson. Le personnel est très sympa, les chambres sont modernes et confortables pour un séjour urbain. Le restaurant de suchi et bon (un peu bruyant mais on est à NY...). Excellent séjour en famille avec des amis.

title: Better than we could have asked for
text: We split our trip to NY into two and spent the first 5 nights in Williamsburg and the last two nights at Sixty LES. The location was ideal for us as it was very close to great shopping areas, both the big name brand shops and also the smaller, independent shops as well. Chinatown and Little Italy are right on your doorstep too. The room itself was really spacious and had a great balcony with a view down Allen. Special mention to the staff as well who were exceptional with a mention to your doormen/bellmen who couldn't do enough for you and were genuinely happy and friendly. This hotel really made our trip from Scotland extra special so thank you!

title: Business - Vacances
text:
Très bel hotel, très bien situé, lumineux et agréable....très proche de restaurants délicieux. 
L'hotel abrite deux bars, et un restaurant suschi superbe. 
Bonne salle de sport, équipes très sympa....surtout Guillaume, français à l'acceuil très disponible pour les francophones. 
A conseiller sans modération

title: Amazing view, great location, best staff ever
text: This is a newer building in a really cool part of town... a few blocks from name shopping, but even closer to cool blocks full of small shops and bars that have tons of character. The staff takes care of you like no place I've ever stayed, and the fact that they have private balconies (very rare in NYC) was the deciding factor for me. (although even the rooms without balconies have floor to ceiling windows with amazing views. The stay here capped off my trip beautifully, and the staff listened to what kind of room I wanted and absolutely came through for me.

title: Great experience!
text: In for the art fairs, this was the perfect spot to recharge, sleep and go for the night. The room was clean well appointed with wonderful beds, an amazing bathroom and fabulous floor to ceiling windows.  The staff from the doorman, reception, housekeeping, room service  and the wait staff in the restaurant were professional, friendly and went the extra mile each and every time. This was a great experience and could not have been better. To put it plain and simple: this is a great place to stay !

title: Great place to stay
text: Hotel was nice. Loved the floor to ceiling windows in my room. Great views toward World Trade Center. Restaurant/bar on second floor was delicious. Best part about my stay was the staff: always friendly and helpful. Raul and the lobby staff always went out of their way to get taxis for me; many thanks!

title: Soho
text: I had not been to NYC in years and neighborhoods change frequently.  I have never heard of this small boutique hotel but was nicely surprised. It has a trendy feel and very friendly doormen and front desk staff. The rooms are clean and small and but have designer headboards with lights and exposed concrete. There is a sushi bar right in the hotel! You can have room service but on the same block is a coffee shop and there is also a park two blocks away where I watched two cute blonde guys play basketball at 730 am. You get a real feel of NYC life. The beds are full so a little small but comfortable.

title: Amazing Staff!!!
text: I had a very long and crazy day and the staff at Sixty Les completely changed that around with their amazing customer service! Having some banking issues Ben took his time to make it work so I could check in for the night to get some rest until I was able to get it fixed. In the morning I went down and was promptly greeted with a smile by Melissa, she put the icing on the cake! I explained what was going on and she right away started working her magic! She made sure I was happy with my room and made it so easy with the banking issues I was having to extend my stay. Her customer service is service that sells and I'm sold! I've been in the service/hospitality industry for over 15 years and appreciate great customer service! Thank you Ben! Thank you Melissa! Great Room! Great Stay!

title: My New - New York Favorite
text: Great hotel on all levels - the reception staff, doormen, killer rooms and food. I checked out, went next for coffee and was waiting for a taxi when Raul comes walking out. He steps out into traffic and snags me a ride. Remember the transaction was over and the guest was out the door. Now that's what I call service!

title: Thank you for a nice experience
text:
Great hotel and nice ambiance. Staff was very friendly and professional. I will be back very soon. The area was also nicely convenient for me. 
I usually stay uptown and this was a nice area for shopping as well as large variety of nice restaurants recommended by the concierge. 
Thank you for a great stay!

title: Boutique style sanctuary in LES
text:
Great bed in a good sized room with a fantastic view of the LES and beyond. All staff were very friendly and helpful. 
Awesome location, easy to get to everywhere in Manhattan, and perfect for exploring the bustling Lower East Side and all its weird and wonderful sights, sounds and smells. Plenty of live music close by, tons of bars and places to eat including the unrivaled Meatball Shop. 
Would def go back next visit to NYC. AND they were playing the Happy Mondays in the lobby when I arrived.

title: Clean, comfortable, convenient
text: We stay here frequently when visiting our son.  The location is great for East Village.  Staff is helpful and friendly.  Rooms are clean and, for NYC, a good value.  If possible get a room with a small balcony - nice addition and late night view is great.

title: Staff So Charming But Hotel Not At Same Standard
text:
The staff is so kind and cheery.  Rooms Supervisor Maria was especially accommodating of my concerns, tried as hard as she could to fix things, but some of it was clearly our of her control.  When I told her as gently as possible why I was cancelling the rest of my stay here, she said “I’m well aware of the issues the hotel has” -- and let’s face it, it must be tough for her, and it’s so understandable that she was defensive and to her credit.  She clearly cares for the hotel’s reputation.  But when is management going to keep this hotel to the standard that it’s loyal staff deserves much less the clientele?  Make Maria an others not have to defend it, but be proud of it?

The rooms are tired and run down.  The TV is slow to work (the channels take forever to change, for example) and the gym is sub-par - small, outdated equipment wedged into a basement.  I was shocked to read that VegasGalB called it “a great gym” -- she must have very different standards that most people, or perhaps liked that there were three treadmills out of the total of five aerobic machines.  Fair enough.  But it’s dark and cramped.

For exactly the same price, you can go around the corner and get a great hotel room in a hotel that’s far better maintained.  My suggestion to management is to either get this hotel in the condition that it’s price requires, especially given the ample competition (seriously, I just ducked into the nearest hotel to ask their prices and inspect a room and the gym, that’s how I made my decision).  Or drop prices and embrace the tattiness of a party hotel, and not try to sell to business travellers.

title: Nice view but be aware of crazy 'Reserve" charges
text:
The staff were great and my room was modern, clean with a fabulous view.

I hated the fact that they "reserved" $150 a night for incidentals- that would apply for every single night you stay there!   They reserved $780 on my Visa card for a $440 bill and now tell me it will take 7 working days to "unreserved" the amount!  How insane.  I settled my bill in full on my Diners card when I checked out and the receptionist assured me the other charges would be released straight away.   If I had known , I would have booked any of the other hotels I have stayed in over the past few months in NYC and never encountered this ridiculous policy - that includes The Quin, The Intercontinental and The Pearl. Fellow South Africans - please be aware - our currency doesn't stretch far and not having access to your funds for 7 working days can seriously upset your NYC shopping plans!  Would never stay there again for this reason. Other hotels have similar policies but not at this outrages rate.

title: Nice Place
text: The hotel is stylish and modern. My room was large and very comfortable and the neighborhood is a lot of fun with quick access to great restaurants and places to hang out. The staff was courteous and made my stay great, especially Rahul. I would recommend.

title: Addebiti errati sulla carta di credito..
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato presso questo hotel per lavoro per un periodo molto breve,

Aspetti negativi:
Trovandoci presso questo hotel per lavoro e quindi dovendo condividere la camera con colleghi e non familiari o amici, la doccia in vetro satinato ha creato qualche imbarazzo,
inoltre in una camera (non si trovava in tutte) in cui si trovava una piccola tenda per "oscurare" la doccia nel tentativo di chiuderla la struttura della tenda è caduta interamente.

FATTORE NEGATIVO PIù IMPORTANTE:
Durante il soggiorno (e anche a seguito del check out) gli addebiti sulla carta di credito sono stati scaglionati e poco chiari, ricevevamo continue notifiche di addebiti non giustificati e solo a seguito della nostra richiesta delle specifiche dei pagamenti sono stati riscontrati degli addebiti in più che ci sono stati riaccreditati. Poca chiarezza e serietà.

Aspetti positivi:
Le camere sono molto spaziose e arredate in modo moderno e piacevole,
la colazione (non inclusa nel prezzo) molto piacevole.

title: good solid hotel
text: stayed here this week.  i like this chain of hotels.  friendly staff. the neighborhood is just ok. not as nice as Sixty Soho for example. bed is on the floor and i wish it wasnt.  affordable.  good choice for a $200 night hotel if youre ok with taking the cab ride to the places you really want / need to get to.

title: Very nice place to stay.
text: De lobby is not has nice has you can expect for so nice place. The rooms are modern, spicy and Clean. Just the right place to stay. Close to very nice area. Walking distance to every were. I wish we stay longer....

title: Best Hotel Gym
text: I travel frequently for business and always look for a hotel with a gym. Sixty Les has one of the best hotel gyms ever. On the small side, it's packed with everything from cardio to kettle balls to free weights and ropes. The rooms here are wonderful as well and in the summer there's an outdoor pool.

title: Boutique with style
text: This was my third or fourth stay at the Sixty, and this fact speaks for itself. The place is good value for money. some rooms are small but all high quality, good bed, great shower and very clean. Location is good, many good restaurants around and the F train is

title: Big Room, Great Breakfast and Really Nice Staff
text:
Visited NYC pre-Christmas when hotel prices are high but this funky gem proved to be quite a deal. We booked through the hotel and got a big room on a high floor with free breakfast which turned out to be really good.
The staff at every level from the check in to bellman to the breakfast staff was great. Adama, a combo door bellman,  really stood out as well as the breakfast staff in Blue Ribbon.
You get a really big room in a cool hotel in what is a very real neighborhood full of good bars and restaurants. 
Will definitely make this our NYC mainstay.

title: Un po' una delusione: vecchio e  rumoroso ma ottima posizione
text:
Abbiamo scelto quest'hotel per via della posizione, delle recensioni positive e delle foto dell'arredamento sul sito, scegliendo la King Suite per 8 notti. 
Bene, è stata una grande delusione, soprattutto considerato il fatto che pagavamo la nostra suite una media di 350 dollari a notte.
1) Hotel rumorosissimo, unico hotel al mondo in cui le suite sono ai piani bassi e non a quelli alti quindi si sentiva TUTTO ciò che accadeva in strada, va bene che siamo a NY, ma non è che l'insonorizzazione dei materiali a NY non esista. Ma su questo si poteva soprassedere perchè appunto, siamo a NY. Purtroppo però si sentivano anche tutti i rumori ALL'INTERNO dell'hotel, dagli ascensori, al cane di un altro ospite che abbaiava in continuazione, alle porte che si chiudevano
2) Sempre in tema privacy, non ci era stato detto che la nostra suite comunicava con la suite accanto tramite una porta che non siamo del tutto convinti fosse chiusa la prima notte e attraverso la quale si sentiva distintamente ogni parola pronunciata dall'altra parte. Super creepy
3) Le foto dell'arredamento che si vedono su internet sono assolutamente vere, ma corrispondono all'aspetto delle stanze più o meno 10 anni fa evidentemente, perchè i mobili sono rovinati, usurati, sporchi e vecchi. Non è stata fatta alcuna manutenzione, comprese le macchie di umido sul soffitto. Decisamente un brutto effetto che non si riesce a rendere in foto ma che in vivo non è particolarmente piacevole.
4) La camera era essenzialmente sporca. O meglio, la pulizia giornaliera veniva effettuata con una certa accuratezza, niente da dire alle cameriere, il bagno veniva pulito bene etc, ma i vetri erano lerci, c'erano macchie di sporco incrostato sui mobili, gli angoli non venivano puliti da anni, insomma mancava una pulizia generale di base
5) Gli accappatoi forniti sono minuscoli! Andavano bene per una donna di corporatura media, ma non certo per un uomo medio! Inoltre è capitato (non sempre) che gli asciugamani forniti giornalmente fossero sporchi
6) Non scegliete questo genere di stanze per il terrazzo, è sporco, minuscolo e francamente un po' inquietante

Ora i pro
1) La posizione è letteralmente fantastica. Vicinissimo a una fermata della metro F (2d avenue) al confine tra LES, Nolita, East Village, perfetta per muoversi a piedi nella lower Manhattan. Un sacco di nogozietti, locali per bere e posti per mangiare proprio sotto l'hotel, c'è ampia scelta. Zona sicura anche di notte, c'è sempre pieno di gente e di ragazzi che escono.
2) Il personale è sempre stato gentile e disponibile (anche se mi ha stupito che nessuno ci accompagnasse in camera la prima sera, inusuale, ma non è stato un dramma)
3) il bagno della stanza era effettivamente molto bello e grande, con un minilocale per il water, e un'altro per doccia e vasca enormi
4) anche la stanza era effettivamente molto grande per gli standard newyorkesi (sospetto che il costo della stanza sia esclusivamente a pagare questo aspetto)
5) La vista effettivamente è interessante anche se lo sarebbe stata sicuramente di più da un piano più alto (eravamo al 6o piano di 15) 

La connessione wifi è gratuita senza psswd a low speed, costa invece 15 dollari (per mi pare 5 dispositivi) se volete l'alta velocità
Abbiamo avuto un problema con il riscaldamento la seconda sera perchè usciva solo aria calda ma ci hanno mandato un tecnico che ci ha fornito un'efficiente stufetta. Il giorno successivo il riscaldamento non è stato aggiustato ma a fine soggiorno funzionava di nuovo, non è stato tutto sommato un problema perchè ha fatto incredibilmente caldo per essere marzo

title: Fine property and location
text: Very modern and comfortable.  Would stay here again in a heartbeat.  The neighborhood is a good one with lots of options.  The hotel has great staff, and the rooms are truly up to a high standard.  Looking for a reason to go to NYC so I can stay here again!

title: Excellent Stay Great Room Even for a Late Night Arrival
text:
Arrived about midnight, after a long day of travel.  Greeted by a great team, they could tell by the look on my face that I really needed lots of smiles!  Gave me my keys. Took my bag to the room and with my surprise let me know that the Japanese Restaurant and Bar was open until 2am.

Food was great.  Tried some really interest Japanese equivalent of Grapa.  Outstanding will be returning for sure.  Easy cab or train to lower manhattan' financial district

title: High Quality on Lower East Side
text:
Fantastic view of downtown and Freedom Tower from my room on the 10th floor with floor to ceiling windows.
Nicely decorated rooms.
Staff was attentive but yet relaxed. Not too "pushy" as American service sometimes tend to appear for a European.
Small but well equipped gym where you can have a serious workout.
A diverse neighborhood with a mix of hip and genuine places with character where you can wine and dine.
I missed a coffee machine in the room or at least an electric kettle. But that is possible to acquire upon request, I was told when I pointed that out at departure.
The free wifi was not very fast. It was still ok, though. If you want high speed internet you got to pay 15 USD per day.

title: Michael was AMAZING!!
text: There was a mix up regarding my room since I booked through Priceline and Michael was extremely helpful and understanding in accommodating my needs to make the birthday surprise for my mom perfect! He also put a note to make the surprise extra special by sending up a treat. Great service & this is always my GO TO hotel when family comes to visit in NYC. Thanks Michael!

title: Great Stay
text: We stayed overnight at Sixty Les on the lower Eastside while visiting our two sons who live near by and loved it. Very nice staff, beautiful clean rooms and fabulous location near many good restaurants. The grilled cheese place next door is a terrific place for lunch and dinner. We will be back.

title: Dark and Dirty
text:
A principio me pareceu uma boa localização ao olhar pelo mapa,próxima ao Soho e west village.
Depois de fazer a reserva,por ser  ocasião de  difícil de disponibilidade(Fashion Week)e este hotel estar com preço razoável,me arrependi horrores!
Entrada feia,gente esquisita,quarto escuro e no quesito limpeza nota 0.
Alem de tudo tem que ficar de cortina fechada,o prédio bem em frente é um hotel também e tem total visibilidade para o interior do quarto.
Restaurante bem sujo com serviço péssimo.Definitivamente não voltaria!

title: Great location and attentive staff
text:
Booked for a week long business trip.
The hotel is modern and close to many food and drink options. You have Katz Deli, Il Laboratorie del Gelato, The Meatball Shop, etc. You are walking distance to Broadway St if you need to do some shopping. 
I had a room on Allen St on the 15th floor, which had a gorgeous view of FiDi and the Freedom Tower. It does get a bit noisy on the street in the mornings, so if you are a light sleeper, you may want to avoid rooms on that side. I also love that there was adjustable lighting throughout the room, it was dim for the most part though, so definitely not great if you need to work for several hours.
The rooms are reasonably sized and I had no troubles getting on the free wifi. The bathroom amenities are standard - you'll have everything you need. The only complaint I have is that the shower heat settings could not go to a high temperature. I was showering in lukewarm-warm water everyday, which was not ideal. I did ask the front desk to take a look at it, though there was never a follow up.
The gym is actually quite spacious and the equipment seems very new and well kept. It actually seemed like not many guests use the facilities, so you can end up having the gym all to yourself.
I never used the spa and they close off the rooftop for the winter unfortunately, but no complaints there since I had a nice view from my room.
The staff were very attentive at the lobby. I remember coming down with my luggage on my checkout day and getting immediate assistance with it. 
Overall I had a great stay and would love to come back again!

title: Great staff
text:
Great staff, its a middle priced hotel service is 5 star especially the concierge Ben Edwards. complimentary breakfast is serviced to your room if you like.

it feels like an apartment more them a hotel the furniture could be updated soon otherwise all good.

title: Top Hotel NYC
text:
Das Hotel befindet sich in einen sehr aufkommenden Viertel in NYC. Lower East Side. Daher auch der Name LES. Die Gegend ist der Hammer. Man ist in ca. 15min mit der Subway am Times Square und in ca. 15min Downtown. Die Lage ist mehr weder perfekt. Am Abend ist es sehr ruhig und man kann sehr gut schlafen. Das Hotel ist Modern, stylisch und das Personal ist sehr Freundlich. Unbedingt für ein Zimmer in der oberen Etage beten, die Aussicht ist der Hammer!!

Die Subway befindet sich in der gegenüber liegenden Strasse. Coole und Trendige Lokale sind in der Nähe. Wir kehren im Juni wieder in diese Hotel zurück. Und es wird nicht das letzte Mal sein.

title: A really cool hotel in the LES
text: My wife and I stayed here in January and loved our room.   Very modern and beautiful.  We had a great view of the Freedom Tower and the financial district. I would recommend it if you are looking to stay in the Lower East Side.

title: Save your Money
text: Location was great - loved being in walking distance to Soho and Chelsea. The hotel however was so disappointing. From the bizarre bathrooms in the middle of the room with leaking showers to our toilet that broke not once but three times. Service was awful. We booked through Expedia and therefore the Hotel could not offer any direct compensations for the our trouble. So many other hotels in the area for same money or less - would definitely not recommend or go back.

title: Hip, helpful, well located
text: Cool hotel, good rooms, well decorated, feels hip. The thing that sets it apart is the helpfulness of the staff. I'm particularly motivated, however, based on the helpfulness of Raúl, a doorman and concierge. He secured my taxi, pointed me in the direction of a bagel and coffee, watched my bag, and made my departure awesome.  Will definitely stay again

title: Good Lower Eastside hotel
text: Had a 24 hr layover in NYC to visit family. My daughter arranged a stay at a boutique hotel around the corner. This was a recently revamped hotel. Rooms where comfortable and very modern - so much so, it took me 10 minutes to figure out how to turn on the shower ( instructions needed). Bed was soft, linen fresh and staff helped me find my phone!

title: A jem in the Lower East Side
text: I've stayed in many many luxury properties. This one is a "jem" on the Lower east side on NYC. The neighborhood is 1st rate. A ton of great places to eat and see within walking distance. My room was so comfortable and great looking. By far, the best place in the neighborhood. HIGHLY recommended. A cool place indeed!

title: Wish this was the first place we stayed at
text:
Had to book some extra accommodation because our flights got cancelled due to the blizzard. I wish this was the first place we had booked for our stay in NYC. 
Very beautiful and boutique. Clean, super friendly staff with a good restaurant. 
The room was spacious and had an amazing 270 degree view of the city with a corner balcony!! 
Subway station right across the road from the hotel as well!! 
Lots of boutique stores in the area and the cheese grill next door does an amazing toastie

title: Cool hotel, great sushi
text: We had just one night at the SIXTY LES but I was really happy with it. Check in was smooth and quick. They give you a number to text if you need anything. Wifi is free. Our hotel room was small (this is NYC) but had a whole wall of windows with a cool city view. We took the elevator down to the second floor to go to Blue Ribbon sushi. The sushi was delicious and the bartender really cool and friendly. For the price we got, I give this hotel 5 stars. It's a great area for bars, restaurants, Russ & Daughters, etc...

title: Simply brilliant
text: I've now stayed here twice in the last few weeks. Both times the room was spacious with gorgeous floor to ceiling windows and a very nice bathroom. The staff were really friendly and sweet. Awesome downtown location, we ate our way through the neighborhood. Recommend!

title: Chic and Boutique In LES
text: I was pleasantly surprised. Everyone was very professional and polite. The Rooms are adorable, chic, and clean. You can have Sushi Room Service delivered from the hotel restaurant till midnight. Charming Cafes, Wine Bars, and Live music are steps away. Get the real LES experience "as a local" without feeling like a tourist. Attention to detail, personalized service, safe, happening East Village Spot.. Hidden Gem and Downtown Hip. Don't be surprised if you see celebrities.

title: Great location, rooms and reception staff
text:
Stayed at Sixty Les during blizzard Jonas.
If you look for a great rooms at reasonable prices stay at Sixty Les.
Super location close to NoHo, SoHo, Lower East Side and even Washington Square and Union Square. Added bonus is Japanese restaurant Blue Ribbon.
Can highly recommend it!

title: The Perfect Getaway
text:
I had come from a very exhausting (but profitable) trip to California and wanted to treat myself to something nice. I originally booked the King Suite but when I arrived there was a host of problems with my credit card and my reservation had been canceled. I was devastated but then the manager came and offered me what I thought was the Penthouse for a reasonable price (suites were sold out) and I jumped on it from exhaustion.

I was not prepared for the room I got. It was actually the Sixty Loft, the best room in the hotel. The one with the marvelous stone tub and two floors of amazing views. It was all mine for one night and I loved every minute of it. It's obviously a room better suited to 2 or more people but if you have the money to splurge this is where you want it to go.

Quick and efficient room service, an AUX cable for my iPhone to hook up to the sound system. I was able to create for myself a high end dinner setting with ease.

My only con was that it was a little freaky to have the elevator open to a door in place of a hallway. Multiple times my key card would stop working and I'd be stuck on the elevator trying to open the room door while simultaneously trying not to get my hand chopped off by the elevator wanting to close on me. The staff happily fixed my card each time and even went so far as to open my room for me. They were amazing, I guess that is just something you have to get used to. I can not wait to return!

title: Best location and great modern rooms!
text: Loved this hotel a lot. The location is amazing and the rooms are modern / warehouse feel with great amenities. Highly recommend for tourists wanting to soak up the coolest area in Manhattan in my opinion.

title: Snowed in in NYC.
text: We were here during the blizzard. Staff went out of their way to take care of guests. Everyone was kind and caring. We appreciate the lengths to which employees went to get to work. Two minor issues with dining, both handled graciously and quickly. Furnishings are slightly worn (missing plate on light switch, bedside table didn't close properly) and the great bathroom lighting highlights any missed splashes on the dark tile. Luggage racks would have been useful. But the friendly staff more than made up for any minor deficiencies. High floor as requested, but the view was of another hotel.

title: great impression at first stay!
text: we stayed at sixty for a 3 nights after Christmas 2015, this was our first stay in this hotel,and we we're happy with everything .great located,and very satisfied with hotel service and very  friendly and professional person,ours room was beautiful ,gorgeous view!very clean! I can't wait to go back there ..Thanks Adama, Taiwo and Josh and all the team..

title: Nice staff, but VERY run down rooms
text: I hate to say this because the staff is very nice, but our suite was extremely run down. There is dust on the cabinets, worn down couches and exposed lamp wires. We wanted to like this place but were let down, big time.

title: Good impression from a first stay
text:
We stayed at Sixty LES for 6 nights during our last trip to NYC, beginning of January 2016. This was our first stay in this hotel,and we were very happy with our overall experience. The hotel is very well located, in a interesting neighbourhood, near a lot of good restaurants and bars. 

We were very satisfied with all aspects of the hotel services and amenities. First, we were welcomed by a very friendly and  professional personnel, valet parking service and check-in desk. 
Our room was perfect, lot of space and very clean. The view was gorgeous, (we had a King Deluxe room with balcony at 17th floor). 
Doing business with room service was also perfect; quick and efficient. 
We took our breakfast at the hotel , good healthy selections with good friendly service there too. 

Our stay in New York was so good  we decided to extend our stay for one more day (the hotel was a good contributor in this decision). We were able to keep the same room, hotel personnel was very helpful. Thanks to Saphire at the front desk and Steve (manager)…. and all the team. 

For sure next time we go back to New York, we won't search for an hotel, we know where to go...

Alain N.

title: Bad service and noisy
text:
I booked the room through an outside site (Jettsetter) and reserved and pre-paid for a Studio King. When we checked in at 5p the front desk clerk said our room wasn't ready. He said since we booked a Queen Deluxe and the room wasn't ready he would upgrade us to a Studio King. I informed him I booked a Studio King and this was not an upgrade. For whatever reason this was too complicated for him to comprehend and I had to show him my email confirmation that stated the room category I booked. Since the room wasn't ready he offered to buy us a drink at the bar while we waited. A nice gesture however the front desk clerk said it would only be about 20 minutes and he would call me when the room was ready. An hour later, no call, I had to go back down to the lobby and ask for the room which was now ready. 

This was a special occasion and since I could not make any comments on the Jettsetter website I called the hotel ahead of time to confirm. The desk agent said I was confirmed for a Queen Deluxe. I had to correct her, she acknowledged the change and noted that I was requesting a high floor. It was rather frustrating that I had to go through this process twice, once on the phone and in person and not get a high floor as requested. 

The hotel has cement ceilings and hard wood floors so it's very loud due to the lack of sound absorbtion. You will hear everthing in the hallways from you room as well as the floor above you. I live in Brooklyn and I'm used to city noise but this seemed louder than normal. Additionally there was some sort of alarm/notification coming from the hallway all night. 

I will not be staying at your property again or recommending it to others. Thanks.

title: Terrible service
text:
Overall, those at the front desk aren't friendly or helpful - so disheartening because I was really looking forward to my stay. After this weekend here, I won't be coming back. 

 My fiancé and I came here for a mini staycation (we live in Brooklyn) to celebrate our engagement. Similarly to other folks who've provided negative reviews of this place on Yelp and Tripadvisor, we also came across the issue of having been told we were being "upgraded" to a room we had already booked AND had pre-paid for. 

Earlier in the day we had even called to confirm that not only was our room ready, but our request for a high room with a view had been granted. The "upgraded room" we eventually got had no view and was on a low floor where it was really noisy.

Because a room wasn't ready when we arrived at 5pm, we were given a voucher for the bar upstairs - a nice gesture, but unnecessary because we were having to wait for a room we had already booked and paid for AND had confirmed via phone. 

We were also told that our room would be ready in less than 20 min. Clearly the voucher was meant to distract us from the fact that the place didn't have it together because by 6p, our room STILL wasn't ready. 

If you're paying to stay at a location like this, you're hoping to get the most out of your time there - that's hard to do when the room isn't ready until evening. The couch in the room was gross and through the night there was a crazy loud alarm noise. 

Basically - we wish we had read the negative reviews BEFORE booking here because they are exactly the issues we ran into at this location. When interacting with folks at the front desk, there was no eye contact, no friendly service, and it seemed they were annoyed by guests' presence.

title: Recent first stay at this hotel.
text: Typically, when we travel to NYC we stay at the Sixty near Columbus Circle, with excellent results.  This time we decided to try the LES Sixty.  Again, the people, hotel, room service and location were excellent. We particularly enjoyed Eleanor, the concierge, who was very helpful in her suggestions.  The LES was well run in the Sixty tradition.  We highly recommend.

title: Хороший тихий отель
text: Завораживающий вид на ночной NYC, номер небольшой, все необходимое есть, персонал отзывчивый. На нижнем этаже есть ресторан японской кухни, есть бассейн и спортзал. Рядом много мест где можно покушать.

title: Penthouse suite is breathtaking!
text: Our group was upgraded to the penthouse suite on the top floor -- wow. Stunning rooms of the city, there were two elevators that opened up INTO the room. Giant balcony. Huge living room (actually there were 2!) and beautiful bedroom. Great location in the lower east side of NYC! Would highly recommend it for big groups.

title: Not to Shabby!
text: The hotel itself is beautiful inside and out. Very clean and welcoming. The staff couldn't of been anymore friendly, willing to help and patient then they were. Especially the two doormen. The room itself wasn't the one I saw pictures of when I booked on Expedia. It was still very nice, clean, and somewhat close to the pictures Expedia advertised. There were also a few more fees when we checked in then Expedia had included in the total. Overall it was a great stay. The hotel itself was great, and I would blame any issues on Expedia. I had forgotten my necklace an hour or so into our 6 hour drive home, I called right away and didn't hear anything back from them. I Called the day after thinking my necklace was for sure gone by now, but the lady that answered walked upstairs right away to look for it. She found it for me and is mailing it back. I would definitely stay here again. I think I would just want another area.

title: Outstanding Hotel in Lower East Side
text: Gem of a hotel offering outstanding views and large rooms. I wasn't a celebrity (and there  were definitely some at the hotel), but thought I was treated like one. Ask for a high floor facing west for views of downtown at night.

title: Fantastic place
text: My husband and I came here on our honeymoon. When we arrived, they'd upgraded us to a king room with an amazing view of the city, and there was a bottle of champagne on ice for us. The hotel itself is great: in a fantastic spot and right across the road from the subway and in walking distance to soho, little Italy, the village and heaps of great shops on Broadway. The hotel has amazing views and clean, modern rooms, the staff were friendly and helpful and check out wasn't until midday. We had a great experience and I would definitely stay here again!

title: Wonderful location below 14th ST. Very good buy! I would absolutely return!
text:
Room was clean and tidy, sheets were comfortable and towels abundant. The room was also bright and there was very little noise from the street.  There were functional windows that could have been opened if one chose to use them rather than the HVAC (weather permitting).  
I thought this was a wonderful room and location, especially for the price.  I will certainly be back.

title: Nice Stay in the Lower East Side
text:
We booked a room at Sixty LES on a pre-paid website.  It was a nice rate ($180/nt), but was for a room with a queen bed; not adequate for two adults and a kid, so we paid a bit extra for a larger room with two queen beds.  It was still a satisfactory rate. The room was clean and had a view of East Houston and Katz's Deli. The staff was friendly and helpful.  The hotel is very close to attractions such as the Tenement Museum and right around the corner from old time establishments such as Katz's Deli and Russ and Daughters and a few blocks away from Momofuku Noodle Bar. This neighborhood has changed dramatically, since I lived in Manhattan in the 80s and 90s. The discount clothing stores on Orchard Street are mostly gone.

One more thing:  the free wifi worked quite well!

title: Good Hotel
text:
Lovely hotel, nice and clean. Friendly, helpful staff. Area looks a little shabby but I think it's up and coming and quite lively. Nice and central. Would go back.

Didn't get to eat in restaurant with it being new year but looked really nice.

Great views from our 12th floor room.

title: Wonderful hotel.
text:
This is a great hotel in a lively and vibrant location. It is modern, but not at all pretentious and all of the staff were friendly and helpful. We stayed here as part of our honeymoon and the hotel even put chocolates in our room, which was a nice touch. 
We would definitely stay here again!

title: Super hotel
text: Hotel pas trop mal situé, pas loin de china Town et de Broadway. L'établissement est moderne, la chambre était très belle et propre avec la vue sur l'empire State building. Le personnel est très disponible, sympathique et francophone. Merci à Guillaume et Catherine à l'accueil et ainsi qu'a Adama.

title: Excellent séjour au Sixty Les
text:
Très bon emplacement, à proximité immédiate du métro. Chambres (1 Studio king et 1 king deluxe) communicantes très pratiques et très confortables, qui plus est de très belles tailles pour des chambres new-yorkaises.
Ravis de notre séjour et de l'accueil en français. Seuls les petits déjeuners sont lents à être servis en salle.

title: 5 Stars not enough
text: Doesn't get any better than this. Thank you for a great stay and your exemplary service. Your staff could not have been more helpful or kind. Elevators were super fast, our room was quiet and spotless. We will definitely be seeing you again soon!

title: Effortless Fun
text: Staff are all smiles at this spacious, high-design hotel in Manhattan's nightlife epicenter. Quality sushi and cocktails accessible by elevator. Rooms large enough for an impromptu after-party. It's an easy choice for a great weekend.

title: Christmas in NYC
text: Really loved this hotel!  We are foodies and there are so many great spots right out the front door and SOHO shopping and tons more dining options are just a short walk away.  Staff were all super friendly and always had a smile whenever we were coming and going.  Beds were comfy, rooms quiet, decent views from 8th floor, probably better higher up.  Good shower with great products.  Allowed early Checkin and Catherine assisted us with making our reservation and was very accommodating of our requests.  We wanted a real NYC feel for our trip and this hotel and neighborhood did the trick!!!

title: Mike in reservations is the best!
text: I came to NY for work for a short trip, Mike upgraded me and I ended up staying longer! The room he gave me was a corner king with a balcony and I could see all of midtown and downtown. Room service was prompt and easily customized my orders and the front desk helped me track down my missing packages. They made me feel like it was my home away from home.

title: Top notch hotel
text:
Very well located near F train, convenient for shopping and also for off Broadway shows (we went to Stomp, amazing show).
The room are nicely furnished, super view on Freedom tower and Empire state building (ask for room 1400)
Good breakfast, restaurant was nice also, tried it one diner.
Staff very helpful, everything went super nice.
Well maintain hotel.

title: Great hotel excellent location
text: Service 10/10 from very helpful and friendly front of house staff and bell boys. Room with a view and very good location for fashions bars and vibrant night life. Stylish clean rooms, cool rooftop bar, and walking distance to WTC, little Italy, etc. Very reasonably priced and I will most definitely be staying again if I am ever back in NYC!

title: Great hotel
text: We arrived around 2am because we had huge issues with our Airbnb host. We were super frustrated and annoyed. The team here at the front desk though was very welcoming and got us set up with a room very fast. Thank you night crew - Saphire, Denis, Adama. I work in hotels too and the night crew can sometimes (not in my current hotel!!) be a tired etc different but the guys here seemed really up to speed and professional. Also we love the room, nice and big. Really great for the rate we paid.

title: Great Place to stay on a rainy weekend on the LES
text: I stayed in the King Suite which offered plenty of space for separate bed and living space and a decent size bathroom and walkin shower. The decor is post industrial concrete with a chain mail dividing curtain, but it's still super comfortable.  Everything was super clean.  Room service was prompt and served a decent cooked to order steak and fries.  The hotel's got a super chill tiki bar on the fourth floor with friendly bartenders and on the night i was there a random DJ spinning down-tempo caribbean house music.

title: BRILLIANT Place to stay!
text: Just come back from a week in NYC and this hotel was great! Fab location and so close to the tube so we were literally able to cross the road and hop on the tube to wherever we wanted to go. Close to shops and bars! Staff fab and cleanliness was brilliant! Would definitely recommend!

title: Great hotel
text: Good location and the hotel suites are amazing them selves, everything is well designed with a lot of thought put into the design of the rooms. Unfortunately we were only here one night so we didn't get much time in the hotel. Check in and check out was a breeze, staff was helpful with what needed and answered a ton of questions for us.

title: Great Experience
text: Stayed for our anniversary and everything was great. Steve Park, Saphire, and Guium were all very friendly and courteous staff members at the hotel. The bar had a nice view of the Empire State Building. Street parking is easy and plenty of bars within walking distance. Katz Deli is only 2 blocks.

title: Noce hotel on LES
text: We chose this hotel for it's location on the LES. They happily matched a lower rate we found at another hotel and included breakfast, which was a huge plus. Rooms are very small, as is the bathroom, but everything was very clean and modern. The bed is low to the ground, but comfortable and the linens were very soft. Our view was amazing. The lobby is small, yes, but the 2nd floor has a beautiful, large sitting area filled with really comfortable chairs and sofas. Breakfast is served in the restaurant adjacent to the sitting room, and it was really good. Staff overall is very helpful and efficient. An added bonus was the subway directly across the street! Overall, a very nice experience. We will be back!

title: Pre Cruise Cuty Break
text: Great hotel, in a more residential area but this was the perfect location for a second short city break to NYC, close by are dinners and your usual starbucks & Mcd's if your in to all that. Very friendly staff and helpful, nice lounge/bar area. Gym very good and sauna included. The room it self was nice and big floor to ceiling windows and bathroom facilities exceeded expectations.

title: Not too bad. Loud + bed bugs.
text: When we booked this we didn't realise how far out the LES is from the main 'attraction' area. It's about 45min walk to everywhere we went, so keep that in mind. The staff were very lovely and we were upgraded to the highest floor (below penthouse) which was great!..... Up until the penthouse was having a party/event. The room shook, and the music was blasting until about 4am, I called and complained but I guess not much was/could be done as I think it was a pre planned event. As we were getting up at 7, being awake still at 4am from the noise was very aggravating... Free wifi was a  plus with this hotel. Even though we were high up, street noise was still very loud. Though, it is New York! Not too bad really. It was clean and pretty with great views. Though, as I was warned about with NY, I did leave with bed bugs :-/ ... 3/5 stars.

title: What  a view from my spacious luxurious room
text: A five night stay at SixtyLES was a wonderful way to experience New York City. From the upbeat neighborhood of the Lower East Side, to the friendly, courteous and helpful service and the comfortable and well appointed rooms, I really couldn't find anything to complain about. Small things like an umbrella provided in my room  (really handy on a wet New York day), the toiletries provided and the exceptional view from my 14th floor room, I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Friendly attentive staff. But disappointing facilities and ambiance
text:
I travel to NYC a lot and I usually stay at hotels in the midtown area or around Times Square. This time around, I decided to check out the Lower East Side and picked the Sixty based on the pictures and descriptions on their website and reviews on tripadvisor. 
Based on what was shown on their website I was expecting a chic, modern hotel, with a trendy ambiance, nice bars and a large, happening lobby seating for socializing. I was terribly disappointed that the hotel did not live up to the pictures on their website. For the same room rate charged by the Sixty, one can fine other hotels in midtown, greenwich or times square that offer bigger rooms and more lively ambiance. The hotel is located on a small side street and you will almost miss the entrance to the hotel if you are not carefully looking out for it. The lobby area is tiny (felt like less than 300 square feet) and dimly lit. The lobby staff is friendly and attentive. The room I stayed in was tiny compared to  the rooms in hotels such as Marriott (times sq) and Novotel. the decor in the room was nice and I liked the modern bathroom with rainforest showers). The walls are soundproofed well and I could hear conversations happening in the next room and street traffic. The "rooftop bar" as advertised on their site isn't really a rooftop bar since it is located on the 7th floor. The  bar is in a closed room (on has to open a door to enter the bar and the inside of the bar is not visible unless you open the door) and the city views from the bar are good but not spectacular. Given the abundance of popular dive bars in the LES area, the bar at the hotel was almost empty on two of the three nights I stayed there and on   a thursday night, it was filled with a huge crowd of what looked like freshmen from NYU. 
I did not try the Sushi restaurant or the breakfast since there were other nicer places in the neighborhood. If you are into listening to live music or clubbing, the hotel is close to a bunch of popular LES dive bars and clubs (mostly filled with NYU students and hipsters). Overall, while my stay was pleasant, I was expecting a more lively and happening hotel full of chic upscale travelers and revelers. If you are a couple, family or a business traveler looking for a quiet hotel then this is the place for you.

title: Amazing Honeymoon stay
text: We booked the hotel in January this year in preparation for our honeymoon and we were definitely not disappointed. We were greeted on our arrival by friendly and helpful staff. We were promptly shown to our room and our bags followed shortly. We were amazed by the room which we had; it was fresh, clean and the size was more than adequate. The view of the city from the balcony was amazing and the skyline varied on a nightly basis with the view of the Empire State. The staff were aware of the occasion which we were there for and they very kindly provided us with a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolates, which was very much appreciated. On our first full day, we had lots of questions regarding our location and different places of interest which we planned to visit during the week. Both Elanor and Ben were very knowledgeable and nothing was too much trouble for them. The location of the hotel was great, the F line on the subway was very convenient and we were able to visit places of interest very easily. The rooms were visited daily by housekeeping and they also did a brilliant job.  We would like to say thank you to all of the staff who looked after us during our visit; Ben, Elanor, (Concierge) Conise, Josue, Josh, Adama, Camise, Taiwo- you truly helped to create many memories during our honeymoon that we shall treasure forever.

title: This is how you're supposed to feel when you travel
text:
First, the one warning:
Careful when logging onto Wifi, they don't make it super clear when you are paying for high-speed service vs. free service.

Now, the review:
Really first class service here. Everyone we interacted with bent over backwards to make sure we had a fabulous experience. Shout out to Christina Pisani who helped us book. I'm going to ask for her every time now. Our room also had a balcony with one of the best views of Manhattan I had ever seen, and I've been to many a rooftop bar in New York over the years.

I've stayed here twice now for work and though it is a bit further away from the office, I think it's worth it. I like that there is a gym in the basement, a great sushi restaurant on the second floor, a really trendy tiki-themed bar on the seventh floor, and stunning views from all of the front-facing rooms above the fifth floor or so.

Make sure to ask for a room with a view if available.

title: a little underwhelmed
text: We stayed at sixty les on a 3 night stay in new york. The customer service couldn't really be faulted other than ahen we asked on our last day if any arrangements could be made for breakfast on our last morning as we had an early start. Breakfast started at 7am and we had to leace by 6.30, I asked if they could provide anything for us to eat prior to leaving - fruit or bread and preserves. The receptionist told us it wouldn't be necessary as breakfast started at 6am?? So at 6am the following morning we went down for breakfast only to find it didnt open until 7.00!!! I would have preferred them to be honest and say they couldn't do anything so we could then have gone out a little earlier to get something locally. The room we had was quite small with minimal storage for clothing and nowhere  to store the cases, lighting in the room could be better too. Think we would definately look for alternative accommodation if we return to new york.

title: Amazing start to our honeymoon.
text: We have just had a wonderful three night stay here to start off our honeymoon!! Large comfy room, great bed and shower, really clean and tidy!! The staff are so friendly and helpful. There is a great little gym and we found the location just brilliant for our stay and for access from and to the airport! Just perfect!! Would highly recommend and the prices are very sensible too!!

title: Incredible Attention to Detail - Best Team In New York City
text:
A beautifully presented contemporary hotel situated within the heart of the new New Yorkers favourite haunt; The Lower East Side, Nolita, Noho, Soho, China Town, Little Italy and West Village are all close by. 

Back to the hotel; the front desk, concierge team and management are some of the best I've ever had the pleasure to meet. Without them, Sixty LES would be just any other hotel. Thank you for your smiles and making my wife and I feel at home in your beautiful City.

title: Every Expectation Fulfilled
text: Pick a topic:  location, service, food, decor.  60 LES met my expectations in every category.  Dozens of restaurants of all cuisines within a two block radius.  The New Museum three blocks away.  The entire lower east side just outside the door.  Friendly staff that answered all my questions before I could ask them.  A fabulous breakfast inside the izakaya.  Beautifully arranged, decorated and maintained sleeping rooms with rain forest showers.  Everything you would expect in a luxury property at a price point a tad less than you might expect.

title: Overpriced for my tiny 'Luxury Room'
text:
Although I do like the location of this hotel (in walking distance to many shops and restaurants), the hotel room did not meet our expectations.  I've stayed in NYC many times and normally we stay on the Upper East Side, but decided to venture out because we always end up on the Lower East Side anyway.  

I didn't have a problem with the price, however....for the price you do not get what we are normally used to getting.  The room was super super tiny.  I should have looked at the square footage.  Had I realized how small it was, I would have upgraded to a bigger room.  The fact that such a small room even exists in a 'luxury hotel' is just outrageous.   Had I not been extremely tired from a business trip and if i was staying more than  two nights I would have either tried to get a bigger room or gone to another hotel. That is how tiny the queen room is.

We did not dine in the restaurant except for breakfast (which was quite good).

One of the nights we came back from dinner, there was a party going on in the Penthouse that was not going so well.  There was about 10+kids in that tiny lobby complaining and threatening to call the police.  Again, not what I expect from a luxury hotel.  

I won't be staying here again.

title: Fantastic hotel - and it got even better!
text:
What a great location this is - we discovered a whole new side of New York after so many trips in midtown and uptown previously. There are so many cool bars and restaurants within a short walk that you will be spoilt for choice !

We were incredibly lucky for our stay and were upgraded to one of the penthouses - wow ! What a way to spend a couple of nights with views of the entire city. 

The concierge and front desk were great and we were never left wanting for anything.

title: perfekte Ausgangslage NYC
text: 6 Nächte - perfekter Service - tolle Lage - cooles Design - fantastisches Restaurant - zentral - gut organisiert - also alles, was man haben möchte, wenn man einen Citytrip nach NYC plant. Genügend Restaurants und Frühstücksplätze in direkter Nähe. Viele Hotspots der LES in unmittelbarer Reichweite.

title: Just lovely - perfect location - nice people
text:
Perfect for families with teenagers  - Nice room size - great bar and lovely people .
Location is perfect if you like more relaxed experience. Mott and Elisabeth street just around the corner. Cleaning could be better but otherwise great service.

title: The Noisiest Hotel I Have Ever Stayed In
text:
I have never heard this amount of slamming doors and toilet flushes in my life! I am not exaggerating when I say there were slamming doors early in the morning. And also toilet flush noises and people walking up and down the hallway every 5 minutes from 7am in the morning.

I do not know who designed the hotel rooms but if I am the owner, I would ask my money back. The problem is the rooms has no carpets and the ceiling is bare concrete. Also, the bed is very, very low to the floor. So if you are want some peace during the day, do not stay here. 

Additionally, the furniture are very worn out, and it definitely 'compliments' the unfinished look. For the price that I pay, I really expect something better. This hotel has all style but no substance. 

Another issue not mentioned here by most reviewers is that the showers have frosted glass. Not a problem for me, but I'd imagine this won't be a hotel you want to stay with your grandpa. 

I don't think the service has really anything to rave about, honestly. Aside from the Asian manager on duty, most staffs are clearly inexperience. I don't have issues but my email correspondence with the front desk prior to my arrival is downright a joke. Again, they are overly concerned with image, but not too concerned with substance. 

Just a 'meh' for me.

title: Old Aussies Come To Town
text: My husband and I stayed about 12 days in Sixty LES. Our son, who lives around the corner, recommended it to us. It was my husband's first visit to NYC and I really wanted him to enjoy himself. We did! The staff were friendly, efficient and didn't mind our strange requests. We arrived early (8.00am) and had a shower in the spa downstairs. By the time we had managed that our room was ready. It was quite large for NYC and had a full length window at one end. We had two very comfortable double beds (they are not too low) and the bathroom was large. It was very sleek NYC style and in good condition with only a few things a little worn (the floor covering had lifted near the bathroom). Yes the bathroom and toilet are all translucent glass but you only see vague, pink blobs.   Because we were there so long we got room service to clear everything out of the fridge and we stocked up on nice cheese, olives etc from Essex Street markets and Wholefoods, a block away. There was a wine shop just around the corner. You can order tea from room service but after two days we spent about AU$60 just for tea.They don't provide a kettle for making it so we bought a cheap one and some 'proper' tea and made it ourselves. The hotel staff didn't seem to mind and helped out in any way they could. We had breakfast a couple of times at the hotel. Nicky, who worked in the restaurant was extremely informative about the area and where to eat etc. There are so many great places to eat in LES we were spoiled for choice (try the Remedy Diner). Josue, Kiat, Melissa and Ben on the front desk were all kind and helpful and the doormen flung open the doors every time we entered and greeted us with a warm welcome home.We aren't the typical guests. We are in our 60s and 70s, well traveled and yes, pretty fussy but we had a great time thanks to the wonderful staff and the comfortable hotel.Thanks Sixty LES!

title: The Best Hotel Experience in NYC
text:
I stayed in many hotels in NYC and it is not an exaggeration to say that this was the best hotel experience I've ever had so far. 

Room was beautiful and spacious. They have the most trendy bar and restaurant as well - Tiki Tabu and Blue Ribbon Izakaya. Convenient location, subway station just one block away. Service was impeccable, staff were very attentive and super friendly - thank you Eric the bellman, Shabina at Front Desk, and the manager Steve! 

Could not ask for more. My parents and I are looking forward to returning!

title: Sehr gute Lage, nettes Personal
text: Das SIXTY LES liegt sehr günstig als Ausgangspunkt um die Lower East Side zu entdecken und darüber hinaus direkt an der U-Bahn Station Station 2 Avenue, sodass man schnell auch up- oder downtown zu allen Sehenswürdigkeiten kommt. Das junge Hotel Personal ist sehr nett und an Hotelgast interessiert. Wenn man ein Zimmer zur Straße hinaus hat, sieht man auf der einen Seite das Empire State Building und auf der anderen Seite den Freedom-Tower, was will man mehr! Die Zimmer sind geschmackvoll und modern eingerichtet.

title: Fantastic service!
text: Nice hotel. Superb service! Everyone went out of their way to preempt our every need.  Special hats off to Raul.  The design is stylish, clean, and modern.  The rooms were quite large, especially for NYC. My one complaint was with the bed. Not super comfy and way too low to the ground. It kind of felt like the mattress was on the floor.  The pillows and linens were great though, and otherwise I loved my stay there.

title: Good Hotel - GREAT Front Desk Service
text:
I got in very late and hit a snafu with my work-related booking, and John D. at the front desk was incredibly, incredibly helpful and patient. He worked through all kinds of solutions with me and even spoke to my company's travel agency on my behalf. He was warm, reassuring and did everything he could to make an annoying process (not his/the hotel's fault!) easier on me.
