Crystal was super helpful the next day, as well, getting my account settled really quickly. Lovely people.

As for the hotel itself, the beds are a bit stiff and the sound of the crying babies next door unfortunately really carried/kept me up (thin walls? no carpet to absorb?), but otherwise a very sleek room!

title: Very nice and trendy hotel!
text: Trendy and nice hotel. The rooms are nice. Good location, a subway station and city-bikes just across the street, and easy to get a taxi. Nice bar and a sushi restaurant. 24/7 gym and a sauna. Nice staff.

title: Stunning rooms and welcoming staff
text:
We had a lovely stay at Sixty Les. Our room was lovely. Super Clean. Great location.
Delicious Chocolates left for us each night after the bed was turned down and a box of 4 chocolates the night before we left.
We had a high floor so it was quiet and to be able to look out of the full length windows to watch the snow falling was beautiful. 
Fast check in and fast check out.
We would definitely stay again.

title: In Hipsville, The Lower East Side, Manhattan
text: Very groovy area- now- when I lived in NY in the 70's,80's it was The Bowery and you went there on your way to Brooklyn or Queens...but its the 21st Century and the LES is happening and one of the happening hotels is Sixty LES. I recently stayed in Sixty Soho which I enjoyed to the hilt so I thought I would give one of their other City hotels a try. It's stylish, moderne and reflects the hipster environment you are located in. I liked the personnel and had some sushi and a hi ball in their lounge up on the mezzo level. I had to wait for my room for a wee while ( it was 4 30) so the cuffed me a few drinks which I appreciated. Once in my room I was pleased with the view of The LES  and The Freedom Tower and the surrounding environs. Comfortable bed and a very nice W.C. All in all a pleasant stay - it was pricey but Fashion Week and The US Open were in swing so rooms were dear.

title: Overly concerned with image, not concerned with substance
text:
If you're simply looking for a clean place to stay on the lower east side, 60 LES is fine. Do not, however, expect superb customer service or hospitality from the staff. I have stayed here several times and have never been impressed. I am involved in the hospitality business, so I tend to be very discerning and vigilant in terms of customer service when I travel, and this place simply doesn't meet my expectations for the price you pay to stay here. In most interactions I've had with front desk employees here, they have been dumbfounded with any complaints that require any sort of ingenuity or creativity to deal with... If it's not a scenario right out of their training handbook they just tell you there's nothing that can be done, even if there is a relatively easy solution available if they decided to spend an extra five minutes doing some work.

I've stayed here four times simply due to the convenience of it's location for me, and the fact that they often have availability with relatively short notice. I do not think that I will be coming back again-- every time I come here there's just some sort of aggravating interaction that I have with the front desk employees, where I feel as if I could come over the desk and figure out a solution for the issue at hand by myself, while they simply stand there with an indifferent look on their face and apologize for the 'fact' that nothing can be done.

There has never been an insanely offensive interaction or anything of the sort, and the rooms are clean and nice, but as someone who gets really peeved by subpar service, especially at hotels that are by no means 'cheap', it's just too aggravating staying here... Bottom line is that I think my title for this review sums up this place pretty well-- they are trying to be some trendy independent hotel on the Lower East Side, and they just take it too far in terms of trying to hold that image of cool nonchalance, when really what they could use more than anything is some substance and dedication behind their front desk staff, instead of the type of attractive, but indifferent employees you see all too often at places like these...

I would recommend the Ludlow a couple of blocks down for a better overall experience in this neighborhood, if you can swing it. I enjoyed it the one time I stayed there; and in my few encounters with the front desk staff and bellmen they were excellent. The bar is lovely, too.

title: 5 stars for sure
text: I had read many reviews prior to our stay at Sixty LES and all offer tips to request a room on a higher floor for better view and noise level, so this is what i did through email. When i checked in however, it appears there were no rooms on the higher floors available so we had to stick with the given room on the 9th floor right above the "rooftop" bar. I thought it was going to be a huge downside but once we stepped into the room, it didnt even matter! the view was GORGEOUS and im sure it would have been nicer being higher, but we had a corner view with clear shot of the freedom tower and to the right was the empire state building. At night, we did hear a little commotion and music coming from the bar but nothing too crazy though im sure there are nights when it could be much rowdier. Overall, the room was spacious, clean (we came back every day to a freshly cleaned room), beds comfy, top notch amenities and room service was quick. The only thing i didnt understand about room service is that they already automatically charge the 20% tip however, when signing the receipt, it gives you an option for ADDITIONAL tip which is weird but i guess that is the standard for NY. anyway, blue ribbon sushi was amazing (and extremely overpriced IMO), drinks were nice and strong but even if nothing else went well, the view alone was worth it with floor to ceiling windows. Going to sleep and waking up to that view took the cake! Outstanding hotel. Definite recommend!

title: Nice Hotel and nice staff
text: Clean rooms and very helpful staff. Great location with noumerous restaurants and bars nearby. Make sure to get a high floor room, with magnificent views of the skyskrapers Downtown. Thanx to Melissa, Crystal, Roul, Christian and Jouse and the rest of the team at Sixty LES:)

title: Big room for NYC
text: The hotel was chic, the people were nice and there was ALOT of space for a room in New York.  The bad part about this hotel is the walls are thin.  We could hear every toilet flush and people walking up and down the stairs.  It was not horrible, but it was distracting.  Besides, that the location is great (next to Katz, awesome) and it was clean.  It was a good deal for NYC and I would stay there again if the rate was lower than other hotels.

title: Room with a View!!!!
text: Really enjoyed our two nights stay at SIXTY LES - only complaint is we didn't book longer... great pool area (it was HOT when we were in town)  - although you need to get there early to bag a bed on a sunny day - pool area opens at 10am.  Great poolside service / food - quite a party atmosphere and gets pretty crowded so perhaps not the best if you want some R&R (although not sure why you'd be looking for that in NYC!).  We were lucky enough to be allocated room 1700 - the reception staff told us the view was better then that of the Penthouse... it was incredible - dual aspect windows and a balcony that went around both sides of building provided an exceptional view of Mid-town, Financial District and everything in between.  Hotel and rooms finished to a good standard.  We weren't there long enough to sample onsite restaurant.  Briefly made the bar which was lively, good buzz.  Overall, would highly recommend - ask for 1700!  Never one to return to hotels but would seriously consider it.  Plus, good location - better then Mid-Town!

title: FRONT DESK NOT SO WELCOMING
text:
I stayed at this hotel for one night and was extremely disappointed.  I reserved a King Deluxe room because I saw that they had balconies.  I called the hotel to double check and was told that yes, all King Deluxe rooms had either shared or private balconies.  I requested for a private balcony.  Upon checking in, I was told that I was upgraded to a Studio King as no King Deluxe rooms were available. The Studio Kings did not have balconies. I explained that I requested for a King Deluxe with a private balcony, specifically because of the balcony.  The woman at the Front Desk seemed to be offended that I didn't want the upgrade.  I explained that it wasn't about the room size but the balcony.  They offered me a higher class room with a balcony, but was asking me to pay an additional $250.  Unfortunately, I didnt get the name of the girl.  Her supervisor also came over and both of them made me the same offer, I take the upgrade or I pay $250 for a room with a balcony.  I explained again, that I never wanted the upgrade, I chose the hotel and the room because I wanted the private balcony.  This whole discussion went round and round until finally, exhausted from a day of travelling, I just took the room they were offering.

Not all guests will jump at an upgrade, sometimes we want the room we reserved because of the features that it offers.  Dont make us feel like we owe you for upgrading us, especially when we didnt ask for it.

Furthermore, I think that they "discriminate" against plus sized guests or maybe they're just saving money.  I am a size 14 and the robe was a size 8 at best and were way too short  The towels are short and were barely long enough to wrap around me and were rough and seemed of low quality.  For the price of the rooms, you would think they'd have enough left over to have bigger size robes made? What do male guests do?

title: Extraordinary service
text: Everything you would expect in a contemporary, mid-range/upscale hotel but the service is beyond any expectations. Beautiful minimalist design and comfort. Staff has fantastic knowledge of the city and goes out of their way to really make sure you are taken care of. Raul, especially ... above and beyond. He actually lent us is Metrocard and saved us from getting gouged by the parking garage.

title: Short stay, but extremely happy with hotel staff
text: I have never stayed in a hotel where all the hotel staff, actually cares about you. We have travelled all over and have never been treated so well. We had a minor problem on our first night here, and it was addressed immediately. The Sixty Les is located away from the over crowded time square area. It is located in the very hip area of the lower east side of Manhatten. We are not hip nor young, but really enjoyed our stay. Lots of restaraunts nearby as well as shopping. We booked a balcony room, which I highly recommend. Our first room was lovely but could not accommodate our large suitcases. (We were on our way to Ireland for 2 weeks) we were upgraded the next night to a studio King, which is superb! I will have more to say, along with pictures, but I wanted to do a short review before we left on our next adventure. Trust me, stay out of Times Square and check this area out.

title: Really nice hotel
text:
Location is great as there is a subway station at the corner of the street and you find some bars, restaurants and shops in the area, but nothing really big, which is good as it 's a rather quiet area.
Reception is really nice and stylish. Personnel is very nice and helpful.
Our room was spacious for NYC standards and the view...was amazing!!!
Bed is okay, wifi is good and bathroom is very good.
They have a pool on the 3rd floor, which is nice to sit and relax a bit.

title: "Stunning!"
text:
We stayed in the Sixty LES from 20th September until 25th September.
Just to let you know, I´m working in a travel agency and know a lot of excellent Hotels.
The Sixty LES was amazing in every part and every detail.
The Check-In was more than friendly and we had on of the most beautiful rooms I´ve ever seen.
The Concierge Melissa helped us with every special request and questions - thank you so much Melissa!
The view from our room was fantastic and we had great sunsets.
When we came back from our daily trips the curtain was closed (due to the sunsets and the low Windows) so the air wasn´t that hot and muggy .
The Service was perfect and so lovley - we will definitively come back!!!
Thank you Sixty LES for that great week!

title: Great, friendly customer service
text: The hotel is beautiful, fun and in a great downtown location, but the kind and attentive staff really set this hotel apart.  The rooms are clean and beautiful; the beds really comfortable. There are many fun bars and restaurants nearby, but the hotel's tiki bar and sushi restaurant are fantastic. Also, just two doors down from a great coffee shop - perfect for the first thing in the morning. Can't wait to go back!

title: Perfect in every way
text:
Sixty LES is perfectly located, the subway is 2 mins away and everything else is at your doorstep. 

We stayed in a Studio King for 8 nights, having the extra space for this long(ish) stay was great. The rooms were stylish and clean, the bed really comfortable.  

The staff were really lovely. The doormen where really friendly. 

This place is a must stay. It was nice to be in an area that was not overrun with tourists. 

Make sure you end your day at the tiki bar, with a cocktail looking back over the city.

title: Super cool hotel with great service
text:
We stayed here during freezing New York weather but were always welcomed back warmly by the team. 
Our room was spacious, very comfortable and looked great. 
Fantastic location in one of my favourite parts of NYC. Close walk to subways and eateries. 
Would love to return one day to experience the roof top when it's not covered in snow!

title: Sixty LES has the best staff of any hotel in downtown NYC
text: we stayed 17 days in a king suite terrace with spectacular city views, the in house Blue Ribbon Sushi restaurant is beyond compare as one of the best Japanese eateries in NYC... all that was really good.. but was was Great was the staff... Front Desk, Doormen, room service/back of the house were all so incredibly friendly and helpful. Would like to give a personal shout out to Canise at the front desk who was so friendly, personable, and had the most excellent customer service skill in the business.  She worked efficiently and diligently to make sure our stay was a success and went above and beyond to help us extend our stay.  Another shout out to door guys Adama and Eric, the service they provided as doormen was above and beyond! When we were checking out Adama was so kind to run and get a bottle of water for us while waiting for our Uber.  Such great customer care!  So good we are heading back less than a month later for another /shorter/ stay and Sixty LES was our first choice thanks to the staff.

title: Lovely property, great locatio, very expensive
text:
What a fantastic place, very clean and the staff are very friendly.  The location is amazing and the place comes alive at night. We also used the pool which is a fantastic way to cool off in an otherwise hot city.
The bed and bathroom were great, I have nothing bad to say about the property.  It was very expensive that is the only downside, but NYC is expensive.

title: Most considerate, kind and energising hotel team
text:
I can't rate these guys highly enough. Everything from booking the rooms, to extra pillows, to organising trips and just general kindness every time we came in and out of the hotel. I got really sick in New York and spent 6 days in hospital and when I came back the whole staff were super conscious of making me feel comfortable and looked after. 

They made our holiday so wonderful. Even though it could have been ruined with the hospital time. 

The rooms are large, the king beds are super comfy, showers and aircon all good. The view was magnificent - highly recommend king deluxe corner rooms with balcony. Clean, well looked after, if you're kind to the crew, they're kind to you back - it's simple. 

I didn't want to leave.

The food we tried was amazing. From the pancakes they organised for the morning of my partners birthday to the sushi platter from Blue Ribbon - all beautiful. 

Thank you team - Really feel sad to leave. But will come back. Just hope you're all still there when we do.

title: Amazing Hotel!
text: Well...where shall I start! What an amazing hotel. We were travelling to New York as part of our 3 week honeymoon and had emailed the hotel a few months back asking if it was possible if we could have a room higher up as we had seen from the reviews to enquire with the hotel. We were so amazed to be on the 17th floor in a corner room with an amazing view of the city through the wall of floor to ceiling windows. Such a treat! You get to see the most amazing sunset also. The hotel also very kindly brought up a bottle of champagne for our honeymoon! We went to the Tiki bar on 7th floor on our last evening for a few early evening drinks which is a great setting with views overlooking the city. I was quite disappointed that i requested a mojito being told we could order any cocktail we like but the bar didn't have any mint so couldn't make one for me. I still find it a little hard to believe that there was no mint anywhere in the hotel (i.e. restaurant etc!) but it wasn't a big deal. The lower east side is a great area to stay. Myself and my husband had both been to New York on several occasions and had always stayed near midtown so it was great to stay somewhere without the tourists and more local. Being from London we absolutely loved the area - with so many cute bars and restaurants on your doorstep to choose from. It was a perfect area for us in our late twenties/early thirties and would recommend it to anyone of a similar age or prefers being out the way a bit. There is a subway station across the road and it's easy to walk around so absolutely no problems with getting around. We will definitely be back to stay at Sixty LES!!

title: 6 day visit to NYC
text:
We arrived here for 6 days as part of our honeymoon.  As soon as our taxi pulled up the doorman was already waiting to help with our cases and was very friendly.   I had emailed beforehand asking for a high floor with a great view since it was a special trip and as soon as we arrived our check in clerk advised they had received this had given us a 17th floor room! Wow fantastic views towards the financial district and we could also see the Empire state building (just).  They also left us a bottle of champagne in our room to celebrate, great touch.  
Every day the staff were all smiling and very helpful.  Room cleaned every day and chocolates left on our pillows every night.  
When leaving they stored our cases and without asking the doorman offered to arrange our taxi back to the airport for us.  
The hotel is out the way of the main tourist hustle and bustle but loads of great restaurants and bars around and a quick walk away from Soho / Chinatown etc so that suited us.  
Would recommend!

title: Hip Hotel In Lower East Side
text:
If i was to recommend a friend visiting NY it would definitely be to stay in Lower East Side, it's the trendy side to NY. 
Sixty LES is a stand out in the area and has the cool factor feel to it.

Hotel is in great location with amazing restaurants and bars a stone's through away.
 
We had an amazing room with a balcony with views of One World & Empire State. The room itself was spacious and has a great bathroom with a bath and a shower. 
I cant give the hotel the full 5 stars due to fact that walls are SO THIN ! One night the people next door must of got home at 4am and it honestly sounded like they were sitting in our room. 
Overall a fab hotel with great service and i would come back.

title: GREAT EXPERIENCE @ Sixty LES NYC
text:
I stayed at the hotel from 09/18/15 thru 09/21/15 and as always had a wonderful experience. I love the entire staff; From Kenise's great energy at check in, Eric being the BEST Bellman, and my personal favorite person at the hotel sexy Mr. Derrick, who holds it all the way down, on all levels.  Shout out to other friendly and helpful hotel staff: Josue, Joshua and Crystal. See you guys all again soon!

xx NAILAH HOLLIDAY

title: Trendy hotel
text: This is a trendy hotel, located in a less crowded neighbourhood. Subway is a 3 minute walk and many restaurants are close by. The staff was very friendly and gave us a warm welcome. Our room was spacious and most of the rooms have a nice view. The bathroom was better then average and our bed was very comfortable. Highspeed internet was included and worked well. If you wanna stay in a not so crowded area with good connections this is a nice place to be.

title: WONDERFUL!!
text:
We can't say enough about this fantastic hotel!  The staff alone were just so kind and helpful; Raul, Ben, Melissa, Lia and Crystal to name a few, but EVERYONE was great.
The hotel is beautiful and very clean and in a very "hip" and cool location; very low key; not in the crazy hustle and bustle like Times Square, but so close to everything.  If you are looking for a very modern, yet more laid back location, this is for you.  We had a beautiful view of the city from the 17th floor.  And once again, the staff will do anything for you and help with everything.  STAY HERE!! IT IS GREAT!!!

title: Can't wait to come back!
text: I recently stayed at Sixty LES with some friends and couldn't have asked for more! Beautiful spacious rooms, comfortable beds, excellent bar (with beautiful skyline view on the balcony), sushi restaurant and amazing pool area. The best thing about this hotel is the service, everyone is so friendly and welcoming and can't do enough for you. In particular our doorman Rahoul! The location is in a less touristy part of NYC which was perfect for us and plenty of cool cafés, bars and restaurants near by. I will definitely back and highly recommend to anyone looking for a funky boutique style hotel with personalized service.

title: Great hotel, great staff!!!
text:
We enjoyed our stay at Sixty LES and found the staff to be very helpful. The hotel itself is immaculate with great rooms.

The area the hotel is located in is great for nightlife although anyone who has not visited the LES may take a few hours to find their feet. Once you do there are a host of really cool bars and eateries nearby as well as a very handy Subway station. If you don't feel up to the Subway theres always plenty of Taxis and the reception staff are only too happy to help you get one. Great base if you want to explore the city by day and have fun after dark.

title: 10 Days in NYC
text:
Stayed for ten days with my wife and daughter. This is the place to be for fun, great service and attentive care. Great rooms and bars and restaurant with the bonus of a pool.Everything is on hand restaurant and bars are quirky and cool.
All the staff were great but one stood out, Sasha was what every regular hotel user needs, a leader who listens and then effects changes to make your stay fantastic, thanks Sasha.

title: Interesting, boutique style.
text: Great location, interesting neighborhood, fantastic bar/live music venue next door...good place for those loving the hipster thing.  Rooms on the small side, nicely appointed but be aware that the room categories may be not what you think.  We booked a queen double...and got only one bed...the hotel then gave us a room with a king and a pull out.  It was ok but a bit disappointing....triple check the room before you book! ! would recommend this hotel, despite this issue.

title: Disappointing
text:
Sixty LES was our final stay in a three state visit, we left new York until last as have been 3 times previously and wanted to finish on a high. After alot of research we chose this hotel as we wanted to explore the LES and the chance of a balcony was perfect for my partner who likes to have fresh air. Prior to arrival there were a few issues that concerned me firstly an email was sent to everyone who had booked, showing all guests names and dates of stays, secondly I was sent an email offering a paid upgrade to a room I had already booked!!! perhaps I should have had a rethink at this point. I emailed the hotel to see if there was any chance of an early check in as we were on the red eye from San Francisco and was told it would depend upon occupancy, which is fair enough and only to be expected.
We arrived at 10am and were checked in by a very nice lady, who was apologetic that the room wasn't ready but we could go to the pool and she would come and get us if room was ready before three, at three we went back to reception and another lady told us our room would not be ready until 4, by this point being very tired and beginning to be a bit fed up, we were given 2 drinks vouchers and went to wait in the bar, back to reception at 4... another lady and still no room, deep breaths and lots of assurances that the room would be worth the wait and housekeeping wanted it to be spotless, don't get me wrong all very pleasant and not front desks fault, but we just wanted our room and a shower, finally at 5 we got our room, now here is where I wanted to say we were blown away by the amazingness of it all....OK the view Awesome, the room OK, the balcony a mess, dirty, impractical the door was soo heavy and opened on to the balcony, neither of us felt safe on it, if it hasn't been cleaned for months (see pictures) when was it last maintained? But the room was like I said OK and you are in an amazing area of NYC so the rest of our stay was fine, all the staff we encountered were friendly, we didn't eat in the hotel purely as there was so many other places in the area to try, so this is where my review should have ended possibly with 3 or 4 stars. however on our 2nd to last afternoon we went to the pool, which is very nice, only to return to our room for the key not to work, so I went to the front desk to be told by a man infront of other guests that both my cards had been declined and he had decided to lock us out of the room as he hadn't been able to contact us, so feeling embarrassed and furious, I went back to the room to tell my partner, get our cards and go back to reception. Again he told us and anyone in the vicinity that both our cards had been declined, he spoke to us like idiots like we didn't understand, yet we knew one card prepaid, had been authorised for the stay and another for the incidentals, both of which had adequate balances. We suggested he tried the credit card again, which miraculously now was fine and explained that the prepaid was showing the total stay as authorised and was ring-fenced, so just required their bank to finalise it, we also pointed out the bank holiday, he finally admitted that neither card had been declined. When we asked him who has authorised we be locked out of our room without trying to contact us he claimed he had, well no email contact, no missed calls on our phones or in the room, not even a note under the door. We asked to speak to a manager he gave us a name but said she wasn't there, we asked for all details of the conversation be passed on so she could contact us the next day, this didn't happen. The following day we spoke with Catherine and she and Sasha provided the apology that was all we wanted for the dealing of the situation, we were happy with this and the other gestures that they made were appreciated, however all these things mean we would not choose to stay here again when there are so many choices in manhatten. Again I think it is only fair to reitterate that most of the employees we encountered were helpful and polite especially Catherine, who ensured the mistake was cleared up and a special mention to Canise who was always helpful and seemed to spend her time firefighting guest issues.

title: Funky hotel in a great neighbourhood where staff make all the difference
text:
Family vacation to NYC and I wanted them to have a great first experience of the city, knowing it well myself.  Looking for a hotel that 
- Has the cool boutique vibe
- Yet has decent sized bedrooms 
- Is in an authentic neighbourhood
- Low rise district away from overbearing high rise 
- With pool and close subway station

Well SixtyLes Lower East Side ticks all the boxes.  

What sets the hotel apart from many/ most in NYC is the personal service.  The hotel is relatively small, they know you and they are there to ensure you have a great time.
- Canise on the front desk with a warm welcome and attentive service
- Joshua & Odama front of house to handle all travel and marshal the kids with cheerful aplomb
- Christopher the concierge emailing with me to ensure we are booked into good restaurants
- and Sasha the front office manager reuniting me with the Bose headphones I left behind :-(

It stacks up well, a great stay, the staff make it, I would recommend it

title: Surprising find!
text: We chose this hotel based solely on its proximity to some of the music venues and speakeasies that we wanted to visit, as well as being a good starting point for gangster tours. We were truly blown away by the staff at this hotel. Every request for happily fulfilled...room with a view, in-room coffee maker, emptying of mini bar to avoid billing problems, etc. Even every housekeeping member we encountered greeted us and seemed so happy to be at the Sixty!  My hubby said the gym was great. While we didn't eat at any of the restaurants at Sixty, my favorite NYC coffee shop turned out to be the Konditori right next door. Sugar on the corner also provided a great place for a quick and healthy breakfast. As for staying in the LES....90% of the people appear to be in their twenties AND they all go out every night. Be prepared to WAIT if there is a specific place you want to go in the LES and have a back-up plan in case you never get in!!! There is not a business center, nor is anything geared to the business traveler. Come here for the fun hotel bars, an overcrowded pool, and cool rooms.

title: Awful -- Definitely not a Thompson Hotel Anymore
text:
Let me start with the positives -- bell hop, doorman was very nice and very good. Location is very good. Never checked out the pool or the restaurant so I cannot comment on those aspects of the hotel. 

Now for the rest. We live in Manhattan but wanted a place to stay for a night out on the LES. Chose this hotel as we have stayed at Thompson hotels in the past and had no issues. I knew this was under new management but decided how bad could it be, it was only for one night. 

Check-in -- fine, you will have to wait pretty much until 3:00 but that is the deal coming in so I cannot complain about that. The attitude of the front desk I could do without. When you stay at a nice hotel like the Mandarin they people who work there are extraordinarily nice. Here they make it feel like you are bothering them. Lose the attitude please, you do not work the line at a club, this is a hotel though reasonable people could be confused when you see the lobby at midnight and have to push through the mass of bodies to just get to an elevator.

Room -- its fine, but very rough around the edges. I understand this is a party hotel and it clearly shows. Furniture is beat up, walls are marked up, etc. Again, its fine and it kind of comes with the territory given the target demographic. Shower is very good but everything else is so so. 

Noise -- again, being on Allen you expect a certain amount of noise. But the AC is unbelievably loud, and the noise from the other guests is out of control. Again, remember, this is a party hotel. Very thin walls.

Food and beverage credit -- pretty limited -- drink at the pool or the club. Tried to see if we could use our $30 for a coffee to go but told no. We never ended up using the credit.

Checkout -- fine, uneventful.

Mystery charges. This is where the fun comes in. Noticed an additional charge to my card. Tried calling. Placed on hold for 10 minutes, then said I would be transferred to someone who could assist. Placed on hold again, then disconnected. Called back asked if the person I was speaking with could help me, she said yes. Asked my name and then said one moment. Put me on hold again for another 15 minutes, after which I hung up. I will simply dispute the charges through my credit card company. Never did find out what the charges were for.

title: Solid trendy option in the LES
text:
Stayed here twice over two weeks, 4 nights the first time, 3 nights the second time.  Am an NYC resident, but was using the hotel as a bridge while waiting for my new apartment to be ready.   Booked both times using HotelTonight so got a pretty good deal.   Was upgraded both times to a king deluxe room, which has a small terrace as well (is kind of weird as there are no dividers on the terrace between rooms, so someone could walk by your room should they desire, however I did not notice this happening).   Check-in was fairly smooth, 1st time it took them 10 min to get the room sorted out, but the 2nd time it was seamless.   The room itself is spacious for a NYC hotel with a good-sized bathroom, including a spacious rain shower.  Would be nice if there was a hook in the bathroom for a robe (there are robes in the room).  Well equipped mini bar (I don't usually use, but nice to have it there), free wi-fi (though the free option is fairly slow, really only good for emails, basic web surfing).  Was a fair amount of hall noise, but I was able to partially cover it up by running the HVAC fan on low.   Some street noise, but nothing too serious, again the white noise from the fan helps.      Rooms were fairly well maintained overall.   I believe there is turn down service, but I did not receive during either stay (not a huge deal, and I did not make a special request).   No free water, but NYC tap is fine.  Nice outdoor terrace tiki bar on the 7th floor (though if you are on the 6th floor you can get some music noise from the bar), gym is decent, didn't use the restaurant, but is supposed to be very good.   Would definitely stay here again at the right price - nice option if you're interested in LES nightlife and restaurants - much more interesting area than times square where most tourists stay.    

Staff was pleasant and helpful as well

title: Perfect
text: I wouldn't say I've stayed in a ton of hotels in New York. Maybe a dozen, but these guys knock it out of the park. Very attentive and authentic. Nice room, hip surroundings, amazing sushi place in the hotel. Pool. Check it out—we loved it and will be back—so there's a fair chance our NYC hotel list won't get any longer.

title: So many good things but let down by simple stuff.
text:
We arrived late in the evening to find the sofa bed had not been made up (reservation was clearly 2 adults & 2 children).  We were told it is likely that it is made up but still in sofa mode.  Opening the sofa bed, we found a mattress covered in crumbs but unfortunately still not made up.  Also the cushions on the sofa were stained and dirty.  We called reception and they sent someone up. They brought us up other cushions but they were also crusted in food stains.  We then had to make the bed up ourselves.

In the bedroom there was very little light because the bulb wasn't working so someone had to come and replace. 

We were offered another room but by this time it was already over an hour and a half since we had arrived and nearly 1am so decided to stay in the room we were in. 

I have to say that apart from these things the room was great and a bonus was having a balcony overlooking the street. The room we had had a lovely big bath also. The shower separate shower had  an overhead rain shower and also hose.  Unfortunately, the hair dryer didn't work. Really nice touch was the REN products.  

The hotel arranged for the room to have a deep clean the next day and all was great with the room.

The hotel pool is very disappointing.  Yes, it was early August and so busy but it was so over crowded with every sunbed taken and we counted 15 people laid around the walkways which in this very small space made it difficult to walk around.   On eventually getting a bed we listened and watched the crowd.  The majority of the occupants (approx 70%) were local New Yorkers, who treat this as their local public pool.  Even talking to people around the pool, they openly explained they weren't staying at the hotel.  Laughably they come with backpacks with changes of clothes and big shopping bags.  We complained to the hotel and they explained they used to sell places round the pool but stopped this. Clearly this hasn't worked, people in NY know this facility is available and take full advantage.   It would be really simple if they asked people for their room number and name when they came into the pool area or to take towel out you need to show your room key and only food and drinks were charged to rooms etc.   

The pool area was so busy that on 3 of the five days (had to sit on the floor and wait for a sunbed to be available) when we did get a sunbed, we had to go into the little storage room at the side and hunt for towels and sunbed covers, then change the beds ourselves.  

This is a real selling point but is something that you can't utilise unless you stalk for beds or wait until the sun has left the pool area.  We accept if is full with paying guests but not people who are walking in off the street.   It was so frustrating.  

The in-house Japanese restaurant is great.  The barman (native of Japan) is very friendly and informative, he recommended the special Bloody Mary with a twist - one of the best cocktails we have ever tasted.   Really would love the recipe.    The food is beautiful and the breakfast were the most amazing pancakes - they were as light and fluffy and get the medal of best pancakes we eat during our month in the US. 

Hotel is in a great busy neighbourhood, perfect for exploring Lower East Side and the subway is right across the street. Allen street and Hudson is a busy cross roads so you do get road noise in the lower level rooms but you expect that as the soundtrack when staying in Manhattan.  My mother stayed in a room on an upper floor and that had no noise but she didn't have the luxury of a balcony so have to say I preferred our room. 

On leaving the hotel to go to the airport was asked the hotel to arrange a larger taxi because we were  3 adults, 2 children and 5 large cases.  When it arrived it was just a normal minivan 4 seater.   The doorman said don't worry just squash in and 1 of the kids can sit on your knee.    When I challenged this he said that all should be wearing seatbelt but if we wanted another taxi it would take a while to come - didn't make sense as he was the one trying to squash us in.  What was the point of giving them notice to arrange a taxi for us?  

I was looking forward to staying at Sixty LES and it was let down by things that are so simple to get right.  It was very disappointing except for the main restaurant and their staff and the concierge/reception staff.

title: Right in the middle of the action
text:
This was my first stay in a Lower East Side hotel and it was excellent. Inevitably hotels in this part of NY may have tendencies to be overly trendy this seemed to straddle the line between comfort, convenience and coolness. Now, I wear rose tinted glasses as I was upgraded to a suite but it was a thoroughly enjoyable stay. I may return in October with my wife and it will be interesting to see whether a standard room is as comfortable for two people over 8 days but I'll worry about that at the time.
In this instance, the room was excellent, the location is superb and the bar and gym facilities are both top notch. There may be occasional parties in the bar preventing entrance but this is a regular feature of most decent hotels nowadays.
My one concern is that on requesting prices for an October stay they seemed considerably higher than for this stay in August. A bit frustrating but I'm considering paying the extra for my return.

title: excellent hotel
text: Chambre magnifique au 17 eme étage avec une vue superbe.Personnel très accueillant,serviable et souriant. Accueillis par Canise,Crystal et Gia ainsi que par Adama qui parle français,nous avons été orientés parfaitement pour toutes nos demandes (resto,shopping....).Hotel que nous recommandons fortement tant pour ses aménagements(piscine et wifi),la qualité des services et sa situation géographique au coeur d'un quartier animé et vivant (proximité du métro,little Italy,Soho...)

title: Room and hotel ambiance are AMAZING
text: Hotel was perfect staycation in lower manhattan.  staff was amazing, especially CANISE at the front desk.  perfect experience.  rooms are gorgeous and not your typical boring hotel room.  felt like a very special place.

title: Lovely hotel in a great location!!
text: We stayed at SIXTY LES for a week as a family of 4 and loved it!! The room had two big beds and great walk-in shower and was great to come back to and relax after a day of walking around NYC. The subway station is right across the street and the F line train takes you straight to the heart of Manhattan and a weekly pass was only $31!! The best thing about the hotel is the location with the subway across the street, many bars, restaurants and cafes so you don't even have to eat at the same place twice. There's Sugar Cafe a few doors down that's open 24hr serving pancakes, eggs, sandwiches, pastries and more as well as Clintons Bakery, Spiegels, Katz and much more so after a day of running around Manhattan we always had the option to head back to the hotel and have dinner locally. The staff at the hotel were all the absolute best and couldn't have been more friendlier, cheerier or more accommodating. Absolutely loved our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone

title: Pretty hotel!
text:
When I was searching for hotels to stay at during our trip to NYC, I was getting discouraged by the options in our "price range" (trying really hard not to pay $200+ a night for a tiny gross room). I found Sixty LES and decided to go for it--it looked modern and nice without the ridiculous price tag of places in Midtown. Not knowing NY at all, I hoped the neighborhood would be OK.

We lucked out with the location! We loved the Lower East Side. Fun places to eat and drink were just minutes away--we never went to the same spot twice. The F line on the subway is literally across the street from the hotel. Don't be afraid of the subway! We bought unlimited rides for 7 days and easily paid for the passes even though we were only in town for 5.5 days! 

The hotel/room itself was nice and sleek looking. We got a Queen Superior room and it was much larger than I thought it would be! Loved the way the room was set up! We mentioned it was our anniversary and they had a letter and chocolates set out in the room for our arrival! All of the workers were very polite--both at the front desk as well as the doormen. Everyone greeted us with a smile whenever we came and went.

The reason it's not a 5 star review is that there were some noise issues...the first two nights I wore earplugs because we could hear the people next to us talking very loudly late at night. The 4th night we actually had someone complain about OUR noise level and someone came up to tell us we had a noise complaint (really? We had the TV on LOW and we were simply talking before bed--nothing loud at all). The rooms are certainly not soundproof so that was the only negative thing. We talked to a family staying there who felt very awkward about the frosted glass shower situation (you can sorta see into the shower from the rest of the room--frosted glass is all that separates you), but as a couple staying there we obviously had no issue with that. 

I would highly recommend this hotel and the whole LES in general! I feel bad for the people who spend their whole trip in Times Square and don't venture into the other neighborhoods--there is so much to explore beyond Midtown!!

title: Muy bien situado
text: Hotel muy bien situado cerca de restaurantes y tiendas muy interesantes. Si vais podéis ir a comer un sándwich al famoso  'Katz's Delicatessen' siempre está lleno y esta a 5 minutos. Las habitaciones muy amplias y luminosas y sobre todo LIMPIAS. Lo único que no me gustó fue el techo que parecía estar a medias. El personal del hotel muy amable y servicial. El restaurante japonés dentro del hotel es muy bueno aunque un poco caro.

title: Hôtel agréable et moderne
text:
Nous avons passé 10j dans cet hôtel et vraiment pas déçus!
Nous n'avons pas pu nous empêcher de faire la comparaison avec l'hôtel que nous avions lors d'un précédent voyage...
Alors certes,  les chambres sont plus petites mais propres, classes et confortables. Il n'est pas dans le très animé Times Square mais cela nous a permis de découvrir un autre quartier et d'avoir un peu l'impression de mener la vie d'un new yorkais : beaucoup de bar et de restaurants sympa le soir, un Whole Food à 2 pas, le métro au pied de l'hôtel.
Le personnel est très agréable! 
Et le top, la piscine!!! Après de longues journées de marche, cet instant de detente était le bienvenu!!! Seul bémol,  dommage qu'elle ferme à 18h, ça oblige à rentrer de bonne heure pour profiter d'un petit bain!
La dernière petite chose qui nous a un peu embêté, mais on cherche la petite bête...
Les lignes de métro à proximité de l'hôtel, que cela soit celle à ses pieds ou celles 2 rues plus loin, ne sont pas les plus pratiques pour visiter la ville et appellent à beaucoup de changements mais ça... Ce n'est pas la faute de l'hôtel!

title: Location, Location, Location
text:
The hotel is in an amazing area of New York that is very up and coming with many great restaurants and shops. The hotel staff are incredibly accommodating as they allowed us to check in early after a night flight. The rooms are very modern and specious. Although the rooms do have thin walls and you can hear everything in the corridors. On our first night the room next door appeared to have a party with extremely loud music being played late at night. Having spoke to the manager and a few calls back and forth the music stopped and they even offered to move us to another room that night. 

There is a pool in the hotel which provides a welcome outlet in the NYC summer heat. 

The breakfast in the hotel is served in the blue ribbon restaurant with serving staff being rude and impolite. The breakfast is below average and would advise eating out. 

Overall I would come back to this hotel for its location, friendly staff and great rooms.

title: Very nice hotel with remarkable service!
text:
We stayed in a King Terrace Suite, which was beautiful, and had a great view of the LES, downtown off in the distance, and 3 bridges.

All the staff we encountered were extremely friendly and helpful, including the front desk, the bell staff, and even the lifeguard at the pool (I was surprised they even had one for that little pool!).

I called a day in advance to request an early check-in if possible, but based on previous experiences at other hotels I was very skeptical that our room would be ready when we arrived.  Much to my surprise, when we got there (even earlier than I had mentioned on the phone, about 12:30 PM) our room was all ready for us!  Big goodwill points for this.

Also, they happily cleaned out the minibar fridge for us so we could use it for our own drinks, leftovers, etc.

The kids liked the pool, which is always a good thing.  It's very small, but what do you expect in Manhattan?  And it was never busy when we were there.

"Basic" wifi is free.  You can pay $15/day for upgraded wifi but we had two kids streaming Netflix and two adults posting to Instagram and the speed was perfectly fine for us.  The wifi did not work very well for me when I was sitting by the pool, which was a bit of a minor bummer.

The neighbourhood is great, assuming you don't want to be close to Times Square (and you don't!).  Subway station directly across the street. Tons of restaurants, bars, shopping within walking distance.  A huge Whole Foods one or two blocks away, and the famous Katz's Delicatessen one block in the other direction.

Anyway, what impressed me the most about this hotel was the 6-star service.  Everyone we interacted with prior to and during our stay was just remarkably helpful and friendly.  Not sure how the SIXTY organization has managed to get such a great group of people together (especially in jaded NYC!) but kudos to them.

title: Make sure you get what you request, book and pay for!
text:
Group of four women travelling from Australia. Long exhausting trip to arrive in afternoon and excitingly expecting what had long been booked in advance. Not too much to ask for. Had booked 6 months prior our 2 room, 2 queen beds in each room for a total of 4 women. Our travel agent phoned 2 days prior from Australia to discuss with the hotel direct that all was clear in our arrangements and booking that our rooms would be accurate in accordance with our requirements and spoke to vinnie that all was confirmed.

On our arrival  both rooms were 1 x queen  bed style rooms.   We discussed.with reception that this was not what was booked, discussed, confirmed, written on voucher or payed for. Management explained to us that this was an error on behalf of our Australian travel agent in correctly understanding and interpreting website room categories.  This was hard to accept knowing that our booking was made 6 months prior and that our Australian travel agent had verbally confirmed exact requirements 2 days prior. We were informed there were no rooms available with 2 beds and offered a king size bed and sofa bed on the 4th floor directly one level above the pool. Needless to say no view but an extreme amount of party noise. I am sure that most people have experienced the 'sofa bed' and know it does  not provide  a comfortable night sleep by any means.

Please do not be fooled by the allure of roof top appeal, as this bar is on the 7th floor and does not provide any skyline views. Opened only on weekends.

I am an experienced traveller and only expect what I book and pay for.

Overall disappointing experience. Especially after travelling such a long way. I would like to say that I would not be interested in management  responding to try to fix these issues now as they have had opportunities to do so over the last couple of days without success.

title: Perfectly OK Hotel
text:
Stayed four nights. Not wowed, not bummed. 

Liked: front desk staff were all super friendly, room (king studio) had sort of cool decor, and it was quieter than most NYC hotels (room faced east), restaurant service was great, and the fact that it had a pool made it unique (however, we were at the pool for a full 30 minutes over our 4-day stay)

Disliked: no coffee maker in room, no complimentary coffee in lobby/restaurant, bathroom was overly tiny, free internet was crazy slow, bed wasn't very comfortable, pool gets sun for only a small slice of the day and people FLOCK there during those hours. The day we were able to finally get out there and enjoy it the health department shut it down due to excess chlorine levels.

If you go, line up at Clinton Street Bakery by 7:45 a.m. for breakfast (opens at 8 a.m.) and eat dinner at Il Buco on Bond Street.

title: NYC at its best!
text:
Ein bezahlbares und gutes Hotelzimmer in NYC zu finden kostet Zeit und Nerven. Mit etwas Glück konnten wir eine gute Rate für 3 Nächte ergattern. 
Dieses Hotel ist einfach sensationell! Die Einrichtung ist top-modern, hochwertig und total durchgestylt. Für Design-Fans und Ästheten ein absolutes muss. 
Unser Zimmer war komplett bodentief verglast, mit Blick auf die Skyline von Manhattan. Das Radio mit integriertem iPod-Dock war nur eines der vielen kleinen Highlights. 
In der direkten Umgebung findet man sehr gute kleine Restaurants und Clubs. 
Alle Attraktionen des Big Apple sind sehr gut erreichbar. Auch die Erreichbarkeit mit den Öffis vom Flughafen JFK ist gut.

title: Hôtel super sympa, de qualité
text:
Personnel accueillant, aux petits soins, qui essaye de régler les soucis au plus vite.
Cadre super ! Piscine en rooftop,
Je recommande vivement
Chambres avec très belle vue - 
Bar avec grand choix de boissons - 
Salon avec accès wifi

title: Buen trato y cercanía.
text:
Termino de llegar declarar una estancia de 6 noches en este hotel y tengo muy claro que volvería. El hotel está situado en una zona que te permite moverte con facilidad por la ciudad y que ofrece una amplia variedad de lugares de ocio.  No todo es recorrer la ciudad, también hay que disfrutar de la noche.... Y aquí encontrarás terrazas y locales que están muy bien y llenos de vida.
El trato del hotel excelente, desde la llegada te hacen sentir confortablemente y son muy atentos, todo pie igual, pero si de alguien hay que destacar por su amabilidad es a Angel, que te recibe según llegas al hotel con una amplia sonrisa y agradable trato. Ayudándote para que tu instacion sea perfecta.
El resto de staff también son muy agradables y están pendientes de ti.

Las instalaciones, como GYM y Piscina están genial y restaurante Japonés que encuentras dentro del Hotel es muy bueno. En las terrazas del propio hotel, siempre hay organizado algo para hacerte disfrutar de las noches de verano. 
Sin duda es una muy buena elección tanto si es tu primera o segunda vez por New York. Ya que tienes enfrente una parada de Metro (F) y a pocos metros encontrás el resto de líneas.

title: You are their best interest
text: My family has been coming here for years, and it has been our go-to hotel. If anything isn't perfect or to your expectations, they QUICKLY fix it. Feels cleaner than other hotels despite being in a busy city with lots of people coming in and out. The location is perfect, because you get too see an interesting, not-so-touristy part of New York. Raul is our favorite employee! He's awesome and we love seeing him every time we visit.

title: Perfect hotel for a locals experience of New York.
text:
We have been to New York quite a few times and didn't want to be tourists! After extensive searching online we came across SIXTY LES and was excited to find a modern, reasonably priced hotel on the Lower East Side. 

The area is fab, full of great restaurants, bars and shops. Its a stones throw from Soho where you will find other great places to eat and more branded shops for those shopaholics out there. In my opinion its so much better than crazy Fifth avenue and the touristy restaurants that you find around Times square.

The room size is amazing for Manhattan! We had a great queen size bed and double wardrobe. We were lucky enough to be on the 10th floor so we had an amazing view of the new World Trade Center. The rooms are clean and well equipped, there is an ironing board!

The staff were so friendly and even before we arrived the concierge arranged bookings for the best restaurants in the area for us. 

We will certainly be going back!

title: Mini bar
text:
My husband and I stayed in the Sixty hotel LES, Lower East Side Manhattan, for four nights in July 2015. We had not stayed in this group of hotels before and chose it mainly for the location in order to be able to see the July 4th fireworks from our hotel balcony. We were not disappointed with the location and the balcony view was stunning, exactly as planned. 
The Penthouse was very pricey and not as luxurious as we had anticipated, apart from the bathrooms and bedroom which were  clean, fashionable and very comfortable. The living areas however had obviously seen some serious partying as the floors were damaged and the seats very well used. The kitchen area was also disappointing, only tea bags and sugar provided and a kettle which did not work and took 24 hours to replace. I have never stayed in an American hotel where you did not have facilities to make coffee! There was a kitchenette area with an oven and hot plates, but no pots, crockery or cutlery ... On requesting this from reception, they weren't sure how to go about getting this for us and indeed it never materialised at all during our stay. 
We could almost forgive these shortcomings as for a major world capital hotel, it was probably priced according to it's location and our touristy plans were easy to fulfil from the hotel location.
On checking out, we were presented with a mini bar bill which was not ours and charged for this despite denying we had taken anything to either eat or drink. We were told there would be an internal procedure to follow as we were challenging this bill item and if Housekeeping said we had taken these items, the charge would remain. This, we were assured would be settled within 5 days. 2 weeks and 2 emails later, we still have no refund or any communication from the hotel or the Sixty group.
To sum up, yes stay with this group as the accomodation is well placed, but ensure the mini bar is emptied on your arrival to avoid false charges!

title: Great Hotel in New York
text: It´s our first stay in this hotel. The hotel has a nice pool and the atmosphere it´s great. Young people, music..... We booked a queen superior room with great views over Manhattan. Our room was on 16 th floor. The Room and its bath room was very clean. Workers at this hotel are very friendly. Location is good because lower east side is a nice neighborhood. From my point of view it´s a very good option to be in Manhattan.

title: Amazing Staff and Service
text: This is one of the nicest hotels I have stayed at in NYC. The proximity to various hot spots around Manhattan was a big perk for me. I must mention the extrodinary service given by Raul and Joshua, two of the employees that helped with our bags and helped us get up to our room when other members of our party had the keys. Super trendy, very nice, great rates and A+ staff, will definitely be returning next time I'm in NYC.

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text:
We were here for four nights and we loved everything about our stay at Sixty LES! The hotel is nice and trendy, the staff super accomodating and friendly. Our room was quite spacious, and since we were staying on the 12th floor we had an AWESOME view. The subway is only one block away and this we found very convenient.
The pool is an asset but it is quite small and it closes already at 6pm. I really think this is a pity. However, our experience was great and we would definitely return!

title: Great place to stay with your family in New York
text:
Sixty LES is a very trendy and cool hotel, but that doesn't make it a bad place to go if you are a family with kids - on the contrary. The pool area is perfect when the kids want to bathe on a hot day. The room had big windows, air conditioning, comfortable beds, separate toilet and shower with a wash basin, mirror, hairdryer etc in between. Plenty of room for a family of four getting ready to go out.

The area (Lower East Side - LES) is, like the hotel, very trendy and young. But we never felt out of place - we liked the vibe! Finding nice restaurants where we could have breakfast or dinner wasn't a problem. There is a very nice restaurant in the hotel as well, but we liked to get out and explore the surroundings. Try the Sugar Cafe just a few steps from the hotel if you like pancakes and fresh fruit or omelets for breakfast.

But I'd say that the best thing with the hotel is its staff. They where fantastic and made us feel at home! Even though we had already checked out on the last day of our stay, they gave us access to the pool and the spa while we where waiting to go out to the airport. So we could take a swim, shower and change clothes before we went to the airport in the evening which was great on this hot summer day. A perfect ending to a perfect stay!

And yes - there is free WiFi. It works great for Facebook, mail and small stuff. If you want more bandwidth (for working) you can get it for an extra fee of $15/day.

title: Something Missing
text:
I was hoping, before our three night stay, to be writing an enthusiastic endorsement of Sixty LES.  There was nothing horrible; but something was missing.

On our stay, the hotel's signature bar was undergoing a renovation.  I was surprised that under that circumstance, the hotel did not have a reciprocal arrangement with its sister hotel, Sixty Soho, that would have given us access to their rooftop bar.

There was no coffee machine in our room, leaving as choices, a trip two blocks away to Starbucks or the high cost of room service.  On a related note, ice was not readily available to guests.  To secure ice, you had to call down to the desk, and of course wait for hotel staff and the inevitable tip to the young person who brought the ice.

I was expecting a hip, twentysomething atmosphere at the hotel, which we never found.

To be fair though, the hotel was clean; the staff was polite; and the location, just south of Houston Street, was great if you wanted to go to Katz' Deli, Russ and Daughters, Litle Italy, Chinatown and Greenwich Village.  About 1.5 miles away is the World Trade Center Memorial.

title: Very Trendy(Frat House)
text: Stayed at the LES in July with family and enjoyed it. Very busy when we stayed so the pool was incredibly crowded. Extremely noisy but that just means that the hotel is thriving which is nice to see. Service was a bit slow in the lobby but room service was quick and very tasty. Overall I would stay there again just not on the weekend. A very happening scene for anyone who wants to see New York life.

title: Excellent, Amazing, Fantastic
text:
Sixty LES was our hotel for our NYC Wedding. We booked it for 4 nights, which included the night before the wedding and the next 3 nights. I had emailed the hotel prior to arriving as the night before the wedding my bridesmaid and grandmother were staying with me. They were fantastic and advised that the room I had booked did not have a fold out sofa, but offered me an upgrade to the next level room which did. When we checked in, the service was faultless, all of the staff were happy and friendly and ever so helpful. The General Manager even came and welcomed me to the hotel and when I had arrived back at the hotel a little later I was greeted with a note and a box of chocolates from him/the hotel which was a lovely touch. The day of the wedding we had people coming and going and the front desk were so helpful in buzzing them up. I can not fault this hotel at all. The room was spacious (3 women got ready for a wedding in the room) and clean and the bed was so comfortable. 
Thank you SIXTY LES, I can't wait to stay with you again sometime.. maybe an anniversary :)

title: Fantastic hotel.
text:
Absolutely loved this hotel.   The staff were really friendly and very helpful.  The views from our room were spectacular.  
The hotel is really well located in terms of shopping, culture and restaurants.  
We would definitely stay here again.

title: Great staff!!
text: Clean and friendly hotel, the only thing that I didn't like was the undecorated ceiling in the hotel room, it was bare concrete! Food in the hotel restaurants was good, the staff were of great personality and did everything to make the stay a pleasure....would return and recommend

title: No 1 on our travels worldwide
text:
It's a big call buy here is why we loved it so much , from the time we arrived the girls on the front desk Carolina,Melissa,lea and Heidi simply where sensational , always a smile , always haptic assist excellent service indeed and Ben our concierge was brilliant , knew where to go what to see and got it all booked and sorted for us . We had a few room moves for July 4 th Fireworks and found the rooms excellent with great views and very clean and comfortable .

The Japanese restaurant within the hotel is also first class plus the pool gym and sauna all add up to our No 1 ranking anywhere we have travelled .

title: Buon hotel a new york
text:
L' hotel é situato al village in una parte di manhattan che ti permette sia di raggiungere time square che di vivere la piu tranquilla parte del village, puoi raggiungere facilmente anche down town grazie alla metropolitana che ha la sua fermata vicinissima all' hotel.
Le camer sono confortevoli, il bagno spazioso, bellissima la doccia ilw.c. è separato. Ottimo confort,pulizia e cortesia del personale. Richiedete le camere con vista sulla parte nord di manhattan. Lo consiglio anche se si viaggia con bambini, il ns ha 9 anni, e la piscina piccola ,ma carina è stata importante.

title: Posizione strategica
text: L'hotel si trova nelle vicinanze del village, little Italy e soho e, prenotato in anticipo, ha un ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo. Personale cortese, camera pulita, bel bagno. la fermata della metro è proprio di fronte. Promosso.

title: Walking Distance to East Village
text: Our original room at the hotel faced the street and was very noisy, I spoke with the manager and she was very understanding and even upgraded us to an available room facing the back street which was much quieter.  This was just one instance of the excellent level of customer service in this hotel.  The concierge was also really friendly and helpful (the guy with the glasses) on several occasions.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York. Rooms were spotlessly clean, comfortable and for New York quite spacious.  On hop on hop off Downtown bus route as well.

title: Trendy, Ultra modern hotel in Lower East Side
text:
I recently stayed here for 5 nights with my husband and parents as part of a trip to NYC. Hotel is located in LES only 2 mins walk to the nearest subway. Surrounded by trendy bars and quirky restaurants this was a great upcoming fun area in Manhatten.

Room was ultra modern with ceiling to floor windows offering panoramic views of NYC. We had great views of both the One World Observatory one way and the Empire State the other. Room was of a good size with extremely modern furnishings, bed was very comfortable. We were staying as part of a 30th birthday trip and they were very kind to leave us a complimentary bottle of champagne in our room for us. Wifi is free throughout.

Hotel outdoor pool was on the roof, but we did not have time to use it during our stay. Overall we had a great stay in 60Les and I would definitely stay here again in the future.

title: Lovely Hotel
text: Empire State views from the balcony. Swanky Gem in the East Village. A fantastic location and an artful accommodation. I highly recommend SIXTY LES’s suites. Manhattan views from the balconies are outstanding. A bit pricey but service, location & comfort make it worth.

title: Sexy Rooms in the heart of the action
text: the Sixty LES has dropped a point or two in service quality since loosing the Thompson moniker. However the facility is still amazing. The rooms have a a unique pied a terre type feel to them perched above the young slightly edgy filled Lower east side. If you want to experience NY without the tourist overload of mid town this is a good spot.

title: Gorgeous hotel in a prime location in the Lower East side!
text: Really helpful staff, very comfortable room, and quiet.  Shared a double bed room with a friend/colleague and we were both amazed at how spacious and comfortable the room was.  This is so hard to find in New York.  Really good location and great for work and fun.

title: The Heart of LES
text: If you want to spend time in a vibrant, safe and fun area of NYC then this hotel is the perfect choice. It is worth noting that the guests, diners, drinkers, staff and when we were there, users of the rooftop pool, are on the younger side - particularly in the bar spaces, so worth noting if you wanted somewhere a little 'older'. On the positive the rooms were clean, we had an amazing view from floor to ceiling windows. On the negative, no free wifi in the room (!! this was a real surprise for us...) the wardrobe was small, there was lack of storage (we were there a week) and no ironing board - although one was brought for us. On this, the concierge were excellent and we were provided with a wealth of information by the friendly team. superb - an asset to the hotel. There was so much to do and see in the area with easy transport links and short walk to almost anywhere - staying here gave us a real sense of the city. Would certainly recommend for short stay to under 35s!

title: NYC
text:
Spitzenmässiges Hotel mit fantastischer Aussicht in perfekter Lage!! Die Zimmer sind modern eingerichtet, der Service ist sehr zuvorkommend, die Lage perfekt und die Aussicht auf die Skyline einfach genial! Unbedingt Zimmer in einer der oberen Etagen buchen und beim ersten Augenöffnen auf das WTC schauen. Die Zimmerpreise variieren stark, mit etwas Glück bekommt man einen akzeptablen Preis 

TOP!!!

title: nice stay in Les nyc
text:
Nice restaurants and bars and shops all around .
Very close underground ca n take you everywhere
there's a nice live music bar near the hotel where you can easily listen different bands al
nights during the entire weekl

title: HOTEL MUY RECOMENDABLE
text: Fantástico...habitación con unas vistas preciosas, con todo lo necesario para tener una estancia confortable durante 7 dias, la situación estupenda, rodeado de bares, restaurantes, galerías de arte, me gustó la zona porque es donde está el auténtico ambiente neoyorquino, el midtown es mas turístico. Zona perfecta para estar alojado en Manhatan....sin duda, si vuelvo a NY me alojaré en este hotel

title: IT could have been a 5
text: Sixty LES is a great place to stay when in NY, close to the Metro and a nice area to be in. The rooms were clean and modern. The difference in the grade, 4 instead of 5 here, is the (what I think) small problem when arriving that we had with som troubles around our reservation. But hotel made up for it so thats ok and erverthing worked out in the end.

title: I love this place
text:
I come to NYC a lot for work. I usually stay in touristy areas, but Sixty LES is right in the heart of the Lower East Side. I've stayed here once before. The neighborhood is very trendy and the hotel is near some cool shops and restaurants. 

Also - this might be one of the best rooms I've ever stayed in. It's bigger than my SF apartment. The best part is the outdoor terrace with the amazing view. The staff here is quite helpful and knowledgeable about the area. I was fortunate enough to meet Canise, who works at the front desk. She advised me on where to go for dinner, what to wear, and everything. She's pretty awesome. Will definitely be back here again for the third time.

title: City Pool Escape
text:
Great experience! We booked for the pool ;P
We booked a suite and were asked if we wanted to upgrade to the Penthouse. We negotiated and got the PH for a total steal. Killer views, duplex, sun terrace, gorgeous decor. Service was great and the hotel let us hang out at the pool post checkout!

Tip for Pool real estate:
The corner opposite the bar at the pool has the MOST sun. Def get there as soon as the pool opens and grab your sunny loungers. All other loungers start to lose sun at 2pm. These three are good until 5/6pm.

title: In town for a wedding.  Hotel a great pick.
text: Loved the hotel and it's Bowery location even as older women.  A young and upscale clientele generally.  Must have been great insulation as there was partying going on into the night at multiple locations and we were not bothered at all.  The room decor was beautiful, modern and clean.   The hotel staff was extremely helpful.  Our only complaints were there were no instructions on how to use the light switches and shower plumbing.  A small issue but easily fixed if they would take the initiative.

title: My new Go-To hotel in NYC!
text: This was my first time at the Sixty. Its in such a great location in the Lower East Side which boasts what I call grit-glitz style (still a bit gritty, yet getting classy). Its super trendy right now and THE place to be in NYC. I checked in and my room was not ready but without a blink of an eye, the front desk manager made what I think was an over and above offer of letting me rest in another room and shower since I had a show to go to. I was also happy to see that their sitting lobby was on the second floor - very important to have a quiet space in a bustling city. My room was large, super clean and had a great soaking tub and was an incredible value. Perhaps the most pleasant part was the staff. The front desk manager is my new best friend (however NOT overbearing) and all the lobby staff and other desk staff were just amazing. I only stayed one night but I feel I know them. I've traveled around the world for years and was so impressed with this hotel. It's my new go-to Hotel in NYC!

title: Great Stay!
text: Never stayed in this part of town before- usually upper west side visitors.  Checked in late Thursday night.  We received a friendly and warm welcome (especially enjoyed talking to a summer intern from Virginia).  The overnight manager, Jeremy, was able to extent our stay and even upgraded us to a spacious room overlooking the pool.  Fun and lively area, clean and comfortable rooms, friendly and warm staff......we will definitely be back!

title: It could have been a 5 star rating
text: Checking in was at ease.  I am grateful that they had the room for ready for us to nap at 8AM, after a long red eye flight.  The room is very nicely decorated with a modern touch.  Pool service was top notch.  Why 4 stars?  I paid extra for breakfast and it was horrible.  Just horrible!  I will return to this hotel for my next NYC trip minus the breakfast.

title: Awesome Place to Stay
text: I love the 60 LES! The staff is always super helpful and it's right in the middle of everything great about downtown New York. Raul who runs the show out front will make sure get where you need on time and takes really good care you during your stay!

title: New York I Love you...and your hotel is pretty awesome too!
text:
From the moment we entered Sixty LES, we knew we'd made the right choice. The lobby is cool and stylish, with the staff polite, helpful and well presented. We arrived early, but they were able to accommodate us, giving us a room that was to our exact specifications that we asked for when we booked in that 'additional comments' bit that I always figured got ignored.   

The room itself was on the 17th floor, and we had views all the way from the freedom tower (financial district) to the empire state building (mid town). The windows are floor to ceiling running along the entire length of the room, and the shower was definitely big enough for 2 people. The room was bright, clean, modern and the bed very comfortable. They even supply an umbrella, so don't bother packing one like we did- save the suitcase space for walking shoes!

As early risers we ate in the Blue Ribbon restaurant for Breakfast- pricier than going elsewhere but the coffee there was LUSH, and the food more than you could eat in one sitting. The staff member who served us each time we ate there was friendly and relaxed- ideal for early mornings.

The pool loses sun in the afternoon from about 4pm, so you need to get there earlier if you want to tan, but we enjoyed the quiet shaded pool side most afternoons after exploring with a beer in hand and a chat with the lovely bar staff member Charlie, who listened to us tell him about our day and suggested places we should visit and eat. 

The hotel is situated right in the heart of things in LES, with bars, restaurants and boutique shops on your door step. It's also a stone's throw from 2nd Ave subway station- handy.

When we checked out, we were able to leave our suitcases with the hotel, enjoy a morning of adventures and then return and use the hotel's spa to shower and change before our flight back to the UK. From start to finish, it was a great experience at this hotel, and if you're a 20/30 something looking for a stylish, modern and accommodating place to stay whilst you explore New York, this is it.

title: Not far from JFK, eclectic neighbourhood
text:
Ultra cool decor in a hipster neighbourhood.

For people staying here to enjoy NYC, there is the subway across the road which is then a short ride to Times Square.

60 LES is out of the main tourism part of NYC which gives you a chance to breathe a little when you kick off your shoes after a big day exploring, before you put them back on again and try to decide which of the many, many bars/ restaurants you want to eat at, all within easy walking distance.

All the staff were super-friendly and we had a really enjoyable stay here.

title: Modern City Look
text: Lovely, chic, modern hotel with an Asian feel.   very cool, hip vibe.   nice pool and amenities.   Great staff and wonderful with requests.   Pricey, but i guess that's NY.   kind of disappointed that housekeeping didn't come twice a day as i saw advertised online.  comfy furniture.

title: Mats Dahlback
text: A very modern hotel with a fantastic location. A friendly welcome combined with a service minded front desk and lobby crew made our stay very pleasant. Modern strict rooms in a cool design. Since our visit they have also made WI-FI complementary all over the hotel, good job!

title: Fed udsigt, venligt personale, tæt på Soho
text: Super fedt sted med gulv-til-loft vinduer. Boede på 15 etage med udsigt ud over hele NYC skyline. Meget venligt personale. Ren produkter på værelset. Lidt kort seng for en mand på næsten 2 meter. Gå afstand fra Soho.

title: pricey treat!
text:
Amazing staff, cool rooms, nice rooftop pool, great views from our (basic) room/balcony!  All of this in a really cool, young vibrant part of the city!  This is a very well run property - every single person on the staff seemed to love their job.  
One thing I would change is that there is a beautiful balcony (we were on the sixth floor) - however, the balcony expanded for the length of the floor so people could walk past your room on the outside and look into your room.  We had to sleep with our curtains closed nullifying the great view.
Oh, and if you can, try the fried chicken and pancake for brunch at Blue Ribbon - the restaurant on the 2nd floor!  Enough to share, and unbelievably delicious!

title: Sehr gutes Hotel in idealer Lage
text:
Hatten zwar zunächst ein Zimmer direkt am Pool bekommen, aber nach Reklamation bekamen wir dann ein Zimmer im 8. Stock mit herrlichem Blick auf den Liberty Tower. 

Die Zimmer sind sehr schön und sauber. 

Das Personal ist hilfsbereit und nett. 

Die Lage des Hotels ist ideal. Ins Village oder nach SOHO sowie zum Seaport/Downtown kommt man mit dem Bus und für alles andere steht die F Linie der Sub zur Verfügung (alle Halterstellen direkt beim Hotel). Essen und Trinken ist in LES sowieso kein Thema. Man hat die Qual der Wahl. 

Kann das Hotel empfehlen, wenn man das eher alternative New York bevorzugt und dem Tori-Wahnsinn am Times Square entgehen will (hinkommt man da immer noch innerhalb von 15 min per Sub). Alternative wäre noch Brooklyn, das mit Subway auch sehr gut angebunden ist.

title: Raul was the bomb!
text: I really enjoyed my stay at Sixty. The rooms was small, pretty standard for NYC, but clean and most importantly quiet. I rarely heard any street traffic. I love the location and the staff were really accommodating. Raul, one of the doormen, was always smiling and offering to help. I'll definitely be back!

title: a good hotel..... has to work it!!
text:
over the years i have been stuck by the fact that a great location and facility .... has to keep working at its reputation....
