the Sixty LES is a perfect example of this.  i have stayed at this hotel a number of times ... i love the room size and it has a great location ... a real neighborhood feel. however, my last visit was a big disappointment.  Firstly, i think hotels should know if you are a regular guest.  and if you are a regular guest and let the staff know it means you have choices... it is not automatic.  my recent stay was a big disappointment.  the first room i was given (bear in mind i am not a young chic New Yorker) was on the bar floor (7th Floor) and when i entered the room gave myself a minute to realize ... NO i can hear the music from the bar. #2 the room had been recently smoked in and #3 Never argue with a customer who tells you the above.  I was given another room begrudgingly.... the internet was beyond SLOWWWWW.... and we were charged even though i did have to go to the neighborhood coffee shop to work one AM.  the Movie section of the TV did not work and also.... no real effort to make anything happen...we were woken up on Monday 7AM to loud construction and when i told the front desk they said... oh well that isn't from our building.  OK If you have construction that is waking up your guests don't charge the same amount as a hotel that is in a quiet neighborhood.... bring down the price and WARN people!!!  i don't complain too much anymore about bad Hotels i just try to warn other travelers.... this hotel needs a shake up .... it is such a great product and it isn't getting my business anymore sooooo many great hotels in NY....

title: Perfect!
text:
Bien ubicado, cerca a la linea F del metro que te recorre todo Manhattan.
El personal es muy amable
Las habitaciones modernas, limpias, la cama deliciosa, silencioso adi wue se escansa del tuido natural de NY.
Las instalaciones son buenas
Lo unico regular es que no hay internet en las habitaciones, sin embargocen el lobby y 2 piso ( lounge) si lo hay

title: Estadía en Sixty Les
text: Muy buena ubicación. Habitación cómoda. Atención excelente!!! Carolina, Canise, Vini, Nick, Raúl, Cristián ....todosss. Están siempre para complacerte! Linea de tren en la esquina. Buena gastronomía en la zona. Excelente! Lo recomiendo.

title: Carina & Jimmy From Sweden
text: Hi! The hotel is really nice and is ideally located at the edge of the NEW. The subway is just wrong outside the entrance and take you on a 15 minutes to manhattan. Feels very safe to go. Next to the reception, there is always a guy who helps with all matters regarding the tourist stuff or if they can drink their water, as it can. Though it does not taste so good. :-) The swimming pool was closed which was not on their website and it was disappointing. The rooms were nice with a huge tv on the wall and cool views on the 16th floor. Bed queen size was big, about 160-180 cm but hard and low. Comfortable duvets and sheets. The bathroom was great with hair dryer etc. Next to the hotel are two bars with live music. They changed band each 45-minute. The only thing that is bad is that we received a letter under our door after a few days in which it said that they would charge an additional amount to in case we couldn't pay our hotel room. Of course we where really worried because we had a ton of money on our account. When we then went to the front desk so she didn't understand either but tried to explain to us. This was a big disappointment!

title: Hip Hotel In Hip Area ... Shout Out To Raoul!
text: Hip hotel in a hip area of NY.  Service above and beyond.  For example, the bellmen see you coming and open the front door of the hotel.  If you hands are full, like mine were bringing cappuccinos back more than once for me and my wife, the bellmen lead you across the lobby and push the elevator button for your floor. Special shot out to Raoul!  We were in town with our two daughters to attend our son's graduation.  We've lived in NY and I work in NY frequently.  We've staid from the upper east side to mid town to the financial district.  LES was my favorite location of all and Sixty is in the middle of it all with fun, clean and friendly staffed hotel.  The fifty year olds, the teenagers and the twenty somethings all give two thumbs up.

title: Good, but not amazing.
text:
Stayed recently May 8-11. The hotel was in a great location and the rooms were comfortable. Maybe I've been spoilt by the Mondrian, but the Sixty LES fell short in a few areas:

- Charging $15 a day for wifi is criminal. Especially given the nightly room cost;
- Housekeeping sprayed water on our bed to get out the wrinkles, however we came home to a soaking wet bed, and had to ask them to change the sheets
- If you advertise that the hotel has a rooftop pool and bar, please advise when booking that it will be closed at the time of stay

On the positive side, the rooms are comfortable and the location is perfect. The LES is so much fun.

Overally decent stay, not sure I'd hurry back though.

title: אחלה מלון
text:
מיקום טוב באזור צעיר ומגניב. חדרים לא קטנים בכלל, בטח לא ביחס לעיר. צוות מקסים. 
תמיד שמחו לעזור. מיטה נוחה, בסופי שבוע יש בריכה. המינוס היחיד הוא שהויי פיי לא חינם וזה קצת מעצבן. חוץ מזה נהננו וממליצים

title: Sleek and sexy hotel with fabulous views from balcony top floor rooms
text: Great location in cool east village area, super restaurants on every block and in-house sushi divine too!  Easy walk to Brooklyn over the bridge and Soho and surrounding city spots or via subway.  Staff are outstanding so service levels are top notch by folks who love their job and the hotel.  Rooms are sleek and sexy with great amenities, comfort and views.  Highly recommend a stay for a different vibe than uptown hotels.  Choose a balcony top floor room with spectacular views!

title: Slick modern
text: Being designers, this hotel resonated with us straight away. It is a small boutique hotel, but all the spaces are generous. We had a beautiful room with a view towards the west. The room had a beautiful and spacious bathroom, finished in quality finishes and sanitaryware. The room finished didn't disappoint either, and the off form concrete ceiling topped it all off. The bed was very comfortable, and the air conditioning worked perfectly - exactly what we needed for a cold winter stay. The hotel staff were very helpful. The hotel bar was very convenient and we spent hours there chatting with friends and enjoying a cocktail or two. The only downside - wi-fi is not included with your room price but it is available in all common areas. You can pay extra to have it in your room though. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to enjoy the Lower East Side.

title: Swanky  Love it!
text:
Around the corner from Russ and Daughters and Katz's is perfect! Great location.
Excellent service.  The personnel were awesome, helpful and accommodating. My view was stellar! Once I figured out how to work the shower, I was thrilled.

title: Nice area
text: This area of east village is very vibrant. The hotel is the tallest building of the street and you have a fantastic view over Manhattan. The personal is also friendly and the sushi bar get an amazing atmosphere with loads of local coming over after 6pm.

title: Review
text: Great hotel. Cleaness could be better though. Neighbour too much noise. Lobby perfect hosts. Pitty after have spend so much money that I had to pay 100$ per hour more for staying a bit longer. Wifi not included, this is not the 21st century like

title: Close to the east village and luxurious!
text: Our family was there for my daughters graduation. The hotel was a welcome repast after a long tiresome journey.  We were welcomed by all staff who were helpful and courteous.   They went the extra mile.   The location was perfect!  there is a little coffe shop called Sugar on the block  where we found reasonably priced meals.  There is also a restaurant called little Frankie's that is up one block and was fun.   I would recommend this hotel and would go again.

title: They take care of you!
text: We have enjoyed staying here in the past.  My family likes the modern decor and the location.  The hotel was oversold this time, and we were upgraded to a beautiful suite!  As usual, the front desk staff couldn't have been better.

title: Excellent séjour
text:
Nous avons passé un excellent séjour de 8 jours au Sixty LES
Un grand merci aux personnes de la réception, le portier, le concierge pour leur accueil, leur gentillesse et professionnalisme.
Nous une grande chambre de luxe très confortable avec un superbe salle de bain.
Nous recommandons cet hotel sans aucun problème.

title: great choice in NYC
text: Stayed here via hotel tonight. Fair rates in comparison to NYC standards. Everyone who hasn't should try Lower east side. Great vibe and not as touristic as Meatpacking or Soho. Large and clean rooms with a helpful staff. Youthful atmosphere. Behind the corner you will find great restaurants as the meatball place ( do not remember exact name, but you cannot miss it) and fat radish.

title: Should have kept on looking for better
text: When planning this trip to New York i looked for the right location and hotel and thought i had found it. We spent 5 nights here. I had payed a large deposit before leaving and on arrival payed the remainder. My fault i did not read the small print regarding incidentals. So when we got to our room we had a call to inform us my card had been decline. we left the luggage in the room went downstairs to pay for the incidentals on another card as they had tried to put the whole amount on one without letting me know. I accept responsibility on my part. We may be old fashion but was shocked when she handed us new cards for our room as she had cancelled the first ones incase we did not have enough money. I must say after that incident the staff was fantastic especially the reception staff and doormen. We spent a lot of time on the metro getting to places of interest so location was not great. We had to walk quiet a way to get to a diner that we used most of the time. There was nothing in the room to make tea or coffee which was disappointing so we found a little coffee shop two doors down we took it in turn to go out first thing in the morning to get our morning cuppa. We spent a lot of money on thing like this and the bar was so expensive. We were recommended a restaurant to get a meal we did not like the menu but stayed for two beers each this came to 36 dollars good job we never ate.

title: Schönes Hotel, beste Lage
text:
Das Hotel ist empfehlenswert. Das Hotel ist wirklich super toll gelegen, 2 Straßen weiter ist SoHo, Little Italy & Co. das Personal ist überaus bemüht und sehr serviceorientiert, jeder einzelne macht einen super Job! Die Aufmachung des Hotel ist wirklich wunderschön, stylisch, modern  und hat mir sehr gut gefallen.
Was mir leider nicht gefallen hat, war, dass wir in ein Zimmer gegenüber der Herrentoilette und neben der Abstellkammer untergebracht wurden. Dementsprechend war es immer laut, durch die Mitarbeiter. Aus der Balkontür raus (die abgesperrt war) konnten wir nicht, da der Pool, trotz nahezu 30 Grad, noch nicht offen hatte. Vor unserem Zimmer auf der Terrasse waren ständig Mitarbeiter, die Renovierungsarbeiten machten, leider auch ein no go. Bei der Abrechnung wurde uns einfach ein Getränk zuviel aus der Minibar berechnet, das wir nicht hatten. Das man heute noch knapp 15$ pro Tag für WLAN bezahlen muss, ist leider auch nicht der beste Service. Das Mobiliar im Zimmer hatte schon einige Macken, was für den Preis und ein 4,5 Sterne Haus eigentlich auch ein Unding ist. Alles in Allem ist es aber ein sehr schönes Hotel, in hervorragender Lage (Restaurants, Cafés, Bars, Shops  beginnen gleich neben dem Hotel) mit sehr gutem Service

title: Great Hotel
text: The Hotel is well located, the stuff very helpful and friendly. The rooms are cool and stylish decorated. We had great view from our room to the World Trade Center but also to the Empire State Building. Would absolutely recommend to chose this hotel for your next NY trip.

title: Great Stay
text:
Just returned from a 5night stay here. The hotel was perfect for our trip. The view from our 15th floor balcony was amazing and the room suited the vibe of the area- Cool and edgy.
The staff were fantastically helpful.
Loved the location, surrounded by bars, music venues and restaurants, possibly a bit to gritty for everyone's taste, but ideal for us.
All in all a fantastic hotel in a fantastic location!!

title: great place in lower east side
text: I found the hotel to be a quiet,clean and the pleasant staff were a pleasure. Comfortable Bed which is my priority. Easy access to lots of interesting restaurants and sights. would plan to stay again and recommend to friends

title: Amazingly friendly staff, and one of the best views of the city I've had from a hotel in a long time!
text:
I was in NYC just a couple days ago Thurs-Sat for a business trip; I booked the room through my company's travel and so had no issues with booking etc. 

Upon arrival, the door/bell staff were amazing. The guys were always extremely helpful, friendly, and had a smile any time we walked in or out! 

The folks at the desk were also very wonderful and I couldn't have been more pleased with the service the hotel provided, including bringing us a bucket of ice directly from the restaurant when we asked! 

The only issues I had during my stay were really extremely minor ones. The outlet cap fell off the wall when I tried to plug in my charger (had never actually been attached as far as I could tell), the water pressure was really low, and unfortunately when the very kind and friendly concierge gentleman directed me to a store so I could make a quick purchase before heading to work, unfortunately the one he recommended was closed until well after I needed to be at work, so I needed to find something else. Last but not least, apparently the keycards automatically reset and lock you out at noon, even when you have set up a late checkout (1pm), but other than it wonking out the elevator (it ended up stalling out on the 7th floor on our way up, then went all the way down to C where we picked up a maintenance man who very kindly told us what had happened and sent us to the front desk where it was easily fixed. 

All told, those exceedingly minor things weren't even really blips on the radar for my stay. I very much enjoyed the hotel, and from our room on the 9th floor, while we could hear occasional club noises (screams, shouts, laughter etc), it was never overly loud, thankfully. 

I would definitely stay here again, and would recommend it in a heartbeat to friends or family looking for a place in the LES area. 

~Paige

title: Nice place to stay
text: Great location.  Nice amenities.  Great hedge between luxury and funky.  Stayed here on business and it was very easy to get around from the location with the F train right there and cabs everywhere.  Not an inexpensive place, but pretty high level of service, so it's overall very good.  One of my pet peeves is higher end hotels charging for wifi.  It's just off-putting to charge a premium for rooms, then make you pay $15 for wifi.  It's not even the money, it's the principle.  It's 2015 - charging for wifi isn't really appropriate anymore...

title: Nothing special
text: The only good thing about this hotel is the location. The rooms are worn down. Holes in the curtains and the couch was full of stains. Floors not really clean. Lots of noice due to streetwork on both side of the hotel.

title: Quality
text: This hotel continues to shine. Staff is excellent.  Rooms are great. With great shower. I stay all over NYC and this is a gem. The area has hidden jewels everywhere. From, food to lounges, to live music.  Great night out.  Been coming here for years. Does not miss a step.

title: Great location
text: My initial reaction on arrival was.... What have I done?  But the rooms were lovely, clean and comfortable and the staff were always helpful. Our room was a little noisey due to street works but these obviously will be completed soon! The location is grungy, vibrant and eclectic. It is close to Little Italy, Chinatown but for us the cafes and restaurants of Nolita, East Village and those with in a block of the hotel catered for our desires ranging from cheap through to quality food and drink in quirky and interesting surrounds. Our only criticism was the steep charge for Internet access. Luckilywe discovered a number of coffee places nearby that provided free internet access.

title: Nice Hotel at a good location
text:
A nice and clean hotel, we stayed 3 nights and another 3 nights in another one (2 blocks next to it) over all a good experience... the shower area is super nice. 

Bad, that TV did not work, we complaint three times and they told us its a problem in the whole area..!? but in the hotel 2 blocks away as we stayed allso, we had brilliant tv choice... WIFI is just in the Lobby for free..

title: BROKEN GLASS in bed
text: I recently stayed at the Sixty LES for an anniversary getaway. While laying in bed I rolled over and felt a big scratch on my leg. I thought maybe it was a crumb or something, but when I looked I had a 3 inch cut on my leg that was bleeding. Upon further inspection I found a piece of broken glass between the sheets. Disgusting. I went downstairs for a band aid and to tell the staff and they said housekeeping would look into it. The next day I had a voicemail asking how my "hand" was and if I needed further medical attention. That's all. I felt as though more should have been done to make up for such a dangerous mistake by housekeeping. Not to mention I had a spa and massage the following day uptown and while trying to relax, the cut hurt badly during my day of relaxation.

title: Not a home run, but more than a single.
text: Stayed in this modern LES hotel in late April15.  Interesting location and neighborhood which is trending upward as the area redevelops.  Very friendly and knowledgeable staff are the highlight of this hotel.   King bed suite offered plenty of room with a few design flaws.  Light switches were sometimes placed across the room from the light.  Glass doors in the bathroom are really noisy and just plain a bad idea.  If you go to the bar you can get free internet, but when you buy a $300 plus night room, you pay an extra $15 per day for wifi.  That's messed up.  I am not a fan of the European style low beds that are offered here.  Close to subway stop.  Using taxi service from this location to Broadway or lower Manhattan is a budget buster.  Pretty decent bar/restaurant with after show food available.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: We stayed here for 6 nights at the end of April and we really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is modern, rooms (we had a deluxe king) are beautifully designed and spacious,  comfortable and clean. The bathroom is relatively small, but modern and pleasant. Staff are great. Friendly, helpful. The hotel is perfecty situated. Lots of bars and restaurants in the neighbourhood. Close to the subway. The view from our room at the tenth floor was absolutely awesome. We did not eat in the hotel, did not use the wifi, or have breakfast there, so we cannot comment on those things. We did take a look at the fitness area, which looked compact but complete. While you are there, check out the tenement museum, a couple of blocks further downtown. Hotel is absolutely recommended!!

title: Loved it!
text:
My Bestie and I stayed here for a one night (thanks to my boyfriend) so that we can go out and celebrate our best friends's "non wedding".  Anyway, from the moment I walked in everyone was so helpful, they asked where my car was so they can grab the bags and park the car.  The room was a perfect size and very high tech with a beatiful view of the LES.  The shower was so cool as well!.  We wanted to order some late night food, and being that room service closed I called the front desk and they brought us menu's.  Soon after our food arrived and I was told that it was paid for by the hotel!   We also woke up with a post card telling us not to worry about paying for the food. This was so sweet.  

Upon check out, they gave us a late check out until 1 which was great. They also take all of your bags in case you are staying in the area longer.  I enjoyed some bellini;s at the bar on the second floor.   

I can't wait to come stay again!

title: A very nice hotel
text: This was an excellent find for us, close to the venue we were attending and quite comfortable. The room was very high tech with an interesting layout and features such as dimmers and an interesting rainfall shower, along with a low platform bed (which I prefer) that made it an out-of-the-box NYC hotel experience for my wife and I, and we are very seasoned veterans of NYC hotels.

title: Sixty Les treats you like a rock star
text:
Most companies and businesses have forgotten the art of customer service. Not
Sixty Les. From the time you enter to the time you leave, you are taken care of.  I arrived and the staff already knew my name. They have it down. Rooms are larger than average. Modern style with a cool vibe. Good location to explore. Coming back for sure. The front desk never seems like you are annoying them. If you want to be treated like a rock star, this is the place. Great restaurant in Hotel too.

title: Best Hotel in the Lower East Side of NYC
text: We have stayed at this hotel many times and we love it.  Its extremely clean, the staff is so friendly and helpful and accommodating.  We have been upgraded at times to larger rooms and they were beautiful.  Two of the women at the front desk are wonderful, Nalani and Fatou, they are the best!!!  Whatever you need they will get you.  Also the guys at the front door that take your bags, hail cabs and take care of your car are so friendly and great!!! The last two times we stayed there which was this January and March we visited the restaurant on the 2nd floor.  The food is very good and the bartender Max is awesome.  He is very attentive and such a nice guy to talk to.  The hotel is right in the heart of the Noho area.  You can walk to Soho, Little Italy and China town.  No need to take cabs unless its raining or very cold out.  There are tons of restaurants and bars close by that you will not have a hard time finding something you like.  I strongly recommend if you come to New York City that you stay at this hotel you will not be disappointed.

title: The only downside for me was the location
text:
This hotel is reasonably small, reasonably chic, with well equipped and set out rooms and excellent staff.

The main problem I had was its location.  The Lower East Side is a bit edgy, a bit arty and a bit ... err ... how do you put this politely, run-down.  If you are in NYC and want something different and happy to stay this far downtown it may be an excellent choice.  For me it was too far from the shops, restaurants and attractions that I wanted.  I spent more money on taxis than I did on shopping (and I did loads of shopping).  So, before booking here, just check whether the location is convenient for you.

The other downside is that there is no place for breakfast.  The concierge did a great job making suggestions, but nothing really hit the mark.  All I really wanted is one of those breakfast buffets that they have in something like the Hilton.  I know that sounds bad, but it's what I wanted.

Although the price was reasonable (by NYC standards) I probably wouldn't stay here again.

title: Top of New York
text:
We stayed in the Sixty LES for our honeymoon. To say it short: It was absolutely amazing! Very friendly staff, a very nice room and an astonishing value for the price.
We recommend a room in the upper floors, because of the great view!
The nearest subway is across the street and nearby is a large variety of bars and restaurants.
Katz's delicatessen is just around the corner.

If you consider a a hotel in Manhattan... There is definitely no way around the Sixty LES!

title: Liked it
text: We had a amacing trip to New York in september 2014. The hotel staff was very nice and helpful except two very condescending girls in the reception. We also find it very strange that the hotel rates changed daily relative to the date and hotel occupancy , which made our hotel bill was substantially higher than the original price. So be sure to pay in advance to avoid paying extra. The outdoor bar - which by the way was very messy - was closed by 21.30 despite the nice weather . The rooms were lovely and the staff - especially those who stood at the doors . Good location .

title: Very comfortable
text:
We stay with my wife and two boys (14-15) for 5 days
The room are very nice, clean and big.
We don't used the SPA and Swimmingpool but I think with a nice weather will be fantastic.
Good location, near the MTA and 5 minutes walk on Broadway Ave.
Nearby a lot of restaurant.
A good experience.
The price is right.

title: A good value hotel close to all the action
text:
We stayed at the Sixty LES over the Easter period and whilst there were issues, this is a great value hotel close to all the action. I would suggest that the real mark for this review would be a 3.5 but i am going to give the hotel the benefit of the doubt as they addressed some of our concerns at check-out in a positive professional manner.
First the good: We had a good sized, corner room with a balcony that had a great view both up and downtown - all for a very reasonable rate. The staff were friendly and courteous at all times (with one exception) and the short walk to Soho and ease with which you can get anywhere in the city makes the Sixty LES a great base.The bed was also very comfortable.
The negatives: the room wasn't ready upon arrival, we couldn't get in until 4.40pm, which after a long flight isn't great. The towels in the room are postage stamp sized, it wouldn't hurt to have a couple of bath blankets so that people don't have to drip-dry! We used the sofa-bed in our room and whilst it was just about ok for a child, there is no way an adult could sleep on this though. When we asked for a duvet to soften the sofa-bed, a member of house-keeping passed this to us in a clear bag with the cover that we had to put on ourselves. Not great. The final gripe is WIFI - this is no longer a luxury and you should not be charged for it, you can walk in to any chain of stores in Manhattan and log-in for free, so come on - sort this!
One tip to make the Sixty LES better would be to make something of the second floor 'lounge'. People like somewhere to hang out, somewhere comfortable and somewhere with a vibe. Take a stroll round to the Ludlow round the corner and see how they do it - there is money to be made if you get it right.
When we raised some of our concerns at check-out, the hotel adjusted our bill and had a positive attitude, so this was good and showed the quality of the staff at the front desk.
I would certainly recommend staying here but be mindful, it is Manhattan on a budget.

title: Liked it a lot
text:
We had an amazing trip to New York. Loved this hotel the general vibe and helpful staff. Tasteful modern decor and a very comfortable bed. 

1 very small robe in the room only just fitted me a size 12 so no hope of it fitting anyone bigger. Not a big issue but a small piece of attention to detail. 
Would definitely recommend and consider staying here again. Hope we get the opportunity. ☺

title: Best hotel on the LES!
text:
We were warmly welcomed by the doormen and front desk as one would expect, but the staff's helpful and gracious manners continued steadfastly throughout our stay.  We arrived about 11:00 a.m. and were shown directly to our room which was wonderful. No waiting and storing bags like most NYC hotels. Our daughter lives on the LES so we are always in search of excellent accommodations. I don't want noisy or small rooms. Sixty LES could furnish us with two queen beds for this trip so we thought we'd try it. Two queen beds are hard to come by on the LES. The room was perfect.
1]STAFF is as efficient and as helpful as in any of the fine hotels we have stayed in. They are patient and quite knowledgable. They supplied us with perfect  restaurant suggestions when we needed help.
2] The room was perfectly clean and very quiet with ample room for 3 adults. The beds were quite comfy with lovely linens.The beds are low to the ground which is a problem if you have knee issues, but we certainly managed without an issue.  Spectacular blackout curtains!  
Nice bathroom with a very modern frosted glass motif and the area is large by NYC standards.
3] We enjoyed the bar nightly, but we did not eat in the hotel's popular Sushi restaurant.
 Sixty LES is surrounded by wonderful coffee shops, bagel shops, restaurants and  delicatessens. We loved exploring some new blocks of the LES!
4] We did not use the pool as it was very cold, but the pool is beautiful.
5] Fitness center was well equipped and had more equipment than most hotels.
6] We did not use the spa. No time for that sadly!
7] I appreciated the security of using your room key for the elevator to guest floors. 
Now back to the exceptional staff. Ben, one of the concierges, Engel and all the doormen, and everyone working at the front desk (sorry I don't know all their names) seemed to genuinely enjoy helping their guests.  It is rare today to witness such service across the board.  
I will return in May and look forward to another great visit!

title: Parfait!
text:
Accueil chaleureux, chambre spacieuse et calme, salle de bains nickel, housekeeping impeccable et un seul regret: de ne pas avoir connu la terrasse (saison d'hiver et tempête de neige!). Il ne me reste qu'à y retourner en été.
L'hôtel se situe dans mon quartier préféré.

title: Beautiful Amazing Hotel in LES
text:
Our experience at Sixty LES was above and beyond all of our expectations. We had no complaints and could not have had a better time. The location is perfect, the staff is amazing, and rooms are gorgeous, and the restaurant/bar was great. We had 0 complaints and were very satisfied with our stay.

The lobby staff was one of our favorite parts of our stay. They were perfectly welcoming, friendly and accomodating. The night manager was ending his shift, but I'm so glad we caught him before he did! Customer service was amazing, and he answered any and all questions thoroughly and honestly. The service at the hotel is unmatched in the city, and we really felt at home. We had a King Deluxe w/ wrap around balcony, and the room was absolutely perfect: clean, modern, comfortable. It's a perfect getaway from all the craziness of the LES right below.  Another plus is the Blue Ribbon Izakaya on the 2nd floor of the hotel, the food was amazing, especially the famous fried chicken. Afterwards we stopped by the bar, and the bartender was an absolute pleasure. He was super nice and knew a lot about alcohol, which is everything we could ask for in a bartender. 

I checked out a few of the hotels in the city during my trip, and Sixty LES was the best as far as design aesthetic and customer service. I will definitely be looking for Sixty hotels in my future travels.

title: Sehr gutes Hotel in der Lower Eastside mit toller Aussicht!
text:
Wir waren eine Woche im März in diesem schönen Hotel in bester Lage. Die Aussicht aus unserem schönen Zimmer hat uns umgehauen: Aus dem 17. Stock blickten wir über Lower Manhattan! Das Zimmer war klein, aber fein: Durch eine bodentiefe Fensterfront über zwei Wände war das Raumgefühl sehr gut, das Bett war bequem und der vorhandene Platz sinnvoll genutzt. Der tägliche Zimmer Service war ausgezeichnet und das Zimmer sehr sauber. Das Personal war insgesamt sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend, dabei jedoch angenehm zurückhaltend. Besonders gut hat uns der herausragend gute Service von Raul und seinen Kollegen in der Lobby gefallen!!! Die Jungs waren spitze. 

Die Anbindung des Hotels ist ebenfalls ausgezeichnet: Fußläufig sind East Village, Soho, Chinatown und Little Italy erreichbar. Die orangene Metro Linie "F" fährt direkt vor der Tür ab. Großartige Restaurants und Szene Locations befinden sich direkt vor der Haustür. 

Einziger Negativ-Faktor des Hotels ist die unglaublich hohe Gebühr für W-Lan (Das SIXTY Les verlangt $15/Tag für bis zu 3 Geräte).

title: Modern hotel in a trendy spot
text: This hotel is spotted in a very trendy and interesting area. I´ve been to Nyc couple of times before but never visited this area. It is a place to see locals and enjoy nice restaurants and bars (and Wholefoods is only few blocks away). One can get easily to other parts of Manhattan by subway. The hotel is well kept, modern and clean. The staff was very friendly and willing to help you. Our room was on the 15th floor and the view was amazing. The room size was good compared to average manhattan hotel and the decor boutique style. The bed wasn´t the best I´ve had but the bedding was very soft and high quality. The only downside is that in room wifi is chargeable, 15$/night. It is free in public areas but the lobby for example is quite small and therefore perhaps not the place where you want to hang around. Restaurant felt a bit overpriced to me but it sure looks amazing. We were in NYC to celebrate my sister turning 30. We kind of hoped our hotel to send her some birthdaywishes but that didn´t happen. It could have been a misunderstanding or it isn´t this hotel´s style to do so. We did have a nice room location so maybe that was the thing ;) All in all I was very satisfied with my stay. If you want to see "the real New York" and stay in a stylish and trendy hotel, this is definitely your place!

title: Gem in lower east side
text:
Very clean new hotel in the lower east side. Staff was outstanding. From the doormen to the concierge and front desk everyone extremely helpful. Rooms are larger than other hotels I've stayed at in the area and very modern.
Will definitely choose this hotel again over others in the area.

title: Great area, some issues
text:
We came for a lush girls' weekend, me and two girlfriends from the UK.

First of all, ALL of us had issues booking -- we were obviously being tracked by cookies and the price raised when we decided to book - 2 hours later! For me, the price jumped $30/night literally WHILE I was booking. I called to complain and they adjusted the rate, and did the same for one of my girlfriends who also called to complain.

My girlfriend who had specifically booked a more expensive room on the promise of having a bathtub did not receive one for the first night. This made me feel badly as I had chosen the hotel. She got one the second night, but only after the inconvenience of having to move rooms and I do not believe she was compensated in any way for her trouble (she's British, throw her a free pint in the bar for her trouble, hey?)

The rooms themselves are perfectly nice (though single room QUITE small, but that seems typical for NYC), price is reasonable for that neighborhood, gorgeous views, staff accommodating with taxis, bags, umbrellas, what-have-you. I only had like 10 working TV channels, luckily I had my iPad to read, though wi-fi is expensive so no streaming for me. 

This neighborhood attracts hipsters and partyers; my floor was quite loud, quite late on the Saturday night and my girlfriend also complained of party noise on the balcony below her floor until quite late. You are not going to get your full 8 hours here on a weekend unless you bring earplugs!

I was prepaid, so if in a hurry I probably wouldn't have gone through the formality of checking out. I did, and only to find I had been charged for 2 still waters that I didn't drink or even touch (I'm a bubbly girl myself). Felt like a sly way to make money on people who are too rushed or confident in their pre-booking to bother formally checking out.  

Anyway these days I feel like you get complimentary still water at most hotels, along with hot water kettle, etc. which this also did not have. Very bare bones.

I would still recommend staying here, but stay on top of them for all the little details that might annoy.

title: Just ok--Not very accommodating
text: Just ok. Rooms small. Asked for late check out on a weekday stay and they were not accommodating and I know they were no where near capacity during winter months. Heard elevator dings from my room, luckily it wasn't to busy but if it had been I would have asked for a room switch. Good location.

title: Fake hip
text:
Low end "standard east", trying to make trendy with black paint. Good location for me, the happening part of town.
Room generous size bed ok, finishes a little dinged, lacking the little touches that make it special.

title: One In a Million
text: Everything I wanted and needed was at my disposal.  Even a masseuse.  The room was quiet, the view extravagant, and I cannot wait to revisit.  The staff was extraordinarily friendly and looked forward to assist me in endeavor.

title: RAUL IS THE MAN
text: I stay here all the time for work and have always had a good experience. This last trip I met Raul and I am pretty sure that he is the hotel's best employee. He always has a smile on his face and is ready to help. One time he stood outside in the snow for 15 minutes to get a cab for me while I waited inside. Nicest guy and always professional. Thanks so much Raul!

title: LES Hotel Perfection
text: The Sixty LES is well located on Allen St in the eclectic LES,  and a comfortable stroll to Soho.  The rooms are spacious,very well appointed with a modernist twist.  Higher rooms have excellent views of the Manhattan Skyline,  particularly at night. The hotel has a great Japanese restaurant,  with a low key softwood setting,  or more formal surrounds if the mood prevails.  Most helpful concierge,  bell hops and service staff complete this package of LES Hotel Perfection.

title: great experience
text:
I stayed here two nights when visiting at NYU. I had the most awesome room, 17th floor, a corner, unlimited view over the lower Manhattan. And yes, this was a normal price room, I think the cheapest what they offer. The room had a nice design, a futon-style bed, simple colors, a modern bathroom, a good shower. Nothing to complain. 

All staff were very nice and helpful. I arrived at a morning, and got my room around 11am. I was enjoying a morning coffee at a neighborhood when they called to me. Doormen were friendly and helpful, smiling always. Also breakfast service was good. I didn't eat a dinner there. A subway F is just a few steps from the hotel, several restaurants and bars close by, also grocery (WholeFoods) in 5 min walk. 

I simple cannot tell anything negative. Some people here complain about a elevator keycard system. I didn't have any problems. A normal system in many hotels all over the world. And about wifi, it is free in public areas. I definitely want to visit at a summer time too, I want to experience the pool!

title: For the Young
text: We stayed here several years ago when the hotel was called the Thompson.  It is very modern chic.  Located on the LES, it is in walking distance of many clubs and restaurants.  We found it to be extremely loud as we were located  very near the hotel's  club/bar.  We had breakfast on the patio...cool space... lousy food.  The price was reasonable...we got what we paid for.

title: Bonne adresse
text: La chambre est grande avec un petit espace salon très agréable lorsqu on reste qq jours. Le lit et les oreillers sont très confortables. Grands placards très agréables. Douche spacieuse et très jolie. Personnel très serviable et souriant. Restaurant japonais bon mais bruyant dans la grande salle. Préférer dîner au bar.

title: Good hotel
text: We stayed here for one night and had a great experience. The front desk was very helpful and attentive. Rooms are comfortable and clean with a very modern artsy decor. Overall a good stay for a very short period of time.

title: Mixed Bag
text:
Pros: good location on lower east side, sauna, fitness ctr, friendly staff, restaurant on-site, very cool shower.
Cons: strives to be "edgy" at expense of comfort. Lighting and switches in room are ridiculous.... Flood lights for reading in bed? A switch on only one side of the bed that controls both high beams? Dimmers, and lighting that is not efficient. Room was a bit tight for the price. $15/24hr period for Internet in the room is steep. Elevator button panel is, again, a lighting fail. And finally, we thought the food was very good at in-house Japanese restaurant, but it had loud pulsing music that meant we couldn't hear each other across the table and everyone else was shouting. 
Overall, this hotel is probably more suitable for twenty-somethings who prefer edgy over efficiency and comfort.

title: Great Gem on Lower East Side
text: Spent 2 nights at Sixty LES over Valentine's weekend. Hotel has a very cool vibe, is clean and comfortable and has some of the nicest most helpful and friendly staff I've experienced in Manhattan. On an extremely busy weekend, the concierge was able to suggest a last minute restaurant for us across the street which wound up being a great recommendation with a special surprise when we received a free desert and discount to our bill compliments of the hotel. Will definitely stay at Sixty LES again!

title: Great Value
text:
brand new construction so everything is new which also means very clean . Also by New York standards the rooms are pretty large. I love the location because you can walk to SoHo , The Village , Downtown and even Union Square. I am not a fan of staying in the big tourist areas . The location is quiet by NY standards and being on the upper floors was great with great views.

If you want the luxury of a place like the Four Seasons or Mandarin this is not for you but if you like a modern hip and trendy spot that is also a good value this is a great choice and I would definitely go back in a heartbeat.

title: Great location, cool place
text:
We stayed 3 nights at Sixty LES and truly enjoyed our stay. Location is perfect in LES, the rooms are rather large for New York standard (we stayed in a King deluxe) and if you get a room on the higher floors the view is amazing! Bed was comfortable and while some minor things in the room could be improved (leaking shower, small towels, amenities not replenished during our stay) it's a very good deal for the price we paid (had a special deal on Booking.com). 
Front desk staff is efficient but (as usual) the bellboys truly make your stay unforgettable. Local tips, always a friendly smile, they remember you by name and always have a nice and kind word. A special thanks to Raul who went the extra mile for us.

title: Bliss on a stick
text: I stayed 5 days at the Sixty LES and all I can say is BRAVO. The room was spacious and very clean. My room offered an incredible view of the Liberty Towers and the bed was beyond comfortable . The front desk was very helpful and has great recommendation, the staff genuinely cares for the guest ( special thanks to Carolina and Zora who took very good care of me ). The doormen take proud of their job and look after you. I am very impressed by the high quality of service provided by this hotel. Also the location is fantastic, the area is safe and fun; I will definitely re visit this establishment.

title: New Favorite Place!
text:
We came up for the weekend and had an absolutely wonderful time in NY partly thanks to the great staff at this hotel. They were attentive from the moment we stepped out of the car and happy to help with any questions we had throughout our stay. Cant wait to return! Oh and the view was incredible!

GB

title: Great place to stay with a fabulous view!
text: My husband and I enjoyed our stay so much we can't wait to go back. Everyone was so cordial and the room was delightful. even though short on space it was large on ambience. Immaculate and with a knockout view of lower Manhattan and the freedom tower. Loved our stay. Breakfast was great too!

title: Positive experience
text:
Loved my room, wish I had more of a city view but the ambiance made up for that. Celebrated my BF 26th birthday, after dinner at sushi-Izakaya inside the hotel we had about 7 people in our room for drinks, we were pretty loud but I didnt receive one call or complaint! That's a first! The restaurant was amazing!

Great experience overall, I'd recommended it to anyone.

title: Great property
text: Hotel experience was great. Property is centralized in LES just south of Houston. Service was great from the front desk, and the rooms were very modern with wood floors, modern bathrooms and nice furniture. Overall it was a great stay in LES at an affordable price. Would recommend.

title: noisy and uncomfortable
text: Booked two nights, checked out after one. Chic design and floor to ceiling windows can't mask uncomfortable mattresses, noisy rooms, & poor climate control.  When we explained our concerns to the front desk the response was "OK - it's fine if you want to check out early."  Not even an apology! This is probably what left the worst taste in my mouth.    We ended up moving to a new Holiday Inn which was half the price, twice as comfortable, with FREE wifi, coffee in the room and an amazingly helpful front desk.

title: Excellent service!
text:
I had to stay in NY only for 1 night before flying off for a vacation in Bermuda. Since the date was December 27th, all hotels were very expensive! I usually stay at their sister property, 6 Columbus, but since it was too expensive I looked on Hotwire/Priceline for great sales. I found one on Hotwire for the Sixty LES. I booked it and was really glad I did. I am in my 40's so the Lower East Side would not be my principal base if I was looking to stay for a couple of days but for only one night it was perfect!

PROS:
     *The restaurant: I am a fan of Blue Ribbon so I ate dinner and had cocktails there.
     *The view: Some people say that when you book with a 3rd party, you get stuck in a closet but it was not the case here. I got a corner room with an incredible view. I had views of the Empire State building and the Chrysler building on the north and East views from the other window. It was simply incredible to have a room with windows from floor to ceiling with this incredible view.
     *The service: Everyone was the nicest...from the concierges to the front desk agents to the housekeeping people I met during my short stay. It is one of the strong points I remember.

CONS:
     *The lighting: There were only 3 lights in the room...a lamp on the desk and 2 bright spots next to the bed where you think you are in an interrogating room in a police station!! I know I am one of the freaks who turn in early in NY to watch television or read in bed but there was no in between..it was either near pitch dark or like in a cafeteria!! I emailed them and they said they would bring alternative lighting it I were to go back. It just shows that they have excellent service.
     *The hotel lobby: It is totally personal...but I prefer smaller hotels where you have the front desk with the concierge and a small intimate area where you can sit and just get up to ask the hotel staff if you have questions. Their hotel lobby is on the 2nd floor and the agents and the concierge is on the 1st floor....I know....I had to nitpcik to find faults!

    All in alll...it is a great hotel that I recommend to younger people who love the Lower East Side. I liked my experience but prefer the area next to the 6 Columbus but it is due to my age;-)

title: LES is where its at!
text: We stayed in Sixty LES for 9 nights and for part of our stay, we were upgraded to a bigger room with an excellent view of lower Manhattan as the in-room safe was not working. We really liked how they handled the issue when it was discovered and immediately moved us to another bigger and better  room with minimal hassle. The bell service staff and doormen were friendly and warm and most of the staff we encountered made us feel very welcomed. As much as we enjoyed exploring NYC, we also looked forward to resting at our room every night as it was so ccomfortable! We would recommend Sixty LES is an a heartbeat. Location wise it is a great base for Manhattan and so many good food in the vicinity!

title: Great location with cool vibe and great gym
text: Stayed there for three nights in January.   The views were fantastic, service from the bellman to the front desk to the concierge were top notch.   Has a standard room the first night which was a bit small for the two of us but they were very good about upgrading us for a very reasonable fee.  The gym in the basement is a decent size but has all the right kit along with a sauna to boot .  All were in great shape and could tell they were well cared for.  The neighborhood is great for eating shopping and of course nightlife.

title: Fabulous Work Visit
text: The staff were so friendly and helpful. The doormen whisked me right up to the room and then helped when I needed to change rooms. Really the doormen were wonderfully helpful about the neighborhood.  I enjoyed the visit and would go back.

title: Great hotel with amazing service.
text:
I'm currently staying at the Sixty LES and have had a wonderful experience. My room is modern, clean, spacious and quiet. I have also received amazing service from everyone at the hotel. 

I highly recommend this hotel!

title: We will stay here again.
text: Top-notch staff and amenities.  Very clean and comfortable.  At 3AM, the room next door to ours was host to a gregarious group of women. It sounded as if they were sitting in our room with us. The front desk tried to get them to be a bit quieter, but to the hotel's credit, rather than minimize the group's fun or require us to forego a quiet night, they simply moved us quickly and efficiently to a new room. Kudos to the staff.  Both my husband and I got massages the next morning, and both of us agreed that the quality was second only to our experience at Ten Thousand Waves in Santa Fe. The hotel was also very flexible in terms of a late check-out and leaving our car with the valet for a few hours after we had checked out. My husband lived in NYC for about 10 years before moving to Boston, so we try to visit as often as we can.  Sixty LES will be our go-to hotel now.

title: Near perfect
text:
Hour and a half wait for room although we were in time .Bellman And doormen extremely helpful 
First room was dirty but upgrade was beautiful 
Heat and a/c could've been better 
Claim of noise complaint but was upgraded to better suite 
Night manager nazim kazimov and bellman justin were wonderful  in solving problems and accommodations  
Nice location and ambience
Beautiful rooms

title: Excellent choice in LES
text: We stayed here for one week in Dec. This is my favorite part of NYC and the hotel is close to East Village, NOLITA, chinatown and SOHO. Subway and bus stops within the block so very convenient for going up/downtown and to Brooklyn. Rooms very well designed, Very well equipped gym, limited breakfast menu but 24/7 cafe next door. Staaf extremely courteous and helpful. Will definitely come back. Highly recommended

title: Sentirsi di casa a New York
text:
L'hotel è in ottima posizione (per i miei gusti Newyorkesi) al 190 di Allen Street, nel Lower East Side vicino a Nolita, SoHo, LittleItaly e Chinatown, tutti raggiungibili a piedi in 15 minuti. Fermata della metropolitana a 1 minuto, fondamentale per raggiungere in pochi minuti qualsiasi posto di Manhattan e dintorni. 
Hotel rinnovato e di arredamento fashion molto curato. Camere molto belle e accoglienti. Abbiamo dormito 6 notti nella 410, una King De Luxe al 4 piano. Stanza da letto separata da salottino (due TV schermo piatto, una per stanza), e bagno con doccia (spaziosa e con irradiatore grande, ottima) e vasca (piccolina ma funzionale). Finestre a vetro fino a terra con balconcino (in comune con altre camere). Vista a west: Freedom Tower, One World Trade Center a sud e Empire State Building da lontano a nord. Dietro al letto matrimoniale una fotografia illuminata (lampada) gigante di un olivo. 
Personale molto gentile e collaborativo. Concierge preparata e disponibile nel suggerire locali per cena o altri avvenimenti (capodanno). 
Prima della prenotazione avevo contattato l'hotel via e.mail per chiedere spiegazioni e chiarimento sulla camera e contrattare il prezzo e ho avuto risposte soddisfacenti (oltre a trovare un piccolo pensiero in camera all'arrivo con lettera personalizzata). 
Hanno una piscina esterna (non utilizzabile in inverno, quindi) piccola e stretta al 3 piano. 
WiFi in camera si paga 15usd /giorno per collegare 3 apparecchi. WiFi gratuito nella lobby al piano terra e in un salottino lettura molto comodo al secondo piano. Quello gratis nel salottino ha segnale potente (reggeva bene le videochiamate con FaceTime). Costo frigobar abbastanza proibitivo: 8 usd bottiglia acqua (grande). È presente ristorante (sempre al 2 piano) ma non abbiamo avuto tempo di provarlo (troppi altri ristoranti carini in zona e non). 
In definitiva, a mio parere, ottima scelta per visitare Manhattan e dintorni.

title: Hotel moderno in zona tranquilla
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato al Sixty Les per 7 notti. Ci siamo trovati molto bene. L'hotel è molto moderno, sia la hall e il primo piano (luogo per rilassarsi con divanetti), sia la camera. La camera era molto spaziosa. Ce ne hanno data una al 16 piano con balcone e una vista stupenda su NY!! Appena siamo arrivati il pavimento era molto polveroso a vista d'occhio (forse non era occupata da qualche giorno?). Inoltre l'accappatoio era sporco di sangue già secco e nei giorni a seguire si potevano vedere ogni tanto qualche macchia sugli asciugamani appena portati. Oltre al primo giorno e agli asciugamani, sempre pulito.
Alla reception c'erano solo ragazzi giovani e gentili. C'è chi si sforzava di parlare italiano quando si chiedeva qualche aiuto su luoghi da visitare o dove mangiare. 
Nelle vicinanze ci sono diversi bar/ristoranti anche per fare colazione. È una zona tranquilla, lontana dal rumoroso centro e dal traffico. La fermata della metro è di fronte all'hotel. Per andare a piedi fino a Central Park ci si impiega un oretta passeggiando tranquillamente. Nei quartieri di Soho e Little Italy ci si è praticamente dentro, mentre per il Financial Distrect in mezzoretta si arriva. La posizione è buona ma da tenere in considerazione che essendo lontana dal centro (Times Square, 5th Avenue,..), se la sera ci si trovava lì il taxi era d'obbligo.

title: Greatest spot ever!
text:
I had the slightly nerve-wracking (yet wonderful) experience of meeting my 1/2 brother for the first time a little over a week ago. He drove up with his wife and daughter from FL and we decided to meet in NY for a few days before returning to my home in eastern CT. Of course, I was quite nervous about choosing the right hotel. I e-mailed the front desk and told them of my concerns and they made sure that my experience was as stress free as possible.

Ms. Fatou Ndione was just awesome. She made sure the rooms we had were close by to each other and the rooms were just lovely. Mine was a king room with a wrap around balcony that gave me spectacular views up and downtown (room 1200) and my brother had a room with two queen beds. Both rooms were very spacious, particularly for Manhattan standards, both were spotless, the linens were cozy and of good quality and the beds extremely comfortable. 

The concierge and other staff were friendly and always willing to help out. Parking is available by valet and is expensive ($55/day without in/out service) but is equivalent to other hotels throughout the city. The LES has a true neighborhood feel with many types of restaurants and shops and easy walking distance to chinatown, little italy, soho etc. The metro is across the street, so basically you can get anywhere very easily!!

The only thing I could recommend to make the experience at the hotel better, would be to offer wifi gratis. Otherwise, it was a perfect stay and I will be returning again. I loved it!

title: Trendy Stay in LES
text: This trendy hotel is a perfect choice for the LES. The staff were accommodating, the well-decorated zen room was large with a good view. Our luggage was delayed by the airline and the hotel staff delivered it to our room when it arrived. The hotel is on Allen Street right near Houston. There is a giant Whole Foods nearby on Houston and plenty of good eateries and bars in the area. The lobby is small, however there is a lounge and very good sushi bar on a higher floor. The room was quiet for being in a busy area.

title: Incredible staff
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Sixty LES over the holiday.  We had a little (okay, major) snafu with our reservations (totally my own fault).  Without going into the whole sorted story, I have to say I was incredibly impressed by the reaction of the staff behind the counter.  Ashley was so helpful in keeping us from panicking and pulled in the lovely manager, Fatou.  Without skipping a beat, Fatou began working on getting something to work for us.  Never once did they make me feel bad about messing it up.  They were extremely professional and diligent in providing the best service they could.  We ended up having a beautiful skyline view suite of the LES and left feeling like we got the best we could have ever asked for.  Thank you to Fatou, Ashley and the rest of the lobby staff for making us feel at home and going out of their way to accommodate us.

title: Well located modern hotel
text:
I've stayed here before when it was known as Thompson LES.  This was a second recent visit

PRO's - well located in Lower East Side.  Modern, clean, quiet, excellent staff, good housekeeping. Umbrellas in room and lobby a nice touch as we had some very rainy days.

CON's.  Bar / restaurant area not busy and breakfast options monotonous.  However no bar or restaurant service on Xmas Day - unacceptable for a full service hotel. Luckily we found somewhere else open for breakfast locally - but most places in NYC closed on Xmas day.  Even more annoyed when I complained the following day to be told by the staff member that the bar had been open on Xmas day, and I was incorrect.  I must have imagined the chairs stacked on tables and locked down bar area on Xmas day...........

TIP's  Wifi expensive in rooms - free in lobby area (albeit Blue Ribbon network is faster than the SIXTY network - bar staff can give the passcode if asked).

Overall a good hotel - but overpriced on Xmas day when they did not provide what should be standard services for a hotel of this standing.

title: Trendy Hotel
text: Sixty LES is in a great location for travelers that would like to be near SOHO, China town, Little Italy, and anywhere happening in the Lower East Side. My significant other and I had a wonderful time in the hotel. It was clean and roomier than other hotels that I have stayed in the past in NYC. Carolina that works there is a huge help and a pleasure to speak with when we had any concerns. She made our stay extra special and made our trip turn from sour to great! We really enjoyed our stay here and would recommend to anyone that would like to stay in the  Lower East Side of NYC.

title: Recommended
text: Incredible views over lower Manhattan. Staff were all knowledgable and most helpful. Great furnishings throughout room. The room has a naturally sexy feel with lighting and other touches. The room was a little noisey during the day with sirens.

title: amazing stay!
text: Loved this boutique hotel for many reasons.... The Lower East Side is the place to stay in Manhattan if you like individual shops and great places to eat and drink. The staff at the hotel were all extremely helpful and made our stay the best so far in New York. The room was perfect and the only thing which lets this place down is that you have to pay for your WIFI unless you want to sit in the lobby.

title: Beautiful room  with amazing wiew of Manhattan and  friendly employees
text:
Well  situated  (metro station near)
Room is clean, well isolated and the suite they gave us was beautiful with a large bath
All what  you need in a room
Employees are friendly and really *comprehensive*

Original concept (decoration, restaurant)

title: Love this place!
text: My husband and I have been coming here regularly for about four years and it never fails to impress! The location is top notch, the ambience is sexy and the service is great from the moment you pull up (special thanks to Christian and Raul who are always more than helpful!). I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great Boutique!
text: Stay here, great staff, dope, stylish, clean rooms. Really good concierge & front desks. Good location, right across the street from the station, so easy to get around. Suga on the corner is a great 24 hour food spot, whole food within walking distance.

title: Hip and Trendy
text: We loved this trendy hotel! Great location! Everyone was friendly and helpful! They really seemed to enjoy working there. Room wasa perfect size, no outside noise, comfy beds (which I usually select marriott hotels for this reason)! Check out the bar next door- great location to hear local music

title: Love this LES hotel!
text:
Had two rooms booked for my birthday celebration with my husband, my friend (her birthday as well) and her husband.  We had booked 2 months in advance through Third party service because it was justa week and a half before Christmas.  We both showed up ( both couples) at the same time, around 4pm on Saturday (december 13th, Xmas time, mayhem time)to find out that for some reason, the third party service had cancelled our reservations. Ashley immediately reacted and was trying to figure out what she could do to help us.  She reached out to Fatou to see what options were available for us. They managed to find space for us in the hotel and upgraded us to a beautiful suite that was large enough to accommodate all 4 of us.  (Our original reservation requested two rooms next to each other)
We had planned a quick one night celebration in the city and it could have quickly been ruined, but the staff at Sixty LES, without even skipping a beat, prevented that from happening and made it a homerun instead. 
At this point, we were now running late for our reservations.  Being Xmas time and Santa Con weekend, (Thousands of santas running around the city occupying all of the taxis.) The doorman ran to the corner to try and find us a taxi, tried calling a car service, literally, anything and everything they could do to help us get to our next location.  Valet/doormen/bell were all super friendly and super helpful.  
There are many great hotels in the city, but it's hard to find a great hotel that has the level of service this hotel has.  We'll be back for sure!  Thanks for a great birthday weekend!!!

title: So good but so BAD
text:
I thought I'd found the perfect hotel for me and my employees to stay in while in NY. Perfectly situated, not cheap - but a decent price, great size rooms and beautiful decor.... however... the staff is completely incompetent. Such a shame.
It took me an incredibly long time to check in because of a missing note on the booking (it wasn't the hotel's fault at all but the receptionist just kept saying "sorry, it's company policy... sorry, it's company policy" - I felt for her, she wasn't trying to be obstructive she just had no idea how to deal with the problem.
That certainly wasn't a deal breaker and the staff (with one notable exception) were incredibly friendly... it's just that nothing went right. AC didn't work, took 3 days to fix; I got a wake-up call when I didn't want one and didn't get one when I did; the valet didn't bring the car around when I booked it and told me it would be half an hour to get it (or I could walk in the pouring rain to the garage to pick it up myself which would take 10 minutes). I had a meeting. I chose to walk.... the list goes on.
When I came to check out I questioned the valet charge and the receptionist said "it was your choice to go and get the car, not ours"!!!! Unbelievable.
Every time we walked through reception we heard the same 2 sentences from staff to various customers - "sorry about that" and "do you know who you talked to?"... Obviously my stay was not the exception.
When I got home I had an email waiting asking me for feedback that addressed me as "Ms Andreson"... I am a man, and my last name was mis-spelled... that sums it up really.
SUCH A SHAME. The hotel itself is perfect and the staff appear to be trying (they just don't seem to know what to do)... No one thing is a deal-breaker but the crazy storm of incompetence means that this hotel is no good - particularly if you're staying on business and need things done efficiently.
Don't stay here. For the price there are much better experiences available.

title: another design hotel if you want to stay in LES
text:
The hotel is typical from all design hotel in NYC: hot for few months and getting old fashion very fast.
The design of the 60 is still pleasant, even if we get bored of this kind of black all over concept..
The rooms are small, as usual in NYC, the beds are quite nice, the service at the frontdesk is just ok.
Location is still quite nice if you are into Lower East Side.
I went there already once at the opening and what seemed to me very cool at that time looks now a bit over..

title: amazing amazing amazing
text: recently my wife and i chose a night at sixty LES to celebrate our anniversary. when we first moved to new york eighteen years ago we spent countless nights on the lower east side. many things have changed since then – some for the better and some, well, let's just say there are memories never to be forgotten, but sadly never to be relived. as a result our trip was intended to be half nostalgia, half adventure. in fact, we weren't even planning on staying in the room all that much. but, once we arrived, we didn't want to leave. the welcome, the attention, the accommodation, and the sheer luxury of the hotel and staff was inescapably extraordinary. we're not the type of people who are ever at a loss for words, but to this day communicating the extravagance we experienced is next to impossible. most incredibly, perhaps, was the fact that we had made no special arrangements: we booked on orbitz, no mention or hint of our celebration. it basically told us this mode of operation was standard business practice, and that was impressive. as a result we now have new memories that, i dare say, are better than many of the old ones.

title: NYC BEST STAYCATION
text: I absolutely LOVE this hotel. It's one of my faves for a staycation in Manhattan. They really appreciate brand loyalty and give upgrades accordingly. Service is exceptional. This hotel is a BIG YES!!!

title: Great deal
text: We were upgraded to a suite for our stay, which was not particularly big, but a nice room.  Service, however, is the big upside of this hotel:  attentive, friendly, really worked hard to make our stay a pleasure.  Raoul, who works as a doorman / bell guy is the bomb, superb.  Ask for a quiet room in the back.

title: Unethical business practices
text:
I was flying red eye for a 9 am business meeting. I booked and paid for this hotel from the night before my arrival so that I could come in from the airport, shower and be ready for my meeting.

I get to the hotel and they tell me that they've given away my room because I didn't check in by midnight.

"But," I say, "I paid for the room."

"Yes," says the manager, "but, since you didn't check in by midnight, we sold your room."

"Then you won't be charging me for the room, correct?", I ask.

"You will be charged the no-show penalty.", says the manager.

"How much is that?", I ask.

"The full night's rate." the manager replies.

So, the hotel made double that night on my room. I didn't get a room. I will grant the manager a tiny bit of credit for letting me shower in their gym so that I could at least look presentable for my meeting. 

I work for a relatively large company that has a travel department. We do a lot of travel and this hotel has an agreement with my company. We bring them a fair amount of business. If this is how we get treated, imagine how you will be treated as an individual.

title: Won't go back
text:
I would rate this place terrible, but the customer service was really good. We had an eventful stay and in a nutshell it was noisy and overpriced. 
Pros: The location is great and very convenient. There are lots of restaurants, supermarkets and coffee shops around. There is a cinema a few minutes away. Little Italy and Chinatown are 10 mins walking distance. The subway is on the other side of the road. There is a bus stop also right outside the hotel. 
Customer service is amazing. They have always tried their best to accommodate us and our needs. At some point they left us a small box with bonbons and a "thank you for staying with us" note.
That being said though, there were a few reasons why we would not go back, noise being the main problem. 
You need the key (a card) to go to all the floors. You would think they explain that to you when you arrive, but no one did, so we stood in the elevator like idiots pushing the button and wondering why it wasn't working. Then you notice the slot for the card and voilá! you introduce the card, press the floor button and you can go up. One of the keys wasn't working, but they can quickly fix that for you.
This never happened to us before, but we had to change rooms twice. The first room they gave us was very nice, but as soon as someone else occupied the room next to ours it was impossible to stay there. The walls seemed to be paper thin - we could hear everything happening next door: the TV (which wasn't even loud), the conversations (also not loud) and the constant cough. We arrived late at night and were tired from a 6 hour trip. We just wanted to sleep, but couldn't. We tried for a while, but it wasn't working, so we called the front desk and they changed us to the quietest room they could think of. 
We had two problems with the second room. We could hear what seemed to be an open window or door slamming every few minutes and it was freezing cold. This room is next to the swimming pool deck, which was closed for the season, and had doors (instead of windows) that give you access to the deck. Unfortunately, we could feel the very cold air come in constantly from every crack of these doors. Because the bed was right next to this door, even with the A/C on we could still feel the wind. Again we tried to make it work, but we were not able to sleep and asked to move again. The staff was impeccable the whole time. They even let me see two rooms and choose the third room. 
This room was smaller, but we didn't have a problem with that. It was a bit noisy because it is facing Allen St. (busy night and day), so we could hear all the honking and ambulances and what not, but we stayed there for the rest of our stay (almost a week). 
The staff followed up and called to make sure we were enjoying our stay and everyone was always polite and nice. 
I ordered food service once and the food was very tasty and it took less than the 20 mins they said it would take. I also asked for a kettle to make tea in room and accidently broke a glass and they didn't charge neither of this. 
The room cleaning wasn't always so great. Our bathroom even smelled to urine for a couple of days. The first time I noticed it, but it was late so I waited to see what would happen the next day. After they cleaned it again the smell was still there, so I asked the front desk to tell the cleaning staff to be more thorough the next time. They offered to clean it right when I complained, but it was late and we wanted to rest. The next day they cleaned it properly. Our last day we didn't have soap in the shower. We had a pen in the room which stopped working in the beginning of our stay so I put it in the bin; it was never replaced. The night before we left was a Friday night - I almost didn't get any sleep. There seemed to be a party somewhere and we could hear music plus the noise from all the traffic - it was like rush hour, but late at night - terrible.
Every night the staff would came to knock on our door to ask if we want ice and a square of chocolate. From our room we could hear the staff collecting the ice from the machine. We could also hear the elevator sound from every room we tried. 
So, no we will not stay or recommend this place to anyone.

title: "What a view!"
text: My wife and I spent the night at the Sixty hotel @ 190 Allen St.in NYC on the lower east side. We were in room # 1600, and had the best view ever!!! It was a corner room with a balcony, when you looked to the left there was the Freedom tower and when you looked to right there was the Empire State Building, we thought it looked great during the day, at night, words cant even describe the view!!! The room was unique, modern,quiet and clean with a great bathroom and shower, the bed was comfy and had a cool modern leather chair for relaxing. The staff was young but very professional and polite. The men at the lobby entrance were great handling our bags and opening and holding the door for us. This hotel is in a great location,& although very pricey, I would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in NYC!

title: Great Location
text: I had a corner room on the 9th floor facing the street. Great street views and beyond. The staff was courteous and professional. Justin who worked afternoon/evening was really helpful and very friendly. The room was spacious and the bed was very comfortable. At night the room got very hot so I had to open the windows to let in some cool air and this was during a freak cold snap that had the temperatures in the low 30's. But doing this also let in all the street noise.  A very cool music hall almost next door. All types of good restaurants within walking distance. Subway is only half block away. There is no coffee or mini fridge in the room, however, you can order room service but it would be $40 for coffee, eggs and toast, for one person... so you definitely have to go out for coffee and breakfast. The Blue Ribbon Asian/fusion restaurant that is shared with the hotel is fabulous.

title: Quiet, Modern & Great Location
text: I stayed at this fantastic location last week and really enjoyed my stay. The room and bathroom were clean with modern furnishing and good products.  The service was excellent and the staff friendly.  Quiet is a big thing for me because I work in my room prior to meetings and events. I was given a room that exceeded my expectations. I was expecting a smaller space and they upgraded me - giving the option of having a meeting in my room.  The friendliness of the front desk staff indicated to me if I hadn't been pleased, they would have taken care of it right away.

title: Modern, unique, hotel with young, attentive staff has all you need under one roof: spa, room service, AND sushi!
text: We stayed in the king suite with terrace. Decor is modern industrial with a European flair. All of our many special requests were honored by the beautiful young staff lead purposefully and warmly by Heidi Engelmann. The doormen couldn't assist us quickly enough. And the location is an event all in itself! We can't wait to return to NYC and sixtyles. Wonderful...

title: Amazing service and ambience
text:
Spent 9 nights in NYC and had an awesome experience - both in terms of the City and the Hotel.  Really cool hotel in fab location (very cool area), but it's the people at the Sixty that make it really special.  They could not have been more helpful.  They made us feel so welcome - everytime we entered or left we had lovely chats, were asked if we needed anything like a taxis and they always checked we were having a good time.
The concierges Ben and William really worked hard for us, and we gave them some challenging requests - one was to get my name printed on my top for running the marathon - they did it at short notice and it wasn't easy - super impressive.
Lovely room, with a sitting area and a fab, spacious bathroom.
All the staff were lovely, in particular Justin, William, Ben and Greg are amazing!!!
Will definitely go back when I next go to NYC and totally recommend the hotel.

title: Amazing Hotel
text:
Room was great and service was amazing - Raul went above and beyond.  Restaurant is also fantastic - great food and cocktails.  

I will definitely stay here again.  Room was spacious, spotless and love the location of this hotel.

title: bright spacious room reasonable price and cool location
text: not stuck by anything amazing about this hotel but i gave us what we needed.... 2 queen beds lots of light and space.  good service and i like the Lower East Side location for a change for us!  not sure it is a 4.5 hotel though.

title: A+++
text: I had a lovely stay here. The room was big and service was fantastic. Fatou at the front desk was exceptionally helpful and ensured that my stay was extremely comfortable. I've already booked for my next visit to NYC and would recommend to anyone.

title: Not worth the money
text: This is one of those hotels which looks great on the surface, but turns out to be all style over substance. I stayed here 5 years ago and it was great. However, now not only is the decor all work and chipped they just get the most basic things wrong. First of all, they checked us into a room which stank of smoke. I mean reeked. Even the bellboy was putting his hands over his nose and mouth. I then had to go through the palaver of moving. We were straight in off the plane from London. I was with my niece who was very tired.Why didn't they bother checking? Apparently (according to the bell boy) they charge $500 cleaning fee if a guest smokes in the room, except on this occasion they hadn't bothered cleaning it. We there then moved. I still wasn't over the moon as the next room stank of air fresher (so off brand - this is meant to be a boutique hotel)? but apparently there weren't any other Double Double rooms available. The next morning, when I took a shower the shower unit reeked of cigarettes too. Weird, but true. I mentioned this and was told they would do a 'deep clean' of the room. This never happened. In fact, the first day our room wasn't cleaned at all.That evening I mentioned it at the front desk and was told that the housekeeper had said that the 'do not disturb' was on the door. Except ir wasn't. They were clearly saying this to cover up their mistake. Also, if they had thought it was on there why not call the room to check? (The previous night the front desk has called at 1045pm waking me up to 'check everything was alright.'! What a crazy double standard. Then the wifi didn't work. And they insisted on going through a merry dance including 45 minutes otp with their service provider to 'check internet settings.' If it doesn't work on two computers and two phones, there's a problem. All they could come up with was 'it seems there is a problem.' Next day no one in the lounge or in the front desk could get online either. It was an intermittent connection. Room service took nearly an hour and twice they got the order wrong. The guy couldn't speak English. I was there for 5 days and they didn't have Earl Grey tea the first day, by day 5 you would have thought they would have bothered, but no. You get he feeling they just don't care. The concierge William was very nice. But the front office staff were brusque and just has no clue about how to treat people.
