My advice is if you're off to NYC don't stay here, stay at the Bowery Hotel. Probably the best hotel I've ever stayed in. They get everything RIGHT! I would have stayed there except I needed a Double Double, and 60LES is one of the few hotels which offers it.

title: Wonderful stay
text: This is a great hotel with top class service in a cool neighbourhood. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room had a panoramic view of Manhattan, was well decorated, clean, spacious and the bed was brilliant. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and helpful. We couldn't ask for more. We'll be back!

title: Outstanding hotel
text: Stayed at LES Sixty last weekend for a wedding and everything from check in to check out was outstanding.  Had an American Breakfast the Sunday morning that was cooked to perfection.  Great. Location in lower manhattan.  Would definitely stay again.

title: Perfect
text:
The hotel itself is great; clean, great location, comfortable.  But the best thing about the place is the staff.  From check in to check out they could not have been nicer. Stay here. It's worth it.
  Trip advisor requires a 200 word minimum on reviews......blah blah

title: Hyggelig
text:
Bodde 5 netter på dette hotellet.
Veldig hyggelig service fra personellet, blant annet resepsjonisten Fatou.
Stor bonus ved at det var balkong med utsikt til både WTC og Empire State Building. 

Eneste jeg trekker for er at det koster penger å benytte seg av det trådløse nettet på rommene.

title: TOP OF THE TOP !!!
text: Vraiment parfait, une vue exceptionnelle, un design super, un confort extra, une situation idéale, tout est à proximité mais on y est tellement bien qu'on aurait tendance à s'y lover. L'accueil est à la hauteur de cet établissement hyper classe mais où l'on se sent chez soi aussi bien dans les espaces privés que dans les espaces communs. Si l'on retourne à NY, c'est sans hésiter au Sixty Les que nous logerons.

title: Great hotel!
text:
Great location at the heart of the LES, the rooms are so chic and hype, very clean and comfortable.
The stuff are welcoming and lovely. Hope to come back there soon...
I slwas planing to stay there for two night but didnt want to live, so i stayed teo might more... By the way u can find cheap rates for this hotel is u try to book on yhe same day u are planing to come ;)

title: Ein super Hotel!
text:
Ein super Hotel! 

Wir können dieses Hotel nur weiterempfehlen. 
Das Personal war sehr freundlich, hilfsbereit und diskret,
unser Zimmer sehr sauber, hell und geräumig. 

Auch das Preis-Leistungsverhätlnis stimmt zu 100%.

Beim nächsten Mal NYC werden wir definitiv wieder dort einkehren!

title: Bellman awesome, rooms modern, walls VERY thin
text:
We stayed 5 nights while on business and having some fun to go with it. Check in was fast and easy and the concierge was helpful. The bellman, in particular Greg and Raul, were exceptional. They always had advice, solved problems quickly and were superb 'directors of first impressions'. 

The rooms were clean and modern with nice finishings. The beds were reasonably comfortable and clean. Our only complaint was that the walls are very thin. You could clearly hear everything from coughing, to late night conversations and arguments, to more. Not sure it would stop us from staying there again, but if you have loud neighbors, you will need earplugs.

The location itself was PERFECT! The F train to midtown/uptown is just across the street and there are restaurants and bars everywhere with the famous Katz's Deli just around the corner. Hit up Little Meunsters just down Allen St for world class grilled cheese sandwiches and The Meatball Shop for a meatball hero to die for...and their ice cream sandwich.

title: Nice one night stay.
text: My husband and I stayed here for a night to reconnect. We loved the atmosphere of the hotel. I used to live in the area, so I loved the location. We had a queen superior room, booked through Hotel Tonight. Check in was quick and easy, the ladies at the front desk were helpful and very polite. Our room was on a higher floor, we had a nice view of lower manhattan. For two adults, the size of the room was perfect. We loved the fact that there was no carpet in the room. Overall it was modern and sleek. The shower and bathroom were nice as well. We were lucky to be able to walk to San Gennaro Festival in Little Italy. We enjoyed the area a lot. The only issue we had was we paid for minibar items when we checked out and were charged for them afterwards again. I called to resolve the issue but the money was never returned to my account. I have to call again. Not a huge deal but definitely annoying. We would stay again, and if we brought the kids would upgrade to a bigger room.

title: Great one!
text:
I’ve just arrive from a 5 days stay in this hotel with my wife, from 10/5/14 to 10/10/14. Our experience was great and the location is perfect. The check in was really fast and the guys and girls at the front desk were very nice and helpful. Unfortunately the pool bar was closed due to the season and we neither could get to know Above Allen Bar, as it only opens on Fridays and Saturdays. But we had dinner at the Blue Ribbon restaurant, on the 2nd floor, amazing sushi and fried chicken. Room service is from de Blue Ribbon restaurant too, totally cool! We ate one of our best club sandwiches ever.

We never try the hotel breakfast as we are lazy sleepers, but just two doors from the hotel you could grap a coffee at Konditori’s, a Sweden place, from the outside it doesn’t look like much, but trust me is one of the best coffees in town. I went to the gym twice and it is very good equipped but the sauna doesn’t heat too much, even though you select the high temperature range. 
The room is awesome, with a lovely iron curtain that separates bed from a tiny living room with a sofa bed and a coffee table, it ‘s quite big for New York standards. The bathroom is the gem and the shower system amazing (ref picture 2).  
Just a few blocks from hotel  are Freeman’s Restaurant, the best artichoke deep in the world and Clinton St Bakery, I believe the best breakfast I ever had, was worth the 35 minutes table wait.

As many reviews mentioned and I totally agree, the most remarkable downside is that you have to pay U$ 15 daily to get internet access in the room, very expensive if you consider the hotel fares. The complimentary wifi at the lobby is very slow, and it practically didn’t work at the lounge area in the 2nd floor, signal is too weak, the people at the Blue Ribbon were very kind letting me use theirs.  Another thing I didn’t like is the use of the key card to be able to use the elevators, the slot is very thin and while you are trying to insert it, the elevator takes you to a ride at whatever floor they call you, only a few times I could reach my room floor without scales, thanks of the help of Raul that was always trying to help you. 

I totally recommend this hotel, thank you very much for making feel our stay very special

Cristian R. lozano

title: Luxury on the Lower East Side
text:
We loved our stay in this friendly, modern hotel. The rooms and appointments are first-class and the location can't be beat. The hotel is just steps away from an enormous selection of great bars and restaurants, convenient to the subway, and right next to Chinatown. The only thing I didn't like was that they want to sell you a bottle of mineral water for $8. C'mon, guys, a bottle of mineral water costs pennies. You'd make a much better impression with a complimentary bottle of Poland Spring instead of an $8 Evian.
The staff was wonderful without exception. In particular I have to mention Fatou, In addition to answering all sorts of questions about the hotel and the area, she was indispensable in helping me to print out our boarding passes!

title: Love it
text:
Booked in on Thurday night for 8 nights, so impressed with this hotel writing my review now.

Arrived Thursday after a stressful long day of delays and long flights, we were met by a lovely receptionist who was extremely friendly. I had requested a bath tub in my room and was given one.

The room is amazing (300) lovely bathroom, clean extremely spacious. Even though it is only 3rd floor you can still see Empire State building lit up at night. Cleaners are amazing room spotless and tidy all toiletries refilled etc.room service breakfast enough granola for 3 people.Very young trendy area, really nice restaurants, walking distance Bleeker Street, high line, Brooklyn bridge etc.

Love it, you do pay for Internet but the pros of this hotel outway the cost of paying for wifi.
Bed really low but really comfy.

title: Impressed
text: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Room was very clean and modern, shower was hot and powerful, staff were pleasant and helpful, great location. I never ate there so cant comment on the food. Mini bar is overpriced though and the TV smartbox kept crashing but only minor flaws. Would and probably will stay here again.

title: Too trendy
text:
The location is just not quite right and not quite soho!
In fact nothing is quite right.
Having asked for a quiet room high up I was in fact on the 16th floor opposite a building site which started banging away at 730!
Not quite right!
Breakfast in the Japanese restaurant was dark,coffee in a sake mug etc...not quite right and at over A grand for three night it really should be more than ok!!!
Check in snooty ad in many design hotels and I would suggest a safer and better hotel.

title: Top Staff
text:
Really good base for exploring the Big Apple. Walking distance to Lower Manhattan and Mid-Town. Easy access to La Guardia. 
Groovy hotel and lots to do nearby - great places to eat, good music & lots of galleries too.
Best thing about this hotel were the staff - Fatou was the best of a very good bunch of front counter and door staff.

title: overpriced bit still ok
text:
We stayed for 6 nights in September 2014
The location is excellent and for sure the biggest plus for the hotel
The rooms are very small, even for NYC standards.
Due to the room size and the lack of free Wifi in the rooms the hotel is overpriced compared to other hotels
The staff is very friendly and helpful - rooms are clean.
However, next time I will look for another option in NYC

title: New York Wedding Trip
text: The staff were excellent. Helpful, friendly & responsive. The queen room could use more storage space. Had to ask for washcloths several days but received them immediately. Live the area, staff & hotel. We will return.

title: Great stay on the lower east side
text: Stayed at the end of march for 5 nights, we were lucky to get a free upgrade.  Fabulous Room, helpful staff and a great location.  The subway is just across the road so getting around New York was easy.  We loved the lower east side and it's the first time we stayed in that neighbourhood.  It was great to be away from the tourist areas and there are lots of great bars and restaurants in the neighbourhood.

title: Great stay
text: Really cool hotel in a great location. Staff are fabulous - especially the doormen. Very close to SoHo if you want to be within striking distance of that part of town. Lots of restaurants and bars within metres of the hotel. Subway stop across the road and very easy access to JFK

title: Sisty LES
text: I travel very often to NYC for business, and this is from far the best hotel I've stayed in that price range. The rooms are clean, quiet, the service is impeccable, the dorrmen are very attentive. Special mention to Fatou, at the reception, for her very kind welcoming.

title: Sleeping With The Cool Kids
text:
Imagine the sort of hangout trust fund hipsters flock to for a staycation – mid-week, of course, because they are sans job – and you will have an acute sense of everything that is Sixty LES. 

Upon a recent visit over the summer, the poolside banter between two twenty-something Prada-clad gents revolved around ‘conceptual’ screenplay ideas and how they could hire a ghostwriter to pen their tales before passing the script over to their friend-of-a-friend Emma Roberts.

Sixty LES stands alone as a haute Lower East Side boutique hotel, with the covetable New York City accessory of an outdoor lap pool. Note: swimming optional.

Close to downtown neighborhoods the East Village, Nolita and Soho and an array of bar and restaurants, the hotel provides a glamorous portal into the city’s trendsetter scene, with the fash pack descending on the luxurious gem during NYFW.

With floor-to-ceiling windows and sleek black mirrored walls, the luxurious rooms are spacious with a distinct industrial feel. Most rooms are equipped with a roomy balcony which offers 180-degree views of the Manhattan skyline.

While sleep is not front and center in the minds of most folk hanging in the LES, if you do indeed choose to rest your head it will be on custom-made 400-thread count SFERRA linen sheets on a bed featuring an illuminated light box headboard by Lee Friedlander. 

The bathrooms offer an urban chic vibe through slate showers complete with rain showerheads and frosted glass.

Above Allen, a guest-and members-only club, offers spectacular views of uptown and downtown Manhattan – one of the few places that provides unobstructed views of both the Freedom Tower and the Empire State Building.  

Another upside to the boutique gem’s unique neighborhood feel is the frequent chance of an upgrade upon arrival.

While one is not guaranteed to overhear discussions about the next blockbuster hit poolside, the chances of catching a snippet echoing what one might head on a reality showed titled ‘Rich Kids of New York’ are quite high.

Please visit my site: http://www.curbingthecatwalk.com.

title: Wonderful stay, great location
text:
We stayed at the Sixty LES for a combination work and leisure trip. 

Upon entering the lobby, it may seem a bit small, but just behind the front desk are stairs up to another public area and bar/restaurant.  Elevators are quick and efficient.

Our room was on the 11th floor and facing out over Allen St. 
The bed was low - like on a platform (futon style) but very comfortable.
The shower was great - rainhead with good pressure - nice shampoo/conditioner etc.

The bar was fun and busy at normal times.
The restaurant has amazing sushi - and surprisingly enough - great fried chicken!

The hotel is only 30 seconds from Katz's Deli.  Also within 3-5 minutes of at least 25 restaurants.
Also - Shopping in SoHo (Big for my wife) was only about a 10 minute walk west.

I would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a true NYC experience without all of the touristy crowds of Times Square and/or MidTown.

title: A week on the lower east side
text: Friendly staff. Attentive doormen. Room was very nice with a balcony offering great views! Great sushi restaurant. I used the spa and gym. Clean and well maintained. The neighborhood offers wonderful ambience. Coffee shops, cafés and shops.

title: Great stay!
text: We loved everything about this place.  It was very comfortable and we were grateful to receive a room upgrade for our anniversary to a very spacious room by NY standards.  The staff was welcoming and helpful. The only reason we gave it a 3 for cleanliness was due to dust in air vent, otherwise room was very clean. Bed was great- pillows fantastic! Modern decor. We highly recommend for lower manhattan stay with easy walk to Soho, etc.

title: Not impressed
text:
First, before I say anything else, I must say that the staff at this hotel is terrific.  They handled the problems I encountered in the room promptly and professionally.  Everyone else, including the bar tenders and doormen were also amazing.
I booked on hotel tonight and chose this hotel because it had a pool and was in a good location for my needs.  I was assigned a very small basic room but when I pulled back the covers there were disturbing hairs on the mattress.  I decided it would make me too uncomfortable to stay in the room so I went to ask for a different one.  After being quickly assigned a second room, I found the same exact issue in that one as well.
I went down, now very upset and asked for a refund, but the manager put me in a bigger room and asked the head of housekeeping to personally walk me up and check the bed.  Thank goodness this one was clean and I stayed.
The room was still not large but a fine size, with a couch and view of the pool.  The decor is minimalist and dark with a black wooden floor and an all black bathroom. The Closets and desk are worn, making them look older and more used than they probably were.  Between this and the hallway, I felt like I was staying in a college dorm.  As I see from other reviews, some people would find this trendy and hip, but to me it just felt cold.  In addition, the bed was very hard so I didn't have a restful sleep.
The other reason why I was disappointed was the lack of guest-only public spaces.  I left the room to try to find a cozy nook where I could relax with a glass of wine and read my book but all of the bars and spaces were filled with loud crowds and blaring music.  There is a "rooftop" bar and an outdoor beer garden and both were teeming with non-hotel pseudo hipsters. This is fine, of course, for a hotel in NYC to have this, but they should also consider their guests as well.  
Weather permitting, the pool is heated and got decent sunshine in the morning, so if I had time, it would have been one of the positive aspects of the hotel.
If anything, this experience has taught me that I definitely like my hotels on the lush side, not the minimalist side.
When not booking on hotel tonight, this hotel runs $500-$1000 per night, which I definitely can't wrap my head around.  It's only worth about $300-$350 so unless you get a deal and like the above described trendy factor, I would look elsewhere.

title: Modern modern modern!
text:
Stayed here in May 2014 with the family.  If you appreciate modern architecture and style - look no further. This is a very hip hotel.  The room was clean.  The shower was huge. They gave us a baby tub and he had fun splashing in the shower with us :)  

The location is good - but it is the Lower East Side; a very 'real' neighborhood.  But it is close to a bunch of restaurants and all kinds of eateries.

My husband was here for a work meeting; so the baby and I found this great park (Tompkins Square Park) and visited it 2ice a day.  It had play areas for children of different ages.

title: Great location - great staff!
text: Really great location in LES! Greatest staff ever in NYC! Been in NYC five times - first time at SIXTY, and for sure not the last time we stay here! Charming down to earth staff - especially Fatou from reception, funny, kind, and always trying to help:) she will always Walk that extra mile for you :)

title: Nice hotel. Great location.
text:
I stayed at the Sixty LES for a month for work and had a really nice stay. My company reserved a queen size room; amazing view but very small. For a reasonable price they upgraded me to a gorgeous, king size room with a balcony. Spectacular view, worth the extra price. Beautiful shower, nice bathroom products, great, firm bed. Fatou, who checked me in couldn't have been more welcoming or friendly at check in and for my entire stay. As were all the bellmen and housekeeping staff. I loved having Blue Ribbon downstairs when I was too tired after work to go out. Superb (pricey) Japanese with a nice bar. Loved Rose and all the other bartenders who made me feel at home right away. Also found some excellent food delivery options in the neighborhood. Pros: perfect location to explore the LES, Nolita, and East Village, great views from some rooms, pool and decent workout room, cool vibe but not over the top. Really important to me: Upper floors quiet if you're in town for business. 
Cons: Some front desk staff surprisingly unfriendly. No interactive TV (no movies, premium cable, or even a menu to navigate channels). Probably something they'll resolve. Rooms could use a bit of refreshing; some things just beginning to get shabby. 
All in all a really nice hotel with a lot of really great employees. I'd definitely go back.

title: Pretty Great Hotel
text: The hotel is really nice, great location, staff is very helpful and attentive.  The decor is modern, the bar on the 7th floor closes around 10pm so there isn't noise keeping you up. Overall we were happy. My only complaint was that our bed had down pillows and comforter.  I'm highly allergic to down so our first night wasn't pleasant, but they were happy to change out the items.  Many people are allergic to down so I'm surprised this is a standard bed setup still.

title: Assez bien situé, bien desservi, quartier animé
text:
Nous avons séjourné 5 jours dans cet hôtel. Nous étions en famille avec 2 ados.
La chambre pour 4 était de taille correcte, avec placard de rangement, salle de douche et vue sur la piscine. 
Chambre un peu poussiéreuse (pour les maniaques) et en face d’un immeuble en rénovation (bruit le matin).
Cet hôtel est situé à un dizaine de minutes à pied de l'avenue "Broadway" (pour ceux qui aime le shoping), de litte Italy (bof), de Chinatown (très bof).
En face de l'hôtel il y a une station de métro. La ligne de bus passe devant l'hôtel (bus touristique et bus normal).
Le bar de l'hôtel situé au 7ème étage offre une vue superbe sur manathan sud ; par contre il n'est pas insonorisé et lorsque l'on à la chambre en face du bar, ce n'est pas le top !
Nous avons déjeuné tous les matins à l'hôtel. On était servi par Chérif Fadel (personnel très très sympathique, serviable qui en plus de sa gentillesse parle français).
En fin d'après midi lorsque nous arrivions à l'hôtel, à la réception c'est Fatou qui nous accueillait avec son sourire éclatant (personnel qui parle français, très serviable, réservation de restaurant, itinéraire pour ce rendre dans un endroit particulier dans NY, etc...).
Tous les soirs on avait du chocolat sur les lits !
Il est situé dans un quartier très animé le soir. Autour de l'hôtel ou à quelques minutes à pied, il y a des bars, des restaurants dont un très bon resto italien en bas de l'hôtel.
En résumé je recommande cet hôtel.

title: Hip hotel in the hippest neighborhood of NYC
text:
Booked 3 nights through h****re, $180 p/ night, which is a steal. Room was very modern, great bathroom ( separate shower and tub), clean with a great balcony and view. The pool on the 3rd floor although it's a small area, was amazing during some hot humid days- I think it's one of the best amenities of this hotel. Location is great. Surrounded by bars, restaurants, shops, etc.   
What impressed me most is the security and how well controlled the lobby is considering the nightlife in the area gets rowdy. Overall I would highly recommend staying at the sixty les, especially if u r young at heart and want an alternative soho, Chelsea, etc boutique hotels.

title: Staff no friendly and welcoming
text:
Stayed recently for three nights for pleasure, the position is cool, between lower east side and east village, the room was great, with a nice view of the city, but I have really to complain about the breakfast service and the staff.
I booked on line a room rate with breakfast included, discovering at the check in that only $ 20 per person (tax included) was in the breakfast package, and at the restaurant a coffee costs $ 5 + tax and the food minimum average $ 15 + tax, and the quality is not up to a luxury hotel. But the worst thing was the staff at the reception, everyone, except one nice girl at the check in, are so unfriendly and not welcoming, maybe they are doing not the right job.
So if you have to spend around $ 250/300 per night, I really recommend you another place in the area.

title: Amazing location!
text:
Came to New York for a wedding with my family. We stayed in a double deluxe room. I was worried that we may be too squashed but the room was actually very spacious for New York standards. Rooms are extremely modern with possibly the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! 
The weather was extremely hot so it was great to be able to chill out by the pool. The pool host was great in finding us sun loungers. Sushi restaurant was delicious although food in the hotel a little on the expensive side. The location however was fantastic for shopping, (short walk to soho, cab ride 10-15 minutes to 5th Ave/Central Park) really trendy restaurants/bars/boutiques close by, great for a young crowd. The only downside is the Wifi charge. At $15 a day I think it is pretty ridiculous to charge this as most places in the city offer free wifi anyway, especially as nowadays most people may not stay at a hotel if there is no free wifi. Overall a great stay and experience. Would definitely return.

title: LOST
text: Recently I was visiting my 22yo Daughter who lives in Manhattan and wound up meeting a  British model who drank so much champagne that she called herself a "Sorry Drunk"  I was not sorry that I met her.  ANYWAYS... we were hopelessly lost in The Lower East Side unable to even see or comprehend the iPhones directions. Guess what happened? ( I'm waiting ) ok, I'll tell you. We met Greg ( who Stella was flirting with), Christian, and Raul who work at SIXTY. LES.  Not only did they hail a cab for us which was ridiculous at that hour but they offered us bottled water for our trip.  In a city that so fast paced it was a delight to find three hospitality professionals who took the time to provide SERVICE.  I usually stay at a stuffy UES hotel when I travel to NYC, but  after this experience I tell everyone to go to SIXTY LES.  The only disappointment for Stella was that  Greg who she fancied was happily married so in the end it worked out perfect for me. Lost no more!

title: Utter Disappointment
text: I had requested an early check in.  We arrived at 2 and was told the room would not be ready until 3.  We ate and came back at 3 to be told the room wouldn't be ready for another hour (an hour after the regular check in time).  The young lady at the front desk was rude, made no eye contact and was unapologetic.  She handed us two tickets to go have a drink (and she made sure we understood it was only one drink) at the pool.  Everyone working the pool was friendly and helpful except for the bartender.  We stayed on a Sunday night and were not aware that the rooftop bar was only open on Friday and Saturday even though our welcome letter stated not to forget to visit Above Allen.  It's ridiculous to have this printed on a form letter when it would only apply 2/7 days of the week.  This was for my husband's birthday and it was such a disappointment.  I don't feel the experience was that of a 4 star hotel at this price-point.

title: Too cool to care
text: At check in they lost my booking. But that was made up for with a room upgrade, or so I thought. I discovered that the room upgrade came with a clogged toilet. The front desk staff seem too cool and arrogant for their customers. For this variable quality, I didn't think this hotel is worth the price advertised nor its claimed 5-star status.

title: Best Staycation
text:
I spent a night here midweek with a friend. I live down the street & frequent Blue Ribbon Sushi, so it seemed like a good idea to choose Sixty for our staycation. I was not wrong. We arrived around 8:30am & Aliana (sorry for the spelling) was able to check us in. She also upgraded us to a double room, which made our day even better. The hotel is very sleek, the staff extremely attentive, & the room was extremely spacious & comfortable. I couldn't have been happier with my decision. After check in we hit the pool right away, which was great. I'm a sucker for a rooftop pool & the Sixty met all my expectations. It was nice & quiet in the morning so I was definitely able to take a nap up there in the sun. I also took a trip down to the spa & utilized the sauna. All the facilities are well staffed, clean, & aesthetically pleasing. 

Aside from the great location & being able to see my own apt from the hotel, I absolutely recommend the Sixty to anyone looking for a great place to stay. Blue Ribbon is delicious & there are so many places to eat/go out in this area. It's conveniently located right on the F & it's easy to catch a cab on Allen. I plan on booking the Sixty for all of my staycation needs.

title: Bien situé, vue magnifique sur Manhattan Sud
text:
Chambre au 17e étage côté rue, sans balcon, vue splendide.
Vue complète : fréquenter le bar les vendredi et samedi soirs, vue sur Empire State et Chrysler.
Taille de la chambre correcte vu que nous sommes à NY, chambre propre, personnel serviable.
A deux pas de Katz's Delicatessen et Russ & Daughters pour les repas.
Restaurant japonais de l'hôtel très cher, avons des références bien moins coûteuses sans baisse de qualité.
Métro au pied de l'hôtel et ligne de bus aussi, à essayer pour la vue (trajet Chinatown, Little Italy, battery Park dans un sens, direction Times Square dans l'autre sens !)
Quartier certes bruyant, mais nous n'y sommes pas allés pour dormir :)

title: Sixty LES, allez y !
text: Très bien situé, dans un quartier très hype et proche de tout à Downtown et de Brooklyn. Personnel aimable et très compétent. Hôtel design, à taille humaine avec une jolie piscine et une très belle vue sur DT. Allez y sans hésiter.

title: Excellent hotel with great pool and staff
text: I have stayed at this hotel three times since June. I regularly travel to NYC and used to stay in the soho grand hotel, but wanted somewhere a little edgier and with facilities. The first time I stayed in a corner queen room. I had a fantastic view of downtown and midtown and the bathrooms and room facilities were of a very high standard. The second two times in July and august I stayed in a king deluxe room which was massive! With a gigantic bath and private balcony. It was very spacious and pure luxury to return too. The location is amazing. Great for bars and restaurants. But the hidden gem is the amazing pool area which has a great unpretentious vibe and exceptional staff. Marie and Peter but the pool are friendly without being over the top. And at the door you have Raoul and Sam who are the loveliest doorman alive. I cannot rate this hotel enough and will be staying here long before the pool closes!

title: Not good
text:
Hotel location is nice, if you like the area.
Standard roms are very small and in need of a refurbishment, bathroom is too small and with poor amenities.
Elevators are a nightmare (in terms is speed).
Pool is again too small.
Breakfast is poor, desk service is also poor.
I will not come back.

title: Great service! Raul and Christian were awesome!
text: Great hotel with an awesome friendly staff. The bellman Raul and Christian were beyond helpful and made our stay flawless. Can't wait to visit NYC again and will stay no other place than here! Great location, clean rooms and awesome service!

title: A charming hotel with superb service
text:
The Sixty LES is a boutique hotel with an emphasis on personal service.  The people behind the front desk and the bellmen all go out of their way to make your stay happy and stress free.  The bellmen, in particular, remember your name and will greet you each day with a smile.  The rooms are cozy without being oppressively small, and are well appointed with HD TV.  My only complaint was that there was no microwave in the room, but that is rarely found in a hotel of this sort.

The hotel is also conveniently situated across the street from the F train, and just three blocks from the 6.  So you can easily get anywhere by subway.  And a bonus:  it is around the corner from Russ & Daughters, Katz Deli, and the new Russ & Daughters cafe.  Very convenient!

title: Nice stay at cool hotel
text: This was our second stay at sixty LES. Through a membership programme we managed to get an upgrade and we had a nice large room. Being two people with lots of luggage that was much appreciated. Our room lacked towels and toiletries, but a quick phone call solved that. Location is good, service is good and the rooms are good. They have a small pool, but we did not have "time" to use it.

title: Très cher pour le quartier
text:
Très déçu de cet hôtel vu les notes moyennes.  Soit nous sommes très exigents,  soient les clients n'ont jamais séjourné dans d'autres hôtels. 
Très mal situé (limite chinatown), hôtel qui n'est absolument pas un hôtel de luxe comme il le prétend.
Chambres minuscules,  photos trompeuses, rouille sur les chaises extérieures (doigt coupé), énormément de bruit le vendredi et samedi soir car le bar est au 7 ème étage et c'est très mal insonorisé. Claquement de portière dès tôt le matin, klaxon et sirènes la nuit et le matin à cause de la mauvaise insonorisation de la chambre. Porte du balcon à moitié cassée.
La piscine est à l'ombre donc est froide et beaucoup de squatteurs qui ne sont pas de l'hôtel.
Seuls avantages : Fatou gentille qui parle français et la jolie vue si vous avez une chambre avec balcon. 
Dans tous les cas,  cela ne vaut pas les 400 dollars par nuit.

title: Great hotel, great location
text:
I used to stay here often when this was the Thompson LES.  Its the same hotel, the name just changed. Being a native NYer, the 60 is in my favorite area.  If you're visiting NY and want a true experience that isnt very touristy this is your spot.  Very nice modern rooms.  Ask for one of the corner King rooms on the 10th floor and up and you will have a private balcony with one of the best views of the city you can find.  Blue Ribbon sushi is in the hotel as well as a great beer garden.  As for the area, right next door is Rockwood Music Hall which is one of the best curated music venues in the country.  Its usually free and you will never be disappointed.  Katz's deli is around the corner along with a multitude of amazing restaurants and bars.  The terrace bar on the 7th floor is open on the weekends and will get loud.  If you want quiet ask for a room facing east or you will get lots of noise from the bar.  Good pool and gym as well.  

My only real complaint, and this is a real sore spot, is that the internet isnt free.  Any hotel that wants to charge $300+ for a room should be embarrassed to make their patrons pay $15 for internet use in their room.  I'm a business traveler 90% of the time and i have to use my computer for work, I dont care that its free in the lobby and bar, i have to work and use the phone and dont want to be in the lobby to get free internet.  If i wanted to get nickel and dimed id stay in a cheap hotel.  C'mon 60 LES, in NY you already get hammered with ridiculous taxes and fees(explain the Convention center fee to me and ill give you a cookie), another $15 for internet is a disgrace.  

Other than that this is a great hotel with a friendly staff that has always remembered my name and welcomed me back.

title: Great stay
text: Very friendly staff. Good location in Lower East Side. Nice bars and restaurants around the hotel. Nice terrace with a lovely view but regulary fee-based partys in the period of our stay. No free access for hotel guests. Our room was to the backside of the hotel, so it was very quiet.

Pour : Emplacement pratique près es lieux de shopping, accueil parfait, chambres clair et propres. Petite dèj cher (pas de formule) mais très bon.
Contre : très bruyant (boite de nuit de l’hôtel au rez de chaussé et chambres contiguës très mal insonorisées)

title: fun girls weekend
text: We mainly selected this hotel for the outdoor pool.  We loved sitting by the pool and having drinks.  There were 4 of us and we were able to get chairs.  Good pool side service - and the hamburger was amazing.  The other reason we selected the hotel was were able to get 2 queen beds in our room.  The room was small, but manageable.  I would have preferred a little more amenities for the price.  I did have to call the front desk a couple of times and always got good service/response.  The staff was genuinely friendly.  It was easy to walk to fun restaurants and SoHo.  The concierge recommended a nail salon around the corner (ThinkPink)- which was such a gem!  We had great manis and pedis!

title: Pimp
text: For a former NYer staying in a hotel, the corner balcony gave me a nostalgic, panoramic view. The bellman were on top of everything. I can't wait to go back. The bed was extremely comfortable. The shower was dark, but water pressure was incredible.

title: Fantastic hotel in Soho!
text:
The wife and I spent our 21st anniversary at the Sixty Les Hotel a few days ago and we were very happy with the excellent service we received.
The beds, the amazing rainfall shower and location were all top notch.
They even surprised us with a Champagne bottle and chocolates the night we arrived.

An incredible experience all around!
Highly recommended.

title: Disappointed
text: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel several times in the past few years and were previously very happy with it.  The location is excellent - an easy walk to Soho and the LES - and good subways.  This time we were very disappointed.  It was not as clean, it was not as well maintained, fewer towels, a nonfunctioning light, our room was not serviced until late in the day.  I am not sure we would stay there again.

title: A stylish and uber-cool hotel in a hip location you won't want to leave!
text: My experience of staying at Sixty LES Hotel was a fantastic and memorable time. It was a special trip for my nephew and I and his first time to New York. The hotel could not have been any better. The swimming pool is simply divine and the gym and sauna were also great. The staff were very efficient, extremely friendly and highly professional. If you are looking for a very cool, comfortable and stylish base to spend a special time in New York, then look no further than Sixty LES.

title: Amazing city views!
text:
I recently enjoyed a weekend at the Sixty LES in the Sixty Loft as it is appropriately called.  Two floors of modern, minimal luxury with a breathtaking view of the city made my weekend escape complete.  Service was prompt and professional as every detail was accounted for.  I recommend Sixty LES to anyone looking to enjoy the SoHo vibe and all that NYC has to offer including helpful staff and comfortable luxury in the perfect location.

I will most definitely return to this hotel for a future weekend get-a-way!

title: Wonderful experience, with extremely wonderful customer service
text: Very trendy with a top notch outdoor pool.  My overall experience was wonderful, especially with the extremely attentive staff.  Very clean rooms, modern bathroom, and great balcony views.  I will definitely be coming back.

title: Big windows, fun neighbourhood.
text: Sixty LES has a lot going for it. First, the rooms are a nice size for NYC - those facing west have very large floor-to-ceiling windows, giving the feeling of extra space. There's enough room to hang clothing, and to fold up smalls into drawers. The staff are really helpful - particularly the doormen/concierge- who are tuned into guest's needs. I spent time working in the hotel, and the desk, plugs and internet were all great for my needs. The hotel is in a fun neighbourhood, with plenty of restaurants and bars nearby, a short walk to SOHO, NOHO, and the East Village. The F train is right across the street if you want to go uptown. Overall, a good hotel, great views and nice staff.

title: Clean, modern, excellent customer service.
text:
I thoroughly enjoyed the Sixty Thompson LES hotel.  This is my first time staying at this property and was excited to try it after many pleasant experiences at the original Sixty Thompson Hotel in Soho.  Here are the wonderful things about this hotel:
1.  Great customer service.  The staff was kind, genuine, and thoughtful.  They were also mature which is hard to find in NYC these days (not by age but by sophistication level.)
2.  Blue Ribbon Sushi is AMAZING.  
3.  They feature complimentary Ren bath products in the hotel - which are all wonderful.
4.  Clean rooms with a modern touch but are not trying to hit you over the head with a design concept. 
5.  Outdoor pool on the fourth floor.
6.  Great location and next to a Whole Foods.

title: Nice room and bathroom, Good service, Good location, Paid WiFi
text:
My wife and I finished our honeymoon trip at this hotel and stayed 2 nights. We enjoyed it. The hotel upgraded us and gave us some bubbly and chocolate to help us to celebrate, which was very kind of them. The room decor is cool, like the rest of the hotel, and the bathroom is small but high quality with a great shower.

Our room had a small balcony from which we could see both the Empire State and the Freedom Tower. The balcony runs the length of the hotel and my wife got a fright on the morning of our departure when a neighbour peered in through our window. So, keep your windows and balcony door locked.

WiFi is extra, which drives me crazy. However, there is an online Macbook and printer available to guests at no cost in the lobby.

title: Fantastic!
text: This hotel is not only very hip, but the staff is extremely helpful. Within walking distance to SoHo shopping, this hotel is my new favorite. The location of this hotel is superb and is surrounded by unique nightlife and delicious cafés.

title: Excellent Overall
text: Great service.  All advise from staff was very helpful.  Room styling was very nice.  View of financial district was a was a nice bonus.  I wish I had a chance to check out the amenities.  Whole Foods and Subway are within 2 blocks.

title: Great LES location and modern decor
text: Second time at this hotel with a great location in the lower East Side.  Close to Starbucks and good places to eat.  The modern decor is very sleek and comfortable.  Rated a 4 and not a 5 as I felt a bit of attitude from the front desk when I checked-in and again when I asked to be moved to a different floor.  My room and floor smelled like cigarette smoke when I arrived and the elevator smelled of other smoke, which my daughter and her friends also detected. Other staff was very friendly, consistent with my last stay.  Will probably try the new hotel in the LES 2 blocks away next time, but this is a solid hotel with a great location.

title: Great service!
text: The staff is very welcoming and accommodating-  we requested a late check out last minute since we were enjoying the pool so much...and the front desk granted our wish!  :). The location is fantastic & the beds are super comfortable.  It has been a great treat to stay here for our anniversary.

title: Beautiful Modern Hotel
text: This hotel is a one class act!  From the moment they open the door for you to the minute you check out. I have stayed at many NY hotels before, but this one has been the nicest and biggest room I have stayed in.  The room has a small area with a sofa and the beds are super comfortable, but practically sit on the floor.  The bathroom actually has a little bit of counter space with a shelf below and the shower was updated, clean and had a wonderful rain shower faucet. The lights in the whole room were so cool, you had the option of dimming the lights and making as bright as you wanted. This is especially nice in the bathroom at 2 AM when you don't want the lights super bright. We ate at the restaurant which is a Sushi Restaurant. Very nice meal, a little pricey, but what isn't in NY. (We had 2 orders of California Rolls, Edame, and 2 drinks and cost $70!)  I had a John Daly drink,(ice tea flavored vodka and lemonade)  not the best that I've had, too strong, but once they added a little more lemonade the drink was bearable.  They have a nice Beer Garden area outside on a patio too. The Internet cost is $15 per day, a little steep, not sure why hotels charge this fee, especially when you pay as much as you do for the room itself.. If you go sit in their 2nd floor lobby or the restaurant, it was free. All around this hotel are restaurants and the subway station was only a couple of blocks away which made it easy to get around the city. Chinatown is close as well. Definitely recommend staying here!

title: Welcoming staff at a great location
text: This hotel was a treat from the moment I arrived. Great attention to service both in the hotel and the bar. Unlike many Manhattan hotels, the room was a good size and the bathroom was spectacular. Wish I could have stayed longer.

title: Beautiful hotel- but jewelry disappeared and staff was beyond unhelpful and could have cared less
text: I would never ever stay here again and would not recommend it- the way they treated me was reprehensible. Kinda hilarious that after two phone calls with arrogant management personnel after my jewelry mysteriously disappeared, the fact that they solicited a review from me shows how disconnected they are from understanding they are in the "service " business.

title: First Time Staying in New York
text: I have stayed at a lot of hotels over the past 20 years, and I have to say this was one of the nicest hotels I have stayed at. The staff was fantastic and so welcoming and helpful. I was not sure what to expect as I have heard many things about New York City, but it was a great experience. If you are going to need a hotel room I would highly recommend Sixty LES.

title: Great place to stay
text: Sixty LES is just as awesome as it was when it was the Thompson LES.  The staff are incredibly nice and the rooms are clean and comfy.  The pool, although small, is a great refuge in the heart of the lower east side. I highly recommend staying here when you're in the city and don't want to deal with the mayhem of midtown.

title: Disapointing
text: We stayed at the Sixty lee Hotel, in New York. I really did like the location, in the middle of a very laid-back hood. It is super close from the Williamsburg Bridge to reach Brooklyn and its surroundings. The problem is that the hotel management team has accepted to hold several private events during the week-end which let us with no access to the pool, no access to the rooftop terrace. They offered us a suite, but still, with 35 degrees outside, we pick this hotel for the pool and terrace. So I would call the hotel prior to your stay to validate the availability of the amenities.

title: New York getaway
text:
Great location if you want to be in Lower East Side -close to great nightlife. I was disappointed when I walked in around 12:45 am and there was not a doorman or security in sight. Got in an elevator with another guest but could have been anyone wandering in off the street, so made me somewhat insecure. 
My first night woken up by guests in the hallway about 4:00 am. Our room was close to the elevator so I would suggest getting a room on the end of the hall -may help with the noise.
Beds are hard, European style-would prefer upgraded sheets and pillows. 

Hotel has a cool vibe and awesome bar for great people watching.

title: A Few Days in NYC
text: I needed a place at the last minute and found LES thru jetsetter with the great rate for the city. The room on the 17th floor was a bit small but worked fine for my stay though would have been tight for 2 people especially if you plan to spend any time in the room. Staff was great. Every time I came and went I was personally greeted. Location was good. They were also able to park my car and even at $55 a day it was very convenient. Wish the bar 'above allen' was open during the week.

title: Wedding Weekend
text: The hotel made my daughter's wedding celebration even better!  Our family had 20 rooms with our guests staying 60 nights. The staff was vey accommodating, they happily distributed our welcome baskets, early check in when available, held luggage........ just any request was met.  Everyone from the bellmen, to the pool staff to the front desk was helpful and pleasant.  We had the rehearsal dinner at the Blue Ribbon Beer Garden and a family breakfast at the hotel restaurant and everything was perfect.  Our guests loved the location......it is young, hip and happening.  The experience was fun and positive and I highly recommend staying at Sixty Les!!!!

title: Independence Day
text: My wife and I stayed at Sixty LES last week and had an awesome time!  The staff was very helpful providing information about the hotel and places to go in the area and made sure we had everything we needed to enjoy our stay.  We watched the fireworks from the 7th floor patio and had a great view....one of the best Fourth of July Celebrations in a long time!  The room was very clean and we had a nice lounge area where we had another couple over to share some Champagne:-)  The next day we relaxed by the pool and were blessed with a beautiful sunny day.  I want to say thank you to the entire staff for taking such good care of us and providing a perfect getaway.

title: Très bon choix
text:
Nous avons été très contents de notre nuit au Sixty LES. 
Accueil très sympathique, très belle chambre, piscine bien agréable quand il fait aussi chaud et petit déjeuner pantagruélique. A recommander !

title: Good, trendy
text: Nice size room for NY city. Nice pool area. Good service and stylish public spaces. Crowd was mainly 20-30 somethings, didn't see many families. Hotel doesn't have parking, but there are some good facilities nearby. The breakfast and room service offerings were excellent.

title: From Thompson to Sixty..
text: I thought service would've fell off because of the new Sixty brand..but to my Surprise, the service and rooms are even BETTER!  Love how the employees are on a first name basis with you- first class service. Definitely will be coming back to see Raul and Christian!

title: 4th of July Staycation
text:
Great location and friendly staff.  The pool is a definite plus and is probably what made the weekend worthwhile, but I wouldn't stay here otherwise. Additional plus factors: Blue Ribbon Sushi and the beer garden.

I've experienced few hotels in NYC having lived there for a few years, but decided to spring for this place since I didn't have any July 4th beach plans and because of a great deal on Gilt.com. Without the discounted rates, I don't think this place would be worth the price tag. We stayed in a King suite; the bed was really comfortable and the shower was awesome too. Overall, the decor of the hotel is also nice, but the hallways were super dark. If a hotel with a pool is your only criteria, and you don't mind splurging - this is the place for you.

title: We will not come back
text: After an overnight flight we arrived to the hotel early morning. We asked to the semi friendly ladies of the front desk for early check in. The front desk team promised to give as a call on our mobiles once the room (which we asked to be quiet) would be ready. The call did never come…  The room we got (even though upgraded from the originally booked category) was definitely not quiet but apparently the only one available in the entire hotel for check in at 1pm. Unfortunately the room was just above the hotel pool where right the day of our stay happened to take place a very busy private pool party with many guests and loud music! Also the rooftop bar was closed for a private event. So neither bar nor pool accessible for regular hotel guests. A midnight room party by a horde of 18+ people topped our SIXTY LES experience. Positive comments: doormen very friendly and welcoming, location, room size.

title: Perfect for the summer un NY
text:
The big positive point is the swimming-pool, very appreciated in hot June!
The rooms and the hotel are really comfortable, and design. The location is nice in lower East side, but it is not as central as 5th avenue. However it s easy to take the subway or the taxi to get in the different places. I think this is the perfect place to stay at in Summer.

title: Horrible service! The pool staff is the worst!!!!
text: I used to love this hotel, there it goes they lost a loyal customer! So overall I'm rating my last stay so poorly because of the pool staff. Of course it was a hot day in July and my boyfriend and I wanted to spend it by the pool. Everything was great until 3 pm. After 3 pm the sun deck does not get much sun besides this particular corner spot where I wanted to move since I was trying to get a tan. However Ashley (who works there and is responsible for making the pool beds) told me that a lady that just showed up requested that specific sunny bed. I told her that I am a guest of the hotel and have been waiting for people to leave so I can move to that bed. She didn't allow me. It turned out that person who took the bed is a friend of one of the managers at the hotel (I think so it was a blonde lady dressed all in black who obviously worked there)!!!! This person was not even staying at the hotel she just dropped by to say hi to her friend (the manager) and she took the best spot!!! Really???? Keep it up! With such hotel policy soon you will have NO paying guests at all and will only have friends coming to the hotel for FREE! Ashley tried to tell me that people were not allowed to reserve beds! Then how come this was reserved for someone else???? I was really disappointed. On top of that the service at the bar was horrible! The girl was rude and unattentive! She kept messing up my orders and guess what? In the end I was charged with 20% grat!!! And trust me I don't mind tipping but this was not a well deserved tip! Maybe that's why the service is so bad, the staff know they will get their tip so why bother to actually do a decent job. The previous day we had an excellent service at the pool bar and the grat was only 18%. Go figure! Maybe on Tuesday is 18% and Wednesday 20%? My boyfriend and I were planning to book a room for one more night but after the entire incident we just left and we are def not coming back!

title: Fantastic location and exceptional service
text:
Staying at Sixty LES is a great experience. I tried not to select the reason or date of my visit because I visit this hotel all times of year for all reasons. 

The location simply cannot be beat. You are in the middle of the action in the LES, and there are few other hotels in the area. You can walk to so many fabulous NYC happenings. 

The management turnover has been quite beneficial to the hotel as well. The management is top notch, and service across the hotel has improved (particularly room service). If you love sushi, the Blue Ribbon Sushi in the hotel, at the pool, and as part of room service is a huge bonus. Finally, hotel management is always willing to add a personal touch and assure you have a wonderful stay. 

The only pro tips are: You should ask if the pool will be open in the summer. Sometimes it si closed for private events. The corner seats at the pool stay sunny the longest. In addition, you should ask what events are happening at the hotel during your stay. Occassionally certain areas are shut off for private events. The hotel management are very helpful in this regard. 

Have a blast and enjoy the stay!

title: Perfectly situated
text: Loved our recent stay at Sixty LES. Staff were helpful, room was lovely, nice and high up with a wonderful view. Quiet on the 16th floor! Loved the location, the lower east side was perfect with subway station across the street, great cafes nearby (and the meatball shop!), a wholefoods a few blocks away. It was just as I expected and would definately stay again. My sister and I loved catching a few rays by the pool after a busy day sightseeing and shopping. Thank you for a fabulous stay.

title: Favorite NYC Hotel!
text:
I have stayed in quite a few NYC hotels over the years, but the Sixty LES is far the best.  The staff was very attentive, location was perfect, beautiful clean room and room service was delicious and prompt.  The king studio room was spacious and quiet with a wonderful view!  Also they honored my request for a high floor.  
Since my daughter lives near by the hotel, I will be definitely returning to this hotel in the near future.

title: Clean & Crisp
text: We were treated very well by staff, great location for us.  Liked the "dimming" picture and the way it reflected off mirror.  No ice machine on floor but promptly brought us ice when requested. It was quiet.  Only complaint was construction put a damper on going to the on-site club gym. Couldn't get a couples massage either due to room constraints.  Room service was good.

title: Cool room and vibe
text: Pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a junior suite, which was more than enough room.  Cool decor, sleek decor, and hip staff.  Used the gym in the morning and while a little small, it was well equpped and actually quite busy -- Sixty LES guests like to stay fit and look good!

title: great spot made better by a smart individual
text:
we stayed mid june for 4 nights as ageing wannabe hipsters.
we'd booked a queen room  which frankly was way smaller than those clever wide angle lenses professional web photographers use made it look on the site.
we moaned to a receptionist. the hotel was full on that first night but we were told we could upgrade to a king size for the thurs-sat nights for $30/night. fine, lets do that.
very helpful young lady dealt with two somewhat cranky brits, both tired and emotional after long flight, with great aplomb and style. she went beyond our expectations as when we moved to our new room 24 hours later, we found ourselves in a corner king with balcony on the twelfth floor with fantastic views of wtc to the south and uptown and empire state skyline to the north. awesome. bags had been moved so it was all seamless.
so thanks NIKKI (i think)..
take note hoteliers, all reception staff should be as good as this.
attitude of all staff was good especially the guys on the door.
its not a bad hotel this though it's charging uptown prices in a downtown location...though to balance that, the pool was nice to relax by before our flight home and nikki made sure we could have a shower in the spa before our flight at 10pm.
we go to nyc once a year and always stay somewhere different...that may change now.

title: Love staying here
text:
I actually live in the neighborhood a few blocks away, so I can tell you that this hotel is very well positioned if you want to explore the East Village, Lower East Side, and also various trains are nearby for excursions beyond the region. It's also walking distance to SoHo etc and other things you may be looking for.

I have been using this hotel while having issues with my landlord and apartment. I initially picked this hotel because it had reasonable prices and last minute availability on a Saturday night, a rarity for Manhattan. 

But when I needed a hotel room for the same reason I went right back. The service is great and the rooms are comfortable. Highly recommended.

..unless if you want total peace and quiet on the streets, at which point you should not be staying in this area of town anyway!

title: Wonderful stay at Sixty Les
text:
We had a great stay at Sixty Les: firstly I was assisted by Heidi through my booking for special requests. As I read some reviews saying that some people found the rooms noisy I was a bit worried - need not to be! Heidi made sure we got a lovely large, quiet room (LITERALLY NO NOISE AT ALL!) with good views and were well looked after ... 

Sam at reception (check in) was more than helpful and I cannot fault any of the other staff - all very helpful and nice. The gentlemen at the door were wonderful - whether helping with the taxis or bookings or luggage. 

We had the most enjoyable stay with some small touches like chocolates in our room each day and fully filled mini fridge were all brilliant. 

The facilities were great (new/clean), the décor was very nice (in particular we liked the photo picture above the bed and the wooden floor, nice bathroom, shower etc) and the floor to ceiling windows. 

Again, Heidi and the Team thanks for your great care you've taken of us and a wonderful stay.

title: New name, same great service
text: Formerly the Thompson LES, the Sixty LES continued to provide great, personal service. I've been staying at this hotel for several years, and the quality of the hotel (staff turnover appears to be very low) brings me back consistently. With the subway across the road, you can in Midtown in 15-20 minutes. Meanwhile, you're in walking distance of SoHo, NoHo, TriBeCa and Chinatown/Little Italy. I never tire of exploring the Lower East Side!

title: Dejligt sted
text: Godt hotel med god beliggenhed ,små værelset ,som de jo er i N.Y gode spise muligheder tæt på ,personalet i receptionen kan godt virke lidt "smarte" tilgengæld var dørmanden super sød ,god value ,kommer helt sikkert igen

title: sixty LES
text: Great location, nice rooms and a reasonable size for NYC. Only let down by free wifi only available in the lobby and lounge. For USD 450/ night I think wifi in room could be included. Good cocktails too!

title: Verygood, not excellent.
text: Stayed here on a girls weekend. The service was great and the rooms were nice but the walls were paper thin. I booked this place because of the pool and bar scene at the hotel. I thought we would spend more time at the hotel and take advantage of it but we ended up not so I don't think the price was worth it for us. The location was good, we wanted to be around a hip area with a lot of bars and restaurants and Orchard St seemed to provide that. It's also a half a block from a subway station. Next time I would book a cheaper hotel, but I did enjoy our stay there.

title: Great stay in the LES, NYC
text: This is the 3rd time I have stayed at the Sixty LES (formerly Thompson LES), and I have enjoyed it more each time.  I really liked the room decor, bathrooms were great and the balcony overlooking Allen Street added to the cool vibe of the hotel.  Loved the 7th floor bar, 3rd floor pool (I stayed on the 3rd floor and the noise from the pool was negligible. And the sushi at Blue Ribbon is some of the best in NYC.  Everyone went out of their way to be nice and welcoming.  I look forward to coming back.

title: Great location, but kind of shoddy up close
text: Overall the hotel was great, but I have to say that when you looked closely, things were a bit rundown/damaged. The shower wasn't very clean, washcloths were stained, and in the public corridors, there were holes in the ceiling and damage to baseboards, etc which made the hotel seem kind of cheap. The bed was remade with damp bedsheets & comforter when we had our room cleaned, which was kind of weird. Other than that, it was great. I really enjoyed the view of Manhattan from our room. Being so central made it easy to find something great to eat after our late arrival on the first night.

title: Cool factor
text:
I stayed at this property for only one night in early June, coming into NYC to avoid a super gnarly layover at JFK.
I liked the sharp modern decor, including lobby, very comfy and good looking second floor lounge, and room with black and white linens and headboard nature art.  I also liked the bathroom/shower and noticed there were a few music choices on the t.v., which you don't usually see in this level of property.
Every one of the staff I encountered were polite and helpful.
This was one of the more reasonably priced (I use that term advisedly in this market) yet nicer properties in New York.

title: Very Modern
text:
Stayed here two nights with my boyfriend just for fun because we wanted to spend time in the Lower East Side.

The hotel is beautiful, but might be a little too modern for families with kids... I think the whole see through shower in the bedroom would make it awkward! Haha

But if you're a couple, you're in for a treat because this hotel is ultra sexy. The furniture and floor is dark, the bathroom is beautiful with the rain showerhead.

I loved that I had a balcony overlooking the street. 

If you're looking for a gaudy, NY, 5th avenue look a like... This is NOT it! What you will get here is an authentic, historical New York neighborhood full of culture, great restaurants and bars. 

I had such a blast!!! Try it!

title: Up and coming in Downtown
text:
Stayed 2 nights as part of our weeks holiday. Had a superior King room with lounge area. Nicely styled rooms and hotel. Close to loads of hip restaurants and bars around 2nd Avenue. Close to Soho shopping, Tribeca, Little Italy and Chinatown by foot, about 15 minutes. 
Roof top bar only open on Fri and Sat.
Very helpfully offered late check out and use of spa facilities to prepare for homeward travel in the afternoon.

title: Great NYC location in a cool setting
text:
The hotel is located in a great spot where you can enjoy the vibe of the LES.
The rooms are nicely decorated with great views of the city, staff was helpful and our overall stay was very enjoyable.
This was my second stay at this hotel and even though it is a bit overpriced I will probably come back.

title: Sixty Les NYC
text:
Good location, very helpful staff, confortable rooms and nice pool area
It is close to 2Av metro station and M15 bus
Good restaurants and bars nearby
All employees are very welcoming and the customer service is great
Defenetelly recommend it!!! Good value for money

title: Sexy LES rooms
text: This is a great property, awesome location, super staff, sexy surroundings!!!  You will love the experience.  The vibe is so amazing you won't want to leave the room.  Roomy and styling'  Bed so comfy you won't want to leave...even without company ;)

title: 60 LES is A-OK
text: Fine service and nice digs, even if the rooms appear to have been decorated by a first-year film school student with a particularly bleak outlook on life. Old-school New York eats - Katz's, Russ & Daughers - and new music venues - Rockwood Music Hall, Arlene's Grocery, Cake Shop - are within meandering distance. I don't usually stay in the Bowery, but really, you could do worse.

title: Wonderful stay
text: We had a wonderful stay end of May for my daughters college graduation from Cooper Union.  Location across the street from a few subway lines, walk to China town and Little Italy, lots of cute local places to eat and drink nearby.  The room was a queen, nice size with a spectacular wall of floor to ceiling windows over looking the financial district and the new freedom tower, it was a wow.  Bathroom nice, shower wonderful.  Staff very friendly and helpful.  Beer garden fun in the evening, with ping pong, frozen beer outside on a 3rd floor terrace overlooking Allen st. Best of all was the Andy Warhol outdoor swimming pool, on a terrace and nicely monitored for hotel guests only, with drink bar and towel service on cushy sun recliners, with FREE wifi.  Could not ask for a better hotel, enjoy.

title: Great NY Stay
text: Sixty LES is an amazing find in the LES and has turned into the only hotel I stay at while in town. The service and staff are always friendly and helpful in every way possible. The rooms are beautiful, well lit and kept and large for being in NY. It is centrally located and is definitely worth the stay.

title: Business workshop
text:
Average may be a bit severe for this hotel but very good is to high. Indeed some services we received during our stay were very good. However, some points can help improve the standard and get to the next level:
- First breakfast: personnel could have indicated us that there was a seperate breakfast served for our group. We were actually the only ones to be served in the bar, so easy to make a connection. Also when printing the bill, system was not working properly and we almost missed the beginning of our meeting.
- Lunch: was served outside when weatehr was at the limit of being too cold (was actually too cold)
- Attique room for business meeting was not really good. Too much light, too hot, too cold....
- Phone kept ringing in the attique room when people were presenting
- You need to be an engineer to take a shower and actually find how you can turn off the water in the shower
- Light system in the room was a constant discovery
- Room was superb, modern, view was supendous
- Food was ok to good

Otherwyse very nice personnel, really trying their best but "hotellier" is a true job, everyone would need even more training, not only to be nice but to anticipate more on people's need

title: Great NY Hotel
text:
If a hotel has air-conditioning loud enough to drown out the city noises and isn't on a stupid timer that turns of and on all night, you'll get a decent review based on that alone.

Great bed, desk and couch. The bathroom could use some small shelves since the counter is small.

One of my favorite NY hotels.

title: Nicest hotel I've stayed in - NYC
text: My room was huge for NYC hotels - normally I'm used to a box and this hotel was very sophisticated and spacious. The bathroom especially was larger than what I expected for NYC - it even had a rain shower. Bar/restaurant in the hotel is amazing and was also cool this place had a pool. It's in the Lower East Side area - and there were a ton of nice restaurants/bars within walking distance.

title: Great Stay!
text: I had a incredible time staying at sixty Les. Everyone was super nice and helpful.  The location is in the best neighborhood in the city. Excellent place to experience NYC. I would stay here next time I am in town.

title: Great stay.
text: Courteous staff, room with a view (15th Fl), complimentary wifi & newspaper, reasonable rates, Alphaville looping in the elevator, amazing espresso around the corner, close to great restaurants/art/movie theatre/subway – I will definitely come back and see what it's like a second time. I visit NYC two or three times a year and this is the first time at Sixty LES. Based on this experience, I'd highly recommend it.

title: Great night in the LES
text: Had planned a surprise weekend with my girlfriend and booked it directly with the hotel. Went and had drinks at the hotel before heading out for a great dinner in the LES. When we checked in, without asking, they upgraded us to a suite with a balcony. Great service and a great evening.

title: Very good option for a clean & well located hotel in LES
text:
LOCATION > Great location with a subway station (line F) just across the street, and Delancey St/Essex a few blocks away. That's almost direct transportation from JFK.

FRONT DESK > Extremely well trained, warm & professional team makes every check-in & check-out processes friendly. When we asked for a late check-out they helped us with what possible for them, plus they offered us a shower where to take a bath as our flight was leaving late that day.

BELL BOYS > I usually travel and stay at 4 stars hotels. These porters team was outstanding, helping us every single moment.

ROOM > Nice view, but as almost every hotel in downtown quite small. Where should I put two pieces of luggage? Definitely not in my room, as there's no space for it. It was awesome the fact that it was very quiet (no noises eared at all).

BED > Very comfortable.

BATH > Clean, and great bath products.

WI-FI > No complimentary Internet in rooms. Had to pay $15/day.

BREAKFAST > Paid a rate with breakfast (through Booking.com) but it was limited to $20 value per breakfast, and a coffee + two different things (eggs + fruit) already exceeded that max amount.

title: Great trip even with kids!
text: Were in New York for a few days before travelling upstate for a wedding and couldn't have booked a better hotel. My husband and I were travelling with our 3 year old son and 3 month old baby and had been rather apprehensive about a city break with them but we needn't have worried. The hotel did everything they could to help. The cot was ready in room when we arrived and they made us feel very welcome. The restaurant too was very helpful giving us tables with enough room for our sleeping boys and we had an amazing sushi dinner there with friends who joined us. The location was amazing as were the front desk staff and bell boys. I would definitely recommend it!!

title: les is my 2nd home
text:
I love this hotel, have been coming here since the hotel opened. 
This is my home away from home, even though the Lower East Side has changed, this place has stayed consistent, and the rooms are clean and large, always greeted with the warmest of welcomes from all the staff. Plus there's good food around 24 hours of the day, which is super important, and the wholefoods is a few blocks down also super important. 

Anyways anyone looking for space in NYC that doesn't look like a shoebox stay here. 
My favorite rooms are the corners.

title: Step one to a fabulous weekend getaway!
text:
Girlfriends came to visit me in June 2013, so I booked this hotel - it had the right vibe and was a fabulous spot for a weekend getaway.  (I stayed here when it was called the Thompson LES.  Website indicates it is still looks the same.)  It has been my go-to suggestion when friends come to visit.  Prices are high, but not terribly different from other nice New York hotels and it has definite benefits as detailed below. 

Location:  The neighbourhood is filled with upscale boutiques and trendy restaurants.  Three popular eateries everyone wants to visit (Clinton St Bakery, Freeman's, Katz Deli) are all here.  Just north of it is East Village and west is Chinatown, both full of cheap food options and within a 15 minute walk.  For sightseeing, your best bet is the subway.  LES has four stations, the 2 Av station (orange F line) is a couple minutes walk away from the hotel.  It intersects with 3 different train lines, so you should be able to get anywhere.  Personally, the most enjoyable walking neighbourhoods are LES, Soho, East Village, West Village, which are all in south Manhattan.  Staying far up in midtown (above 34th, anywhere near Times Square) is just too touristy, too loud and less fun.

Rooms:  We stayed in a room with two double beds (Double Deluxe).  This room was really lovely, spotlessly clean, sleek and modern.  For 3 girls, it was ample room, far more spacious than other boutique-y/swanky hotels.  One nice addition is the flat seating bench along the wall, which worked out really nicely for storing our luggage (2 carry ons and a large duffel).  The beds were very comfortable.  The lighted wall art could be turned on and off as you please.  The glass and black tiled bathroom is an extension of the room and sectioned into 3 pieces:  Spacious standing rain shower, separate vanity with good counter space, a separate room with a toilet.  One note:  The shower, even with lights behind it, shows ONLY the silhouette of the person in it.  We experienced no noise on the 9th floor, but if you are a light sleeper, ask for a higher floor.

Service:  I can't speak to the restaurant or pool amenities as we didn't use it.  I noticed the pool on the lower deck, which faces east so sun is blocked out in the late afternoon.  Front desk and doormen were superb.  They were helpful with little tasks (getting ice, helping with champagne, luggage storage etc) and very friendly.  Overall, made for a terrific stay.

title: Very disappointing
text:
Unfortunately, a really disappointing stay.  The hotel is very much style over substance, except when we stayed, works were being done in the lobby / first floor and so there wasn't even any style!

The corridors were tatty, dark and had flickering lights.  The room on first view was great (on a high floor), although small.  However, once you look closely, the walls are dirty, wood looking tatty etc.  The bathroom was also style over substance, with a shower which wet the bathroom floor and it all needed a good refurbishment.

Bed was very comfortable and the floor-ceiling windows with a view helped mask some of the disappointing issues with the room.

Staff were either great (bell boys and some of the reception staff) or terrible.  The lady on reception that evening had such attitude that we didn't feel she was remotely approachable re. the issues raised.  When we mentioned on check-out that the room / hotel was disappointing, the lady (who was much nicer!) offered us an upgrade on our next stay by way of apology.

Location was good, but really this place looked well past its sell-by date.

title: Lower East Side - great area to stay
text: Great location, near a lot of good restaurants and a very busy area. Lots of little bars around the hotel. We stayed for 5 nights and all was very good. We found a very nice breakfast at the corner of the hotel and a great live performance bar called the Rockwood music Hall just next door.

title: Disappointing payment issues
text:
Although the T&Cs advised otherwise, they charged us fully on the date of the booking. After a discussion with the website we did the booking, they paid us back. 
We stayed in the hotel for 5 nights during our US trip. On the day of check out, we paid cash and received the invoice. However, they charged us again on the credit card. We contacted both the website we did the booking and the hotel. The hotel told there was no cash received. It was difficult to get hold of the manager and they did not call us back as they promised on the first day. We were advised to take it to the police by our credit card company as this came under theft and fraud. The hotel checked and agreed the payment was received as cash after we told them we planned to get the police involved and watch the CCTV cameras in the lobby. 
I would expect them to be better in managing situations like this. It is disappointing and upsetting.

title: Top hotel
text:
Zeer aangenaam hotel in een zeer prettige ligging in lower east side. Relatief klein hotel met goede ruime kamers en goede badkamers. Moderne inrichting zeer vriendelijk personeel en leuke bar en Japans restaurant. Kortom een aanrader. Metro vlak bij en fietsverhuur voor de deur. Niet erg goedkoop maar is het wel waard. Zomers een klein zwembad met wat ligstoelen.

ruud schulp

title: LES is More
text:
Really didn't know what to expect since the hotel had been sold since we made our reservation. We were greeted promptly by the door men who took our car and bags immediately. The front desk staff was great and informative. The room was surprisingly big with a separate shower, bath, and toilet. Very nicely decorated and comfortable the windows opened for air along with a small balcony. There are a lot of hidden gems in this hotel so snoop around. There is a salon/spa, sushi restaurant, beer garden, and a comfortable meeting area. If we had to be in NY again in this are we would sty here. 
Tip: Parking is $55 and $65 for larger vehicle.

title: MOLTO BUUONO E OTTIMA POSIZIONE
text: L'hotel è ferfettamente ubicato in una zona ricca di locali e bar. Adatto soprattutto a chi non cerca la classica, ma sempre fantastica, midtown e cerca qualcosa di un po' più trendy. Fermata della metropolitana di fronte e si raggiunge tranquillamente a piedi Little Italy, China Town e Soho. Con due fermate si è nel Greenwhich Village. Mi ha purtroppo sorpreso il costo della wi-fi decisamente caro, in un hotel del genere mi aspetto di averla gratuitamente. Per fortuna nonho avuto bisogno del condizionatore perchè lo ritengo troppo rumoroso.

title: Thin walls
text: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights to celebrate our anniversary.  The first night started loud but died down soon enough.  The room next to us got a wake up call but thought it was our phone ringing.  I heard the whole conversation the girl had.  Later that day we wanted to take a nap but instead listened to the same girl talk on the phone, crunch paper and unzip her suitcase. We thought it was over the top that we could hear word for word what she said not to mention the unzipping of the suitcase.
