We finally went down and complained so they moved us to a different floor.  This room was great, quite, a bit bigger because of the wheelchair access.  In the end they took care of us but the noise on the 6th floor is insane.

title: Excellent hotel in a fantastic location
text: 60 LES put the lie to everything you fear about hotels in NYC- it was spacious and spotless, with warm and friendly service at every point.  Sensational location and very cool decor, but well thought out - reading lights you can actually read by, for instance.  Would recommend it strongly.

title: Great location in LES, great service
text: I booked 60 LES for a short stay in New York for my boyfriend's birthday.  It is in a great location, in the middle of everything which the LES has to offer (great independent boutiques, restaurants (including Katz and Russ & Daughters) and Soho and Greenwich Village are both easily walkable and you are close to Williamsburg for a visit.  I'd called ahead to ask if we could have a room with a view, as it was my boyfriend's first visit to NY, and the hotel were really sweet and gave us a free upgrade and one of the corner rooms, with a view of the Freedom Tower to our left, and Midtown to our right.  It was a great sized room, comfy bed, nice shower - our only gripe (and it is a teeny one) is that the TV kept playing up, it was a little old.  But then you don't watch much TV if you're visiting NY ;) I also want to add that the concierge desk were super helpful before we arrived, helping me secure bookings in restaurants which were impossible to book otherwise.  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay Downtown.

title: Cool hotel, perfectly situated for the foodie
text:
A very trendy, very "New York" style boutique hotel. Staff were polite if not overly chatty, however, the service was great. We had a late check out confirmed with no issues the day before we departed and a stray minibar charge removed from the bill with no questions asked. The room itself was small but very funky and functional. We'd also been given a high floor on request and the view of the Manhattan skyline was simply stunning. The best part of this hotel for us though was the amazing location in the Lower East Side. Although we roamed around Manhattan and even into Brooklyn to see sights and museums, nearly all of the places we wanted to eat and drink at were within walking distance of the hotel. It was our first trip to New York but we were very glad to have lucked out and not be staying in tourist-packed Midtown. The most number of metro stops we had to take was just two, and there is a station right across the road.

The only issues we really had were that housekeeping staff seemed to ignore the privacy sign we hung out each night, several times knocking on the door - if we'd been sleeping in this would definitely have woken us up. I was also not a fan of the shower, which was a combination rainfall shower with absolutely no water pressure, and a waist-height detachable shower head. It may have just been us or our room but we found it difficult to get the temperature right.

Overall a great hotel that I'd gladly return to and recommend to others. Next time I'd upgrade to a room with a bath, which would have come in handy after pounding the New York pavement each day.

title: Loved our stay
text: From the moment we entered this hotel the staff made us feel so welcome. The reception girls were so helpful and friendly and we were so happy to get an upgrade. The concierge was very helpful with great recommendations for restaurants near by. Special mention to the bell boys who always welcomed us on our return and often even getting the lift for us. This hotel is very trendy with a great vibe going on at all times. Loved having a drink at the roof top bar with amazing views of the Empire State Building. Our room was spacious and very modern and clean. Lower East is definitely filled with character and so much to see and do from this location. Would definitely stay here again if we get the chance to come back to New York.

title: Lovely hotel
text: I recently stayed here for my birthday and thought the hotel was quite trendy. It was a quick trip, as we only stayed one night. The location was perfect for our agenda and the views from our room balcony (on the twelfth floor)  of freedom tower and the empire state building were fabulous. For visitors, that would be a huge plus if a view is what you're looking for. The room itself was very clean and generally quiet. The bed and pillows were SO comfortable, I love a firm mattress! The pillows were also fluffed for perfect neck support. The bathroom had a strange faucet on the sink that seemed to need an extra push to turn on, but otherwise had no issues. The overhead shower was also fabulous, I almost didn't want to get out. The staff were also professional and courteous, no issues checking in or out. I would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting the NY area and looking to stay downtown in the LES/ Soho area.

title: Wonderful experience!!
text:
Just back after a week there: the pros:
-  the location, if you like to be in a trendy place, with very good restaurants, cafes...close by, hard to find better. If you want to discover NY but more areas like SOHO, the East Side, Williamsburg...clearly stay in that hotel and/or in all case don t move north above the 14sth...
Other positive about the location, 2m from the subway which is not always the case in that part of NY!
- the room: modern, nice, convenient
- the staff: helpful, friendly....
- The cons: as far my experience..none ...I trust some guys who said it was awful due to the noise, if you want a quiet place, when you book just ask the staff for a room not close to the bar. It is just simple as that. You can blame them for something you don t ask.  And if you have a room that is not close, be sure you won t be distrubed. I was there on Friday, on Saturday nights..It was very quite and we slept extremely well, give the quality of the bed too!!

title: youth hostel
text: so noisy at night, felt i was in a youth hostel, after complaining at 01.00 am, security said that it was written on the site that the lounge/club closes at 01.30 am. Well finally at 02.30 music went down and at 03.30 people started to come home and made a lot of noise while entering their rooms, never ever again I will be visiting this hotel

title: Buon hotel ma molto asettico
text:
L'hotel mi è piaciuto e la vista dalle camere lascia senza dubbio sorpresi, specialmente grazie alla parete interamente vetrata. La sauna è buona ma si percepisce che in USA non ve n'è la cultura (problema dunque non del Sixty LES ma generale). WiFi in camera costoso.
Il condizionatore in camera era molto rumoroso: fortunatamente ho potuto lasciarlo spento tutto il tempo.
Quello che ha influito negativamente sul punteggio totale è la sensazione di essere solo un numero e non un cliente, cosa non aspettata da un hotel di questo livello. I saluti al mattino in uscita o la sera all'entrata sono rari, a volte nemmeno corrisposti. Certo, è NYC, ma un saluto non costa nulla e fa molto!

title: Always Thrilled!
text: I rarely write reviews on hotels but I regularly stay at this hotel while in NYC (I currently reside in Miami) and felt it important to share my experience with this property.  I have stayed here approx 20 nights over the past 60 days and must say that my time as a guest has been simply Wonderful.  The staff and accomodations have been terrific from the bellman to the housekeepers to the senior management.  I'm usually a difficult customer because I've travelled quite a bit, and I have been a bit spoiled...but this hotel has had the perfect level of privacy, luxury, and style.  I enjoy the 24 hour sauna and Blue Ribbon food too.  I also happen to love the location to all of Manhattan (especially downtown) and its proximity to great coffee at Konditori (downstairs) and across the street from the subway.  This hotel Rocks!

title: Cosy hotel
text: Really nice and cosy hotel. The room was really warm with cool modern decoration. Located in a great place just a few blocks from legendary Broadway and all major stores you still can have a great quite sleep. Stuff is really polite and free coffee to go to all clients in the morning.

title: Great Hotel in Newly Great Location
text:
The Sixty (formerly Thomson) LES is a well designed an run hotel on the Lower East Side of Manhattan. An area that was once more than a bit edgy but is getting to a point now where it is almost too hip.

The LES has a great staff and well designed rooms. Even though the hotel is at the busy intersection of Allen and Houston streets the rooms are quite because of great floor to ceiling windows insulated. There is a small balcony outside each room. Rooms are well decorated, spotless and comfortable. 

The hotels restaurant is Blue Ribbon Sushi and Izakaya. It is great to be able to get sushi as room service but go down to the restaurant and bar for the great atmosphere. 

The private Above Allen club was small, cramped, loud and hot, but everything can't be a winner. Instead go downstairs and next-door to the Rockwood Music Hall which has three venues, one of which has non-stop FREE live music! Stage one is the free venue where acts rotate every 45 minutes, so even if you don't like the current band stick around for the next. The other two rooms have better known acts which tend to sell out in advance.  Worth trying I'm sure.

Down the street and around the corner you'll find remnants of the old lower east side, the famous Russ and Daughters appetizer store (think lox, white fish salad, bagels...) and Katz's Delicatessen maybe the last of the great old jewish delis in New York, now that the Stage is closed. The LES is also only a few blocks to the new and brilliant Tenements Museum, if you plan to go allocate at least 2 hours for one of their walking tours.

The staff at the LES is friendly and accommodating. 

I would not recommend this hotel for your first visit to New York, but if you want to be close to the newer hipster neighborhoods of the Lower East Side and Williamsburg and you know your way around town, his is the place to stay.

title: A room with a view ... and an espresso !
text:
I got lucky in this hotel as I got a room with the view of midtown, which meant going to sleep looking at the Chrysler and Empire State building. My room was nothing short of spectacular, as probably due to my late arrival stayed in a junior suite. I think there are only 3 basic things that are needed for a hotel room to be hit the bar: Clean sheets, good shower and some power points for electronics. Sixty Les excelled: The room was meticulously clean, the bed had the right softness/firmness that gave me a great nights sleep. The shower was like having a spa with powerful hot water from the two shower heads. And there were plenty of power points to charge electronics after a long day. 

Little things were done very well and in particular I loved the nespresso coffee maker, which for an early morning start is a like a turboboost. My only concern with this hotel is that some of the rooms have balcony's, and that led to a bit of late night noise which could potentially be worse in the summer.  I didn't use the hotel facilities (bar, restaurant or gym) so cant really comment on them and that is the only thing stopping me from giving an excellent rating.

I had a great stay, with great service ( among other things the concierge stood in the street for 10 mins to get me a taxi) and would stay again in a heartbeat.

title: great value for price
text:
When I am in New York we spend almost no time in our hotel.
All I want is a clean, safe, comfortable room and a good price.
The rooms were small, but stylish. 
The price was right.
The location was great for visiting a friend in Brooklyn with great access to the lower Manhattan.

title: Good hotel for celebrating couples!
text:
We stayed at the Thompson LES (SIXTY) for 3 days in January to celebrate our engagement. We were therefore after somewhere a little bit swanky as well as in a good location to explore New York. Prior to arriving I telephoned ahead to see if we could secure a nice room with a view - and was met with a polite, helpful reply. On arrival, it was even better as we were given a lovely corner room (#1600) plus a free half-bottle of champagne plus chocolate truffles to congratulate us!!
The room was cool in design and had a great view of the Manhattan skyline, both south and mid-town. The bed was very comfy, the bathroom was small but shower was amazing!!
We really enjoyed this hotel as well as the location, however here a couple of 'less-great' observations:
- Noise from outside street was still quite audible despite being up on the 16th floor.
- Corner room is nice but was opposite 'cleaners staircase', so often heard doors opening/closing and stacking of used room service trays.
- No tea/coffee making facilities - these we had to order in, but otherwise the room was very well-stocked.
- Be wary of 30% mark-up on any room service once tax has been added on (though recognise this is likely a US thing).
We'll leave the decision up to you as to whether these things would bug you. We'd still recommend the hotel!!

title: Great Experience
text: We stayed for one night at the Sixty LES.  The hotel is very cool, the room (studio king) was plenty big and modern.  We ate a late night dinner at Blue Ribbon Sushi which was very good.  The location is great as wandered around the Lower East Side and into SoHo.  At the base of the building is the Rockwood Music Hall with bands playing all afternoon and into the night in small studio-type spaces.  All in all, a great break.

title: Great from the start!
text:
Let me preface this by saying that I haven't even checked in yet and I'm so excited and impressed by the level of customer service.

Having lived in NYC for over 10 years, I recently moved away and will be visiting in the near future to surprise a friend. I figured I may as well treat myself (right?!) and location and customer service are probably the two most important things I consider when paying for hotel stays.

On that note, I emailed the hotel for clarification on a matter and a hotel representative, Linda, emailed me back within hours. Not only did Linda answer my question swiftly, she provided me with excellent information. 

Because of Linda, I booked my room, without hesitation, before even reading any reviews. 
After booking my room I decided to come check reviews here on TripAdvisor and I'm so excited to see how positive they are. Indeed I am even more impressed that Tenzing seems to respond to all recent clientele who leave reviews. This is impressive and, in my view, should be a clear indication of the level of service that is offered at Sixty LES.

Once I actually do fulfill my hotel stay I will come back to revise this review, but at this moment, I am very pleased.

title: Great design hotel at great location
text: NYC has many great hotels and this isndefinitively one of them. The rooms are gigantic for manhattan standards, and beautfully decorated. Views are superb on the higher floors. Beds are super, and unless you have a room right next to the pool or rooftopbar in summer, it is a very quiet hotel and you will sleep as a rose, a midst of one of Manhattan's liveliest areas: LES.  Tons of restaurants and bars are within a range of minutes. Also Soho, The Village, Chinatown are within walking distance for the ultimate NYC experience.  What I like so much there is that within 2minutes you have great places to discover live music like the Rockwood orMercury Lounge.  Last but not least, the hotel's own restaurant is atop japanese restaurant annex bar. This is by far out my favourite NYC hotel!

title: A Must Stay!!!!!!!
text:
I have had the most enjoyable stay here thanks to the kind staff and super luxe hotel accommodations. This king deluxe room not only had a large modern bath tub... But a great balcony on the main street to get a real view of the city. The cleaning crew never knocks on your door early.... In fact I never put out my sign saying "do not disturb" they simply came sometime after 1pm when I was already out exploring the big city!!  When I checked in Miguel immediately upgraded my room. That was just the beginning.....

Later during my visit.. I decided to extend my stay. I called downstairs and the girl who answered made me feel like I had to move all my things out of my current room and into my next. But when I went downstairs I met Robert! He made all the changes while keeping me in my upgraded room in 5mins and compd. ...my internet for the day.  And he is the reason I decided to write this review! 

So thank you Robert and Miguel and all of the wonderful staff at Sixty LES!
See you next time!
